Al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for anÂ attackÂ on a Kenyan police station located along the common border in Mandera on 2 January. "Reports from al-Shabab Mujahideen say that six soldiers (police) were killed in theÂ attackÂ with one being the commander of the police in the area, four were killed in theÂ raidÂ on the police camp while two other soldiers were killed in anÂ ambushÂ while they were rushing to back up their colleagues from El Waq town," the website reported.
7 armed assaliants launched an attack in the town of Toliara.  One person was killed in the attack.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: JNIM targeted a MINUSMA convoy between Douentza & Dansa, no casualties.
A rally was held at the Bamako Memorial Pyramid to denounce domestic violence; 150 people gathered around the Amazons collective to demand measures to protect women

assoc_actor_1: IRA: Resurgence of the Abolitionist Movement
notes: Members from the IRA, an anti-slavery movement, organized a protest march in Nouakchott to call for the release of two activists being jailed since 2016.
Fighting erupted between security forces in Rabat and dozens of African migrants near the âGammeraâ station after that hundreds of Africans had been camping in theâGammeraâ forest for months.

Thousands of people protested in Jerada against economic marginalisation after two young men died while digging in an abandoned coal mine. The demonstrators have adopted the slogans of the Al-Hirak al-Shaabi movement that staged a string of protests this year in the neighbouring Rif region.
Boko Haram abducts 31 logging workers as they travelled outside of Gambaru.

"Youths" or "hoodlums" from Foko and Itamaya areas of Ibadan clash over two days in the Oke Ado area of the city. A high value of property was reported destroyed. The reasons leading to the clash are not known. Police made 14 arrests.

Jubaland forces, supported by SNA in Dhobley, clashed with a group of disgruntled armed soldiers who deserted their posts in Kismayo at Diif village (c. 70 km north of Dhobley town) There was brief exchange of gunfire after which the disgruntled soldiers retreated. Jubaland force detained their vehicles. Other reports indicated that clashes were ongoing outside of the village. One soldier was killed and another was injured during the second armed clash.

An Somaliland soldier hailing from Warsangeli/Reer Saalah sub-clan shot and injured another Somaliland soldier in Badhan (c. 106 km east of Cerigabo) after a group soldiers attempted to arrest him under the order of his commander in Badhan. He was accused of refusing to follow instructions from his commander. The victim was transferred to Badhan Hospital and the perpetrator was arrested.

A group of disgruntled Jubaland soldiers, in two Toyota pickups, deserted their posts in Kismayo and travelled to Dhobley area and moved further to Diif village. The soldiers clashed with al Shabaab fighters manning a checkpoint in an area between Qoqani and Berhani village while on their way from Kismayo to Dhobley. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and their two AK47s were confiscated. The road from Kismayo to Qooqani was not accessible to government and AMISOM troops since 2012 due to al Shabaab presence. The motive of the soldiers who decided to abandon their base in Kismayo and move to Diif village was not clear. It was believed that there were internal clan disputes and differences within Jubbaland authorities in Kismayo.
2nd December, PM, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: The father of a Military Court official is shot and killed by two unknown gunmen. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility. The assailants escaped the scene.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an AMISOM base at Halane neighbourhood in Qoryooley district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 2nd December, AM, Shaan, Awdhagle, Lower Shabelle: Suspected U.S. airstrike targets possible Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device (VBIED). Causality numbers at present are not known; a second source claims six al Shabaab deaths. The United States took responsibility the following day, asserting two al Shabaab dead.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 2 Jan, c. 0700 hrs. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Barawe to Bulla-Mareer, exploded near Marin-Gubay village in Barawe district. The AMISOM lead vehicle was damaged. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 2nd December, PM, Buulo Mareer, Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that an African Mission in Somalia convoy has been hit by an IED strike. Perpetrators not named by source, though al Shabaab frequently operates in the region and often carries out similar attacks. Causalities not known.

Puntland Darawish Forces took control of the custom office/check point located at North Galkayo entrance near a UN Compound (c. 400m south west of the UN Compound). Initial reports indicated that the security forces demonstrated over unpaid salaries. The forces blocked the main tarmac road linking the custom check point and Galkayo town. The issue was resolved after the involvement of government officials.

On January 2nd, an unidentified group of armed people attacked the districts of Lwengo (village of Kiryasaaka) and Bukomansimbi (villages of Kisojjo, Kyabagoma and Kyamabaale). 5 people were killed and 12 others were injured. 2 fatalities recorded in Lwengo.

On January 2nd, an unidentified group of armed people attacked the districts of Lwengo (village of Kiryasaaka) and Bukomansimbi (villages of Kisojjo, Kyabagoma and Kyamabaale). 5 people were killed and 12 others were injured. 3 fatalities recorded in Kibinge.

NRM Protesters took to the street in front of the Civil Division of the High Court in Kampala protesting litigations against Parliament Speaker Rebecca Kadaga. The group claims that Kadaga is being targeted over presiding the proceedings that led to the passing of the age limit law. The protesters argued that Kadaga had nothing to answer to in regards to the bill having passed, which they claim happened in the right manner.

actor1: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
actor2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: There were clashes outside the MDC-T headquarters. The MDC-T claim that their supporters were attacked by ZANU-PF supporters, but the ZANU-PF youth deny involvement in the clashes. Gunshots were fired and windows were broken.
MRP activists demonstrated at the Bulawayo Court, where arrested activists were supposed to appear. They carried placards denouncing Mnangagwa's government and the arrest of the activists.
The residents of Karambo beat a man to death. They accused him of stealing. The police have taken no action against the vigilantes.

Three people were killed and two wounded in an attack by armed men at the "Chinese" site. In retaliation, elements of an armed group assimilated to the community of origin of the victims launched attacks against an opposing armed group located on the Bria-Yalinga axis.

The population of Mboum-Mbindoyé was displaced to Ndim and Kounang following a clash between armed groups in Kowone village located 20 km from Pougol axis. Following this incident, about thirty houses were set on fire.

actor1: MNLC: National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic
notes: Since January 2 and according to the local MP, the ex-Seleka General Ahamat Bahar (ex-MPC, ex-FPRC, and co-founder and leader of MNLC) occupies Betoko, Bedaya, Bemal, Bebora 3 and Gadoulou. "The armed men of RJ and the Antibalaka have been disbanded for lack of ammunition". Many villages "were burned and looted" but no fighting reported at the time.

Fulanis attack six Benue communities (Tom-Atar, Umenge and Akor villages in Guma, and Ayilamo, Turan, Ngambe-Tiev in Logo Local Government Area) over two days. 73 reported dead the following week. Eight of the suspected assailants were soon after arrested. 40,000 displaced.

Fulanis attack six Benue communities (Tom-Atar, Umenge and Akor villages in Guma, and Ayilamo, Turan, Ngambe-Tiev in Logo Local Government Area) over two days. 73 reported dead the following week. Eight of the suspected assailants were soon after arrested. 40,000 displaced.

actor2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: The Shura Council of Darna Mujahedeen targeted the LNA with an IED in al-Hila south of Darna. Three soldiers were wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: LNA forces targeted Shura Council of Derna Mujahedeen positions with artillery in Dhahr al-Ahmar.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
actor2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
notes: A militant in hiding from the BRSC blew himself up in al-Qarawishah, Benghazi, after being discovered by LNA forces.

actor2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: Unknown gunmen attacked the gendarmerie in ToÃ©ni, Sourou Province near the Mali border around 20h, no casualties or significant damages, although the assailants seized three motorbikes

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: The FARDC and the Mayi Mayi Hapa na Pale clashed on New Year's Day, January 1st, in the locality of Butondo, in Kongolo.

actor1: Kuluna Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On January 1st, in the beach in Moanda, a fight broke out between 2 attenders. The Kuluna gang took advantage of the situation and violence ensued. At least 10 people died, of which 1 woman and 9 children.
Unidentified militants attacked a liquor shop on al-Omraniya Street in Greater Cairoâs Giza district, killing two Copts.

Protesters call for the release of political prisoners in Shashemene, Kofele, Arsi Kokosa, Ambo and Bako noting the demonstrations have "continued" on 03/01 (date of initial protest not given; protests in Ambo and Bako have continued for "several days now.") [As such, protests in Shashemene, Kofele, Arsi Kokosa coded as two days; Ambo and Bako coded as three]. Clashes with security forces have been reported in "some places."

Protesters call for the release of political prisoners in Shashemene, Kofele, Arsi Kokosa, Ambo and Bako noting the demonstrations have "continued" on 03/01 (date of initial protest not given; protests in Ambo and Bako have continued for "several days now.") [As such, protests in Shashemene, Kofele, Arsi Kokosa coded as two days; Ambo and Bako coded as three]. Clashes with security forces have been reported in "some places."
Security forces enter Gelila in an effort quell an anti-government protest in Gelila. It is not known if the forces stopped the protest.
Anti-government protests "continue" in Shambu 01/01. It is not known when the protest began, or if it had continued for consecutive days.

Thousands of people protested in Jerada against economic marginalisation after two young men died while digging in an abandoned coal mine. The demonstrators have adopted the slogans of the Al-Hirak al-Shaabi movement that staged a string of protests this year in the neighbouring Rif region.
A security official is beheaded by "militants" in Ndoro.

700 escape from Boko Haram captivity and are received by government forces in Monguno town. The victims are believed to have escaped from areas surrounding Monguno and the Lake Chad regions. The events leading to their escape as well as the date(s) are not known. Source dated 01/01/18. According to a second source, the exodus of the former Boko Haram abductees is not unconnected to a follow up bombing operation which was conducted a "few days ago" to exploit the gains of the recent successful Operation Deep Punch 2 in the areas surrounding Lake Chad. This is possible reference to the events occurring on 20/12.
Three people are believed dead in a bomb attack on Magadali Local Government Area of Adamawa on Monday. The bomb was planted alongside of a road. Perpetrators not known.

A traditional ruler and his wife are killed by unidentified assailants in "southern Kaduna [State]" on 01/01. The killing of the traditional ruler and his wife has brought to ten, the number of persons killed by unknown gunmen in southern Kaduna in the last one week.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a group of people leaving a New Year's church gathering during the early morning hours. The source gathered that about 26 persons were shot in the attack, 14 persons died on the spot, while 12 injured victims were rushed to hospitals in the city. Of the hospitalized, three later succumbed to their injuries. Unconfirmed, the attack may have been 'cult' or street gang related.

A Tiv man is macheted to death by suspected Fulanis at Gidan Wurji in Awe Local Government Area while moving his farm produce to Awe town. A second vicim was gunned down along Awe-Tunga road in the same area later in the day. Two others were killed at Bakin Kortaa, a border settlement which is about 12 kilometres from the Benue/Nasarawa border at about 7p.m. - - four total.
Christian and Muslim violence continues in Illorin; a Muslim group attacks a church in Taiwo Isale area during the morning hours. Reports of injury and rape.

01 Jan, c. 1830 hrs. A hand grenade was hurled at the Office of Laanta Towfiq District at Towfiq village in Howlwadag district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attackers. There were no reports of casualties. The assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

01st January, PM, Wabeeri, Mogadishu: Unconfirmed reports state three al Shabaab gunmen  have shot and killed a Somali police officer. Secondary reports indicate the victim was a senior military officer.
01st January, AM, Buurdhuubo, Gedo: One al Shabaab fighter killed during a security clearance operation carried out by SNA.
01st January, AM, Balcad, Middle Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports state an al Shabaab attack on an SNA position on the outskirt of Balcad kills one soldier.

Unidentified armed attackers using AK47 rifles, travelling in a vehicle, shot at an SNA base near Salama Hotel vicinity in Howlwadag district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about ten minutes after which the attackers escaped. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Security forces arrived at the scene. There were no reports of arrests.

A police officer shot and killed a civilian at Halwadag neighbourhood in Baidoa. The incident occurred after the man was found running and police suspected him. The perpetrator surrendered to the police.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 01st January, AM, Wajid, Bakool: Unconfirmed reports state that al Shabaab have launched an attack against an Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) position near Wajid. No causalities reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM on foot patrol at Danow neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

1 Jan, c. 2130 hrs. A civilian (a government intelligence officer) survived an assassination attempt after a UVIED, fitted onto his car, detonated at Tintiinley village vicinity area in Wadajir District. Two children playing near the vehicle were slightly injured and the vehicle was damaged. The motive of the incident was not clear.

Attack without casualties: 01 Jan. A Pro-Puntland Dhulbahante militia based in Tuka-Raq village shot at vehicles of a delegation led by a Dhulbahante traditional leader after the drivers of the vehicles failed to present Puntland registration plate numbers. They were traveling to Buuro-wadal that was under the control of Puntland. No reported injuries.

01 Jan, c. 2300 hrs. A truck carrying UN food aid from Bossaso to Jiirbaan Mudug, was hijacked by Ali Saleeban clan in Armo (c. 100 km South of Bossaso) due to clan feuds of a truck that was detained by Omar Mohamud clan. No reported violence.
A councillor in Jozini, KwaZulu-Natal was murdered on New Year's day.
Community members attacked and prevented emergency crews from attending to the fires in Ekurhuleni, which resulted in the death of the mother and the house burning to the ground.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO rebels allegedly kidnapped a retired chief from Bieh state on his way from Yuai to Pieri. The chief is a brother of the government appointed governor of Bieh state, Moses Majok Gatluak.

Clashes between RSF elements who had refused to pay for a meal at Otash camp near Nyala, South Darfur, and a group of IDPs. One report says the IDPs beat and injured the RSF militiamen, arrested them and handed them over to the authorities; other report says RSF opened fire on people when an IDP confronted them after they raided the Komboi market, seriously injuring two.
A policeman was victim of mob justice on January 1st, in the Makindye Division, in Kampala. The motive for the killing is alledgedly that the officer was involved in a motocycle robbery.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Ntunda attacked and beat a bartender.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a man in Kinindo who broke curfew, and then beat a man who tried to intervene.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
notes: Three villages near Batangafo were attacked between 31 and 1 January 2018. Humanitarian organizations registered houses burned down and deplored the lack of humanitarian assistance. Several dead.

Fulanis attack six Benue communities (Tom-Atar, Umenge and Akor villages in Guma, and Ayilamo, Turan, Ngambe-Tiev in Logo Local Government Area) over two days. 73 reported dead the following week. Eight of the suspected assailants were soon after arrested. 40,000 displaced.

actor2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: A gendarme was killed in Gomboro (Kossi) and another wounded in an ambush by suspected militants. A patrol of four gendarmes fell into an ambush Sunday morning in PÃ¨ in the rural commune of Gomboro, Kossi province (Nouna). The report mentions a policeman killed, another seriously injured and a motorcycle and two weapons carried by the attackers.
2 dead and 28 injured in suicide bombing this morning in Bia. 3 fatalities include the bomber.

A group of suspected LRA forces attacked the mining town of Mbangana, CAR. They killed a man who refused to porter looted goods for them and forced another 5 to carry the goods they had looted from the community members.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On Sunday 31st December, the DRC police repelled an attack by the Mayi Mayi around the Kananga military district.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On Sunday 31st December, the presumed Mayi Mayi attacked the police in the village of Batuashama, in Mweka, injuring some of the policemen and burning a police sub-station.
Hundreds of the National Democratic Congress (NDC) members and supporters of the 31st December 1981 revolution, have taken to the streets in Ho in the Volta Region, to commemorate the day.

Kenya Defence Forces soldiers killed five suspected al-Shabab militants believed to have been involved in the attack on Ijara Police Station in Garissa. KDF said a vehicle that had been taken away by the militants during the attack on the Ijara station on Saturday, 30 December was destroyed after explosives it was carrying exploded during a gunfight that ensued between the soldiers and the militants.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Sporadic clashes took place between the LNA and the Shura Council of Darna Mujahedeen in Darna.
A university student from Benghazi university was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen.
Members of the Gendarme police and Dahalo clashed in Isaka_Ambohimahasoa. Four people were injured in the clash.
Gunmen entered the village of Douna, Mopti near the Burkina Faso border and fired shots in the air and also abducted a young Dogon, Kisal reported

Thousands of people protested in Jerada against economic marginalisation after two young men died while digging in an abandoned coal mine. The demonstrators have adopted the slogans of the Al-Hirak al-Shaabi movement that staged a string of protests this year in the neighbouring Rif region.
Several thousand people demonstrated in Niamey against the 2018 finance law that they deem "antisocial"
Christians and Muslims clash at the New Year's carnival in Taiwo area of Ilorin. Several serious injuries reported. A number of arrests were made the following day.

Islamic State claims to have attack a state military barracks at Kanama on 31/12. IS claimed soldiers dead (numbers not known; coded as ten), as well as weapons seized. Two Islamic State members killed.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab carried out a suicide bombing against AMISOM forces near the Ministry of Defence killing at least a dozen. Second and third sources claim the blast was from a roadside bomb, killing two.

Local security forces in Burdhubo district conducted an attack against al Shabaab fighters believed to be collecting illegal tax from the pastoralists community at a grazing area located c. 40 km south of Burdhubo town. The security forces shot and injured the al Shabaab commander who managed to escape with injuries when al Shabaab withdrew. During the attack, over thirty herds of goats were recovered. Further report indicated that the al Shabaab commander later succumbed to his injuries.

Two civilian men carrying a tortoise were killed by al Shabaab at the outskirts of Daynuunay (c. 18 km south west of Baidoa). Al Shabaab fighters vowed that anyone found carrying a tortoise would be killed.

One person was killed and another one was injured by an armed man at Horumar section located south east of Galkayo. The perpetrator and the victims hailed from same unidentified clan. The motive of incident was not clear.

Al-Shabab fighters have attacked a Somali government military base in in Elka-Gelow village on the outskirts of Bal'ad town. At least one person was killed and two others wounded. The attackers seized control of the checkpoint after government soldiers fled. They also torched houses made of sticks and grass. Al Shabaab left the settlement later in the evening.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Al-Shabab fired mortar bombs at an Ethiopian military base in Wajid, Bakool region, in southwest Somalia on Sunday [31 December] night. Ethiopian troops at the base launched retaliatory strikes against the attackers. No immediate causality report.
Unidentified gunmen attacked Sudanese refugees at Pamir camp, Ruweng State, leaving one killed and another injured. Police later arrested five suspects.

actor2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Relatives of political detainee Radwan Daoud staged a protest vigil in front of NISS' Information Office in Khartoum II. During the vigil, NISS officers briefly detained two. Date unclear - report dated 31 December. Daoud was arrested early December for leading protests with the SCP against the demolition of brick factories in the capital.
Dozens of small farmers from Jendouba governorate protested against difficult working conditions and the release of security records against them.
An IED exploded when a sheep herd steppped on it.
Sit-inners blocked roads in Gabes to denounce the government tipping chemical waste in the region.
Taxi drivers in Kairouan blocked the main road in Kairouan to denounce the robbery of a colleague and the insecurity that taxi drivers are facing in general.

MRP activists demonstrated during Mnangagwa's speech at the Trade Fair, calling for justice for Gukurahundi victims. They were arrested by soldiers, and held in the barracks, where they were severely beaten.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure was severely injured in a fight between 2 factions of Imbonerakure in Gifurwe. He was left to die on the banks of the river.
A family in Murwi was attacked by unidentified men wielding machetes. The reasons for the attack are unclear.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure attacked and beat the guests attending the new year's eve party of a local FNL Rwasa supporter in Ntega. They accused the party guests of holding a clandestine meeting.
Three villages near Batangafo were attacked between 31 and 1 January 2018. Humanitarian organizations registered houses burned down and deplored the lack of humanitarian assistance. Several dead.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Unconfirmed government claim that SPLA-IO attacked Boaw payam in Koch county, Unity on 31 December, killing 7 old men.
ANP killed a presumed ISIS-Katibat al-Fath/Jund al-Khilafah militant and seized an AK in the heights of Mechtat Mohcine, southeast of Jijel.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Early on December 30th, in Ndosho, protesters belonging to the "Congo Conscience" group started burning tires in the streets. The riot was quickly choked by the police, which arrived at the scene and used tear gas to disperse the crowd in order to return the traffic to normal condition. Some rioters were arrested by the police.

Strike: 11 of the LUCHA protesters arrested on Friday in Kananga are undergoing a hunger strike in order to protest the irregularity of their arrest. 3 of them, who are students, are currently sick, according to a statement by their lawyer on January 1st.
3 Hasam militants killed in security raid near Atfih, Giza. AKs (including local Maadi variant), AP IEDs seized.
In Horo Guduru welega woreda, Shambu town, Ethiopian security forces killed two people in an attempt to release a sugar transport truck that was being held by local militias.
Oromo militia clashes with Amhara and Tigray militias in Yayu on or before 12/30. Six injured. Security forces made arrests.

Al Shabaab terrorists have set on fire two police camps in Ijara, in the latest attack from the Somalia-based militant group. The attackers also destroyed the main communication equipment used in the town before speeding off with a police land cruiser which is yet to be recovered. A senior police officer briefed on the matter has told Capital News beat that no casualty was reported in the attack.

Transport along the busy Nairobi-Naivasha was Saturday morning paralysed for more than two hours after squatters at Soko Mjinga barricaded the road protesting a move to construct a high cost cemetery within the locality.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Property destruction: Salafist group Sibil al Salam in Kufra allegedly exhumed & took Mahdi Sanoussiâs remains.
A woman and an infant were injured by a shrapnel from an anti-aircraft weapon from an unclear destination.
Four young Tuareg men, accused of being robbers, were killed by local militia (Ganda Izo) at the weekly market in Gabero-Zinda, Gao Region

Thousands of people protested in Jerada against economic marginalisation after two young men died while digging in an abandoned coal mine. The demonstrators have adopted the slogans of the Al-Hirak al-Shaabi movement that staged a string of protests this year in the neighbouring Rif region.

Boko Haram attacked military and civilian locations at Katamma, Yobe. Losses not yet evaluated. Nigerian air forces launched an air attack against the perpetrators following the initial attack which killed "all of them" - numbers not known. This occurred following a successful defence of the town by ground forces.

actor2: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Barnawi faction Boko Haram "attacks" Kam village. The operation "was not successful." Any causalities incurred are not known. The town is situated along the border with Niger. Following the incident air forces were mobilized against the fleeing attackers. The warplanes killed "many."
Boko Haram attacked civilians along the Maiduguri-Damboa road. "Dozens killed."
Boko Haram forces attack several civilian locations in Mafa LGA (also in conjunction with an attack in Marawa) killing "no less than 50 [total]." (Coded as 46, subtracting from events at Marawa)

actor1: Boko Haram - Wilayat Gharb Ifriqiyyah (Barnawi Faction)
notes: Barnawi faction Boko Haram "attacks" Kam village. The operation "was not successful." Any causalities incurred are not known. The town is situated along the border with Niger. Following the incident air forces were mobilized against the fleeing attackers. The warplanes killed "many."

Boko Haram attacked military and civilian locations at Katamma, Yobe. Five reported military deaths, several others missing. Nigerian air forces launched an air attack against the perpetrators following the initial attack which killed "all of them" - numbers not known. This occurred following a successful defence of the town by ground forces.

Boko Haram attacked military and civilian locations at Katamma, Yobe. Five reported military deaths, several others missing. Nigerian air forces launched an air attack against the perpetrators following the initial attack which killed "all of them" - numbers not known. This occurred following a successful defence of the town by ground forces.
Boko Haram forces attack Marawa (Maiwa) village, north of Maiduguri, killing four. Boko Haram forces attacked several locations in the area, including in Mafa LGA, killing "no less than 50" total.

Four people are killed at Kamale village in Michika Local Government Area of the state. The MP representing Michika/Madagali Federal Constituency, Adamu Kamale, narrowly escaped the attack. It is not known if the politician was the target. Perpetrators not known. The event took place on or before 30/12.
Four are dead during a clash between Fulanis and a group of farmers in Minda.
Unknown gunmen kidnapped a member of the Taraba state House of Assembly representing Takum. The politician was abducted on Saturday at about 8 45pm in his house in Takum.
30 Dec, c. 1842 hrs.  An IED planted near an SNA checkpoint exploded at Bakaro junction road in Hodan district. Two reported deaths. No group has claimed responsibility for the incident.

30 Dec, c. 2020 hrs. : A UVIED, planted in a vehicle owned by a civilian man who worked with South West State as a coordinator in the Ministry of Health, exploded at Ramadan Mosque area in Hodan district. The explosion missed the intended target. The vehicle was damaged and there were no reports of casualties.

Detonation: Local police detonated an IED that was planted at the livestock market located east of Bulloburte district (c. 115 km South of Beletweyne). There were no reports of casualties or damages. The security situation in the area was reported to be calm after that incident. The IED placing perpetrators not named by the source, nor was the suspected target.
Al Shabaab attacks government forces in Diinsoor District. The fighting lasted for approximately 30 minutes. At least two deaths reported.

Masked men who appeared to be members of the Somali security forces raided the house of a Somali senator (Abdi Hassan Awale Qaybdiid) on 30/12. The raiders attacked the Senator's security detail. Several soldiers were arrested following the incident.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Report that SPLA-IO rebels attacked passenger vehicles on the road between Nadapal and New Site on 30 December. Report points to one of the rebels later arrested in Kenya and handed over to the South Sudanese authorities in Kapoeta.

Clashes between rival communities in Bor South, Jonglei state on or around 30 December left 22 people dead and 18 critically injured. Circumstances unclear. Similar clashes were reported the week prior.

Angry students broke-down walls at the Shambat Agricultural Complex and another faculty at the University of Khartoum in protest against the dismissal of students a year prior after their alleged involvement in protests against the sale of the university buildings in central Khartoum. They also reportedly broke the doors of a nearby mosque.

President al-Bashir declared a six-month state of emergency in North Kordofan and Kassala states to support the launch of a disarmament campaign and to combat other criminal activities in these states. The following week, thousands of RSF troops were moved to Kassala and by 9 January, 70 had been arrested. Activists have denounced the government's attempt to control protests in the country through this measure, amid harsh economic conditions.
Tens of thousands of people again took to the streets of Lome to protest against the regime of President Faure GnassingbÃ©
Supporters of the football clb  'EspÃ©rance Sporte de Zarzis' organized a protest march.
Street vendors rioted and injured two policemen when they started to demolish their shops. Policemen had to use teargas to disperse the rioters.
Sit-inners blocked roads in Gabes to denounce the government tipping chemical waste in the region.

actor1: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)

notes: A pastor in Nyabibuye was stabbed by 2 Imbonerakure because he belongs to the MSD party. He was seriously injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: On December 31st, the police prevented a protest against Kabila's continued presidency from taking place in Kinshasa. 4 Filimbi protesters were arrested and later reports state that they were subjected to torture while in the custody of the National Intelligence Agency.
Two explosions (kamikazes) in the locality of Kordo: three killed in suspected Boko Haram attack.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
notes: Armed groups clashed after the assassination of an armed group's leader on September, 27. Provisional toll: 5 wounded and some dead.

notes: During a clash between the FARDC and a coalition of Mayi Mayi Mutomboki Musumbu and Malaika, 3 rebels were killed in Nepanepa on December 29th. 1 of the rebels was captured, 1 soldier of the FARDC captured and 1 FARDC soldier injured.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Two days before the already set date for a manifestation in Kinshasha, LUCHA organised a protest in Kananga, on December 29th. The protesters manifested peacefully against the continued stay of President Kabila in power when the protest was dispersed by the police and 12 LUCHA militants were arrested.

actor1: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A Twa ethnic militiaman was killed on December 29th in the village of Katato, Tanganika, by a Bantu ethnic militiaman, after being mistaken for an attacker.
To exert revenge over the killing of one of its members, the Twa ethnic militia attacked the village of Katato, in Tanganika, on December 29th, killing 2 people and injuring 7 others.
The Islamic State claimed responsibility for an attack on a church and a Coptic shop in Helwan that left at least nine people dead. The attacker from ISIS was shot dead as well.
ISIS/Sinai claimed to have killed a soldier through sniping in Karm al-Qawadis.
ISIS/Sinai claimed to have damaged and destroyed two MRAPs btw two IED detonations in Balaa west of Rafah. The attack resulted in 'dead and wounded' in the ranks of the EG army.

Anti government protests in Asebe Teferi (aka Chiro) on or before 29/12. Protesters smashed windows.

Four students were injured in Bule Hora University as anti-TPLF protesters clashed with regime supporters. Classes have been disrupted and the pro-TPLF students have reportedly left the campus. Injuries not known.
Security forces killed two people in Horogudru-Shambu, West Wollega during an anti-government protest.

Commercial sex workers in Kisii Town on Friday protested against the killing of their colleague on Wednesday. They matched though Kisii Town streets, calling for justice, wearing red T-Shirts inscribed "Stop Violence against Commercial Sex Workers".

Thousands of people protested in Jerada against economic marginalisation after two young men died while digging in an abandoned coal mine. The demonstrators have adopted the slogans of the Al-Hirak al-Shaabi movement that staged a string of protests this year in the neighbouring Rif region.
Election of new executives of the Abaji students union turned violent when a free for all broke out between supporters of the two contestants. The unrest disrupted the election.

29 Dec, c. 1300 hrs. Two groups of SNAF soldiers clashed at Biya-Cadde village in Mahaday district. There was an exchange of gunfire. The two group of SNAF soldiers disputed over extortion money collected from public transport vehicles. One SNA soldier was injured.

29 Dec, c. 0400 hrs.  Somali commandos, supported by anti-al Shabaab (not identified) forces, conducted an overnight raid in an al Shabaab controlled area in Galawaar village (c. 05 km north west of Afgoye district) targeting high ranking al Shabaab leaders at a meeting. One civilian male was killed while seven others were apprehended.

A hand grenade that was hurled at Suuqa Qudaarta Police checkpoint, exploded at Bakaro market in Hodan district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attackers. There were no reports of casualties. The assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the attack.

A civilian man from North Galkayo was shot and killed by an armed man from South Galkayo at the main market near the border line between South and North Galkayo following a brief exchange of gunfire. A bystander was injured. The victim was waiting for a delivery of khat from South Galkayo near the border line at the time of the incident. Joint military forces responded and arrived at the scene of the incident and fully secured the market area.

A group of staff working for Cerigabo Hospital staged a demonstration in front of Cerigabo General Hospital. The protesters reportedly accused a local NGO that manages Cerigabo Hospital and Somaliland Development Fund of excluding them from the list of the local NGO staff. They also accused Cerigabo authorities of nepotism and favouritism.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded two civilians at Abo Asharow (c. 05 km South of Baidoa town). The reason for the killing was not clear. Unconfirmed reports indicated that the victims had an argument with al Shabaab fighters over land.

An aggrieved armed SNA soldier in possession of an AK47, who was relieved off his duty, shot in a teashop at Bangala Military Camp where SNA soldiers frequented. The owner of the teashop was killed while three others, including two SNA soldiers, were injured. The perpetrator managed to escape.

29 Dec, c. 1830 hrs. Unknown armed assailants using pistols shot and killed a civilian while on his way to his home at khat market in Hawo Tako village in Afgoye district. The body of the old man was taken away by police who conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Social housing beneficiaries blocked the street conencted Khenchela with Batna at Kais with the help of rocks. They denounce not being included in the published social housing lists.
SME-owners protested in Tizi Ouzou to call for a complete debt cut on their private debts.
1 dead in an incursion in the village Guilkidaye.

Three Islamic State militants were killed in a counter-militant operation by the Egyptian army. In a seperate attack the same day a police conscript was killed by the militants.

ISIS attack in the area of Gafgafa, central Sinai. Reports indicate that a conscript was killed and two others wounded after being targeted by a barrage of mortar shells.

Scores of New Patriotic Party (NPP) supporters in the Klottey Korley constituency besieged the partyâs headquarters in protest of what they say are attempts to expunge persons who supported independent candidate Nii Noi Nortey in the 2016 elections, from polling registers.

Angry young people denouncing false promises of the Guinean government were dispersed by police a few meters from the presidency of the Republic of Guinea. According to our informants, protesters denounced the non-compliance with the commitment of rejuvenate and feminize the administration.

Reports from Lamu Island say a deadlyÂ attackÂ was carried out in parts of the island. TheÂ attackÂ was a well-plannedÂ ambushÂ targeting a vehicle carrying "Kenyan crusaders" travelling on the road that connects Mwitu and Gamba villages in Lamu county. Al-Shabab forces, who are waging jihad in Lamu, captured the vehicle and two Kenyan infidels, who are among those settled in the Muslim land of Lamu.

RSF attacked the Abuja market at camp Aradeiba in Garsila, Wadi Saleh locality in Central Darfur, beating displaced people, including wounding one with a bullet, and stealing their property. Date unclear - report dated 28 December.

SPLM-N under the leadership of Malik Agar extended its unilateral cessation of hostilities for six months in Blue Nile state. In parallel, the group declined to join an initiative launched by the Popular Congress Party (PCP) for peace and constitutional reforms based on the recommendations of the National Dialogue Conference.

The demonstrations that took place Thursday in the streets of Lome, to protest against the regime of Faure Gnassingbe, have injured 12, including five seriously. "Fifteen were arrested", on the sidelines of the marches that were dispersed by police using teargas.
Workers from EPSP in Adekar went on a strike and organised a sit-in to protest against a recent aggression of one of their co-workers.

Protesters in Gaidam, Yobe State, have blocked streets with burning tyres in protest of what they described as 'inhuman treatment' by an army lieutenant. The officer had allegedly wounded a local hunter.
Osun State civil servants strike and protest, blocking the entrance to their facility over salary concerns.
Ten traditional rulers are killed in southern Kaduna over the week of 25/12 - 01/01/2018. Locations and circumstances of the violence are not known. Two of the dead are recorded previously.

Al Shabaab militants were reported to have beheaded a Somali man whom they had accused of rape.

Two men dressed in Somali military uniform have killed a civilian in Mogadishu on Wednesday, Dec 27. A witness told Radio Shabelle that the killers riding in a rickshaw abducted the man and shot him dead at Badbado, an IDP camp in the broad-day light.
Angry protesters from affected residential areas of Sharpeville, some parts of Sebokeng and other neighbouring areas turned their anger on motorists by pelting their cars with stones.

A woman was beaten to death by 2 police members of the Rapid Internvention Unit in Lubango on December 26th. One of the policemen's wallet had disappeared, and the policeman accused the victim of stealing it. The two officers then beat up the victim.
A man going to his field was killed by armed men.

The Chadian army and locals in northern Tibesti were involved in violent clashes on the outskirts of Miski with heavy and light weapons. The armed locals who staged an uprising is believed to have managed to repulse the army, who reportedly left casualties behind.
Unknown militants blew up a major oil pipeline in Sirte region. Oil flows had been reduced by about 70,000-100,000 bpd. ISIS is supposed to be behind the attack.

Fighting between rival gold miners left at least 15 people dead in northern Chad on Monday, a security source said. The violence erupted in Iri Bourgouri near the border with Libya, in the Tibesti region. "Then there was a broader clash which left about 15 other people dead and several injured."

A riotous mob attack and nearly lynched the Jigawa State House Assembly speaker 'over the Christmas break' - exact date not known. The attack began after the speaker attempted to drive through a barricade erected by the protesters. The reason for the protest is not known.

Many injured while property worth millions of naira were destroyed in a communal clash between Gbagyi natives and Hausa residents in Bwari, a community within the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Abuja. Boko Haram attacks a civilian area at Dalori, abducting one person. Three others were alleged to have been burnt to death. The attack came as Boko Haram members were raiding a security checkpoint in the area.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO claimed that its forces repulsed a government attack on their positions near Kansuk in Kajo-Keji county after the recently signed cessation of hostilities agreement, killing over 20 government troops and destroying ammunitions. SPLA claimed that SPLA-IO attacked their positions in Kansuk area around 25 December.
Explosion of an IED/landmine at Jebel Abd El Adim (Chaambi), Kasserine during the passage of a shepherd and his herd.
Civil society activists staged a sit-in in front of the UAE embasssy in Tunis to protest over the recent UAE-Tunisian spat after the UAE prohibited Tunisian women to board Emirati airplanes.
Attack: Militants opened fire on shepherds on Jebel es Sif without causing any injuries.
On December 25th, a group of residents of Odek sub county exercised mob justice on another resident who had stolen a bull. The victim was beaten up and died in the hospital.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A trader from Bugenyuzi was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure. They accused her of robbery, although there was no evidence that she had stolen anything, causing observers to think that she was targeted for political reasons. She was held for 9 days.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A 20 year old was arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure in Rutegama.
Arrests: 308 citizens were arrested between December 24-25 by the National Police following alledged involvements in 297 crimes in Angola.

actor2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: The gendarmerie in DÃ©ou, Oudalan Province were attacked by unknown gunmen (presumably Ansaroul Islam), military reinforcements dispatched. Assailants seized a vehicle and arms, and also gendarmes gone missing following the attack in DÃ©ou.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: A lieutenant was killed on Sunday 24th in the village of Lweba, 7km from the in Baraka operational zone. Another report mentions that the place was the village of Kakwena and that the attackers were presumably the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: Movement of forces: the FDLR heavily deployed military along the border after the strikes against ADF undertaken during the weekend, as a response to the growing tensions felt and in order to prevent an expansion of the conflict into Uganda.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Two civilians were severely injured during the weekend of 23-24 December, in the village of Swima, after an altercation between them and the FARDC. The FARDC soldier tried to prevent the passage of a prefect student on a motorbike, which led to a dispute that alerted the population. Due to being inebriated, the soldier started shooting.
On Sunday, 24th, the inhabitants of Lembabo and Simbiliabo, in Bunia, lynched 2 people who were stealing.
Masked gunmen opened fire on a cafe in Al Ayat, killing three civilians. Five others were wounded.
Nine people suspected of belonging to a cell behind attacks in the Sinai Peninsula were killed during a police raid on a hideout in al Salehiya el-Gadida. Nine others were arrested.
ISIS/Sinai claimed to have killed two EG soldiers by sniping south and west of Sheikh Zuweid.
ISIS/Sinai claimed damaging an army bulldozer by IED detonation west of El-Arish Airport, North Sinai.
Gunmen killed eight South Sudanese refugees, including women and children at Dima Refugee Camp in Gambella region of Western Ethiopia on 24/12.

Five dead in clashes between residents of Falikogo and Karga neighborhoods in Kanakono, in the sub-prefecture of Tingrela (northern Ivory Coast). Reasons for clash: rumors about the beginning of the work and the choice of the site of the college.

A Salafist group from Tiji raided a mosque in the village of Tandamira in Jabal Nafusa to intimidate the worshippers whom they accuse of belonging to the Ibadi sect. The young worshippers were detained and beaten in detention.
Following the death of a boy, 3 Fokonolona attempted to fight Dahalo militia. They were injured in the attempt.

30 Dahalo, in Antongomavo,_Ambodimanga-Sarobaratra stole 300 Zebu animals. Following this attack, police supported by Fokonolona militia hunted down the Dahalo and clashed with them. 3 Dahalo were injured and 3 were killed.
One boy was killed by 11 Dahalo who entered a the village of Atsatratokana,_Bemavo in Tsaratanana.
A farmer was killed in Ankabokimaty,_Sakena,_Beroroha as seven Dahalo robbed the household.

Thousands of people protested in Jerada against economic marginalisation after two young men died while digging in an abandoned coal mine. The demonstrators have adopted the slogans of the Al-Hirak al-Shaabi movement that staged a string of protests this year in the neighbouring Rif region.
Teenagers protested in Imzouren to denounce a lack of opportunities. They have been arrested the following day and now face trial over participation in a non-authorised protest.

Unidentified assassins made attempts on the life of the former Chairman of the Presidential Task Team on Pension Reforms on two occasions. The first occurred "last week" (source dated 27/12) and the second occurred on 24/12. During the second event several private security guards were abducted by the attackers.
Six are dead following an attack on Ungwan Mailafiya in Jemaa on 24/12. A similar attack took place in the area two days earlier.
Unidentified gunmen attacked Utonkon community on 24/12. Two dead, several injured. A second source claims 5 dead.
24th December, PM, Buulo Mareer, Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports claim that SNA have launched an attack against al Shabaab. Details remain limited.

24th December, Beled Xawo, Gedo: Complaints over the demarcation of a Kenyan built security wall being built on the Somali Kenyan border have reportedly turned violent, with Somali protestors amassing and throwing stones.
24th December, PM, Idaale, Baidoa, Bay: Al Shabaab execute five men accused of spying for the Somali, Jubbaland and U.S. intelligence services.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: US air forces conduct an air strike against al Shabaab at a location known as Ball Raho, northeast of Kismayo. 13 reported fatalities. Two al Shabaab affiliated Kenyans were killed in the blast.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA accused rebel SPLA-IO forces of attacking the government forces at Wath-Nyoani military outpost in Northern Liech state on Christmas eve in violation of the recently signed cessation of hostlities.
Unknown militants stabbed to death a young boy in Aweil town. Circumstances unclear - several gang members later arrested.
Clashes between youth from the Mundari tribe over grazing rights on Tindili Island at Koputa area, Terekeka state, on 23 and 24 December left at least six killed and 10 wounded.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO claimed government forces attacked their positions in Jebel Rabi along the Bazia road of Wau state, on the day of the start of the Cessation of Hostilities agreement signed three days prior between the warring factions in Addis Ababa.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Government claimed rebel SPLA-IO forces attacked their positions in Jekou of Maiwut state, Leer, Raja and Lasu in an attempt to establish new headquarters on the day of the start of the Cessation of Hostilities agreement signed three days prior between the warring factions in Addis Ababa.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA accused rebel SPLA-IO forces of attacking the government forces at Lokbere.

notes: Government claimed rebel SPLA-IO forces attacked their positions in Jekou of Maiwut state, Leer, Raja and Lasu in an attempt to establish new headquarters on the day of the start of the Cessation of Hostilities agreement signed three days prior between the warring factions in Addis Ababa.

notes: Government claimed rebel SPLA-IO forces attacked their positions in Jekou of Maiwut state, Leer, Raja and Lasu in an attempt to establish new headquarters on the day of the start of the Cessation of Hostilities agreement signed three days prior between the warring factions in Addis Ababa.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO attacked government forces in Koch town in retaliation for an earlier raid by SPLA-affiliated youth in Lang, where 7,000 heads of cattle were stolen. 15 people were killed in the Koch attack, including three children, and 26 wounded. The Koch attack occurred on the first day of the entry into force of a Cessation of Hostilities agreement signed three days prior between the warring factions in Addis Ababa.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO accused government forces of bombing their positions around Yei county on the day of the start of the Cessation of Hostilities agreement signed three days prior between the warring factions in Addis Ababa.

notes: South Sudanâs warring factions signed a new Cessation of Hostilities agreement on 21 December to be implemented from 24 December and subsequently issued instructions to their forces in the country to abide by the agreement's provisions and act only in self-defence or against any aggression.

A Rwandan refugee was surrounded by RNC members and Mukombozi members in a shopping mall in Ntinda, Kampala, on the week of the 24th of December. He was taken to Katuna border, where he was brought to Kigali and allegedly blindfolded and beaten.
Shots were heard during the day in Busunga because of clashes between the UPDF and ADF, on December 24th.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Suspected clash between government and SPLA-IO forces in Ladimwa, Mundri, on 24 December caused by SPLA troops moving into areas dominated by the opposition forces between Bari and Gariya. SPLA-IO claimed their deputy commander was killed in the action but CTSAMM was unable to corroborate this.

actor1: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
notes: FNL Nzabampema militants attempted to ambush the Route 5 near Gihanga, but were repulsed by soldiers.
Looting: armed men perpetrated exaction on civilians.

Workers of a ceramic company in el-Adabiya continued their protest against the planned relocation of the company to 10th of Ramadan city, especially after 650 workers were arbitrarily dismissed after the first protest.

On Gurbi bordode woreda (part of Mieso), Ethiopian security forces along with Liyu police reportedly "sneaked into the middle of the town and started a fight" with people. 6 locals were killed, and one was wounded in the fight that lasted for more than 5 hours.
The head of MorofÃ©, Nanan Tanoh Kouassi Georges and his wife were assaulted by individuals armed with machetes
Attack without casualties: Four unidentified gunmen intimidated and fired shots at employees and private security at the University of Benghazi before leaving the campus. No one was injured.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Displaced residents of Tawergha held a protest outside the headquarters of the Presidency Council in Tripoli. They called on the PC to facilitate a safe return to their city. They also tried to storm the premises after which PC-head Serraj went outside to talk to them in persona.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A civilian was injured as he stepped on a landmine when returning to his home in As Sabiri al Gharbi in Benghazi.
Fokonolona villagers in Manjakazaza,_Ambohitrambo,_Arivonimamo tortured and killed 2 dahalo.
Fulanis attack and kill two civilians in Odonto village in Akpa district of Otukpo Local Government on 23/12. Two others were wounded. Causality figures from multiple sources vary.
Military forces engaged Boko Haram forces at Beneri, killing two and recovering 200 head of stolen cattle.
Military forces engaged Boko Haram forces at Firgi, Bama LGA, killing one. A second source claims the attack occurred on 22/12.
Crafts traders protest following a destructive fire at their market.

actor1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Peace agreement: signed on 23/12 between the Congolese Government and the Ninja Militia group.
23rd December, 1300L, Wardhigley, Mogadishu: Eight mortars are fired at Villa Somalia, with three reportedly landing inside Villa Somalia. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. Causalities not known.

23rd December, 1723L, Yaaqshid, Mogadishu: An explosion reported as a Large Vehicle Bourne Explosive Device (LVBIED) was found to be an explosion in a rubbish refuse collection site. No casualties reported. Perpetrators not known. The event may have occurred on 22/12.
Attack without casualties: 23rd December, 2340L, Dayniile, Mogadishu: Unidentified attackers throw two hand grenades at the Ministry of Defence. No causalities or damage reported.
23rd December, AM, Hamar Jabjab, Mogadishu: Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a Somali district official. The assailants escaped the scene.

At least 14 people have been killed and 50 others injured in renewed fighting between two clans in villages in Mudug, Sool and Nugal regions. The identities of the combatants, as well as the locations of the fighting is not known. The fighting began over use of water and pastureland. A second source claims the combatants were militia from Darood-Dhulbahante and M-Omar Mahmud clans, resulting in 15 dead. The second source also claimed the events took place on the 24th.

A second source claims the combatants were militia from Darood-Dhulbahante and M-Omar Mahmud clans, resulting in 15 dead. The second source also claimed the events took place on the 24th.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO claimed government troops attacked their positions in the town of Bangalo, Amadi state, killing a general and his two bodyguards and capturing the area.
Raid: Raid by SPLA-affiliated youth in Lang, where 7,000 heads of cattle were stolen.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Border Guards
notes: Three members of the paramilitary Border Guards repeatedly raped two girls at gunpoint south of Nierteti in Central Darfur as they were collecting firewood. Army and police forces arrested one of the perpetrators.

RSF militiamen stormed the Abola IDP camp in the Sadoun area of Gireida locality, beating people and sheiks with whips and sticks, leaving nine people injured, robbing them of their belongings and arresting 20.
Medical students in Tunis organized a protest march to denounce the rape of a female colleague in front of the institute.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: The youth leader of the MSD was kidnapped by the SNR in Muzinda. He had recently returned from Kenya, where he had been exiled.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: The ZANU PF Harare Commissar and Harare Chairperson, both lacoste supporters, held a voter registration exercise in Ushewokunze. A crowd of ZANU PF G40 supporters rioted and tried to attack the officials.
Inhabitants from Bellil, Hassi Rmel, organized a protest march to call on authorities to put an end to the insecurity and lawlessness in the city.
3 villagers killed by Boko Haram
Part of the community living in Ippy marched to protest the Minister of Public Security Henri WanzÃ© Linguissara's initiative to make this town a city without weapons

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On Friday 22nd, the Mayi Mayi striked the FARDC in the operational area of Baraka, killing 9 soldiers in two ambushes.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
source: Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse; Xinhua
notes: The Ugandan army announced on December 22nd that it had undertaken a preventive strike on the positions of ADF rebels along the Uganda-DRC border, in Eringiti (8 ADF bases were destroyed: Madina, Canada, Tadia, Popoke, Makayoba, Kaynama, Ngiti and Kikingi). Air force and long-range artillery were used (operation Tuugo). This came after the establishment of a mechanism to share information on ADF with the DRC forces. On Monday 25th, the Ugandan army claimed to have killed 100 rebels.
On December 22nd, in Bunia, the members of the Kimbangist church of Sayo clashed with autochtonous civilians, wounding 6 people with machetes and stone throwing.

Hundreds of Muslim Egyptians stormed a church in Atfih and destroyed what was inside it, after assaulting the Christians there. Several were wounded before security forces intervened and disperses the crowd.
Dozens of protesters staged a demonstration at al-Azhar mosque condemning the decision of US president Trump proclaiming Jerusalem as the capital of Israel.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Clashes between GATIA men and unidentified armed individuals in Ahina locality 100 km East of Gawa. A notable of the Imghad community was killed in this area last 10/12.

Nigerian police were deployed in Niamey on Friday (December 22nd) to prevent sympathizers of a civil society collective from gathering. They wanted to demonstrate against the 2018 Finance Act, as they had already done at the end of October, but were finally unable to march because the police dispersed the few protesters who were starting meet early in the morning.
Nigerian air forces strike Boko Haram locations at Bogumari. The strike "neutralised a large [number of Boko Haram]."
Fulanis attack and kill four civilians in Nindam at 2200hrs on 22/12. Eight others were wounded. Causality figures from multiple sources vary.
The students of the Cheikh Anta Diop University of Dakar beat the tarmac to demand the payment of scholarships and the reopening of restaurants. While clashing with the forces of order.

Al Shabaab forces threw a hand grenade against a government building in Shibis District. The resulting blast caused "deaths and injuries" of military forces stationed inside. Civilian causalities not known.
Al Shabaab threw a hand grenade against a police station in Karaan on 22/12. Three police dead.
22nd December, 2200L, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Militants carry out a drive-by attack on a SNA checkpoint. Causalities not known.
22nd December Galhareeri, Galgaduud: Two local men are reportedly executed by al Shabaab.
Armed clashes between al Shabaab and area herders after the latter refused to provide cattle to al Shabaab. The fighting lased for several hours. Causalities not known.
Residents of Aliwal North in Walter Sisulu municipality brought Aliwal North to a standstill, protesting against power cuts in the two areas.
Residents living in UN IDP camps in Juba demonstrated peacefully in support of the cessation of hostilities agreement signed by the warring parties in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, the day before.

Clashes erupted between the Nyara, Manyayiel, Biong and Nyichak clans in Panweel who wanted to rename the village Anuat in Bor South county, Jonglei, leaving at least 22 killed and 18 injured. 20 people, including five chiefs, were arrested for allegedly incting the violence among the communities, and a buffer zone monitored by security forces was created to separate the parties.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO rebels claimed that their positions were attacked by the government forces in Kola in Fashoda State, Upper Nile. The attack occurred less than 12h after signing a Cessation of Hostilities agreement in the Ethiopian capital, Addis Ababa, due to be implemented from 24 December.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA accused rebel SPLA-IO forces of attacking the government forces in Aweil East state on 22 December. No casualties.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO rebels claimed to have repulsed a government attack supported by the Sudanese rebels JEM on their positions in Deim Jalab along Raga-Boro Medina, western Bahr el Ghazal, leaving five soldiers killed while two died on their side. The attack occurred less than 12h after signing a Cessation of Hostilities agreement in the Ethiopian capital, Addis Ababa, due to be implemented from 24 December.

Looting: SPLA personnel looted property including motorcycles and bicylcles, food items and bedding from the people of Bangolo, Mundri, when they passed through the town on or around 22 December. Witnesses claimed SPLA soldiers sold the looted items at the Mundri market soon after the incident.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An influential Imbonerakure in Mubuga, working with the police, arrested and beat an FNL Rwasa supporter. He was accused of sending information to radio stations based in Rwanda.

A man from Murengezi was killed by unidentified attackers and his body was dumped in the Mpanda river. He is believed to have been targeted because he refused to sell his land to the president's wife.
Senior ZNA officers invaded Elphida farm in Domboshava on 22/12. They beat and harassed A2 farmers who had been granted land in the land reform programme.
Workers from an Italian company in Ain Charchar, Skikda, protested to denounce bad conditions in working for the company.

In west Hararge, Habro woreda, Wachu town, Ethiopian security forces killed 2 young men as they were traveling to Daro Labu. Residents killed 4 of security forces to avenge the two men.

In west Hararge, Habro woreda, Wachu town, Ethiopian security forces killed 2 young men as they were traveling to Daro Labu. Residents killed 4 of security forces to avenge the two men killed by them.

Some persons believed to be members of the governing New Patriotic Party in the Ellembelle Constituency of the Western Region, have besieged the partyâs headquarters in Accra, demanding that their National Executives furnish them with their original polling station register

Schoolchildren were playing with a device when it exploded. At least five children have been killed in an explosion in Banisa, Mandera County. Banisa Sub-County Deputy County Commissioner Mathias Chisambo said the schoolchildren were playing with a grenade they had found in a grazing field.
A man from the Gadhadhfa tribe was found shot dead in his car near Sirte's 700 neighborhood.

National Guard unit ambushed  in DjennÃ©, Mopti Region, one wounded, FAMA says it arrested "a suspect".

Al Shabaab fires at least three mortar rounds towards Villa Somalia on 21 December. Casualties, damage not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An AMISOM convoy is targeted by a roadside IED on 21 December in Warta Nabada. Causalities, perpetrators not known.
Surrender: 21st December, AM, Berdale, Awdinle, Bay: Unconfirmed reports have stated that four al Shabaab militants including a deputy commander have surrendered to SNA.
Security forces clash with al Shabaab elements at Black Sea Junction in Howlwadaag. One al Shabaab member captured.
A group of Mthwakazi people from Mathebele Land protest outside Zimbabwe embassy where hundreds of business people are expected to meet with President Emmerson Mnangagwa.

notes: Government forces claimed to have repulsed an SPLA-IO attack on a convoy of government troops at Omboro area of Lol state, Bahr el Ghazal, killing several rebels. Peace negotiations to sign a ceasefire and revive the ARCSS agreement were ongoing at that time in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

The head of the police in Nyabiraba beat a local shopkeeper. When the administrator of the commune intervened, the police blamed the shopkeeper, saying he should be punished for refusing to pay contributions to the police.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: Surrender: an old commander of the FDLR-FOCA surrendered to the MONUSCO forces in Goma, on December 21st. The colonel Evariste Nizeyimana, known as 'Kiszito', is responsible for more than 80 people killed, some of them burried alive. He also orchestrated the burning of several villages, namely Buleusa, as well as the massacre in Miliki.
Medical workers protested in front of the general direction of the CHUO in Oran due to their difficult working conditions.

Inhabitants from Meziraa in Biskra rioted over bad medical care. They attacked the gendarmiere and injured a gendarme with stones. Gendarmerie managed to reestablish order in the city after reninforcements arrived.

Looting: Gunmen opened fire in the village of Damba, some 40km northeast of Djibo, Soum province and seized a motorbike, after they moved to the nearby locality of Bouro and seized 60 cattle. No reported injuries.
Looting: Gunmen opened fire in the village of Damba, some 40km northeast of Djibo, Soum province and seized a motorbike, after they moved to the nearby locality of Bouro and seized 60 cattle.
Property destruction: Kambakota was attacked: 300 houses, hospital and food stocks were burnt.

Upon arrival, they were attacked with knives and their weapons taken from them.
Raid: the Mayi Mayi Nyatura went to Kalungu after the attack in Numbi, at 3h in the morning on December 20th, where they shot in the air before disappearing into the wild.
Five militants from the Islamic State were killed by EG military forces near El-Arish airport.
Workers of a ceramic company in el-Adabiya staged a protest against the planned relocation of the company to 10th of Ramadan city.
ISIS/Sinai claimed sniping an EG soldier at the "Abu Attiyah" checkpoint south of Sheikh Zuweid.
As of 25/12 anti-government protests at Dire Dawa University (among other not named universities) "continue." The date(s) of the initial protest at Dure Dawa (not others) not known.
In west Hararge zone, Doba woreda, 4 people including a member of Oromia police were wounded by Liyu police from Somali region.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Clashes broke out between the 'Cow militia' and the 'Ostrich militia' in Ain Zara.

An army colonel is dead and several villagers are displaced after armed men impersonating members of the national army invaded communities in [Benue State]. Exact location and date not known; source dated 22/12.
Two farmers have been reportedly killed during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers in Giromasa village, Bagudo Local Government Area of Kebbi State.

People of Isheri-Oke Church town in Ikosi-Isheri Local Council Development Area (LCDA) of Lagos, on Wednesday protested at the Governor's office and the State Assembly in Ikeja, to register their grievances over the controversy surrounding local kingship issues.

Unidentified assassins made attempts on the life of the former Chairman of the Presidential Task Team on Pension Reforms on two occasions. The first occurred "last week" (source dated 27/12) and the second occurred on 24/12. During the second event several private security guards were abducted by the attackers.

Protesters in front of INEC office in Abuja over the delaying of issuance of certificate of return to Dr Obiora Okonkwo as Senator representing  Anambra Central Senatorial District.

Protesters from Ogoni, Rivers State gathered at the  Port Harcourt zonal office of Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, NNPC, demanding a halt to perceived approval for resumption of oil exploration in Ogoniland.

Twenty Boko Haram fighters have been killed by Nigerian forces in an ongoing operation to rout remnants in the Lake Chad region. 17 others captured. 100 rescued. Six soldiers have been reported injured. The military made this announcement on 20/12. The operation is currently ongoing. Known areas that have been cleared include Arena Chiki, Chikun Gudu, Arena Waje, Sa'ada and Juwe, among others.

20th December, AM, Abal, Hudur, Bakool: Al Shabaab execute three locals in the settlement of Abal.

Al-Shabaab fighters attacked Somali security forces' station in Afgooye District, Lower Shabelle region reportedly causing casualties (numbers not known). A similar attack occurred in Afgooye the previous day.
Between 16-20 December, RSF arrested 45 people in the framework of the campaign to collect weapons in North, Central and West Darfur, including students, Omdas, sheikhs, mosque imams and traders.

A group of 12 armed herders affiliated to Omda Dagahsh attacked displaced women collecting firewood near Tabit in North Darfur. They beat them with rifle butts, sticks and whips and severely injured eight of them. They claimed that the land was a grazing area, not a land for collecting firewood.

RSF forces raided the Dato market in Dito unit, Gereida locality in South Darfur under the pretext of arms collection, beating residents indiscriminately with sticks that left three injured, 16 arrested and a quantity of cash and goods stolen. The RSF siege - including the beatings - was continuing as of two days later. RSF continued beating the residents with rifle butts, sticks and directing verbal and racist insults.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire on the residents of Shuru village near Balila in El Salam locality, West Kordofan, leaving two killed. A rescue team set up after the incident to apprehend the alleged killers hunted down a boy and killed him.

Citizens organized a protest in front of the National Assembly to call on deputies to legislate a law prohibiting a normalisation of relations with Israel.

Police clashed with people at Gudele market in Juba as they came to remove those who had illegally obtained plots belonging to the Juba City Council. The police said one person attempted to grab a gun from a policeman, leading to a shootout that left at least three killed and eight others injured. The police had asked the area's paramount chiefs calling themselves "64 tribes" to stop selling the lands illegally and to evacuate a month prior.

Rioters in Feriana blocked streets with burning tires to prevent security forces from dispersing them and robbed a telephone shop.

Non-violent activity: 50 soldiers/presidential police members entered Uganda's Parliament on Monday 18th December when the age limit bill that would allow President Museveni's presidency to continue was being discussed. Several reports mention that soldiers took over the Catholic and Anglican chaplains. The soldiers' presence sparked fears over the security of the MPs, which in turn led to a scuffle on Tuesday morning when the house resumed debating the contentious age limit amendment bill, resulting in the debate being adjourned and restarted two hours later.

notes: SPLA-IO forces claimed to have ambushed a government forces' convoy carrying Sudanese rebel JEM fighters under the command of Brig. Gen Abdel Rahman Arbab near Mangayat in Raja, Bahr El Ghazal, killing 35, injuring several others, abducting 15 soldiers and "rescuing" four humanitarian staffs. JEM later confirmed the death of six of its members on an "administrative mission" in "liberated territories" but without specifying the exact circumstances. Local officials claimed that the rebels had ambushed four commercial vehicles in two separate attacks, killing at least eight civilians and abducting six aid workers from HealthNet, Solidarity International and a local aid group (one international and five nationals). The aid workers were released three days later. It is unclear if the two events occurred simultaneously.

Defusal: the Mines Advisory Group announced on Saturday 16th that it had defused over 476.043 square meters of land in eastern Moxivo province, in Angola, during the last 11 months.

32 Somalis are killed by Oromo attackers in Daro Lebu between 14/12 - 17/12. The attacks were apparent retaliatory strikes during several days of attacks in nearby Hawi Gudina. Other reports claim varying fatalities; 14 - 65.
29 Oromos are killed by Somali attackers in Hawi Gudina between 14/12 - 17/12.
A Nigerien man attacked 2 Danish tourists in a market in Libreville. He claims to have attacked them in retaliation for US attacks on Muslims.

Hundreds of journlaists and relatives of Gambian journalist Deyda Hydara marched in Banjul to commemorate his death 13 years ago and to call for justice. This is the first time that such a march occurs in Gambia - in previous years, it took place in Dakar, Senegal.

The Chairman of the Peopleâs National Convention (PNC), Bernard Mornah, has been arrested together with 12 other persons for allegedly staging an illegal protest in Accra.
