Local sources tell us that angry students demonstrated peacefully this Saturday to denounce a screaming lack of teachers at Filira de BokÃ© High School in Lower Guinea.
Violent clashes between the police and 7 armed Dahalo fighters tok place in Maintirano.  The leader of the Dahalo group was killed.

The group of wives of the military and paramilitary pursued in the so-called "red berets" case organized on Saturday in Bamako, a 4km March to protest against the slowness observed in the judgment of the case of the red berets.

Mauritanian police has arrested protesters who carried the old flag of the country, which was abolished in November, during a rally held in Nouakchott. Five of them were later handed prison sentences.

Military authorities say Nigerian soldiers have arrested more than 400 people associated with the Boko Haram extremist group hiding on the islands of Lake Chad, including fighters, wives and children. The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. Another 57 insurgents were arrested during a separate operation in "another part" of the region. The operation included air and ground offensives. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.
Residents of Ilamoshe community in Oke-Afa, Isolo Lagos took to street on the poor state of electricity in their area.

A communal clash has claimed the lives of at least four people in Ogobia community of Ugboju district in Otukpo Local Government Area of Benue State. 200 protesters gather at the officers of the Enugu electricity company to protest high billing "at the weekend."
Gunmen, suspected to be kidnappers, have abducted wife of Paramount ruler in Ayakoro Community in Ogbia Local Government Area of Bayelsa.

People in Bu Arada rioted and clashes with police forces who used teargas to disperse the rioters. Rioters initially protested over the suicide of a prisoner in the region.

People in Meknassi, Sidi Bouzid, gathered in front of the city hall to steal phosphate from the truck. Then, they burned tires and blocked the street. Rioters demand employment.
Villagers in Chipinge were chased away from their homes by soldiers. Many were beaten, some have been hospitalised.

A march against the marginalisation of the Berber language turned violent. Rioters destroyed bus stops and trees.
Berbers clashed with police in Bejaia when they protested against the government's decision to allocate insufficient teaching funds to Amazigh schools.

Clash between Berber activists protesting the government's decision to allocate insufficient funds to Amazigh schools in Bouira over at least 12-13 December. They disagreed on the way to organise the protests and clashed with stones and batons.
Berbers protested in Tizi Ouzou against the government's decision to allocate insufficient teaching funds to Amazigh schools.

Security forces prevented a march from taking place due to their physical presence. Protesters wanted to denounce the insufficient allocation of funds to teaching the Amazigh language in schools.
Law students blocked access to the law and political science faculty in Batna to call for a regularisation of their diploma.

The Shura Council of Darna Mujahedeen kidnapped a sports journalist.
Malian railway workers decided to organize a sit-in on December 12 in the courtyard of the Dakar-Bamako railway to claim four months of unpaid wages.

Thousands of students demonstrated in the streets of Niamey, Niger to demand the payment of their scholarships, better living conditions on campus and, above all, justice for their comrade killed during violence on campus.

Military authorities say Nigerian soldiers have arrested more than 400 people associated with the Boko Haram extremist group hiding on the islands of Lake Chad, including fighters, wives and children. The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. Another 57 insurgents were arrested during a separate operation in "another part" of the region. The operation included air and ground offensives. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.

Hundreds of youths from Manchok in Kaura Local Government, Kaduna State took to the streets to protest against the establishment of a Solar plant in the area. The youths were not happy that a proper environmental impact assessment was not carried before the plant was cited in the area.
The home of the Acting Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) was invaded by gunmen. A police officer was reportedly killed.
A police officer kills a motorist after a failed attempt at extortion.

Several Libyan men tried to enter the HQs of the Libyan delegation to the League of Arab States by force. Doors were broken and staff assaulted. The scene was captured on video.

Inhabitants from al-Tadamun neighbourhood, 17km from the Sabna center, protested to denounce bad infrastructural access and deteriorating living conditions in their neighbourhood.

At least four people were killed in a blast at a camp for people displaced by the Boko Haram conflict. Somali forces launch an offensive in Gedo recapturing several villages between Baardheere and Garbaharey. Al Shabaab offered no resistance and exited the area before the arrival of troops.
11th December, PM, Kaaran, Mogadishu: Infighting between SNA and MoSF. No causalities reported.

SNG forces intercept a vehicle-borne IED in ex-Afgooye area. The explosive was believed to have been intended by Al Shabaab for a security checkpoint. Details limited.  The following day, MoSF units intercepted another truck laden with explosives in Mogadishu.

The Tunisian army flew retaliatory airstrikes at militants at Jebel Chaambi, Kasserine after they had attacked and killed 1 soldier. Okba ibn Nafaa claimed the attack on the soldiers.

Unidentified gunmen, possibly either kidnappers or herdsmen attack several villages in Muya including Fwapai, Tsoho Kabulo, Shehudna, Bakin Nyanyi, Mudungo, Rigogo, Bakin Dako and Sabo Gida. Three dead, several abducted. The attackers gained control of several of the villages.

Two people were feared killed as suspected "militants" attacked Jebs area of Anantigha community in Calabar South Local Government Area, Cross River State. Al-Shabaab torched six commercial trucks in Maroodile village near the town of Beledweyne. A "number" of al-Shabab fighters were killed (later revealed as 4) in a brief gun battle with locals following the incident.

A police officer was injured in clashes between sub-Saharan migrants and police forces. The migrants had tried to escape from their camp  in Casablanca because they were threatened to be deported to Dakhla in Southern Morcco.

Military authorities say Nigerian soldiers have arrested more than 400 people associated with the Boko Haram extremist group hiding on the islands of Lake Chad, including fighters, wives and children. The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the former provost of the School of Maritime at his home in Kiagbodo community, Burutu Local Government Area of Delta State. Motive not known.
A vigilante mob attacks and kills a suspected motorcycle thief.
Boko Haram forces attack military forces near Damboa. Two reported deaths. A similar attack took place the following day in the same area.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 09th December, AM, Gansahdera, Qansah Dhere, Bay: Al Shabaab launch an attack against Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) base. The ENDF forces repelled the attack. Causalities not known.

09th December, 1400, Hodan, Mogadishu: Somalia National Army (SNA) clash with Mogadishu Stabilisation Forces (MoSF) in Tarabunk junction. Three civilians died in the crossfire. The clash is believed to be related to a land dispute.
09th December, AM, Hodan, Mogadishu: Al Shabaab shoot and kill a SNA soldier.

09th December, 0030, Galkacyo, Mudug: Two civilians killed in drive by shooting. The killing is likely related to recent clan-based violence in the area. A similar incident took place the previous day.
Puntland forces repel an attack by unidentified militia in Taleex. No reported causality.
Unidentified gunmen kill two civilians outside of Ceelasha Biyaha.
Al-Shabab fighters attacked a Puntland military base Af-Urur village in Bari region. Al Shabaab claimed they inflicted losses on the Puntland forces.
Hundreds of women held a silent procession in Juba, calling for peace to prevail in the country. Armed security personnel confiscated their placards and banners.
Armed herders beat and raped at gunpoint two girls collecting firwood in Foro Baranga in West Darfur.

Workers of the Tunisian Sugar Company have carried out an open sit-in at the companyâs headquarters for two days, protesting against the Tunisian Chamber of Commerce's rejection to pay its outstanding debts to the company.
Inhabitants from Sfax protested against the setting up of a statue of Habib Bourguiba in the city.
Police officers rounded up bicycle taxi drivers in Cibitoke. They were forced to pay a tax 2000-5000BIF. If they could not pay, they were beaten and their bicycles were confiscated.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

Another 53 blue helmets were injured during the attack and reports of rebel deaths vary from dozens to 72. The attack was described by UN Secretary General AntÃ³nio Guterres as a 'war crime' and the worst attack on UN peacekeepers in the organisation's recent history.

notes: A protest was held by supporters of the Liberal Democratic Party in Goma on 8 December. The police stopped the protest, arresting 4 people, including the president of the opposition LDP, Jean-Paul Lumbu Lumbu. The protesters were demonstrating against the draft law, which according to them excluded youth and women from the deputation race, owing to the representativeness threshold and bail imposed. The police used tear gas to disperse protesters; students who were close were caught in the middle of the tear gas.

Clash between supporters of the president (Charles Pongo) and rapporteur (Martin Shongo) of the provincial assembly in Lusambo left three severely injured. Police fired shots in the air to disperse the groups and arrested several.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

Protesters demonstrated in Alexandria to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Protesters demonstrated in Cairo to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.

Four people were killed by Liyu police in East Hararge, Babile woreda. The Liyu police were supported by Ethiopian security forces. A member of the local peacekeeping militia killed two Ethiopian security forces during his capture. The militia member was later killed.
In East Hararge zone, Jarso woreda, 1 Liyu Policeman was killed during overnight fighting (clashes began late on the 8th and continued on the 9th).

A suspected "terrorist" was shot dead by police in Likoni area of Mombasa. According to area police Chief Benjamin Rotich, the suspect was cornered during a raid at his house at about 3 am. The report did not specify whether the man was armed.
Students are protesting against what they term as poor management at the institution. Daystar University was on Friday closed due to studentÂ unrestÂ that has rocked the institution since November.
Al Shabaab gunmen assassinated two SNAF soldiers in Hawo Takko. SNAF launched a cordon-search, without success. Assailants escaped.
Al Shabaab attack SNAF base near Qansax Dheere. Assailants were repelled. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters fire 10 mortar rounds against Puntland base of Af Urur. No casualties reported. Al Shabaab later attacked the village with small arms.
Two groups of SNAF forces organised along clan lines clash over land dispute. Two civilian bystanders injured. No mediation ongoing, high tensions.
MoSF assault positions held by SNAF organised around clan lineages. One civilian bystander injured after 25 minute long firefight.
Protesters demonstrated in Bani Walid to denounce US president Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Angry citizens in Benghazi attacked election centers and destroyed them partly.

Fulani herdsmen invaded two local government councils where they reportedly killed 10 persons and then set their farmlands on fire. The incident took place on 08/12 in Ogabifo village near Agbenema of Omala LGA and Yagba West local government councils respectively. All ten fatalities took place at Omala LGA.

Fulani herdsmen invaded two local government councils where they reportedly killed 10 persons and then set their farmlands on fire. The incident took place on 08/12 in Ogabifo village near Agbenema of Omala LGA and Yagba West local government councils respectively. All ten fatalities took place at Omala LGA.

Youths of Ikebiri community in the Southern Ijaw Local Government Area of Bayelsa State have shut down three oil wells belonging to the Nigerian Agip Oil Company. The protesting youths claimed that they shut the oil wells due to alleged neglect and refusal of the company to re-award some abandoned projects under the Global Memorandum of Understanding.
Protests in Mogadishu following the US announcement to recognise Jerusalem as Israeli capital.

South West State forces have attacked an al-Shabab military base outside the town of Burhakaba in Bay region [southwestern Somalia]. Two al-Shabab fighters were killed in the attack which occurred on the afternoon of 08/12.

source: Shabelle Media Network (Mogadishu); Local Source Project

Clashes between the Manyangok of Tonj and Malou-pec of Gok States left eight people dead, one person missing and 11 others injured on the side of Manyangok alone. Fighting erupted in Thony Gok after the Gok youth allegedly looted cattle. Date unclear - report dated 8 December.

actor1: Pakam Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
actor2: Rup Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; OCHA
notes: Clashes between the Rup and Pakam clans at Chueichok area in Lakes state over cattle on 6 and 8 November in Chueichok, Mayom and Apet areas left at least 12 people killed, more than 200 injured, 342 houses burnt and 1,800 people displaced. The fighting is reportedly linked to a land dispute in Malek County. A humanitarian assessment mission in Rumbek after the fighting found that only dozens had died in the violence while many more were injured, over 2,200 homes razed, thousands displaced and food crops and valuables looted and destroyed.

Public and private students from the city of KoupÃ©la have blocked the RN4 route with bikes to protest bad condition of the education system.

A crowd of protesters made up of carriers, students and shopkeepers from the city of Kaya blocked the road for the second day through Kaya City. The demonstrators demanded the outright release of two of their convicts for denouncing mismanagement of reserves and plots in the city of Kaya.

Citizens organized a march in Didouche Mourad street to protest against the arrival of French president Macron in the country.

High school students from Zorgho, the capital of Ganzourgou province, began a 72-hour strike demanding teachers and assessments. Thousands of students gathered in front of the high commission of the city to convey their message to the first person in charge of the province.

Suspected Yacouba killed a Lobi in Mahapieu. The Lobi killed a Yacouba civilian in retaliation, leading to wider clashes between the two groups, leaving several people injured. All the incidents occurred in the space of one day.

actor2: Rup Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; OCHA
notes: Clashes between the Rup and Pakam clans at Chueichok area in Lakes state over cattle on 6 and 8 November in Chueichok, Mayom and Apet areas left at least 12 people killed, more than 200 injured, 342 houses burnt and 1,800 people displaced. The fighting is reportedly linked to a land dispute in Malek County. A humanitarian assessment mission in Rumbek after the fighting found that only dozens had died in the violence while many more were injured, over 2,200 homes razed, thousands displaced and food crops and valuables looted and destroyed.

actor1: Pakam Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
actor2: Rup Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; OCHA
notes: Clashes between the Rup and Pakam clans at Chueichok area in Lakes state over cattle on 6 and 8 November in Chueichok, Mayom and Apet areas left at least 12 people killed, more than 200 injured, 342 houses burnt and 1,800 people displaced. The fighting is reportedly linked to a land dispute in Malek County. A humanitarian assessment mission in Rumbek after the fighting found that only dozens had died in the violence while many more were injured, over 2,200 homes razed, thousands displaced and food crops and valuables looted and destroyed.

Renewed clashes between residents of El Jireif in Khartoum and police over the demolition of brick factories in the area. Six people were injured and seven others arrested. Police also later arrested a member of the Sudanese Congress Party (SCP) in relations to the protest.
University students in western Kordofan held protests on 6 and 7 December against the deterioration of services at El Fula University. Police did not interfere.
An unknown criminal stabbed to death a retired South Sudanese soldier in Al-Obeid town in North Kordofan. Circumstances unclear.

SPLM-N led by Agar claimed to have destroyed a government convoy at Jabal Badoba and Khour Zaroug areas, northeast of Jebel Tora in Baw district in Blue Nile, leaving seven soldiers killed and 28 injured.

More than 90% of secondary education professors and teachers in Tunisia participated in a general strike to protest against bad working conditions. Several physical protests took place as well without specification where.

Unknown gunmen assassinated on Wednesday 6th South Sudanese MP Jacob Kuwinsuk Gale in the district of Yumbe. The MP was in the company of other people making consultations as part of the national dialogue for South Sudanese refugees in Uganda. No armed group has claimed the attack so far.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Movement of forces: The government of Uganda increases security at settlements hosting over one million displaced South Sudanese people, after reports that some elements in Sudan People's Liberation Army In the Opposition (SPLA-IO) were trying to recruit rebels to fight the South Sudan government.

A police officer opened fire on Police Commissioner Chihuri's house, setting it alight. It is believed that the house was set alight to destroy the finebooks recording illegally-collected traffic fines. The military intervened and engaged in a 3 hour firefight with the police.

actor1: SCACUF: Southern Cameroons Ambazonia Consortium United Front
notes: Kombone, located on Kumba-Mamfe Road in Meme Department, Southwest Region, was the scene of clashes between gunmen and police. One policeman dead and several wounded.
Medical workers protested to call for a reform of the civil service sector.

The autonomous collective of Algerian residential medical workers organized a protest in the hospital Mohamed Lamine Debaghine in Algiers. Several residents from Algiers, Blida and Tiziouou participated in the protest.

assoc_actor_1: CNAPESTE: Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers
notes: The 'Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers' staged a sit-in in front of the prefecture in Tizi Ouzou to call for a punishment of a policeman who attacked a teacher on October 18.

assoc_actor_1: CNAPESTE: Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers
notes: The 'Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers' protested in Azazga to call for a punishment of a policeman who attacked a teacher on October 18.
Amazigh students from the Abderrahmane Mira University marched in Bejaia against recent attacks against their language, paralysing two campus at the university.
Security forces dispersed a movement of the population that descended on the streets in Cove to protest against the early start of transhumance in the Agonlin region.

The RN1 was blocked with barriers by students in Tita who were demonstrating to support their teachers and denounce the lack of teachers since the beginning of the year in their schools. They clashed with a joint force of police and soldiers sent to disperse them.
Property destruction: unidentified attackers attacked the police station in Koumbri, Yatenga Province overnight, causing significant material damage. No mentioned clash nor casualties.

Property destruction:  unidentified assaillants burnt down the primary school in Nganoua, about 15km northeast of Djibo, Soum Province. More than ten primary and secondary schools have also been burned since the beginning of the "Anglophone" crisis in the South West region.
A Burundian deputy in the East African Legislative Assemby was injured when gunmen fired at him in Kigobe.
A man was caught stealing sweet potatoes in Mishiha, the community attacked him with machetes and hacked him to death.

actor1: SCACUF: Southern Cameroons Ambazonia Consortium United Front
notes: Three secessionist fighters were killed during clashes with the Cameroonian army at the Sanghang border post in Manyu department.

actor1: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bafuliru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Banyindu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Clash between the Banyamulenge and a coalition of Bafuliru and Banyindu, in Bijombo, around 5 December. 5 people were killed and 10 others injured. The violence is attributed to the latent conflict that exists in Bijombo.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: The students of the University of Bunia burnt tyres on the road on 5 December to demand the DRC government to return the money spent on buying the land for the campus of the University. The students broke doors and windows and stole items. Police intervened to disperse them and arrested seven.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On December 5th, six students of the private university of Tshikama, in Mbuji Mayi, were arrested by police during a protest against the high rates of tuition fees.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 2 MSF agents were kidnapped on the morning of December 5th by unidentified armed men in Bambu, Nord Kivu. The agents were in mission in the area.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress; UNADEF: National Union of Democrats and Federalists; Filimbi Movement; OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
notes: The representative of the OCR claims that, while in detention, their militants were tortured by DRC police members. Date unclear.
Following a car accident in South Omo, Mursi residents embark on a violent protest, attacking passing motorists. Thirteen dead, 24 injured.
In East Hararge, Jarso woreda, Anano Mite area, Liyu police killed one person and wounded more. According to the report, the Liyu police started an attack as they were harvesting their crops.
An Ivorian student was shot dead following a possible police blunder in Conakry during student protests against teachers' strike.
Guinean women trade unionists organized a peaceful march to mark the international day of the fight against gender-based violence instituted by the United Nations

assoc_actor_1: FESCI: Student Federation of Ivory Coast
notes: Students threw stones at police and dislodged teachers and other students of high schools and colleges of Korhogo with stones and clubs. The protesters denounced in particular the lack of tables and benches in the high school Dominique Ouattara of the city.
Angry residents lynched three suspects at Murwani village as they attempted to flee from the scene of theÂ attack, in reponse to the overnight killings.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A civilian died as he stepped on a landmine when entering his home in al-Zaryriya in Benghazi. Landmines are remnants of the activities of militants.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab destroys several communication masts.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated Seyduna Hajow. Assailants escaped. Motives unknown.

Intragroup clashes in Sabha caused the death of seven fighters of Chadian origins. Nasser Ben Jarad, head of a local Kaddafa militia group, was reportedly settling his scores with members of his own militia who includes numerous Chadian and Sudanese mercenaries. The latter were demanding their salaries which had not been paid for a year which led Ben Jarad to escalate the situaton.
Residents of Sakaraha killed a suspected serial killer as his guru.

Over 70 mine workers of the DYS demonstrated in front of the company's building in Katutura under the leadership of the Mineworkers Union of Namibia (MUN) demanding the management to relook at the decision to cut their salary and meet them half way.

Military authorities say Nigerian soldiers have arrested more than 400 people associated with the Boko Haram extremist group hiding on the islands of Lake Chad, including fighters, wives and children. The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. Another 57 insurgents were arrested during a separate operation in "another part" of the region. The operation included air and ground offensives. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.

The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. Another 57 insurgents were arrested during a separate operation in "another part" of the region. The operation included air and ground offensives. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.
A group protests alleged unjust arrest in Amagu.
Electricity consumers in Calabar South axis of Cross River State protest six weeks of power outage in the area.

Tricycle operators in Owerri, the Imo State capital, laid siege on the Imo Government House, protesting the injuries inflicted on their members by officials of Imo State Environmental Transformation Committee, ENTRACO, trying to enforce governmentâs ban on Keke operations. The protesters blocked traffic and allegedly destroyed vehicles belonging to the officials of the ENTRACO.
A Fulani group fired weapons into the air while moving upon Mbiabong village. Believing attack, 200 villagers fled. No reported causalities.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 05th December, AM, Dhoobley, Afmadow, Lower Jubba: Al Shabaab launched an attack on an African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM)/Jubaland base on the border town of Dhoobley. It is possible that this was a diversionary attack to facilitate an attack into Kenya. Causalities not reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 05th December, AM, Beletwayne, Hiiraan: Unconfirmed reports have stated that al Shabaab launched an attack (mortar fire) against the an Djibouti-AMISOM position in Beletweyne. The UN reports "some" causalities.
Four unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a prominent local elder.
Al Shabaab said 5/12 it has killed a senior security official, Colonel Qasim, in Bosaso.
Rape Crisis supporters and some residents picketed outside the Khayelitsha Magistratesâ Court, calling for a dedicated sexual offences court for the area.

assoc_actor_1: SAFTU: South African Federation of Trade Unions
notes: Paramedics aligned with the Federation of Unions of South Africa (FEDUSA) marched to Parliament to demand better protection against attacks, especially during the festive season.
Suspected soldiers detained and later killed two young men from the Juba PoC site at Jebel Kujur area. The victims were returning to the camp from town.
A suspected policeman took three people hostage in a bakery in Munuki neighbouring of Juba and later shot them dead before killing himself.

The Sudanese opposition umbrella National Consensus Forces (NCF) announced its boycott of the planned 2020 general elections, stressing its rejection of any calls to a political settlement that keeps in place the regime and its political and economic policies, and calling for popular uprising against the current government
Hundreds of youth protested in Ain Beida against their rejection from the social housing benficiaries list, hampering access to the town. They set up a tent and banners and stayed for several days.
Bakers from Tizi Ouzou region held a sit-in in front of the prefecture to protest against their difficulty to sell their bread at a set prize.
Medical workers protested to call for a reform of the civil service sector.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: CNDD-FDD supporters in a neighbourhood in Buhayira attacked and nearly killed one of their neighbours, who they accused of bewitching a CNDD-FDD supporter.
A grenade was thrown in a bus parking lot in Bwiza. A number of people were seriously injured.
The chief of the Mpishi hill was attacked in his home by unidentified attackers. One of his visitors was hit by a bullet.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: A youth from Bwiza was arrested by the SNR and detained for 10 days. He was tortured by the SNR. He was arrested because he took a photograph of a person wounded in the attack.
Looting: 2 LRA forces ambushed 2 men near Mboki and stole their clothing.

actor2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: Three peacekeepers were slightly wounded and one was killed when anti-Balaka attacked a MINUSCA checkpoint near the PK3 IDP site. The attack followed the liberation of several hostages held by the anti-balaka and the arrest of several of the assaillants by the MINUSCA forces a few hours prior.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An armed group broke into the MSF office on the morning of December 4th, in Mweso, and brutalised the officers there before looting equipment and money.
Egyptian security forces killed five militants in a shooting during a raid on a hideout between the 10th of Ramadan city and Belbeis town.
ISIS Sinai has released images showing the beheading of a young man from the Tarabeen tribe which is considered as cooperating with security forces.

Football fans embark on a violent anti-government protest in Weldiya. The protest was alleged to have begun after supporters of an opposing team shouted racial slurs at the group. Several cars and buildings burnt. After state military forces opened fire on the group, several of the protesters attacked Tigrayan owned businesses. Protest spread into Amhara towns (not named). In retaliation, military forces attacks civilians in Raya, Kobo, Haik and other towns on 04/12. Causalities in all instances not known.
Members of the Sabaot Land Defence Force (SLDF) attacked the villages of Masaek and Kutere in Kopsiro Division in the troubled Chepyuk Settlement Scheme, leaving five people killed.
Unidentified gunmen injure clan elder. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Hawadle clansmen attacked by Habargidir at Wardheer grazing area. Two killed three inured.
Civilians stage a protest against the sale of the Ceel Afweyn Intermediate School grounds to Telsom. Police dispersed the crowds. 10 arrested.
UVIED planted under the car of a SNAF General "Abdiweli" detonates inside Villa Baidoa. Casualties and target unverified.
Al Shabaab fire one mortar round against Af Urur. Round landed in vacant area. No casualties nor injuries.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate Puntland Custodial Corps officer "Qassim". Assailants escaped the scene.
Al Shabaab attack JSF base near Afmadow. One RPG fired. No casualties reported, assailants repelled.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
actor2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
notes: At least two soldiers were killed and three others injured in clashes between army forces and the BRSC in the last pocket of militants in Sidi Ekhrebish area, Benghazi.
A protest took place in Bemasoandro-Itaosy.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: The mayor of the SougoulbÃ© commune was kidnapped by jihadists due to a pending debt. It is unclear if the event occurred in Sougoulbe's main village, Kora.
Several non-academic staff unions protest at the University of Lagos over allowances.

Military authorities say Nigerian soldiers have arrested more than 400 people associated with the Boko Haram extremist group hiding on the islands of Lake Chad, including fighters, wives and children. The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. Another 57 insurgents were arrested during a separate operation in "another part" of the region. The operation included air and ground offensives. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.
One civilian is assassinated by suspected hired assassins in Ijaye. The motive is believed to be political, though details are not known.

In apparent retaliation from violence against them in mid-November, Fulani militia attacks Lawaru, Dong and Kiken villages in Demsa and Numan Local Government areas killing "many" and burning structures.

In apparent retaliation from violence against them in mid-November, Fulani militia attacks Lawaru, Dong and Kiken villages in Demsa and Numan Local Government areas killing "many" and burning structures.

In apparent retaliation from violence against them in mid-November, Fulani militia attacks Lawaru, Dong and Kiken villages in Demsa and Numan Local Government areas killing "many" and burning structures.

Residents of Ijegun-Imore community in Satellite Town, Lagos State protested four months of power outage in the area by Eko Electricity Distribution Company (EKDC).Hundreds of placard-carrying protesters from David West New Site Estate blocked their major road, preventing motorists from passing through the area.
A group of visually impaired persons staged a protest in Owerri accusing the state government of not addressing their needs.
A civilian is assassinated by unidentified gunmen in Benin.
Military forces neutralize three Boko Haram members at Sabsabwa.
Military forces neutralize four Boko Haram members at Miyanti-Darel Jamel.
Several unions representing Obafemi Awolowo University began a labour strike. Several members of the unions protested following the announcement.
No fewer than 11 persons were ambushed and killed by suspected herdsmen in Rim town.

#OurMumuDonDo protesters led by 'Charly Boy' gather at Ministry of Foreign Affairs to demand well coordinated government action to ameliorate the plight of Nigerians allegedly sold as slaves in Libya.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 04th December, 1400L, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Following on from 03rd December attack launched by al Shabaab, unconfirmed local reports have stated that AMISOM have ambushed militants ivo Qoryooley. "A number" of al Shabaab causalities reported.
Clan conflict flared up on 03 and 04 December in rural areas between Beledweyne and Maxaas. The identities, causalities not known.

04th December, 0920L, Hodan, Mogadishu: An Under Vehicle Improvised Explosive Device (UVIED) attached to a senior military officialâs vehicle detonated in Villa Baidoa. No causalities reported. Perpetrators not known.
A soldier killed three civilians in ex-control Afgooye district, Yaaqshiid. The violence was blamed on "tensions."
Two unidentified clan groups clash in Galguduud region over two days. Two fatalities reported on the first day. Additional causalities reported on the second, though specific numbers not known.

actor1: SSUA-Gadet: Southern Sudan United Army (Gadet Faction)
actor2: SSUA-Gadet: Southern Sudan United Army (Gadet Faction)
notes: Misunderstanding within the South Sudan United Movement/Armed Forces (SSUM/A) rebel faction led by General Peter Gatdet Yaka led to clashes at the border with Sudan. Three fighters were killed. Fighting erupted after the former intelligence chief who hails from the Gok section of the Bul Nuer, was arrested and replaced by a relative of Gatdet from Mayom county. Date unclear - report dated 4 December.
Hundreds of people marched in Wau in support of an international campaign to eliminate violence against women and to end child marriage.
Herders from Chad shot and killed a farmer in Jebel Moon locality in West Darfur as he tried to protect his farm against cattle grazing.

Workers of a Tunisian rubber wheels company protested in front of the Ministry of Industry calling for the implementation of decisions agreed upon after negotiations between the UGTT, the government and the owner of the company.
A protest for development and employment took place in Meknassi, calling also for a swift completion of the phosphate mine project.

assoc_actor_1: SCACUF: Southern Cameroons Ambazonia Consortium United Front
notes: The Big Nyang village's chief, Abang Ashu (Akwaya District, Southwest Region) was severely beaten and tied to a tree in early December. He was accused to be close to the Cameroonian defense forces and of betraying elements of the Ambazonian defense forces to republican forces.
A group of secondary school students took to the streets of Sidi Aich with banners condemning attacks against Tamazight.
Students organized a commemoration march on the day when journalist Said Mekbel died 23 years ago.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: Imbonerakure beat an MSD supporter from Rutambiro. He was accused of opposing the CNDD-FDD party.

actor2: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
assoc_actor_2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
notes: Clashes between Anti-Balaka and UPC-FPRC at Ippy left around 50 dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: FARDC forces deployed to the collectivity of Salamabila, in Kabambare in Maniema, allegedly raped 17 women between end November and early December (report dated 10 December). The last victim was 8 months pregnant and left severely injured.

Sudanese forces gain control of several Ethiopian villages along the border between the two countries. Area not listed by the source, however the occupied villages has been among those in an ongoing border dispute. The soldier claimed they had orders from their government for the action. No reported violence. The forces withdrew on 05/12.

Several cars and buildings burnt. After state military forces opened fire on the group, several of the protesters attacked Tigrayan owned businesses. Protest spread into Amhara towns (not named). In retaliation, military forces attacks civilians in Raya, Kobo, Haik and other towns on 04/12. Causalities in all instances not known.

A German tourist is killed by unidentified gunmen at Erta Are Volcano. Though not yet substantiated, there is speculation the Afar Revolutionary Democratic Unity Front (ARDUF) may be responsible, as the group has carried out similar attacks against area civilians in years past.
Unidentified clan-based gunmen attack Garfuur. Two killed three injured.
Rahanweyn labourer shot and killed by Sacad gunman. Assailant escaped. Tensions subsided.
Al Shabaab carjacked a vehicle transporting Khat outside of Garbahaaray. Civilian passenger shot and injured during the incident. Driver escaped.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Defusal: MoSF & NISA cordon off suspected VBIED near Nasa Hablood 1. Vehicle Toyota LANDCRUISER

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: AMISOM convoy from Afgooye to Buulo Mareer struck by an al Shabaab IED near Buulo Nagaad. Outcome not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: AMISOM convoy from Afgooye struck by IED near Gandawi. Convoy subsequently ambushed for 20 minutes by al Shabaab. Two AMISOM soldiers injured, one truck damaged by second explosion.
Youth from Jabal al-Akhdar protested in Baydah to call for the copletion of the al-Baydah center project.

assoc_actor_1: UMT: Moroccan Workers Union; UGTM: General Union of Moroccan Workers; UNTM: National Union of Moroccan Labour
notes: Teaching personel from three syndicates organised a protest march in Rabat to protest against ongoing physical aggressions against them.

Protesters, alleging neglect and refusal to live up to their social responsibility, angry youths and residents of Tanbiri II community, Biseni, in Yenagoa Local Government Area of Bayelsa State, disrupted oil production at Adibawa oil field operated by Shell Petroleum Development Company (SPDC), and shut down two oil wells.
A police officer shot and killed an APC protester during a rally in Ajaokuta. A second report claims the police officer many have been inebriated while reporting three dead.

3rd, December, AM, ivo Balcad, Gololey Middle Shabelle: Al Shabaab ambush a Somali National Army (SNA) convoy. Three government forces reported dead, including an officer. Al Shabaab claims the attack took place at Kongo village and eight soldiers died, unverified.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 03rd December, 1200L, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab launch an attack on African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) position just outside Qoryooley. âA numberâ of al Shabaab causalities reported.
Clan conflict flared up on 03 and 04 December in rural areas between Beledweyne and Maxaas. The identities, causalities not known.

An al Shabaab roadside bomb targeted a government soldier convoy travelling between Afgooye and Wanlaweyn. The blast is believed to have also resulted in fatalities and injuries, specific numbers not known.
Two unidentified clan groups clash in Galguduud region over two days. Two fatalities reported on the first day. Additional causalities reported on the second, though specific numbers not known.

source: Telegram messaging service in Arabic 0632 gmt 20 Dec 17
notes: Islamic State claims to have attacked Somalia soldiers on 12/03. IS claimed to have killed a solider (on 29/11, which was previously recorded) and two intelligence operatives.

actor1: NPASS: National Peopleâs Alliance of South Sudan
notes: The South Sudanese Freedom Movement (SSFM) announced its merger with the National Peopleâs Alliance Forces. The groups called for a united front for all the armed and non-armed opposition groups to remove President Salva Kiir from the power. NPASS was formed end November by the former rebel-appointed governor of Liech state, Ruai Kuol Jal. Date unclear - report dated 3 December.
A UXO detonation left a man killed and a woman with both hands blown off at Kaja area north of Shangil Tobaya in Dar El Salam locality in North Darfur.
Policemen reportedly beat and assaulted a blind man in El Gedaref after he criticised the financial and administrative corruption at the Union of the Blind. Date unclear  report dated 3 December.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Military vehicle struck by IED/mine in the area of TountÃ©, 4 wounded. Claimed by JNIM on 26/12.

notes: Imbonerakure tied up and beat a 60 year old FNL Rwasa supporter. When he tried to complain to the police, the police accused him of having demolished a bridge, and arrested him.  He was released soon after due to his health condition after the beating.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: The police in Muramvya arrested and beat the headmaster of a local school and a member of the FNL Rwasa. The police accused the men of instigating the attack on civilians by a machete-wielding assailant a few weeks previously.
A security force' vehicle on its way to counter an alleged Islamist attack in a village in Tchebe-Tchebe struck an antipersonnel mine, leaving two soldiers killed. It is unclear who laid the mine.

A group of armed individuals suspected of being affiliated with the Islamist sect Boko Haram abducted ten people and killed two others after raiding a village in the Tchebe-Tchebe locality, Far North region.

actor2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: Following the death of a man at the Bangui M'Poko airport, displeased youths expressed their anger at the entrance to the airport guarded by international forces. According to the deputy, the international forces fired live bullet into the crowd, causing two deaths.
22 people were kidapped in the periphery of Dimbi. They were freed by a MINUSCA patrol.
Arrest: Colonel Ahmed Konsowa was detained by Egyptian military prosecutors for 15 days after he announced plans to run in the country's 2018 presidential election.
Dhulbahante gunmen opens fire against Warsangeli-owned truck. One passenger was injured. Perpetrator later arrested by Somaliland Police.
Al Shabaab kidnapped 15 civilians accused of being spies for NISA and US. Twelve killed three released. Victims were al al Shabaab fighters or sympathisers.
KDF aircraft target al Shabaab positions. Outcome and casualty figures unknown.
Students at a school in Gharian organized a protest in which they  demanded protection from gun violence while at school
The secretary general at the Mayor's office in Dioungani, Cercle of Koro, Region, assassinated at his home this evening in the village of Gourti not far from the Burkina Faso border

source: Agence France Presse; Vanguard (Lagos); Sunday Trust
notes: 25 people were killed and 53 wounded in a dual suicide bomb attack at a busy morning market in Biu on 02/12. No group has claimed responsibility, though Boko Haram is believed responsible.
A prominent cattle dealer and three of his aides are assassinated for unknown reason at Yenagoa.

actor2: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
notes: Lawyers in Congo Brazzaville gathered at the Poointe Noire Bar in solidarity with a colleague who had been arrested earlier in the week. The police broke up the meeting.
Government forces and al Shabaab clash at Maxaas. 11 al Shabaab and one soldier reported dead. Four others wounded.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 2nd December, multiple settlements, Beledwenye, Hiiraan: Joint Somali National Army (SNA) and African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops carry out security offensive against al Shabaab. Casualties and outcome of the operation are not known.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: US forces launch an air attack against an al Shabaab position at Buulo Barow. Outcome not known.

Unknown gunmen ambushed a vehicle  along the Panyagor-Poktap road, in Poktap area in Duk Payuel county, Jonglei, leaving at least four traditional leaders of Pajut area shot dead and three others wounded. Officials accused Murle tribesmen of involvement following the recent attacks in Duk Payuel.
Unknown gunmen killed a displaced woman on her way from camp Hamidiya to camp Khamsa Dagayeg in Central Darfur.
SPLM-N led by Agar claimed to have repulsed a government attack on its positions in Kakr area north-west of Baw district in Blue Nile, leaving four soldiers killed and capturing material.

notes: The FARDC recovered, on Tuesday 28th, the city of Kilembwe, which was under the control of a Yakutumba-Malaika Mayi Mayi coalition. The army recovered, without resistance, the control of the Lulimba-Kilembwe route, following an offensive launched on Sunday.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Protesters supporting the resignation of President Kabila took to the streets of Butembo on Tuesday 28th. The protest was later stopped by the police, protesters were dispersed and 2 of them were arrested. The protest was organised by LUCHA, Filimbi, 'Parlement dÃ©bout' and 'new citizenship'.
Property destruction: During the flee of the Yakutumba-Malaika coalition from Kilembwe, they set fire to the villages of Tulungu and Mabunga.

Dozens of workers of Tanta Lenin Company held a protest in front of the headquarters of the Holding Company for Spinning and Weaving, to protest against the non-payment of the settlement due to compensate workers for the closure of the company.
Security forces killed three and arrested another five suspected militants in a crackdown in central Sinai.

Egyptâs Interior Ministry said on Tuesday that 11 militants were killed in a shootout with police forces during a raid in Ismailia Governorate aiming to arrest a group of militant leaders with links to North Sinai.
Two Palestinians were shot and injured by Egyptian forces on Monday night while attempting to cross from Gaza into Egyptian territory in the northern Sinai Peninsula.
Anti-TPLF government protest in several locations in East and West Hararghe. The protests lasted three days between 28/11 and 30/11.
Anti-TPLF government protest in several locations in East and West Hararghe. The protests lasted three days between 28/11 and 30/11.
Students of schools of hygiene in the country are protesting at various state agencies, demanding the payment of their allowances.

Teargas fired at opposition leader Raila Odinga and his supporters as they attempted to rally in Nairobi. At least two people were shot dead in clashes with police. Odinga's supporters engaged in running battles with police as they attempted to gather for a "memorial rally" to honour nearly 60 people killed, mostly by police, in over four months of political upheaval.

Two Administration Police officers have died while three others have been injured after suspected Al-Shabaab militants ambushed an escort vehicle they were travelling in at Lango La Simba in Nyongoro, along the Lamu-Malindi road.
Police lobbed teargas on Tuesday to disperse hundreds of Jubilee Party supporters outside Moi Sports Centre Kasarani where Kenyatta's oath was taking place.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Destruction of property: An historic Koranic school and small mosque in Tripoli was set on fire and badly damaged this morning. The assailants are unknown, but they are assumed to be militant Salafists.
An unidentified armed group kidnapped the director of the National Development Company Holding in Benghazi.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Raids: An armed group wearing a military uniform launched an attack on Tripoli's Maitika International Airport. The men robbed civilians and stormed the Brega company.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: On 28 November another man was injured by explosive remnants of war on Misrata Street in Benghazi.
2 alleged militants were killed in clashes with police in Toliara.
Military forces and militants clashed in Vondrozo. 1 soldier and 2 villagers were killed.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Mortar/rocket fire against the MINUSMA camp in Kidal followed by gunfire this morning.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Mortar/rocket fire against the MINUSMA bases in Aguelhok and Tessalit

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Mortar/rocket fire against the MINUSMA bases in Aguelhok and Tessalit

assoc_actor_1: IRA: Resurgence of the Abolitionist Movement
notes: A group of widows and orphans from those killed by the military regime in the 1990s disrupt the independence day celebrations and call for an inquiry into forced disappearances. They are arrested by the police.
A group of some 40 vendors from the Frans AupaIndongo Open Market at Oshakati staged a peaceful demonstration for the second time this year demanding affordable municipal services.

Scores of people blocked the Zuba-Kaduna highway in Abuja to protest what they said was the excessive granting of land to the Army in the Nigerian capital. The protesters carried placards and put a halt to movement of traffic.
Striking staff of tertiary institutions owned by Oyo State Government protest payment of salary arrears. No reported unrest. A second protest of non-academic staff took place elsewhere in the city.
Non-academic staff of the University of Ibadan block the entrance of the school in protest over non-payment of allowances.

Members of the Nigerian Union of Teachers (NUT) in Kebbi State protested against transfer of primary school teachers salary to Local Government authorities. The protesters took their grievances to the state's House of Assembly demanding a rejection of the Bill sent to the state from the National Assembly.
Military forces kill four Boko Haram fighters, capture a commander ("Ameer" of Chawa, Amman Judee) and rescue 212 hostages during an operation in Sambisa.
Nigerian air forces strike a "large gathering" of Boko Haram at Gobars (near Gwoza) on 28/11. Causalities reported, number not known.
Heavy gunfire between military forces and al Shabaab near the Perfume Factory in Hodan. No reported causalities.
A soldier killed and three others injured in an al Shabaab attack in Yaaqshiid.
Police in Nugal and a unidentified anti-terrorism group exchanged gunfire for unknown reasons. There were no reports of casualties. The exact location of the clash is not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM soldier on foot patrol at Danow neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab forces attack a joint AMISOM/Jubaland base in Hosingow during the late night hours. Reliable sources say that the Kenyan forces suffered casualties including deaths (numbers not provided) and injuries in the 28 November night attack.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland forces on foot patrol at Kulbiyow village (c. 178 km South West of Kismayo town). There was heavy exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab briefly took control of the village at civilian residences. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

A suspected armed man hailing from Dhulbahante clan shot at a vehicle belonging to a man hailing from Warsangeli clan at Damala Xagare village (c. 99 km South East of Erigavo) in an alleged carjacking attempt. One passenger in the vehicle was injured.

A civilian businessman was shot and seriously injured by another man from the same clan at Buulo yaaquub neighbourhood in Buunda Weyne village located South of Beletweyne. The motive was related to a dispute regarding a well and water supply in the village. The injured man was rushed to Beletweyne Main Hospital for further treatment but later succumbed to his injuries after four hours.

Unconfirmed reports indicated that a man was shot and killed in Wadama-goo town in an alleged revenge killing. The nature of the motive is not known, though 'revenge killings' are typically clan based.

assoc_actor_2: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan); Aid Workers (South Sudan)
source: Sudan Tribune; UNMISS; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; Gurtong; UNOCHA; CAJ News Agency (Johannesburg)
notes: Two armed cattle raids by Murle armed youth from Boma state on Dinka civilians in Duk Payuel and Pajut in Jonglei on 27 and 28 November left some 69 people killed (including 3 on the first day) and 19 others wounded. About 55 women and children were also abducted by the attackers, more than than 1,300 cattle raided, civilian properties and humanitarian food items looted and burnt down. Among the casualties, six people working for NGOs were killed (including five from WFP cooperating partners) and another three aid workers injured. A joint force of the army, police and security was deployed and the abducted people were recovered a few days later.
An Islamist is killed by military in Jebel Tioucha Kasserine during gunbattle. A second is 'hit' but no information on whether he was killed.

On Tuesday 28th, an angry mob that wanted to lynch a thief in Adjumani district engaged with police killing 3 people. The mob descended on the police and burnt 6 motorcycles at the police post. The three casualties included one student, one resident and one rioter.

source: Red Pepper; The Daily Monitor; Chimp Reports
notes: On Tuesday 28th the UPDF killed a Turkana pastoralist during a clash in Losilang. The gunfire clash lasted for 20 minutes, and happened after the Turkana had raided cows in Losilang village in Kotido District.

assoc_actor_1: CNES: National Council of Higher Education Teachers
notes: The National Office of the Higher Education Teachers Union decided to take part in a national protest in front of the headquarters of the University of Mascara against the Dean who filed a law suit against a professor who was a member of the union

assoc_actor_1: CAMRA: Autonomous Collective of Algerian Residents
notes: Doctors and locals protest and demand to be exempt from military service. The protest was organised by Autonomous Collective of Algerian Resident Doctors (CAMRA)

assoc_actor_1: CAMRA: Autonomous Collective of Algerian Residents
notes: Doctors protest in Constantine and demand exemption from military service.

assoc_actor_1: CNAPESTE: Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers
notes: CNAPESTE launches a strike and protests outside the education directorate and accuse the government of destroying the education sector.

assoc_actor_1: PNSD: National Party for Solidarity and Development; Fajr Jadid; HMS: Movement of Society for Peace
notes: Opposition parties continue to protest agains the FLN's victory in Ouargla. For two days party activists violently clashed with police.

assoc_actor_1: CAMRA: Autonomous Collective of Algerian Residents
notes: Doctors protest in Oran. The protest is organised by CAMRA.
Civilians of the neighbourhood of Ritondo, in Malange, protested in front of the company for electricity distribution ENA, to protest against the lack of electricity for the previous 2 weeks.

Several hundred workers in public and private administrations, led by the secretary general's of Benin's seven trade unions and confederations, observed a sit-in at the Beninese Ministry of the Environment and Sustainable Development in Cotonou, demanding the immediate cessation of proceedings against the Acting Secretary General for Waters, Forests and Hunting, Captain Patrice TrÃ©kpo.

Two masked gunmen aboard a motorcycle dropped a grenade in front of Paul VI Medical Center in Tampouy during the passage of a motorcade of French militaries. Three locals wounded including one severely.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
notes: An MSD member in Bweru was beaten repeatedly by Imbonerakure and the head of the police. They accused him of participating in Tutsi military training in Rwanda.
A policeman guarding a gas station in Karonda beat a civilian who resisted paying a bribe with a stick, leaving him severely injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a man who was the former chief of the Imbonerakure in Munyika. They accused him of failing to support the party. They held him underwater and whipped him all over his body.
Property destruction: 5 houses burned and food stolen.
Looting: houses burned, about 300 livestock heads and 3 motorcycles taken from Tallassari.
A truck was attacked on the national No.1 between Dabanga and Gouess. Three missing, one injured.
One villager was killed in Sanda-Wadjiri. No further details.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the 27th or 28th November, a group of Mayi Mayi Nyatura rebels, a self-defense militia of ethnic Hutus, killed 4 people during an attack in Numbi. One of the victims was a Congolese soldier.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On Monday 27th, the Twa ethnic militia attacked the locality of Kakusa, 20km from Pweto, clashing with the FARDC. During the attack, rebels armed with arrows and light weapons pillaged commerce and agricultural fields belonging to residents. The military was deployed but was caught in an ambush by the rebels, who injured 5 military men.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: On Monday 27th, 6 people were injured during demonstrations in Beni and Majengo (Goma).

notes: During the flee of the Nyatura Mayi Mayi from Numbi, one civilian was kidnapped and a ransom was demanded in order to free him.

actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On Monday 27th, Congolese citizens protested against the presence of Burundian refugees in Kamanyola. The protesters protested in front of the MONUSCO offices, where there are more than 2,800 Burundian refugees. Protesters were dispersed by MONUSCO forces. The report mentions that a cemetary where 39 refugees were buried had their crosses stolen by the protesters as an act of provocation.

Amid suspension of classes by teachers demanding salary increases, clashes erupted in several neighborhoods of the capital Conakry. Young people threw stones at the home of the Minister of National Education, Ibrahima Kalil KonatÃ©, and were repulsed by gendarmes.

22 people were killed and several others injured in clashes between goldminers on the Mali-Guinea border. Malian goldminers, assisted by Malian gendarmes, who attacked the Guinean goldminers at a mine in the village of Faranokho.

Kenya'sÂ security forces on Monday destroyed six Al-Shabaab training camps in an ongoing operation to flush out militants from the vast Boni forest in the coastal town of Lamu.Â "Many" Al-Shabaab militants were killed and others injured during the operation. Â

Local sources confirmed that a civilian was killed by a gunfight between two armed groups. The clashes broke out near the Arab Medical University in Benghazi on Monday and resulted in the death of Khalil Sulaiman al-Qubaili, who was on his way to university.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Armed clashes and exchanges of fire in Derna between the LNA forces of the operations room Omar Mukhtar, and elements of the so-called Mujahideen Shura Council in the city.
4 people were killed when militants and Police clashed in Belo-Sur-Tsirbihina.
Relatives of some 200 Moroccans held in Libya for attempting to emigrate to Italy demonstrated in Rabat
The police at Ondangwa prevented a group of about 50 members of the Ondonga community from entering the authority offices premises at Ondangwa Town's Olunono suburb.
Nigerian Union of Teachers (NUT) protest to call for greater local authority in schools.
3,000 National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) members deployed to public secondary schools in Nasarawa state on Monday in Lafia protested over alleged non payment of their state allowances.

actor2: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
notes: Supporters of Claudine Munari held a peaceful demonstration at the Moungali roundabout in Brazzaville, demanding the liberation of political prisoners. They were dispersed by the police using teargas.
Young people from the commune of Tambacounda (east) blocked the traffic on the main road of the district Abattoirs to demand the completion of its construction started in 2011.
A military officer is shot and killed in Daynille. Al Shabaab propaganda claimed responsibility.
27th November, 2010, Heliwa, Mogadishu: Al Shabaab launch an attack against security forces ivo SOS junction. At least one soldier killed in the attack.
27th November, PM, Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle: Probing attack carried out on SNA position in Qoryoley. A solider was killed in the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 27th November, 2000L, Dhobley, Lower Jubba: KDF convoy ambushed near the town of Dhobley. The attack was initiated with an IED explosion then followed by small arms fire. At least two KDF dead. The attack may have been a reaction to recent Kenyan offensives against al Shabaab in the nearby Boni Forest, Kenya.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 27th November, 1500L, Bari: Press Release from U.S. Africa Command has stated they have carried out an airstrike against Islamic State (IS). The target is believed to be Abdulaziz Gurre, who was later confirmed dead. The attack was near Qandala.

A group of women demonstrated in front of Borama local government office to protest the increase in price of water imposed by the local government. The demonstrators demanded that the local government review the new prices of the communal water.
A protest march took place outside the Pretoria courts over housing issues.

assoc_actor_1: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
notes: Several pro-Palestinian organisations joined a protest with NEHAWU in Pretoria,accusing government of betraying the Palestinian struggle by what it calls âcontinuously strengthening ties with Israelâ.

The Gauteng Department of Health has terminated the contract of a private security company "with immediate effect" after its employees staged a protest at the Steve Biko Academic Hospital. The protesting security guards used stones and rubble to block the entrance to the hospital in Pretoria and vandalised signage and vegetation.
Unknown gunmen shot and killed a policeman in the area of Bilinyang in Mangala county, Jubek state.
An SPLA soldiers beat and shot at sellers from the Vivacell telephone company in Yei town, accusing the company of high charges. Military agents later arrested the soldier.

assoc_actor_2: Bor Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan); Aid Workers (South Sudan)
source: Sudan Tribune; UNMISS; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; Gurtong; UNOCHA; CAJ News Agency (Johannesburg)
notes: Two armed cattle raids by Murle armed youth from Boma state on Dinka civilians in Duk Payuel and Pajut in Jonglei on 27 and 28 November left some 69 people killed (including 3 on the first day) and 19 others wounded. About 55 women and children were also abducted by the attackers, more than than 1,300 cattle raided, civilian properties and humanitarian food items looted and burnt down. Among the casualties, six people working for NGOs were killed (including five from WFP cooperating partners) and another three aid workers injured. A joint force of the army, police and security was deployed and the abducted people were recovered a few days later.

The RSF Commander in North Darfur gave a 48h ultimatum to all armed groups to hand in their weapons as part of the illegal weapon collection campaign launched a few months prior in the region. The news came a day after they clashed with SARC forces, arresting their leader, whom had been among the main opponents of the campaign.

The residents of El Jireif clashed with police while protesting the planned demolition of brick factories in their neighbourhood of Khartoum. A joint security and police force fired tear gas to disperse the crowds and hit demonstrators with batons. 18 people were injured.

Unknown militiamen opened fire on a group of returnees in the Katur area of Tawila locality, leaving two children seriously injured. The group was returning in the framework of the voluntary repatriation. Troops stationed in Katur intervened opening fire in the air, which forced the militiamen into retreat.

assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Sudan); SLM/A-Transitional Council: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Transitional Council Faction); SLM/A-Minnawi: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Minnawi Faction); JEM: Justice and Equality Movement
notes: The leaders of the SLM-MM and SLM-TC accused the government of subjecting the 243 members of their groups captured during clashes in May to physical and verbal violence at El Huda prison in Omdurman. Two prisoners reportedly died as a result while others were amputed (though it is unclear if the amputations are from the conflict or from the violence in prison). Date unclear - report dated 27 November.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Police launched an eight-day campaign of newspaper confiscation in the capital, repeatedly seizing the copies of El Taghyeer, El Jareeda, El Watan, and Akhir Lahza newspapers. The seizures have been described as âa massacre of the pressâ resulting in huge financial losses. A one day strike called by the Sudanese Journalistsâ Network was followed by 70% of journalists on 5 December.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: NISS arrested and detained two students from Alsalam University at a student hostel of Babanoosa over engaging in political activities on campus. The students were released the following day. They were reportedly subjected to torture and/or ill-treatment whilst in NISS custody. They had wounds on their bodies from beatings with a solid object.
Protesters in Gafsa demand their immediate recruitment by the Ministry of Education as secondary school teachers.
The owners of the ready-to-wear stores and their employees protested outside the headquarters of the Sfax governorate.
Strike: 80 detainees convicted in "terrorism" cases and imprisoned in Mornaguia Prison have gone on hunger strike.

More than 5,000 students in the city of Lira arrested their principal on Monday 27th, for alleged corruption and nepotism. The principal was brought to the Lira central police. Police fired teargas and live bullets in order to disperse the angry students.

Police arrested six district leaders of the Obusinga bwa Rwenzururu in Kasese district. The suspects had started mobilising the residents to assemble at the Rwenzori square to demonstrate. In an attempt to disarm one of the police officers, one of them attacked. In response, the police shot and killed him.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: An MDC-T supporter was beaten by ZANU-PF supporters because he had received a vending stall in Mbare. They were angry that a member of the opposition had received a vending stall.

assoc_actor_1: PNSD: National Party for Solidarity and Development; Fajr Jadid; HMS: Movement of Society for Peace
notes: Opposition parties continue to protest against the FLN's victory in Ouargla. For two days party activists violently clashed with police.

Unidentified armed individuals riding three-wheeled motorbikes killed councillor Tamboura Boucari Aissama from the village of Dohoure-Rimaiba. A secondÂ attackÂ took place in Kain in Yatenga province. A French language teacher from the high school in Kain was killed by gunmen "on motorbikes", while two other teachers were injured during the assault on their residence.
A person suspected of witchcraft was killed in Mirango.

actor2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: An Egyptian blue helmet was killed in an ambush in southern CAR. He was part of a convoy from Bangassou and was attacked by Anti-Balaka a few kilometers from Pombolo.

On Sunday, a few hundred people had protested, with the authorization of the police and on the initiative of a coalition of associations claiming to be members of "civil society", to denounce the attitude of the United States.

ISIS says its Sinai Province assaulted gatherings of Egyptian soldiers in the buffer zone near the "artificial border" with Gaza. Reports that the clashes and the IED detonations resulted in dead and wounded in the ranks of the Egyptian army.

Thousands took to the streets in North Sinai to protest against the recent bombing. "No to terror, only prayer houses," thousands of students in North Sinai chanted in a spontaneous protest against the massacre Al Rawdah mosque in Bir al-Abed. The exact location of the protests is not mentioned
In West Hararge zone, Mieso woreda, students demonstrated against the Liyu police after a student was wounded.

Ethiopian security forces have been arresting and beating young men who were going to the rural parts of Chiro city to help people who were removed from Somali region. The exact location of these attacks is not known.
In West Hararge zone, Mieso woreda, Liyu police wounded one person in Haramaya University. Students demonstrated condemning Liyu police following the incident.
Residents of destroyed areas and affected houses in Sirte protested and called on the unaffiliated government to assume responsibility for their areas.
A student was allegedly assassinated at the university of Andrainjato in Fianarantsoa.

A police officer robbed a civilian in the povoation of Nhagamba, in the locality of Nhacassoro in Nguawala administrative post on November 26th.  The police officer fled when other civilians intervened to help the victim, but first fired a shot, hitting one of the civilians and causing him severe injuries.
Two groups of youths violently protest for and against the postponement of an upcoming election. The unrest lasted two days. Several buildings destroyed. One death reported on the first day.
26th November, 1000L, Yaaqshiid, Mogadishu: Infighting between government troops reported. The fighting is believed to be related to the illegal demolition of area shops. No causalities reported.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a herder hailing from Biimaal clansmen at Afaqoow grazing area near Ceel Wareegow village (c. 13 km North East of Marka town). The perpetrators took the victims. Armed organized community clan militias followed the perpetrators and managed to recover the herder after a brief violent clash.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a herder hailing from Biimaal clansmen at Afaqoow grazing area near Ceel Wareegow village (c. 13 km North East of Marka town). The perpetrators took the victims. Armed organized community clan militias followed the perpetrators and managed to recover the herder after a brief violent clash.

assoc_actor_1: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
notes: Former finance minister Pravin Gordhan has denounced the behaviour of a large crowd of protesting people who interrupted him and threw sewage outside a venue in KwaDukuza, north of Durban, where he was supposed to deliver a speech. The protesters were believed to be ANC Youth League members.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Clashes between government and SPLA-IO forces at Kubri Jekau near Pagak town in Upper Nile. Both sides blamed the other for launching the offensive. Rebels claimed to have repulsed a government attack on their positions in this area on 25 November, leaving "several" government troops dead, while two fighters died on their side. Government claimed to have repulsed several rebel offensives to regain control of the Jekau bridge area on 25 and 26 November.

Clashes between RSF and SARC elements in Mistiriyha in North Darfur left at least 14 RSF and 9 border guards killed. RSF captured 50 SARC members, including the movement's leader, Musa Hilal, his sons and several of his aides. One of Hilal's aides and tribal leader of the Awlad Eid Rizeigat clan died in detention the following day, allegedly from torture. The leaders of other rebel groups including the SPLM-N and SLM-MM denounced the arrest of the SARC members and accused RSF of burning homes in the area and killing further civilians, which authorities denied.

Tunisian residents block the road leading to the Libyan-Tunisian border between 22 and 26 November. The shutdown came after the Libyan Customs Department had seized goods for residents of Dehiba town on the Tunisian side.

On Sunday 26th, students of Ayer Seed Secondary School threw stones at the building, smashing the windows of the administration block, the stores and two classroom blocks. The police were tipped off by administrators who had been called by other students.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: Property Destruction: Mnangagwa loyalists led a group of 100 people to the prophet Wimbo's homestead, where they destroyed buildings. Wimbo is accused of supporting the G40 faction.
Soldiers beat a vendor in Harare CBD.
Dozens of citizens gathered in front of the Oran Regional Theater to demonstrate against violence against women.

assoc_actor_1: PNSD: National Party for Solidarity and Development; Fajr Jadid; HMS: Movement of Society for Peace
notes: Hundreds of citizens and activists protested in the city of Ouargla for two days to challenge the results of the local elections. Activists belonged to the opposition PNSD, HMS and Fajr Jadid. The protesters alleged electoral fraud by the ruling FLN.

More than 2,000 people fled the town of Pendé to take refuge in central Paoua because of abuses perpetrated by armed men of the RJ-Ex seléka coalition. Abuses in reprisal for the killing last week of 4 breeders by strangers not far from Paoua center.
Around 100 people have been kidnapped by armed men in the periphery of Kembe between 13 November - 4 December.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: During the weekend, the military clashed with the police forces of Yamongomia in Basoko due to disputes over the bags of hemp seized by the Yamongomia police.
