notes: The Finance Minister, Ignatius Chombo, the CIO director of security, and the leader of the ZANU PF youth were arrested by the military and severely beaten.

assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: ZANU-PF G40 leader, Shadreck Mashayamombe, was tortured by soldiers during the military take-over of Zimbabwe.

Inhabitants from Tamtetoucht started a month-long sit-in in front of Toudgha dam in Tinghir province. They denounce the fact that they will not profit sufficiently from the dam with regards to irrigation.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: Report of intra- group fighting among SLA/AW members in Deribat in East Jebel Marra in November and December 2017, resulting in the killing and injury of civilians, destruction of houses, looting of community assets and in the displacement of hundreds of people.
Social housing beneficiaries organised a protest in front of the seat of the wilaya in Tizi Ouzou to demand a  the swift completion of guaranteed social housing unitis.

Property destruction: Unknown gunmen burned the primary school including three motorbikes and other materiel in GountourÃ© Kiri, department of DÃ©ou;  teachers at the school managed to hide themselves amidst the attack

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: A Frodebu member was beaten by Imbonerakure in Mutobo. The Imbonerakure were angry that he had not contributed to the CNDD-FDD party.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On November 14, a soldier was killed by the FRPI in Singo, a locality 50km from Bunia, in Ituri. The soldier was in route to his position when he was ambushed by the enemy. There was a clash and 4 minutes later he was killed and his weapon taken.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki clashed with the FARDC on the night of the 14th to 15th in the villages of Kantungo and Changombe, in Mulamba. The militiamen had just raided some houses when the FARDC intervened. The rebels fled into the forest.
In November, 14 men from central Sinai were kidnapped and interrogated by Daesh over accusations that they had been agents for Egyptian security.
Islamic State (IS), Wilayat Sinai, has claimed a missile attack on a cement factory linked with the Egyptian army at Jabal Libni. No casualties were reported
Ethiopian forces carry out an attack against Liben community. During the attack seven people were killed and several others wounded.

Three police officers were killed on Tuesday.Â A team of police officers were headed back to a settlement called Lomelo from Kapedo where they delivered food rations to police camps when bandits sprayed their vehicle with bullets, killing the officers.Â A group of officers sent for reinforcement and rescue their colleagues were also caught up in theÂ ambush, which left 10 withÂ injuriesÂ and one missing.

The hearing of a petition challenging the election of Homa Bay Governor Cyprian Awiti was adjourned for more than 30 minutes after supporters of two opposing groups clashed. Governor Awiti's supporters of and those of former Kasipul MP Oyugi Magwanga fought outside the Homa Bay High Court Tuesday morning.
Prisoner's release: Ansar al-Sharia's Abrayek Maziq, former commander of the branch in Ajdabiya, and four others were released from Misrata prison.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Operation Solid Structure said that members of its security forces had been "lightly injured" during clashes with an armed group in the Jarf area of Sirte. Eight militants were then arrested.

Dozens of demonstrators protested outside the Libyan parliament in Tobruk to demand the dismissal of Omar Al-Bar'asi, head of the Audit Bureau, accusing him of financial and administrative corruption.
A suspect was captured and killed by Fokonolona militia in Ambatomipaka,_in_Vavatenina.
Another attack targeting FAMa checkpoints overnight at the eastern and southern entrance (MÃ©naka & Labbezanga) of Ansongo, assailants routed, no casualties reported.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: JNIM claimed a IED attack against MINUSMA, axis Tabankort-AnÃ©fis, on November 14.

Gunmen suspected to be 'ex-militants' have attacked a police patrol team by Ovia River bridge along Benin-Iguobazuwa road in Ovia South West Local Government Area of Edo State. Police sources said the attack, which happened on Monday left one policeman dead and three others injured while the patrol vehicle they were using was burnt.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against SNA forces positioned at Xudur town. Al Shabaab fighters fired small arms fire from a distance to the direction of the SNA base. SNA forces responded with small arms fire and machine guns. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: A Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device (VBIED) has hit an AMISOM convoy on the Afgooye road north of Afgooye ex control. The vehicle's operator crashed into the convoy. Apart from the driver, the number of causalities are not known.

Two groups of government soldiers clashed at Haanta Dheer village in Deynile district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 15 minutes. The two groups disputed over land in the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Local reports claim that the SNA have carried out offensive operations in a number of villages around Baraawe. Government forces gained control of a number of locations in the area the previous day. Fatalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: A suspected al Shabaab suicide bomber rammed an AMISOM convoy with an explosive-laden vehicle outside of Mogadishu along the Mogadishu-Afgooye road at Garas Barey. One confirmed death. After the attack AMISOM forces conducted a security sweep and arrested 19 suspects.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An IED buried along the roadside was defused by AMISOM forces travelling on the road at Ceelwareegow (c. 13 km North East of Marka district). It was reported that another IED exploded at KM 67 area and killed one AMISOM soldier and seriously injured another. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: A suspected US drone targeted an al Shabaab base at Idow-Jalaad, near Yaaq Biri Weyne, killing 'several' militants - four confirmed. A later report claimed seven 'likely.'

Attack without casualties: An unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at South-West special police forces position near Telesom Telecommunication Company in Berdale neighbourhood of Baidoa. The hand grenade landed on an empty place. There were no reports of casualties. There were no reports of arrests.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Defusal: An IED buried along the roadside was defused by AMISOM forces travelling on the road at Ceelwareegow (c. 13 km North East of Marka district). Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for this attempted attack and a second attack near KM67.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed two civilian charcoal burners and injured another at a grazing area near Buulo Xaaji village (c. 70 km South West of Kismaayo town). The injured was taken to Kismaayo Hospital for medical treatment. Al Shabaab fighters took the bodies of the victims from the scene to an unknown location. The motive of the killing was not clear.
A body of a teenager was found in a shallow well in Bad-wayn village (c. 27 km North East of Ainabo). The dead body was taken to Ainabo Hospital. Perpetrators not known.

A group of armed Wadani supporters using machetes assaulted other residents at Qasabka neighbourhood in Burao. The motive of the attack was unclear but it was believed to have been linked to rallies conducted by both Wadani and Kulmiye supporters for unofficial victory of the elections. SLP dispersed the crowd.
Residents blocked the N2 with burning tyres in Beacon Bay. A ward councillorâs office was wrecked in the protest.

assoc_actor_1: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; ANC: African National Congress
notes: Scores of rubber bullets were fired at an angry crowd protesting outside the Bronkhorstspruit Magistrate's Court. The crowd  of EFF and ANC members threw stones and bottles at the police and broke windows of the court's building before rubber bullets were fired.
Unite Behind activists protested against the state of train services in Cape Town saying dodgy tenders and corruption was draining money meant to fix issues that railway commuters encounter daily.
A female train driver on the Durban/Stanger route was left traumatized on after commuters who were late for work reportedly threw stones at her when she refused to proceed past a red stop signal.

Unknown armed men opened fire on a group of people employed by the aid organisation Caritas in Torit East County, Imatong State, wounding one. On their way to a nearby health center, the group fell again in an ambush at Ileu and fled, leaving the wounded in the car whom they later found dead.

Strike: Administrative and education service employees went on a three-day strike in Babanusa Locality in West Kordofan, to protest non-payment of their October salaries. They said they would enter into an open strike should their salaries not be paid by the end of the week.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: NISS launched with RSF a "professional security operation" in a mountainous area of North Darfur to free a Swiss aid worker abducted a month prior from her captors. It is unclear if there was a clash but the aid worker was freed and several of the captors were arrested.

assoc_actor_1: PF: Popular Front; CD: Democratic Current
notes: Civil Society acctivists protested in front of the National Assembly against a controversial 'security law' which stipulates high penalties for resisting and attacking security forces. The protest was supported by the Popular Front and the Democratic current parliamentary blocs.
Merchants who trade with imported products on a market blocked a street leading to the market with burning tires and other obstacles to prevent customs inspection to check and seize their products.

A protest took place on the 14th, in Mbarara. The group encountered a police road block at the Mbarara-Masaka road junction (Mahembe Gente), and stones started flying and police responded with teargas, water cannons and live bullets. The police at this point decided to arrest Besigye in his Land cruiser, which they pulled to Mbarara police station.
The military beat 2 reporters at the national broadcasting station, prior to taking control of the airwaves.
There were running battles between the vendors and the police in Harare. A vendor was injured when a stone hit him.
Workers from 2SP-company protested against the dismissal of 7 colleagues.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: Some CNDD-FDD members in Cumba were beaten by Imbonerakure for not having participated in the demonstrations against the ICC.
A watchman was attacked and killed by unidenitified attackers in Mutaho. As nothing was stolen, it was speculated that the killing might be political.

Four homemade bombs exploded in the night of 12-13 November in Bamenda, the regional capital of northwestern Cameroon, without casualties. One of the bombs exploded shortly after 9:00 pm near the mobile intervention group (GMI), a police unit often targeted in recent weeks. The other three explosions occurred at regular intervals between 3am and 4am on a commercial avenue. These different explosions did not make a victim.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On November 13, a new civil group called 'Les DÃ©boutistes' rioted at 5am in Ndosho. They blocked the main street Goma-Sake and burned tires, in protest for a militant belonging to their group whom had been arrested. This was the first demonstration by the group. The Police used tear gas to disperse the youth group.
In East Guji zone, Liban woreda, Liyu police attacked Oromo people, who returned fire.  Seven Oromos and 8 people Liyu policemen were killed in the exchange.

At least eleven houses have been razed at Esoit in Trans Mara as renewed fighting between Kipsigis and Maasai communities erupted. No fatalities following the incident as residents of Bogoria Village had temporarily abandoned their homes following prolonged insecurity.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Raid: November 13, army gunmen stormed the TV station "Spirit of the Country" in Benghazi, seized furniture, equipment and documents and ordered the station closed.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A civilian was injured when he stepped on a landmine in Gwarsha. He died later of his injuries.
Three civilians were injured as they stepped on landmines in the outskirts of Sirte.

Inhabitants of Tobruk protested in Martyrs Square in Tobruk to show their support of the HoR as legislative authority and Haftar as head of a Libyan army, denouncing the GNA trying to create "parallel institutions" in Benghazi.
Non-violent activity: Islamic State set up a temporary checkpoint 80km south of Abu Hadi to control cars of civilians passing by.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A civilian died as he stepped on a landmine when he was returning to his house in al-Sabiri al-Gharbi, Benghazi.
Dahalo militants attacked a house, killling the person who lived there in Andranomanintsy.
One person was injured as armed militants attacked a group of houses in_Ankerana,_Arivonimamo._
One person was killed in an attack led by Dahalo bandit in Ambatobe in Antananarivo.
3 people died in an attack on a taxi by armed militants in_FanjakanaIsandra.
Hospital staff protests over salaries.
Four members of Boko Haram attacked Muktum village of Gujba LGA, targeting and killing one of the attacker's father.
Hundreds of villagers blocked the Kaduna-Abuja highway in Chikun LGA, protesting the killing of the Commander of Civilian JTF Haruna Halilu in their community by suspected kidnappers.

Students, protesting alleged mismanagement at their school, clash with police. Several injuries reported. The unrest is apparently unrelated to a teacher protest elsewhere in the city. Police may have inadvertently shot a bystander, status unknown.

assoc_actor_1: NUPOS: National Union of Pensioners in Oyo State
notes: A teacher's union protests unpaid salaries.
Al Shabaab throw agrenade at SNA position. One civilian was injured, it is reported one of the assailants was detained. The attack may have happened in Wadajir.
Somali National Army (SNA) have reported taking further previously al Shabaab controlled villages in the Baraawe district. The names of the locations were not given. No reported violence.

Two groups of Wadani and Kulmiye supporters were confronted at Daamurka polling stations in Borama town after both groups attempted to bypass the queue forcefully. SLP at the polling stations dispersed both groups and resumed normal functions at the polling station.

Two groups of Wadani and Kulmiye supporters were confronted at Mohamed Ali and Qasabka polling stations in Burao town whereby both groups attempted to bypass the queue forcefully. Police fired warning shot in the air to disperse the crowds. The administration in Burao intervened and resumed the voting process at those polling stations after an hour. There were no reports of casualties.

Security Measures: Pro-Puntland militia/politicians attempted to disrupt the presidential elections in Widhwidh, Ceegaag and Balihadhac villages. Somaliland security forces pre-empted the move and reinforced security around the polling stations. There were no reports of clashes.

Three SNA soldiers driving a small vehicle shot and killed a civilian man at Tarabunka junction neighbourhood in Hodan district. The soldiers stormed into the house of the victim and shot at the man. The man and soldiers allegedly hailed from the same clan. The perpetrators escaped. The motive behind the killing could not be established at the time of reporting.

Local reports claim that local man was shot and killed by a Somali National Police (SNP) Officer. The reasons for the attack are not known. The attack occurred near the Karan district offices. An attack against government official occurred in Karan the previous day.

Unknown armed attackers injured a civilian man at Nageyle village in Karan district. The victim was taken to hospital but succumbed to his injuries. Security forces responded to the incident and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrest. The motive behind the killing was unknown. The perpetrators escaped. No group has claimed responsibility for the killing.

SLP officers at two of the polling stations in Kaba-dhere and Mohamed-Ugas shot and injured a civilian who created unrest at a queue. Both police officers were arrested at the Burao Police Station. The nature of the 'unrest' is not known.

An armed man from Dhulbahante/Samokaab Ali clansman shot and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Farah Ali sub clan in the vicinity of Taleh. The motive of the killing was linked to prolonged disputes and revenge killings between the two clans. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.
Wadani supporters assaulted an officer who was representing Kulmiye party at the polling station in Iskudar village (c. 56 km North of Oodweyne). Police intervened and dispersed the attackers.

A group of armed Waddani supporters using sticks attacked the representative of Kulmiye at the polling station in Mandhere. SLP in Mandhera arrested four people and the representative was taken to Berbera Hospital.

A group of Kulmiye supporters stoned Waddani officers, who were observing the voting process, in Waddo-Makahiil and Fara- weyne. Two vehicles were damaged. Police fired warning shots in the air to disperse the crowd. The extent of injuries are not known.

A group of Kulmiye supporters stoned Waddani officers, who were observing the voting process, in Waddo-Makahiil and Fara- weyne. Two vehicles were damaged. Police fired warning shots in the air to disperse the crowd. The extent of injuries are not known.

Arrests: Military forces arrest several high profile al Shabaab members in Afgooye. Their identities have been revealed as Aweys Khadar Ahmed, the âEmirâ of Afgooye district, Abdullahi Mohamud Mukhtar âIleeyâ, an explosives technician, Salah Abdulkadir Abdulle, the head of finances in Afgooye district, Mohamed Aweys Ali, an Amniyat operative, Mohamed Hussein Salad (Yemeni/Somali), an Amniyat operative, Mohamed Ali Hassan, an Amniyat intelligence operative, Bakar Mohamed Yacqub, Zakariye Salad Mohamed, an Amniyat operative and Aweys Kamal Muhiadin, an Amniyat operative.
Residents of Letlhabile near Brits took to the streets demanding the resignation of the Letlhabile Community Radio station manager and the board of directors

More than hundred residents protested outside the Polokwane high court in support of Michael Komape's family who is suing the department of education over poor sanitation which they say led to his death in 2014
More than 20 shops closed their doors at the Cleary Park Shopping Centre when a service delivery protest spilled over into the centre.
Residents who wanted to force their way into the Qumbu Magistrate's Court, where a Facebook serial rape and murder accused was appearing, went on a rampage damaging cars and property.
The police were on high alert as a crowd protested, with some screaming " women beater" during the trial of a politician accused of assualting a woman at the Randberg Magistrate's Court.

People in Lakes State took to the streets again to demonstrate against the presence of small weapons in the hands of civilians in the state. They expressed frustrations over road ambushes and rampant attacks on farmers forcing them to abandon cultivation.

Agreement: The standoff between government and former General Paul Malong Awan broke as Malong agreed to reduce his bodyguards from 30 to 4 and president Kiir withdrew the troops recently deployed around his house in Juba and freed him from house arrest, allowing him to travel to foreign countries but not to his home state in South Sudan. The move was said to have significantly reduced tensions in the capital.
Unknown gunmen shot dead three government officials in Rumbek in separate incidents on the week of 13 November in protest against the current state administration.

Brick factory employees and residents in El Jireif East district of Khartoum protested against the arrest of the owner of the factory and three employees as they resisted police's intervention in the factory to prevent people from working there. Police intervened and used sticks, tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the demonstrators, injuring at least two children.

On Monday 13th, protesters demonstrating against the amendments to the Constitution clashed with police in Moyo. Due to poor road infrastructure in the area, tensions had been rising for some time. It emerged that the police had also arrested Obongi County MP Fungaroo Kaps, which enraged his supporters. When police tried to arrest the lawmaker on Monday, protesters clashed with the police officers. The military was sent later to restore order.
During the clashes in Moyo on Monday 13th, rioters attacked an officer of the UNRA, who was later hospitalised.
A policemen was seriously injured by a bullet. It is not known where the bullet came from.

Protesters blocked access to the locality by barricading the section of the national road running through the city. They demand the resignation of the mayor and the establishment of a special delegation to manage their municipality until the next elections.
Unidentified men armed with machetes and clubs attacked 4 households in Giheta, wounding 4 people.
Unidentified men armed with machetes and clubs attacked households in Ndava wounding 5 people.
Crowd burned a Presidential Guard's vehicle after the Guard shot accidentally a youngster following a dispute about a car accident.

Property destruction: "A group of young men" set on fire the girls' dormitory at St. Pius College, located in the South West. Beds, books, notebooks and the personal effects of the 32 students were totally charred.
Property destruction: The public school of Vouzi burned.

Four homemade bombs exploded in the night of 12-13 November in Bamenda, the regional capital of northwestern Cameroon, without casualties. One of the bombs exploded shortly after 9:00 pm near the mobile intervention group (GMI), a police unit often targeted in recent weeks. The other three explosions occurred at regular intervals between 3am and 4am on a commercial avenue. These different explosions did not make a victim.

Following a grenade attack, a series of acts of reprisals were reported to KP 5 and the surrounding neighborhoods of the 3rd district causing at least 5 deaths. Automatic gunfire was heard in the zone during the night of November 11th to 12th and in the morning of Sunday, November 12th. Fatalities split between events.

Villagers in Zawyat Ghazal blocked the road in front of the village after poor road conditions caused an accident which led to the death of 7 children. Police-troops were deployed anticipating serious riots but did not have to intervene.

assoc_actor_1: PDGE: Equatorial Guinea Democratic Party (Equatorial Guinea)
notes: The ruling party, Partido DemocrÃ¡tico de Guinea Ecuatorial, won a majority in the early legislative and municipal elections held in the country on 12 November, with a total of 325,554 registered voters and 18 participating political parties. Ahead of the vote, the opposition party Ciuda danos por la InnovaciÃ³n accused the government of excluding it from the elections, including by preventing it from organizing campaign events and restricting funds. On election day, security forces were deployed, Internet access was suspended and the use of private vehicles was banned. Social media had been inaccessible since the start of the campaign, on 27 October.

About thirty young people gathered this Sunday afternoon, behind a banner Occupy Westfield, to read a statement to the press. And electricity is no longer their main problem: "with this demonstration, it is a matter of upholding the supremacy of our constitution and upholding our right to protest ".

28 bodies, showing traces of torture and mistreatment, have been found in the Western area of Wershefana, nearby Aziziyah where fights took place last week between Zintani militias supported by the GNA and Wershefana militias. A total of 70 people reported killed in week-long fighting
Workers at Misrata International Airport shut down the airport through protests to denounce that they have not been paid their salaries for more than a year and half.
A former communal councilor from Djougani named Oumar Barry was murdered in Koro by two men on a motorcycle.

assoc_actor_1: FNDU: National Forum for Democracy and Unity
source: Anadolu Agency, BBC Monitoring, Sahara Media News Agency
notes: Opposition parties have held a protest rally to pressure President Ould Abdel Aziz not to run for a third term in elections in 2019. They accuse him of succumbing to Western pressure over reducing the sentence for a blogger accused of apostasy from the death penalty to a two-years sentence.
A soldier was reported beating civilians in the Chibok area. His captain and three other soldiers attempt to stop the attack, the perpetrator shot the squad, then himself.

A soldier was reported beating civilians in the Chibok area. When his captain and three other soldiers attempt to stop the attack the perpetrator shot the squad, then himself. The status of the civilian is not known.
Osi and Etan militias clash over two days over 'a long-held dispute.' Two dead, four injured.
Members of Islamic Movement and police clash during a protest. Ten arrests reported.

At least two persons were killed and many others feared injured as gunmen believed to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked Maikadiri village in Askira-Uba Local Government Area. The attack came at night. Some violence spilled into the following day.
After a man is killed in a suspected land dispute, youths of Aiyegbaju Ekiti protest violently. Police made 20 arrests.
After a man is killed in a suspected land dispute, youths of Aiyegbaju Ekiti protest violently. Police made 20 arrests.

Two people were killed at Wereng village of Riyom Local Government Area by suspected Fulanis. The victims were said to have been ambushed near Wereng Station and were found dead the following morning.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 15 IS fighters are dead following a US drone strike 30km from Qandala on 12/11.

Unidentified war planes conducted several air offensive operations at Sanguuni village (c. 50 km North East of Kismayo town). The planes destroyed several al Shabaab locations in the area. Al Shabaab fighters fled from the incident location towards Jamame/Kamasuma. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: Two additional US airstrikes are carried out against al Shabaab 'in the south' between the dates of 09/11 and 12/11. Causality figures are unknown in the two instances where the location is not known. The strike on 12/11 occurred in "Lower Shabelle Region about 64 km west of the capital of Mogadishu." Ballot boxes deployed to Badhan were disrupted in Xingalool due to resistance from Puntland supporters in Badhan. There no reports of clashes or casualties.

Attack without casualties: An unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at South-West force position at Jidka Sodonka in Horseed neighbourhood of Baidoa. The security forces were not present at the location during the attack. There were no reports of arrests.

Attack without casualties: An unidentified man hurled a hand grenade against local security forces on patrol at Waaberi neighbourhood in Dinsoor district (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa). The grenade landed on an empty place. There were no reports of casualties or arrests made in connection of the incident.
A local elder and electorate was killed in a likely targeted killing in Baraka Market. Assailants escaped the scene. Al Shabaab are suspected.

Mogadishu Stabilization forces shot at the Commissioner of Mahaday District while travelling at Sanca junction in Karan district. The official was headed to his residence and the forces suspected his body guards. One of his security guards were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 12 November US airstrike against an al Shabaab camp located near Mareerey, south-west of Jilib in Middle Jubba region. This strike had resulted in 81 casualties.
Battle Churchgoers clashed police and metro officers in Hillbrow because they towed away an illegally parked car, one cop badly hurt.
In Mitchells Plain, residents clashed with police after news spread that a teenage boy had raped a 6-year-old girl. They pelted police officers with rocks and burnt tyres on the road.

Hundreds of protesters burned the house of the commissioner of Kalogi, South Kordofan and locality buildings to protest the use of cyanide by the gold mining companies in the area. Police shot and wounded three protesters, including a higher secondary school student who succumbed to his injuries.

A Burundian refugee was tortured by the Baha communal militia near the Nyaruguse refugee camp, on December 11th. The refugee, named Niyongabo, was intercepted close to the camp by the Baha and severely tortured. The event led other refugees to fear for their safety and to demand an authorisation to leave the camp.
The candidate of the 'Front el-Moustakbel'-list, Farouk TirÃ¨che, and supporters were attacked by a group of young guys armed with knifes and stones. 9 people were injured.

A grenade attack took place during a cultural event at 5th arrondissement Community Centre. 4 dead and 20 wounded.
On November 11, a grenade attack was recorded during a cultural event at the 5th arrondissement town hall, killing 4 people and injuring 20. The perpetrators and their motivations remain unknown.

Following a grenade attack, a series of acts of reprisals were reported to KP 5 and the surrounding neighborhoods of the 3rd district causing at least 5 deaths. Automatic gunfire was heard in the zone during the night of November 11th to 12th and in the morning of Sunday, November 12th. Fatalities split between events.
Ten militants were killed during Apache helicopter raids on hideouts in Sheikh Zuweid.
Egyptian air forces destroyed 10 vehicles loaded with arms attempting to infiltrate into Egypt through its western borders. All militants inside the vehicles were killed.
In West Hararge, Gumbi Bordode woreda, Liyu police attacked Oromo people early in the morning in a pre-dawn raid. They killed one person and wounded one other

Two young people, who were protesting against power and water cuts, were wounded by gunfire Saturday in Guinea in the mining town of Sangaredi (north-west) during clashes with police, it was reported, during violent clashes that broke out between hundreds of excited young people and police, also making about 20 minor injuries since Friday. A gendarme on the phone also reported two of his comrades "injured by young people who use slingshots".

notes: LNA forces stormed and took over the headquarters of Faraj Eg'em, deputy MoI of the GNA, in Budzira district in Benghazi. Eg'ems forces fled to neighbouring Bersis which was attacked and seized by LNA forces later the day.

Unknown gunmen kidnapped a man in Sirte named Usama Ahnish al-Baqar al-Warfalli.
4 people were killed and other injured in Ambotry as villager clashed (Fokonolona) over the theft of livestock.

FAMa detected and destroyed an IED planted on a bridge between DjennÃ© and Kouakourou, Mopti. The unit was subjected to gunfire following the triggering of the device but routed the assailants, 1 FAMa wounded, casualties among the assailants unknown.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: The village chief of KarguÃ© (Lowol GuÃ©ou) accused of "collaborating with the Malian army", was assassinated by presumed "jihadists", the locality recently experienced communal violence between Peuls and Dogons.

source: Anadolu Agency, BBC Monitoring, Sahara Media News Agency
notes: Opposition parties have held a protest rally to pressure President Ould Abdel Aziz not to run for a third term in elections in 2019. They accuse him of succumbing to Western pressure over reducing the sentence for a blogger accused of apostasy from the death penalty to a two-years sentence.

Several are injured in a clash between the security detail of Rivers State Governor Nyesom Wike and those of Minister of Transportation Chibuile Amaechi, PDP and APC, respectively, in Port Harcourt. Injuries reported. The clash may have been related to an assassination attempt against Wike.

Three persons were 'at the weekend' injured in Twon Brass, Brass Local Government Area of Bayelsa State following a bloody clash between supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) and Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in the area. Persons involved in the violence were said to be loyalists of the APC House of Assembly member, Israel Sunny-Igoli and the newly- appointed Caretaker Committee Chairman of Brass, Victor Isaiah.
Osi and Etan militias clash over two days over 'a long-held dispute.' Two dead, four injured.

At least two persons were killed and many others feared injured as gunmen believed to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked Maikadiri village in Askira-Uba Local Government Area. The attack came at night. Some violence spilled into the following day.
The governor of Rivers State survives an assassination attempt allegedly perpetrated by members of the Special Anti Robbery Squad.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Minister of Information Abdirahman Omar Osman has released a statement that joint SNA and AMISOM operations have killed 81 members of al Shabaab. Al Shabaab denied the attack took place. The date(s) of the attack were not provided by the source. Source dated 11/11.
Limited unconfirmed reporting has claimed that al Shabaab have killed a Somalia National Army (SNA) soldier in Afgooye.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: United States drone strikes were launched against al Shabaab in or near the village of Basra (possibly in nearby Mareerey). Casualty figures area unconfirmed but reports state at least 10 al Shabaab were killed. The Pentagon reports at least 36 al Shabaab dead in 5 airstrikes between 09/11 and 12/11, though the causality figure in this instance is not precisely known. Four of five strikes were conducted 'in the south' against al Shabaab. This attack may have occurred on 12/11.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed South West State (SWS) force convoy headed to Berdaale at Ideedi village (c. 45kms North West of Baidoa and c. 11 km East of Berdaale). Al Shabaab fighters detonated an IED targeting one of the convoys followed by a protracted armed clash. Al Shabaab fighters used several RPGs in the attack. Five SWS soldiers and three al Shabaab fighters were killed, and seven SWS soldiers and five al Shabaab fighters were injured in the attack. SWS forces reportedly lost a PKM machine gun to al Shabaab in the attack. SWS forces retreated from the scene and the injured soldiers were transported to Baidoa for medical treatment.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: US air strike against al Shabaab at Bulo Gudud. One causality reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab conducted an IED attack against a Jubaland, AMISOM KDF contingent and international partners joint force convoy near Barka village (c. 40 km North West of Kismayo Town). A Toyota pickup was destroyed because of the blast. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: Anti-al Shabaab drones (likely US) conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab base at Darasalam settlement village in Qoryoley district. Three civilian farmers were killed. Casualties of al Shabaab fighters could not be established at the time of reporting.

Attack without casualties: Al Shabaab members carjacked a vehicle transporting khat near Damase Village (c. 60 km South West of Cel Waaq district). The vehicle was destroyed by al Shabaab using explosives. The whereabouts of the driver and passengers were unknown.

Earthlife Africa, supported by Greenpeace Africa and partner organisations, marched in Johannesburg opposing South Africaâs planned nuclear power station build programme as part of the global day of action on climate change.

Pupils and students of various secondary and primary schools in Rumbek marched to call for the disarmament of civilians possessing illegal firearms and weapons and for improved security, expressing frustrations over road ambushes and rampant attacks on farmers and the resulting closure of schools in the area.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: Clash between former rebel troops led by El Sadig El Fakkah (operating within SLM-AW) and militants who beat and forced IDPs away from their farms at Teo, 2km east of Sortony camp in North Darfur. UNAMID was unable to confront the attackers due to lack of ground troops. One man was wounded and another of El Fakkah's force went missing during the fighting.

Four children died and another was injured in their family's house when an ammunition storage exploded in Nyala, South Darfur. The storage is believed to belong to RSF - a bigger explosion had occurred last May, killing 12.

Clash between former rebel troops led by El Sadig El Fakkah (operating within SLM-AW) and militants who beat and forced IDPs away from their farms at Teo, 2km east of Sortony camp in North Darfur. UNAMID was unable to confront the attackers due to lack of ground troops. One man was wounded and another of El Fakkah's force went missing during the fighting.

In an operation to arrest the SARC leader, Ali Rizgallah, RSF ambushed SARC forces at Al-Malha area in Jibal Moro, east of Kabkabiya in North Darfur. One RSF fighter died and another was injured in the clash, while the SARC leader was indeed arrested.

Police at the Marange diamond fields arrested 3 villagers suspected of mining for diamonds. They were severely beaten and then detained for some days.

At least 4 presumed Ansaroul Islam militants killed following hours of clashes with the Burkinabe army around noon today in Ariel, Soum Province. 4 soldiers also wounded including 1 severely. One of the soldiers wounded succumbed to his wounds.
Property destruction: it was reported that the village of TountÃ© between Koutougou and DÃ©ou, has been attacked by presumed Ansaroul Islam members, gunfire reported and school in flames.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

Sali Lafia kidnapped in Sandawadjiri, was found killed this morning in Bornori. 2 OTHER villagers (Zara Abba and Wanie Haman) kidnapped at Warawide on the same day.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On Friday 10th, a protest took place in the University of Bunia, in which students protested against the decision to cease by the Minister of Land Affairs of ceasing the land in which the university campus is located to a trader. 16 people were arrested by the police after they intervened to stop the protest.
In Minjar Shenkora, North Shewa, protesters burnt a Chinese chipwood factory and disrupted a meeting by regime officials. The protesters were demonstrating the TPLF regime. Arrests reported.

Protesters in Chefe Donso, in East Shewa set ablaze courts, government offices, as well as the townâs municipality and several other buildings in protest of the TPLF regime. Several arrests reported.

In Bale zone, Mada wolabu woreda, "many" (coded as 10) Oromo people living on the border of Oromia and Somali region were killed by Liyu police. About 7000 people have fled the area to Dalo mana woreda.

The death of two gentlemen in the custody of the Police occurred in the Asawase Constituency in the Ashanti Region. Wudu Usman and Lukman Mohammed suspected to be armed robbers, were shot death while in police custody at Sepe, a Kumasi suburb.

People protesting against power and water cuts ransacked the gendarmerie, the police premises and looted the residences of the director of the mine, SÃ©kou BÃ©rÃ©tÃ©, as well as the head of the laboratory of the hospital of the Company of the Bauxites of Guinea (CBG), according to the same sources

Tense situation in Massakro between the military and the population. A 25-year-old man was killed by a soldier: the man was transporting cocoa to neighboring Ghana despite the ban. Questioned by the soldier, disputes ensued when the villagers came out to lynch the element. To defend himself, the latter made two warning shots in an attempt to dissuade them.

Three women in Kitui were allegedly tortured by police on claims of insulting a local church leader. Mrs Hellen Kyalo, Ms Janet Mwikali and Mrs Kathini Mwema from Syongila Village in Kitui Central on Friday said the officers inflicted serious injuries on their behind, thighs and legs.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Deputy MoI of the GNA, Faraj Egems, headquarters were attacked by a rocket-propelled grenade, killing five security personnel and injuring at least three others. Egem accused the LNA of the attack although they denied responsibility.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Attack against FAMa checkpoint at the southern exit of Ansongo towards Labbezanga. Barkhane intervened with airstrikes, body of one assailant was found in the morning, AT-mine, bag with various materiel, 2 motorbikes, 2 PKMs, 2 mags & ammo belts also recovered
Looting: Three transport vehicles carrying health workers en route to Sevare and Bamako were attacked, 30km from Bambara-MaoudÃ©, all stripped of their belongings.
Hundreds of people in the eastern city of Laayoune went to the streets to condemn the alleged light sentence (two years prison and no death penalty) handed down against a liberal blogger.

A protest by radical Islamists in Nouakchott against the light sentence of two years prison for the liberal blogger, Mohamed Ould m'Khetir, was dispersed by police forces with teargas and truncheons. Several protesters were injured.
At least three Nigerian soldiers and a militiaman were killed in a Boko Haram ambush in Gwoza on 10/11.
Following a spate of violence protesters call on Fulanis to leave the area.

Members of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB)  took to major streets of Onitsha and its environs calling for boycott of an upcoming Anambra State governorship election. The group marched along major roads including Awka road, Old Market road, New Market road to Main Market, Oguta road and Upper Iweka to Owerri road vowing that there would be no election in the state or 'Biafra land' unless a referendum was held for the exit of Igbo people from Nigeria.
Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram in Bama LGA 'killing many.' Elsewhere in the LGA military forces cleared a Boko Haram camp and rescued a young prisoner.
Police disperse a Shiite (Islamic Movement) protest in Kano. The protesters were calling for the release of their incarcerated leader. No violence reported.

A protest march by members of the Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN) demanding the release of their leader, Ibrahim Zakzaky becomes violent following a clash with police. The report was late-breaking and the injury figures are not known.
Members of the NLC violently protest a teacher layoff proposal.

Military forces clear Shyadawe-Angwan-Fulani, Shyadawe-Angwan-Bula-Musa and Shyadawe in the Sambisa Forces area on 10/11. The troops captured two gun trucks, three motorcycles, many bicycles and a laptop containing valuable information. They also located a vandalised and unserviceable tank in one of the camps. No violence reported.
Puntland forces launch an attack against IS members at Timirshe. A similar attack occurred at this location on 07/11. Causalities in this instance not known.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a base at Baqdaad. Causality figures not known.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a base at Jambaluul. Causality figures not known.

Al Shabaab recaptured on 10 November Baasra settlement, located approximately 15km west of Balcad in Middle Shabelle region, following a sustained attack against the base recently set-up by the SNAF. Causalities are not known. Basra had recently been claimed by government forces on 05/11.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States

The Pentagon reports at least 36 al Shabaab dead in 5 airstrikes between 09/11 and 12/11, though the causality figure in this instance is not precisely known. Four of five strikes were conducted 'in the south' against al Shabaab.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters were observed at Kalabayr junction (c. 22 km North of Beletweyne town) where they coerced the local power company, located on the eastern side of Beletweyne town, to switch off electricity to the town. The company switched off the electricity for 30 minutes. AMISOM Djiboutian contingent forces received the information and fired several rounds of artilleries to the area where al Shabaab movements was observed. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Armed militia from Reer Mataan sub clan of Abgal shot and killed two other clansmen hailing from Mohamed Muse Reer Mataan sub clan at Dhaay Waraabe settlement in Jowhar district. The perpetrators escaped. The motive behind the killing was unknown.

source: Congress of South African Trade Unions (Johannesburg)
notes: The house of a NUM youth leader was burnt down by alleged Amcu members in  Orange Farm.
Suspected cattle raiders from Boma attacked a cattle camp in Twic Centre county in Jonglei, leaving one person killed, two others injured and 17 heads of cattle stolen.

notes: On 4 November, government and SPLA-IO forces clashed in Ngop and Tarkhan, near Nhialdiu in Unity, with casualties on both sides.

notes: On 4 November, government and SPLA-IO forces clashed in Ngop and Tarkhan, near Nhialdiu in Unity, with casualties on both sides.

Dozens of residents from El Tirtir and El Tadamon gathered for a vigil in front of the house of the Kologi locality commissioner to protest mining activities in the region. A delegation of the Sudanese Company for Mining had just held a symposium to persuade residents to allow them to operate, but the protesters refused.

Bloody clashes between RSF and SARC forces of Ali Rizgallah at Amari Gadid, Kaila, Niro and Eshbara in Korma area of North Darfur. RSF said they defeated the rebels, killing "several" and capturing 9 fighters.

Bloody clashes between RSF and SARC forces of Ali Rizgallah at Amari Gadid, Kaila, Niro and Eshbara in Korma area of North Darfur. RSF said they defeated the rebels, killing "several" and capturing 9 fighters.

notes: An Imbonerakure attacked and beat a nearby family in Jimbi over a land dispute.

actor1: SCACUF: Southern Cameroons Ambazonia Consortium United Front
notes: On the night of 9 to 10 November, a soldier serving with the 22nd Motorized Infantry Battalion was killed. The incident took place in Akwem, 30 km from Mamfe in the southwestern administrative region.
Clashes between armed groups since November 9th, on the Bria Ouadda axis.
Militants from an Islamic State affiliate ambushed a convoy of cement trucks from an army factory in the central Sinai Peninsula, killing eight civilian employees and two soldiers.
Pope Kyrillos stages a sit-in after the power is cut to his church. The sit-in is joined by a wider protest by Copts who fear that the power cut is a pre-text to close the church down.
Students of Metu University in Illubabor staged a protest rally. The students were chanting slogans denouncing the ethnic and divisive policies of the TPLF government.
Looting: In Guji zone, Liban woreda, Liyu police reportedly conducted a cattle raid, taking as many as 450 Oromo owned animals.
A woman who stabbed her boyfriend to death after a dispute over a phone was lynched by a mob in Murang'a Thursday morning.
Policeman wounded after armed men seized his vehicle.
Local disturbances in Tessit following the arrest of 6 MNLA fighters amidst the first joint G5Sahel force & Barkhane operation in the tri-state border.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: MINUSMA convoy struck by mine/IED detonation around 13h, axis Boni-Hombori, 2 wounded, medical evacuation to Gao. Claimed by JNIM on November, 15th.

source: BBC Monitoring, Sahara Media News Agency
notes: There have been nationwide protests against a lenient verdict that was issued by the court of appeal in  Nouadhibou against a blogger accused of apostasy.
Dozens of workers of the Chinese fishing company Poly Hon Done demonstrated after the company arbitrarily dismissed them. Protesters calledon the authorities to intervene.

There is tension at Iyana-Iba, around the main gate to the Lagos State University, as hundreds of commercial motorcycle riders have barricaded the entire road leading from Lagos to Badagry area of the state. The motorcycle riders were protesting the seizure of the motorcycles by the state task force.
Ikorodu area residents protest a prolonged power outage in Ikeja.
Protest in Kaduna following the termination of a number of state employed teachers.
Members of the "Young Pharmacists Group" protest in Kano over employment discrimination.

09th November 1100L, Hodan, Mogadishu: A road side improvised explosive devise (IED) detonated at the Ministry of Defence.  The explosive missed its target, though it hit a Somali National Army (SNA) vehicle injuring three. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

Armed supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties using sticks clashed at a roundabout near the local government in Burao. Police intervened and dispersed the supporters. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: The US on Thursday launched an airstrike in Somalia's Bay region killing several Al Shabaab militants. The attack occurred about 100 miles west of Mogadishu. The Pentagon reports 36 al Shabaab dead in 5 airstrikes between 09/11 and 12/11, though the causality figure in this instance is not precisely known. Four of five strikes were conducted 'in the south' against al Shabaab.

Unknown armed attackers shot and killed a NISA soldier at Dhagah Tuur Village in Afgoye district. The soldier was working in Mogadishu and went Afgoye for his leave before the armed attackers shot him. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab elements claimed responsibility for the attack.

An IED, buried alongside the road, targeting an SNA convoy travelling through Industrial Road near Caafi Factory, exploded. Troops opened fire at suspected directions of the attack. At least one civilian pedestrian and a government soldier were injured in the blast. The unidentified perpetrators escaped.

An IED planted near Perfume factory detonated in Heliwa district. The place was frequented by SNA forces. At least three soldiers were injured in the blast. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the explosion.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: United States forces carry out a drone strike against IS personnel 'in the northeast' (likely near Qandala) on 09/11. Four deaths reported.

Armed assailants shot and killed a civilian man at Weydow village in Deynile district. The man was attacked by armed men while he was in his house. The motive behind the incident was unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Members of the ANC in the Boland region in the Western Cape protested outside the party's provincial offices in Cape Town demanding to know why their regional secretary, Jonton Snyman, had been suspended.
Two more houses have been torched by angry community members in Rustenburg following the disappearance of a teenage girl.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO claimed to have attacked the village of "New Site" close to the border with Kenya in Kapoeta and withdrawn soon after. New Site was the former SPLM headquarters prior to signing of the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) in 2005.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Two SPLA-IO combat intelligence agents were killed and another was injured after an ambush by government troops in Torit town.
A grenade explosion wounded three children from one family at Hai Mangatain in Juba.
Traders in Tonj town closed their shops and demonstrated to denounce increasing theft cases in the main market at night. The state government promised to provide security patrols at night.
Clash between armed youth from Western and Eastern Lakes state during a cattle raid in Western Lakes State left at least four people killed and six others wounded.

Unknown gunmen fired shots in the air at the Gereida IDP camp in South Darfur as young people were gathering building materials from the Abola area to re-construct buildings that had burned in the camp fire two days prior. Three displaced students were wounded.
Armed herdsmen opened fire on a group of farmers as they attempted to chase away the herders' cattle from their farms south of Gireida in South Darfur, wounding two.
Armed men beat and raped four displaced farming women from Abu Suruj in Sirba, West Darfur, causing them varying injuries.
Unknown gunmen stormed the dormitory for teachers of a school east of Muglad town in West Kordofan, killing two teachers.

Thousands of protesters descended Thursday in the streets of Lome and other cities for the third consecutive day against Togolese President Faure Gnassingbe. Sokode and Bafilo were unable to demonstrate during these three days, these two cities were besieged by soldiers deployed in large numbers and who prevent any gathering.

Thousands of protesters descended Thursday in the streets of Lome and other cities for the third consecutive day against Togolese President Faure Gnassingbe. Two musicians were shot and wounded in Lome on Thursday, reports VOA Africa correspondent on the scene.
Construction workers in Medenine protested in front of the seat of the governorate to show their solidarity with colleagues in Tunis.

Unidentified attackers killed a woman in Nyabiraba.
Looting: Incursion in Talakachi. A wounded villager, 3 motorcycles, 4 bicycles and cattle washed away.
17 people were kidnapped on November 8 about 5km south of Dimbi.

Shortly after 10am, dozens of police dispatched to the scene. Reports mention arrested people and one student whose hand will have to be amputated after having lost a thumb.
A total of five militants were killed, another seven were injured and further suspects were arrested in a joint army-police crackdown in the cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
A total of five militants were killed, another seven were injured and further suspects were arrested in a joint army-police crackdown in the cities of al-Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.

A 52-year-old commercial driver was killed at Kasoa in the Central region by persons suspected to be land guards. The son of the late driver said the guards stormed their home at Opeikuma at about 7:00pm Wednesday and murdered his father.
Drivers eager to demonstrate over a wide range of issues capitulated after police, leaving no stone unturned, showed up in full force.

The objective of the 6-day long military operation was reportedly to crack down on pro-Qaddafi forces in the area.

A police commander from Bayda, Ayman al-Hassi, was wounded and seized from his home by unknown gunmen. Hassi, in his role as head of the townâs police investigation unit, has earnt a reputation for toughness against militias. He was released after 1 day in captivity.

Non-violent activity: Islamic State elements set up a temporary checkpoint 70km south of Sirte to control cars passing by and confiscated food from trucks.
20 Dahalo, in an attempted robbery, injured a lady in Ambohibary.
Fulani, fleeing from Benue State following the implementation of an anti-grazing law, attack Jangaru area of Awe, leaving scores dead and many hospitalised.
Motorcyclists protest police extortion in Akure.
Taxi drivers light bonfires in protest a case of police brutality against a colleague. Police made arrests.
Police allegedly attack a taxi driver without provocation. The attack led to a protest.

Al Shabaab launched a heavy attack against a newly established SNA base (c. 14 km from Balcad). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about two hours after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least eight people from both warring parties were killed and four others were injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 08th November, PM, Basra, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed local sources have claimed that African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops have been attacked by al Shabaab Militants. Causality figures not known.
Al Shabaab injures a civil servant with a remote controlled under-car IED attack.

assoc_actor_1: UCID: Justice and Welfare Party of Somaliland
notes: Armed supporters of UCID and Wadani political parties using sticks clashed at Ahmed Dhagah district in Hargeisa. Police arrived at the scene and the two groups escaped from the area. There were no reports of arrests.

assoc_actor_1: AMCU: Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union
notes: Amcu members protested outside the Brits Magistrate's Court, after NUM member Nkosinathi Mantashe, accused of attempted murder, was granted bail.
A bodyguard of the Msunduzi municipality speaker was shot dead by two suspects in Caluza near Pietermaritzburg.

Commuters from villages and residential areas along the R61 found themselves stranded as taxi operators joined residents of Mthatha West in a protest march to the King Sabata Dalindyebo municipal offices.
Three separate houses were set alight by angry community members in Rustenburg following the disappearance of a teenage girl.
The bodies of two men, riddled with gunshot wounds, were found at the infamous Glebelands Hostel in Umlazi.
A gunfire exchange between unidentified armed men and a night patrol of SPLA and police officers left at least two soldiers and an assaillant dead along the Kineti River in Torit.

Ceasefire: The government of South Sudan extended its unilateral ceasefire with the various armed opposition movements operating in the country, and called on the rebels to honour it as well. The following day, President Kiir extended the state of emergency in parts of Bahr al Ghazal region for 90 days.
Dozens of former Sudanese staff at the World Food Programme (WFP) protested in El-Fasher, North Darfur demanding payment of financial dues that amounts to $20 million.

Thousands of protesters descended Thursday in the streets of Lome and other cities for the second consecutive day against Togolese President Faure Gnassingbe. Sokode and Bafilo were unable to demonstrate during these three days, these two cities were besieged by soldiers deployed in large numbers and who prevent any gathering.
Raid: A group of 4 presumed ISIS/Jund al-Khilafah militants raided a home for supplies last night in Selta, adjacent to Jebel Mghila.
Pupils protested in front of several schools in Jendouba against the return to a system of trimesters instead of semesters.

The regional syndicate of the force of the Interior Ministry organised a protest in front of the Bardo to denounce the recent aggressions by rioters & militants against them and called for the adoption of a controversial law.

Armed riot police officers deployed at the venue of a protest fired teargas canisters to disperse a crowd of youth who wore red ribbons as they cheered the opposition politicians who had just arrived at the venue. Police also lobbed tear gas canisters under the cars of the opposition politicians to have them come out of their vehicles and abandon the venue but in vain. Mr. Besigye, who was attending, locked himself in his car, refusing to Mr Wanyama, Aswa Regional Police Commander. The presidential contender was been held static in his car for nearly three hours since 3:00pm by armed riot police officers who also double shielded his car with a police firefighting truck and police patrol pickup. Mr. Besigye managed to escape without being arrested.
PF youth rioted at an event in Luampa and refused to allow an MP to enter the event.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: ZANU PF youth in Makokoba staged a protest against their MP, accusing him of belonging to the fired Vice President's faction.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: The Masvingo Provincial Youth Chairman of ZANU PF and other Masvingo Youth League members beat up a member of the Youth League from a different faction during a meeting to purge Mnangagwa's allies.
Police at the Marange diamond fields arrested 5 suspected diamond panners. They set dogs on them and then held them for some days, while they beat them.
Inhabitants from Adrar staged a sit-in to protest against the decision by authorities to transform a school into an educational center for teachers.
Parents of students from a primary school in Ras Bouira protested in front of the municipal council in Bouira against the closure of the school canteen.

Parts of a building that was buying destroyed fell on a taxi and damaged the vehicle which angered public transport workers who interrupted work to denounce the authorities. This led to a short panic by passengers, followed by a gathering of several protesters which required the intervention of police forces to appease the angry protesters.
Two militants killed and arms seized yesterday afternoon in the area of Djebahia, Bouira Province.

2 landowners in Gitaba were attacked by armed men in police uniforms.

actor1: SCACUF: Southern Cameroons Ambazonia Consortium United Front
notes: Two policemen were killed by assailants in two different attacks in Bamenda's peripheral neighbourhoods. 2 assailants and one civilian dead in national guards' riposte.
Reports of violence on civilians during the past weeks has led to 695 displaced persons from the Benamkor locality. Exact details not provided.

Nubians blocked major streets and railway tracks in Kalabsh vilages, 50km south of Aswan, to denounce the recent death of a prominent Nubian activist in jail. 10 of them were arrested by police for organizing the event.
ISIS claimed damaging EG army bulldozer & destroying vehicle by IEDs, today & y'day respectively, area of Rafah near Gaza border.
Attacks and many injured in violence by suspected Liyu Police members in West Hararge zone, Mieso woreda.
Occupy Westfield, Gambia: group of young people tried to stage a demonstration at the main crossroads of the city to express their anger against the very frequent load shedding.

Some youth suspected to be supporters of the New Patriotic Party, backed by the Nanumba North District Chief Executive, Abdulai Yaquob, have taken control of the community water system at Binbcheratanga in the Nanumba North District of Northern Region.
This has led to a water shortage over the past four days in Binbcheratanga, forcing residents to trek long distances to a single borehole for water at the risk of cholera.

Several hundred journalists demonstrated against violence against a dozen of their colleagues last week by gendarmes and denounce the lack of support from their supervisory authority, said an AFP correspondent.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Clashes took place between Juwaili forces, a Zintani commander of the PC western military zone, supported by a militia from Zintan, and Wershefana forces in Aziziyah. 40 combatants were killed and injured during the weeklong fights in and around Aziziyah.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: The LNA reopened the Ain Ghazala gate (60 km west of Tobruk) in the Tobruk military area by setting up new headquarters and military barracks for the security services stationed at the gate. It was done to protect the area from the Gulf of Bemba West to Imsiad East and further south down to Jaghboub from incursions.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: A military vehicle hit by a IED. 3 wounded.
Parents on Monday barred children and teachers from entering the school premises by locking the gates.
Workers of the College of Education at Ikere-Ekiti block the entrance of the institution over two days over unpaid salaries.
The headquarters of the Energy Commission of Nigeria (ECN) was shut down as its senior staff barricaded the entrance over what they said was unfair labour practices.
Four suicide bombers attack London Chiki/Kaleri axis of Jere Local Council, killing themselves and injuring eight others.
Disguised in army uniform, suspected Fuanlis kill 11 and injure others at Arim, Riyom on the evening of 07/11.
Timirshe, Bari: Puntland security forces conduct offensive operation against Islamic State in the Bari region. Details limited.

Four people hailing from Marehan clan were abducted by Suleiman clan militias in Cadado town. The motive of the abduction was connected to previous carjacking and abductions. The victims were later released.

A civilian vehicle travelling near Tixsiile was ambushed by armed militia who shot at the vehicle. As result, five passengers were killed and three others were injured. The attack occurred on either 07/11 or 08/11.

The NTA and its affiliated taxi associations descended on Tshwane CBD in protest to hand over memoranda, which listed the grievances and issues affecting the taxi industry.  Two taxi drivers were arrested after allegedly assaulting a female Tshwane Metro Police officer.
Students protested in Pietermaritzburg over the lack of transport. This action was part of an Equal Education-led protest for government to provide needy children with scholar transport.

Hundreds of IDPs marched from the UN protection site to Rabittha in the Jebel Khair neighbourhood in Wau to call for improved security to return home and build peace in their communities. The march was organised by UNMISS.
Attack without casualties: Unknown gunmen set fire to two fuel tanker trucks along the Yambio-Mvolo road after beating one of the drivers. No reported injury.
Unknown armed men killed a driver working for the UN Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO) at his house in Hai Korton in Torit town.
Suspected Murle tribesmen attacked Pero village close to Pochalla town, abducting four children. This is the second incident in less than a week.
Five children were injured, some of them seriously, when a grenade they found at Sham El Naseem district in Nyala detonated.
A herder severely beat and injured a displaced woman in Kabkabiya locality in North Darfur as she was trying to stop camels from entering her farm.

actor2: ACT: Alliance for Change and Transparency Wazalendo
notes: Raid: Tanzanian police carried out a raid Tuesday night on the headquarters of the opposition party ACT, which recently criticised the state of the economy under President John Magufuli.

Thousands of people took to the streets in Sokode on Tuesday in the latest protest calling for the long-standing President Faure Gnassingbe to step down. Gatherings were dispersed in the late morning by law enforcement, despite the recent lifting of the government's ban on demonstrations on weekdays

Thousands of people took to the streets in Togo's capital on Tuesday in the latest protest calling for the long-standing President Faure Gnassingbe to step down. "The army has been in the area since last night (Monday) and has been chasing young activists to their homes," said Ouro Akpo Tchagnaou, from Fabre's National Alliance for Change (ANC). "They are breaking up any gathering on the streets and are using sticks and chains to beat people."
People rioted in front of a school in Bousalem against the return to a system of trimesters instead of semesters. The riots injured some pupils and damaged some cars.
An individual who killed his mother with a knife resisted an arrest attempt by a policeman in Kairouan and heavily injured the policeman who had to be hospitalised.
Security forces from the Interior Ministry organised a march and a protest in Monastir to call for the implementation of a law that stipulates serious penalties for agressing security forces.

Police in Lira district indiscriminately fired tear gas canisters at supporters of former Forum for Democratic Change [FDC] presidential candidate Dr Kizza Besigye, leaving two people seriously injured. It started with the police ordering the protesters to leave the Lira mayor's gardens, after which the protesters disobeyance led the police to start firing tear gas canisters. Police on Thursday apologised to 'innocent' people in Lira town who were affected by the tear gas and rowdy Tuesday atmosphere. One person was shot by a stray bullet.

A police officer in Matutu, Rutana, attacked a group of people who were out after curfew. He beat them and opened fire to scatter them. This police officer is known in the area for his violence.

A Cameroon policeman has been killed while pursuing men who attacked a school in one of the country's English-speaking regions, where tensions have fuelled a separatist movement, authorities told AFP on Tuesday. "Suspected separatists gunned down a gendarme yesterday (Monday) in Jakiri".

On November 06, 2017, the 35th anniversary of the ascension to the supreme office of President Paul Biya, activists, activists and sympathizers of the Democratic Rally of the Cameroonian People, dressed in the colors of the party of the burning flames, invested the multifunctional center and promotion of the young people of Baham, theater of the demonstration, to the effect of celebrate the man of renewal.
60 people were kidnapped between 4 and 9 November in Kembe by armed gunmen.

Transport in Mandera County has been paralysed after operators suspended bus services in the county for three days after al-Shabab attacked two police vehicles on Monday evening. Al-Shabab militants ambushed and burnt down two police land cruisers in an attack in Daba City, Mandera County on Monday. The two vehicles carrying police officers were escorting a bus to Mandera when they were hit by rocket-propelled grenades. 12 killed, several wounded.

Angry protests took place outside Misrataâs anticrime office following the death in detention of leading Benghazi Revolutionariesâ Shoura Council member Mohammed Bakr Al-Yedri.
A rocket attack (RPG) on Benghazi Radioâs broadcasting studios slightly injured a number of people, including the poet Khadija Bsikri.

The belief in vampires led to rioting in which the Cuamba district secretary of the Mozambique Youth Organisation (OJM), the youth wing of the ruling Frelimo Party, and a community leader in Mepica locality were accused of protecting the vampires. The police have arrested eight people for spreading rumours about vampires, which prevented the mob from lynching their two intended victims.
Looting: Health centre was attacked and looted. 2 motorcycles and 5 phones seized.

At least two civilians were killed when dozens of Boko Haram fighters tried to storm Gulak, in the Madagali area of the far north of Adamawa state. The force of 50 was repelled by military forces in the town. One soldier was killed. "A lot" of Boko Haram KIA. Recorded total as 13. A Vanguard report published the following day claims 42 dead (it is not known if this report accounted for the soldier's death). The attack caused a large portion of the residents to flee for safety.

Fulani herdsmen attack Azege, Tse Ikyoifi, Logo Local Government Area (LGA) of Benue state where they sexually assaulted at least one woman. They also burnt several houses in the village and displaced many others in the process.
Protests over state land acquisition for the purposes of a highway reported in several cities.
Protests over state land acquisition for the purposes of a highway reported in several cities.
Protests over state land acquisition for the purposes of a highway reported in several cities.
Protests over state land acquisition for the purposes of a highway reported in several cities.
Protests over state land acquisition for the purposes of a highway reported in several cities.
Workers of the College of Education at Ikere-Ekiti block the entrance of the institution over two days over unpaid salaries.
Hospital employees protest over salaries.

Violence broke out on Monday in the central Freetown between supporters of the opposition Sierra Leone Peoples Party (SLPP) and the ruling All Peoples Congress (APC) over a radio talk show. The fight started after opposition supporters claimed they were marginalized in the talk show at Sierra LeoneBroadcasting Corporation (SLBC).

Attackers shot and killed a correction police officer at Carafaat neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. Security forces responded to the incident and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrator escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing.

South West State forces attacked al Shabaab fighters preparing to ambush civilian vehicles at Ugaari area (c. 10 km North West of Buurhakaba) on the road between Baidoa and Buurhakab district. There was an exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. One al Shabaab fighter was killed in the attack and his body was brought to Buurhakaba town by South West State forces.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: AMISOM forces launch an attack on an al Shabaab position near Bali Doogle airport. Causalities not known. The attack is part of a wider offensive in the area.
A Somaliland soldier was shot and killed by a fellow clansman in Lasanod during a scuffle. A stray bullet injured a civilian.
Defusal: Security forces seized a small vehicle laden with explosive devices. The vehicle, which was parked on the road, was suspected by residents who informed security. Perpetrator not known.

Two clan militias hailing from Saâad and Suleiman clans, sub-clan Habargidir hijacked four vehicles amongst themselves, two from each corner of South Galkayo and Godinlabe (c. 30 km South of Cadado) in Mudug and Galgaduud regions respectively.

Al Shabaab publicly executed three al Shabaab fighters and one civilian of Somali origin. The victims were accused of aiding with Ethiopian/Somali troops and spying for foreign intelligence agencies. The victims were brought from other al Shabaab controlled areas a day before the killing.
Tension was reported to be high in Meygagle following the murder of a Dhulbahante/Reer-Hagar man by an armed Dhulbahante/Ali-Geri sub-clan man. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.
A number of taxis operators staged a sit-in in front of the Glen Manor Office Park in Menlyn (Pretoria) where the Cross-Border Road Transport Agency has its office.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO claimed to have attacked the village of "New Site" close to the border with Kenya in Kapoeta, killing 50 SPLA soldiers. They claimed to have gained the area but another statement a few days later claimed they attacked the area again on 9 November and withdrew. New Site was the former SPLM headquarters prior to signing of the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) in 2005.
NAS claimed to have repulsed government forces' attack on their positions in Mvolo County in Western Equatoria, killing several soldiers and capturing guns and ammunitions.

Militiamen raped a young woman at gunpoint as she harvested crops in Mershing locality in South Darfur.

The regional union of national security organized a protest in Jerba. Police, National Guard, Civil Protection and Custom Workers protested, calling for the ratification of a law that foresees to increase the punishment for agressions against security forces.
Protesters from the National Water Distrubution Company (SONEDE) protested in front of the seat of the company in Gafsa.
Three soldiers were wounded in two separate explosions of two mines in the closed military zone of Chaambi.
Property destruction: Unknown men set the house of a policeman in Sousse on fire. No one was injured.
Young protesters blocked the road between Tatouine and Medenine to call for a speeding-up in the provision of micro-credits for them.
Strike: The Order of Ugandan Doctors (UMA) launched on Monday a national strike to protest the improvement of their wages and working conditions.

Police fired live bullets and teargas to disperse supporters of the opposition figure who had gathered at Arrow Square in Soroti. Police also arrested former Presidential candidate Dr Kizza Besigye, who led a group of Forum for Democratic Change leaders to a campaign rally in the municipality. Besigye, who was in company of the FDC Presidential candidate Patrick Amuriat Oboi was arrested as the situation worsened and detained at Soroti Police station. The police also mentioned that they dispersed the raly because it was taking place illegaly. According to the Daily Nation, supporters of Besigye engaged with police in battle for almost 6hours. Some people were injured and others hospitalised.
Teaching personel and workers from a college in El Euch, south of Bord Bou Arreridj, protested in front of the school. Protesters denounce surcharged school classes and missing didactic materiel.
A candidate from Takatoul al-Fath Alliance for the municipal council elections in Khenchela was attacked by a man with a knife and heavily injured.
The regional offices of the FFS in Ait Abdelmouemen were ravaged by unknown men.
Unknown men ravaged the regional offices of the RND-party in Mekla.
A electoral candidate of the FFS was physically agressed in his home in Tizgirt by unknown men.
A student was kidnapped by men dressed in security force uniforms from a graduation party in Kamenge. His family fear for his life.
