Former President John Dramani Mahama and other bigwigs of the opposition National Democratic Congress (NDC), led thousands of party faithful in a Unity Walk in the Central Regional capital, Cape Coast, on Sunday morning. The thousands of party supporters and leaders, marched through some principal streets in the Cape Coast municipality, singing, dancing and drumming.
Property destruction: Associate Justice Sie - A - Nyene Yuoh's residence was attacked by unidentified men.
An Egyptian citizen was injured on 5 November 2017 by a stray bullet in the Majouri area.

Staff at one of the stations in the Shahara oil field were attacked last night. Nobody was injured, although the engineers were beaten and two vehicles as well as mobiles were stolen.The incident, not known whether criminal or political, did not affect production.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: JNIM claimed assault on gendarmerie post in Bla taking control of site and seizing booty.

The guards and cleaners at a regional hospital in Al Hoceima organized a protest inside the regional hospital's courtyard against a series of measures taken by the hospital administration, such as arbitrary dismissal and forcing them do work not foreseen in their job description.

Police Forces in Taourirt prevented workers who were dismissed from a coal factory from completing a protest march from Oujda to Rabat. When protesters arrived in Taourirt the police prevented them from continuing the march. Workers in the city went on a hunger strike and 3 of them had to be taken to the hospital.

After the funeral of a deceased citizen, rioters marched from Bni Drar to the seat of the prefecture in Bni Khaled which they attacked with stones before blocking the circulation at the National Highway 2, connecting Oujda with Nador. They also entered the communal depot in Bani Khaled and set vehicles on fire before smashing several shops and bus stations in the city. Security forces then intervened to stop the rioting.
Residents protest high electricity bills.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber attempted an attack Irmirsa community, but were shot and killed by soldiers and local hunters before they were able to attack.

A pair of Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Tsilda on 05/11, killing themselves and two civilians. Another bomber attempted an attack on Irmirsa community, but were shot by soldiers and local hunters before they were able to attack.
Islamic State (pro-Iranian Shiite) protesters clash with police in Kano, two believed dead. A second source claims three dead.
05 November, afternoon, Afgooye/Balcad districts â SNAF forces capture Baasra, Daniga/Baloow and Buulo Kuunto. Five killed in Basra. No violence reported in the other areas.
05 November, afternoon, Afgooye/Balcad districts â SNAF forces capture Baasra, Daniga/Baloow and Buulo Kuunto. No violence reported.
05 November, afternoon, Afgooye/Balcad districts â SNAF forces capture Baasra, Daniga/Baloow and Buulo Kuunto. No violence reported.
SLP arrested seven youngsters involved in a "public disturbance" in Halane neighbourhood, Borama. No reported violence.

A group of students in Wadamagoo secondary schools staged a demonstration against the arrest of their school principal by police after being accused of getting USD 5,000 from Wadani opposition party as compensation for lack of three monthsâ salary.
SLP arrested eight youngsters involved in public disturbance in Mohamud Haibe, Hargeysa. No reported violence.

Unknown assailants shot and injured a municipal officer at Bakara Market gold section in Howlwadag district. The victim was taken to hospital but later succumbed to injuries. The attackers escaped. The motive behind the killing was unknown.
5 November, IVO Qandala, Bari â Islamic State fighters kidnaped nine civilians in retaliation for the 3 November US drone strikes.
The members and supporters of the Ancestral Burial Ground Committee protest outside St Georgeâs Cathedral in Cape Town.

Report that pro-government forces killed five civilians on their way from Bamure to Wudu, at Kinyiba. SPLA-IO accused NAS troops stationed in the area of being unable to prevent the attacks. Date unclear, report dated 5 November.

Suspected youth from Amothnhom shot and killed a senior protocol officer attached to South Sudanâs Western Lakes state at Makoi residential area in Rumbek. A police officer related the attack to a recent wave of civil âdisobedienceâ in the area, with public outcries demanding that Governor Major Gen. Matur Chut Dhuol be removed from power.
Unidentified gunmen killed the chief of Fongo Nuer area of Besselia County in Wau town.

Military intelligence officers beat a merchant in a military garrison in Sirba, West Darfur, after he gave them high pricing on women's clothing at the Sirba IDP camp. He was severely injured in the head. He was only released after a group of people protested his detention in front of the garrison and the headquarters of the locality.

Security measures: Sudan President Al Bashir declared a state of emergency and dissolved the Legislative Council of El Gezira state after a political conflict. The move was condemned as violating the law.
Militiamen attacked a number of farmers in Kombo Umbera in Mukjar locality, Central Darfur, firing shots in the air, looting property and beating a woman who resisted, breaking her hand as a result.
Armed herders in military uniforms attacked farmers in Gireida. Two women were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Military Intelligence Service
notes: Military intelligence officers beat a merchant in a military garrison in Sirba, West Darfur, after he gave them high pricing on women's clothing at the Sirba IDP camp. He was severely injured in the head. He was only released after a group of people protested his detention in front of the garrison and the headquarters of the locality.

Attack without casualties: Unknown gunmen attacked a government delegation at Al-Hameedh area in South Kordofan, 20km north of Kadugli town. No casualties. There are currently tensions over gold production in the area.
A dispute between two individuals resulted in a knife fight between two clans in Dar Chaabene Fehri, Nabeul. Two persons were injured.

State Minister, Hajj Abdul Nadduli, faced an angry crowd in Mikono during the weekend. He was meeting NRM leaders from the districts of Buvuma, Mukono, Buikwe and Kayunga on the invitation of Sam Bbemba, a party member. The attendants to the meeting became rowdy and denounced the age limit Bill after they were denied allowances.  The protesters entered the house and tried to burn files and party cards before the anti-riot police stopped them.

Police in Kabale on Sunday afternoon dispersed a group of students from Kanungu district (The Kanungu Kabale Students Association (KAKASA)) that had convened to protest the way Dr. Chris Baryomunsi, the Kinkiizi East legislator has been conducting his consultations on the proposed amendment of Presidential age limit.

Police in Mbale Town under the command of the District Police Commander fired live bullets and teargas to disperse the opposition leaders and supporters who had gathered at scene to welcome FDC presidential candidate, Patrick Amuriat Oboi. The police also arrested Mr. Amuriat Oboi on allegations of holding an illegal assembly and inciting violence. He was injured during the arrest. Pressure was also created by FDC leaders who camped outside the police station demanding his immediate release. During the arrest, some police officers were seen kicking Mr Amuriat who was already on ground helpless.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: ZANU-PF youths beat an MDC-T supporter. When other MDC-T supporters tried to intervene, the ZANU-PF youths beat them too.

Several thousand people demonstrated Saturday in Ouagadougou to demand "truth and justice" for the deaths of the 2014 popular uprising, which drove former president Blaise CompaorÃ© out of power, and the victims of the failed coup of September 2015.
Unidentified attackers threw a grenade into the house of an agronomist in Kigoma. He was injured but not killed. He is believed to have been targeted in a land conflict.
3 people killed last night at Mahola
3 people killed at Mahola
A humanitarian worker was killed in Kaga Bandoro

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Raid: Unidentified armed men in military gear broke into the Norwegian consulate. There were no injuries and nothing was stolen, apart from some objects broken. The police says it was not informed. The report mentions that the Norwegian consul is the mother of the wealthy art collector Sindika Dokolo, who mobilises social networks towards President Kabila renouncing his position.
East Hararge, Mayu muluke woreda, Somali Liyu police attacked Oromo people and killed 2 persons and left 4 more wounded. No additional information.

notes: Rada special deterrence force raided the comic con-event in Tripoli, arrested organizers, participants and visitors and beat several of them.

DETONATION: Detonation not long ago in Kidal, no further details.
A vigilante group attacks and kills a suspected kidnapper in Ibadan.

Attack without casualties: A PDP Senator is attacked with sharp weapons and stones by "thugs" during the Kabba Day celebration. The target was in an automobile at the time of the attack. No reported injury.

Explosions injure three (possibly kill; unknown) during Enugu State council elections. The first occurred around 8:20am at Coal Camp in Enugu North Council area of Enugu State just before voting began. Three injured. The second was reported at Amechi, Awkunanaw voting centre

Explosions injure three (possibly kill; unknown) during Enugu State council elections. The first occurred around 8:20am at Coal Camp in Enugu North Council area of Enugu State just before voting began. Three injured. The second was reported at Amechi, Awkunanaw voting centre
Army forces kill "dozens" of Boko Haram fighters and rescue a small boy in Banki-Bula Yobe road in Bama Local Government Area of Borno.
Early AM, Xudur â Bardale, Bakool â al Shabaab ambush a Southwest military convoy. Al Shabaab claims 5 dead.
Puntland Security Forces conducted a military operation against al Shabaab in Harweyn Calmadow (c. 57 km South West of Bossaso). 13 al Shabaab fighters were killed.

Al Shabaab ambushed two soldiers travelling by road between Cali Fooldhere settlement and Biyo-Cadde in Mahaday (Jowhar) district. The government soldiers were riding on motorcycles when al Shabaab elements attacked. There was an exchange of gunfire. As result, one of the soldiers was killed and another escaped. One al Shabaab fighter was killed.
AM, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle â al Shabaab operatives hurl hand grenades against two separate security checkpoints. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab militants attacked an SNA checkpoint at Bulo Folyo settlement in Afgoye district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab elements withdrew. There were no reports of fatalities.
04 November, 18:00EAT, Galkacyo, Mudug â an UVIED explosion targets the Deputy Mayor of Galkacyo. The target was injured. Perpetrators not identified.

Two armed assailants shot and killed a police officer at Jaamacadah village in Hodan district. The officer was sitting outside his house when he was shot by armed attackers. The perpetrators escaped. Police forces in the area responded to the incident and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab elements claimed responsibility for the attack.
Unknown gunmen abducted three women from Nimule town. They later killed two and released one, whose family paid a ransom.

Gunmen from neighbouring Gok state in Lakes attacked Tonj in Warrap on several occasions between 1-8 November, leaving seven killed and dozens of people displaced. In one incident, the youth undressed twelve women who were travelling from Manyangok County to Tonj town.
SPLA-IO accused government troops of killing a youth leader, burning down homes and looting civilian property in Karika, Mundri West County.
Armed herders abducted two villagers from their farms near Timo village, 10km west of Khazan Tunjur in North Darfurâs Tawila locality.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
notes: Police Forces used teargas to disperse hooligans from Club African de Dehiba who invaded the stadium. An agent from the National Guard was injured by hooligans from Club African who threw stones at him.
Teaching & administrative personel at a school in Manouba staged a sit-in to protest against the rising number of attacks on them.

Young inhabitants who were dissatisified with results of an exam to be recruited for the phosphate company in Gafsa blocked the road in Metlaoui with burning tires. Police Forces clashed with rioters and used teargas to dispere them.

Protests in Redeyef against the results of an exam to be recruted for the CPG turned violent swiftly. Rioters then blocked roads with burning tires before attacking the posts of the police force and the national guard which they burned down completely. Some security forces clashed with rioters before they fled. No injuries were reported.
After Okello Tango was hit in the head, police was forced to intervene with live bullets and teargas.

The Member of Parliament for Kioga County in Amolatar district, Anthony Okello Tango was on Saturday afternoon stoned on the head with a brick by youths against the controversial presidential age limit. The youths demanded to know whether he was in support of the age limit bill. He was also questioned about the 29 million given to each MP to consult on the age limit bill. All MPs not supporting the Bill have been returning the money Okello Tango had not.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: A group of ZANU PF youths aligned to the Vice President's faction violently disrupted a ZANU PF rally while the President's wife was speaking. Police are now hunting for the culprits.
Police in the Marange diamond fields in Chiadzwa shot a villager in the stomach. He was then detained at the police diamond base for 2 days, where he was beaten regularly.

notes: Workers from SNVI-complex in Ain Bouchekif staged a sit-in in front of the local seat of the UGTA in Tiaret to denounce the decision by the syndicate to support the ex Secretary General of the company in his efforts to again become Secretary General of the company.

After a demonstration against a construction project, protesters changed the city hall locker, preventing anyone to access it. Police recovered keys and surround the place.
Property destruction: gunfire heard in Koutougou, it appears the police station has been attacked and burned.
A mob of people in Gahwazi rioted and chased a man down the street until the chief of the hill intervened and stopped them. The man was accused of witchcraft.

notes: The FARDC intercepted a group of presumed ADF fighters in Munzambayi / Mayangose.
ISIS, Wilayat Sinai, claimed sniping a police officer & a policeman in central El-Arish. Fatalities not confirmed.
4 Oromos killed by suspected Liyu Police as they were taking their cows to water. All 4 dead are from the same family. Incident reported in Hararghe zone, Mieso woreda, in an area called Bareda.

Joy Newsâ camera technician who was covering the election of the DCE for the Ada East District Assembly in the Greater Accra Region Friday was locked up after a scuffle broke out. The cameraman was arrested by some heavily built men, numbering more than five and was bundled into a room outside the auditorium. Joy Newsâ Maxwell Agbagba who was also at the venue reported some police officers prevented him from filming the process.

Pro Haftar group organized a Million man march in Benghazi to delegate him to run the country. Turnout was very low.
Armed militants abducted at least two Turkish technicians and a German engineer who were on their way from Obari airport to the local power station.

Residents of Darna held a protest after Friday prayers to condemn the airstrikes on the city that led to the death of 15 civilians on Monday.

A Dahalo fighter was killed in clashes with gendarme police in Itaosy.
Attack on two FAMa checkpoints early this morning in Imboraghane (Bourem) 1 killed and 3 wounded
Kidal subjected to mortar/rocket fire (six shells) this morning, still no eventual casualty toll available
Attempted carjacking this morning in Timbuktu, driver sustained several stab wounds, here teachers & students parade the assailant
At least six people were killed when suspected Boko Haram fighters attacked Jaddannam, Magumeri LGA location. The assailants burned the town and stole livestock.
The NDA announces an end to a ceasefire agreement with the federal government.
Oyo State workers strike and protest in Ibadan, Oyo and Lalate.
Oyo State workers strike and protest in Ibadan, Oyo and Lalate.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: US air assets target Islamic State (IS) positions in Buqa village, 60 kilometres south of Qandala. "Several" killed. This was the first known case of direct United States involvement against IS in Somalia. The target of the attack was Sheikh Abdulkadir Mumin. IS later claimed the target survived. The attack consisted of two strikes.
Residents protest after the town of Bwelet Weyne changed currencies to the US dollar.

Suspected al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a government soldier at Tabeleha Shiekh Ibrahim village in Deynile district. The body of the soldier was taken to CID for further examination. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Armed assailants attacked a government soldier at Livestock Market in Heliwa district. The attackers stole the AK-47 belonging to the victim and escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for this assassination.

Jubaland forces (JISA) and Kismayo police clashed at Siinaay Junction in Kismayo town. There was an exchange of small arms fire. The incident occurred after police officers manning a checkpoint at the junction attempted to stop a JISA officer, driving a vehicle with armed JISA officers. One JISA officer was injured. The JISA officers later clashed with other forces at Golgol areas of Farjano neighbourhood in Kismayo town. One JISA officer was seriously injured. The injured soldiers succumbed to their injuries in Mogadishu after being transported for further medical treatment.
Habar-Yunis/Sacad Yunis and Habar-Jeclo/Baho militias clashed at Ceel-Afweyn over territorial control. SLP intervened and arrested four militiamen. There were no reports of casualties

Armed assailants, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled two hand grenades at police forces patrolling near Xawo Tako CP in Afgoye district. The hand grenades landed on an empty place and the forces shot towards the general direction of the attack. There were no reports of fatalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for attack.
Residents protest after the town of Bwelet Weyne changed currencies to the US dollar.

A rally organized by Kulmiye political party was dispersed by police as a group of youngsters stoned the Horn Star music band performing at the rally. Police fired warning shots to disperse the crowd.

SLP arrested seven youngsters for creating a "public disturbance" in Galjano, Hargeysa. The youngsters confronted the police and the police resulted in firing warning shots. Two youngsters were slightly injured. It is not known if the disturbance is related to unrest between Kulmiye and Wadani.
Supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed at Hargeisa stadium during Kulmiye political rally. SLP dispersed the two groups. There were no reports of arrest or casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a vehicle transporting khat to Xudur town from Ceel Berde district at Maaray area (c. 45 km South West of Ceel Berde district). Four people were killed and the vehicle and khat was destroyed. Security forces arrived at the scene and took the dead bodies to Xudur for burial. Al Shabaab fighters managed to escape from the area before the security forces arrived.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a civilian at Dhurey village (c. 16 km South of Wajid district). The victim was transporting personal commodities to Rabdhure district. Al Shabaab fighters accused him of transporting commercial goods to Wajid district. Al Shabaab fighters destroyed the goods and the donkey cart of the victim. Family members of the victim within al Shabaab in Rabdhure district demanded for the detention of the perpetrators.
03 November, evening, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle â unidentified gunmen assassinate a clan elder.
Unknown attackers shot and killed a civilian male at Dhagah Tuur Village in Afgoye district. Residents confirmed that the man was well-known in the village. The motive behind the killing was unknown.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: An SPLA-IO official's statement on 6 November claimed that SPLA-IO recaptured Bore, Sokare, Jalimo, Mangalatore and Logo areas in Kajo-keji county during fighting over 2 and 3 November that left 10 government soldiers and 4 rebels killed. However, it is likely that the clashes in Bore, Sokare and Jalimo erupted between SPLA-IO and NAS, as NAS forces were stationed there. In a statement on 5 November, the SPLA-IO official had claimed that SPLA-IO regained territory from NAS in Kajo-Keji, leaving 20 NAS killed. 20 NAS fatalities spread over two days of fighting in relevant areas; 14 killed in government and SPLA-IO clashes spread over Mangalotore and Logu. An additional fatality counted in fighting in Logu among civilian population.

Bandits targetting gold traders in town got into a clash with the police forces when these ambushed them after receiving local information on their whereabouts. The bandits refused to surrender, which led to the clash. 5 of them were severely injured and ended up dying in the hospital. An investigations shows that the suspects have a link to recent criminalities in Tanga, Rufiji, Mkuranga, Kibiti and Dar es Salaam, having killed government officials, police and political leaders in the areas.

Hundreds of Tunisian policemen demonstrated in Sfax, Gabes, Bizerte and Siliana, demanding that parliament adopt a law on "protecting" them against unlawful attacks, after one policeman was killed in an attack two days before. Civil groups have called the law "dangerous" for democracy.

Attempted vehicular attack by an unidentified man targeted two soldiers in El Baten, Kairouan. No injuries were caused. The attacker is on the run.

Workers of Education Directorate in Tizi Ouzou went on a strike for a full day and physically protested against the repeated attacks on staff and police working within the Directorate.

Five are dead following a boundary dispute in Itim-Amagu in Ikwo LGA and Adadama in Abi LGA.
Protests in Makurdi in support of a new anti-grazing law aimed at stemming Fulani attacks in the state.

At least three people including a driver were seriously injured in a car bomb explosion in Zoobe. Perpetrators not named by the source. It is not known if the perpetrators were present at the time of the attack.
A suspected IED is discovered placed in front of the sunrise hotel, near CID headquarters. It is not clear if the explosive was detonated. Al Shabaab believed responsible.

Reer Diini clan, sub-clan of Marehan and Suleiman clan, sub-clan of Habargidir militias clashed near Dhuumoodle village (c. 30 km West of Cadaado). There was an exchange of gunfire. The clash was due to the hijacking of a vehicle. Two people, hailing from Marehan clan, were killed.

Hundreds of local residents and traders conducted a violent demonstration in proximity of the main market near Bossaso seaport in protest to the increase of port charges and a construction company. Security forces intervened and dispersed the crowds.
Hundreds of SABC employees - among them journalists - took to the streets of Cape Town, demanding a 10% wage increase from the public broadcaster.
Hundreds of SABC employees - among them journalists - took to the streets of Durban, demanding a 10% wage increase from the public broadcaster.
A small group of SABC employees protested outside the broadcasterâs headquarters in Johannesburg demanding a 10% salary increase.
Economic Freedom Fighters national leadership led a protest to the Israeli Embassy in Pretoria. Hundreds of EFF supporters gathered at the mission, in solidarity with Palestinians.

A group of roughly 200 people, believed to students, attempted to disrupt academic activity at the University of Cape Town. Western Cape police used stun grenades to disperse protesters and arrested one protester who tried to damage the university's shuttle service.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO claimed to have regained Ombasi on 2 November after around a week of clashes. The rebels claimed to have regained control of the area. They allegedly launched the attack after South Sudanese security officials denied civilians access to humanitarian assistance in Lasu payam.

Unknown gunmen attacked a displaced family in Konkore Village, Ngerejebi Boma, Lokiliri area, Jubek state, leaving two killed, a boy injured and another child abducted. The motive for the attack is not known.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: An SPLA-IO official's statement on 6 November claimed that SPLA-IO recaptured Bore, Sokare, Jalimo, Mangalatore and Logo areas in Kajo-keji county during fighting over 2 and 3 November that left 10 government soldiers and 4 rebels killed. However, it is likely that the clashes in Bore, Sokare and Jalimo erupted between SPLA-IO and NAS, as NAS forces were stationed there. In a statement on 5 November, the SPLA-IO official had claimed that SPLA-IO regained territory from NAS in Kajo-Keji, leaving 20 NAS killed. 20 NAS fatalities spread over two days of fighting in relevant areas; 14 killed in government and SPLA-IO clashes spread over Mangalotore and Logu. An additional fatality counted in fighting in Logu among civilian population.

An additional fatality counted in fighting in Logu among civilian population.
Suspected Murle tribesmen attacked Jiethagwata village south of Pochalla leaving at least 5 people killed, another injured and a child abducted.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Between 1 and 2 November, government and SPLA-IO forces clashed in Kotobi and Yeri near the town of Mundri, Western Equatoria, leading to civilian displacement.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Between 1 and 2 November, government and SPLA-IO forces clashed in Kotobi and Yeri near the town of Mundri, Western Equatoria, leading to civilian displacement.

Attack without casualties: Two incidents of shootings by unknown gunmen on 31 October and 4 November at the Leha Mining Company in the Baloula area of South Kordofan. It is unclear if the gunmen exchanged fire with another group. No casualties were reported. The company stopped its operations as a result. There have been tensions recently over gold production in the area.
Herders opened fire on a woman while she was trying to drive their camels away from her farm at Guldo in Jebel Marra in Central Darfur, leaving her seriously wounded.
Defection: Some 300 Darfur rebel fighters defected from Ali Rizgallah faction in SARC to the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) militia and joined them in El Fasher.
A young shepherd was wounded by the explosion of a mine/IED at Jebel Chaambi, Kasserine.
Medical workers in Sidi Bouzid governorate staged a sit-in in front of the regional health directorate to denounce recurring attacks on them.

Rioters in Zarzis blocked streets with burning tires to denounce disrespectful police behaviour towards the inhabitants. A young guy immolated himself because of the disrespect and had to be hospitalised. The police clashed with rioters and intervened with teargas to disperse them. 4 policemen were injured.
Teaching personel and workers from a college in El Euch, south of Bord Bou Arreridj, staged a sit-in inside the school. Protesters denounce surcharged school classes and missing didactic materiel.

More than 1000 former soldiers staged a protest in front of the local representation in Mila to denounce the injustice they are suffering from. They ask for a renumeration for several unpaid months of military service.

Dozens protested in front of the medical-pedagogical center for handicapped people during the visit of the governor of Relizane. They wanted to shed light on elevated housing prices that make their live difficult.

assoc_actor_1: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
notes: Hundreds of workers, led by seven union executives, staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the general management of SNVI-company in Rouiba.
A weapons trafficker opened fire on Algerian military forces in Tarat, In Amenas, near the Libyan border. The military shot him dead in response. His wife was arrested.
A man was clubbed to death in Mikoni, Gahombo.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: The body of an Imbonerakure from Mwumba was found in Gitega town. He had been hacked to death by machete.
6 dead in a suicide bombing yesterday night in Zamga (including the perpetrator)

actor1: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
notes: Clashes between armed groups were reported in Kabo, 60 km north of Batangafo. 21 wounded, plus several houses burned and dead bodies. The locality of Batangafo and surrounding villages have for several weeks been the scene of violent clashes between the self-defense groups and the MPC that operate in the region.
Clashes between armed groups in Noufou.
A vaccination agent was kidnapped by armed men and freed on November, 7th following the MINUSCA intervention. An international organisation agent was assaulted by armed men on the same day.
Looting: LRA forces ambushed and looted 2 motorcyclists who were traveling near Pambayamba in Yalanga area of Haute Kotto.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: The FARDC recovered, from Monday (30/10) to Friday (03/11) the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu.

Commercial and administrative activities were stopped in Bukavu due to a call for a 'dead city' strike decreed by civil society organisations and civilian movements. The structures in place demand the quitting of President Kabila.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Acording to civil society and NGOs, the Twa militia has during this week been plundering houses and villages, killing at least 10. The three locations attacked (Mwabou, Shikayimba and Shikatemba villages) are all located within 30km of Pweto.

Member of Parliament Mangowd El Hawary had his car attacked and smashed by Fayoum University students after he physically assaulted a female security guard who asked his daughter to show her university ID to enter university.

Traders at Abofour in the Offinso Municipality of the Ashanti Region are protesting moves to relocate them to a newly constructed market in the area. Tensions were high when over 10 military personnel stormed the area on Wednesday following the refusal of the traders to relocate to the newly constructed market.
The military were said to have vandalized structures of traders that have been erected by the roadside at the old market.

Police were patrolling the private ranches in Ol Moran and Ratia and were attacked by the pastoralists when they tried to evict them. There was an exchange of fire between the officers and the pastoralists who were all armed. The latter destroyed a vehicle, after which the police countered with fire in a 2-hour long battle.
On November 1, a 15-year-old Syrian boy was injured in his leg by gunshots in the Qweifiya area

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: A joint force consisting of members of the Special Operations Force, led by Major Imad Trabelsi, and a unit under Osama Juwaili, the PCâs western region military commander, launched an attack on the 4th Brigade camp Azziziya. The two leaders are from Zintan. The 4th brigade consists of local militiamen, and is led by Omar Tantoush, head of the Wirshefana Military Council. The 26th Brigade camp and the Azziziya Training Centre are also reported to have been attacked. Attacks resulted in the death of a child.
A mob at Nkhoma in Lilongwe has killed a man for torturing his houseboy to death.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: LOOTING: 2 Red Cross vehicles seized and staff robbed by unknown gunmen overnight in Almoustarat, Gao Region

Unknown armed people killed on Wednesday the secretary of the municipal neighbourhood of Nanchemele in Mocimboa da Praia. According to testimonies, 5 men broke into his house with knives and stabbed him in the neck.

Fulanis attack several Plateau villages in "in the last two weeks" (source dated 09/11), including Wereh, Foron and Rim in Barkin Ladi Local Government Area as well as Miango, Jebu, Taegbe and Ncha in Bassa Local Government Area. Causalities not known.

Fulanis attack several Plateau villages in "in the last two weeks" (source dated 09/11), including Wereh, Foron and Rim in Barkin Ladi Local Government Area as well as Miango, Jebu, Taegbe and Ncha in Bassa Local Government Area. Causalities not known.

Fulanis attack several Plateau villages in "in the last two weeks" (source dated 09/11), including Wereh, Foron and Rim in Barkin Ladi Local Government Area as well as Miango, Jebu, Taegbe and Ncha in Bassa Local Government Area. Causalities not known.

Fulanis attack several Plateau villages in "in the last two weeks" (source dated 09/11), including Wereh, Foron and Rim in Barkin Ladi Local Government Area as well as Miango, Jebu, Taegbe and Ncha in Bassa Local Government Area. Causalities not known.
More than 200 former militants from the Niger Delta protested the non payment of their allowances in front of the National Assembly in Abuja.
Fulanis and farmers clash in Ugaga, one dead. Exact date of the clash is not known - likely sometime after Benue State's implementation of an anti-grazing law, as it was referenced by the source.
Members of the Islamic Movement (Shia) protest in Kano over the detention of their leader, Sheikh Zakzaky.
Fulani headsmen attack Hingier Akaa at Tombo ward, Gaambe-tiev in Logo Local Government Area of the state killing one and injuring a second.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate the leader of NASU in Okene.

The people of Foundiougne went to the street to ask the government to find a solution "fast and effective" to the problem of drinking water supply of their municipality and surrounding localities, noted the APS

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against SNA forces based at Daynuunay village (c. 25 km South East of Baidoa) on the road between Baidoa and Mogadishu. There was an exchange of small arms fire and heavy machine guns after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed South West State forces traveling in two Toyota Noah vehicles near Lug-Habar village (c. 22 km North West of Buurkahaba) on the road between Baidoa and Buurhakaba. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which SWS forces withdrew. Two SWS soldiers were injured. Al Shabaab fighters burnt two vehicles at the incident location. SWS soldiers were reported to be escorting khat back to Buurhakaba district.

Armed al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against an SNA position at KM 50 settlement. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about three hours after which al Shabaab withdrew from the position. Five SNA soldiers were killed while nine others were injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab combatants attacked AMISOM troops at Mashalay settlement outside of Qoryoley district. The clash was initiated with a mortar attack following heavy exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew from the area. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
SNAF forces recapture Mukay Dumis, Iidow Guudow and Goosaarow, 15km west of Buulo Mareer from al Shabaab. No reported resistance.
SNAF forces recapture Mukay Dumis, Iidow Guudow and Goosaarow, 15km west of Buulo Mareer from al Shabaab. No reported resistance.
An IED placed on the roadside targeting a government convoy travelling in Shalanbod area exploded. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Hundreds of people conducted a violent demonstration at the main market near seaport in protest to the increase in tax and a construction company. Security forces intervened and fired warning shots in the air. One protester was killed, two others were injured and several vehicles were damaged.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 01 November, afternoon, Gedo â 1,000 Ethiopian soldiers cross the Somali border in Doolow, and are seen heading to Luuq.

A government soldier shot and killed a rickshaw driver at Tarabunka intersection in Hodan district. The soldier denied the driver access to a restricted road but the driver disobeyed the instruction. The perpetrator was apprehended by security forces.

One person has been reported as killed and five injured when Puntland security force opened fire on protestors who had assembled over reasons surrounding inflation in the city and the closure of the now P&O owned port. The protesters were reportedly peaceful.

Jubaland forces shot at a speeding civilian vehicle in suspicion of al Shabaab at Argo Junction area in Kismayo town. A civilian bystander was injured in the incident. The victim was taken to Kismayo Hospital for treatment.

A civilian man was shot and killed by an armed man at Xaaro village (c. 110 km North West of Hobyo). The motive of the incident was connected to a land dispute. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene. Both the victim and perpetrator were close relatives from Saâad sub-clan of Habargidir.
Reer Omar clansman killed by Reer Muse Cadde (subclan of Isse Mohamud/Majerten). Motive was previous shooting over land ownership dispute. Female bystander injured.
SNAF forces recapture Mukay Dumis, Iidow Guudow and Goosaarow, 15km west of Buulo Mareer from al Shabaab. No reported resistance.
The UniteBehind campaign, led by veteran UDF members, started civil disobedience and staged a protest at the NPA offices in Cape Town.
A man was beaten but left alive in Umhlatuzana, Chatsworth by an angry mob.
Armed men ambushed a vehicle carrying Murle herders along the Juba-Magiri road, in Jubek state, leaving three dead and two injured.

notes: SPLA-IO claimed to have regained Ombasi on 2 November after around a week of clashes. The rebels claimed to have regained control of the area. They allegedly launched the attack after South Sudanese security officials denied civilians access to humanitarian assistance in Lasu payam.

notes: Lt Garang claimed to have captured several military outposts when he defected along with 200 soldiers from the SPLA in Juba to the SPLA-IO. Date unclear - defection reported 29 October. He announced further plans to launch military offensives against government forces in Juba.
