notes: Clashes between government and SPLA-IO forces in Nimni, Guit county. Several aid workers were forced to flee for their safety, while NGO compounds, health and nutrition facilities were looted and vandalised.

The families of detained Darfuri students held a vigil outside the US embassy in Khartoum and handed over a memorandum with the names of student detainees, native administrations and hostages, as well as the ongoing human rights violations in the province. Police cordoned the protesters. The activists said the aim of the vigil was to draw the US' attention at the continued human rights violations in Sudan in general and in Darfur in particular.

"Barbed men" attacked a bar in Al Jorf in Derba after it had reopened after a long period of restauration. They occupied the bar and sent home the costumers. Security forces intervened to sort out the situation.

In protest of scarce teaching personel in schools in Sidi Boubaker, Gafsa, parents of students and their children closed the post office, the headquarters of the Delegation and the LycÃ©e to draw the attention of local and regional officials on the situation in the region.

Employees of the 'Institut supÃ©rieur des Ã©tudes technologiques' in Tozeur organised a protest in Tozeur in solidarity with technical workers from the institute who protested in Tunis to call for a clarification in their legal status.

Employees of the 'Institut supÃ©rieur des Ã©tudes technologiques' in Tozeur organised a protest in Tozeur in solidarity with technical workers from the institute who protested in Tunis to call for a clarification in their legal status.
Education counselors staged a sit-in in front of the directorate in Mila to demand an improvement in their professional situation through properly regulating their status.

assoc_actor_1: UGTA: General Union of Algerian Workers
notes: More than 300 workers from a metal-company staged a sit-in in front of the factory in the industrial zone Zaaroura in Tiaret to protest against their deteriorating socio-economic conditions.

assoc_actor_1: UNAPOL: National Union of Policemen (Burkina Faso)
notes: Strikes: Burkinabe policemen went on an indefinite strike to claim for better work conditions.
Attackers killed a man in Musongati to use his head for witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Inhabitants of Nyanza-Lac report that they were beaten by Imbonerakure and forced to contribute to the president's visit. The visit lasted three days between 24-26 October.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was strangled in Rurambira.

LRA forces ambushed and temporarily abducted 5 travelers on the Mbangana-Sam Ouandja axis, CAR. They looted the victims of all their belongings. The victims were forced to porter the looted goods before being released several hours later.

actor1: Djupajalafuru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Djupagiju Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A land dispute between the residents of Djupajalafuru and Djupagiju degenerated into a fight on the 25th. One person was killed and 2 others seriously injured. Almost all of the houses on either side were looted systematically before being burned. Both villages were emptied of their residents and activities are paralysed.
Residents of Guder burn tires and block roads in anti-government protests. Protesters have also forcibly stopped sugar supply trucks in an effort to economically hurt the industry.
Prison officials beat a political prisoner to death. It was reported the deceased was attempting to smuggle a mobile phone. Source dated 22/10 - date of death not known.

Some irate youth in Karaga in the Northern Region, believed to be sympathizers of the New Patriotic Party (NPP), have reportedly invaded a police station, and freed some NPP members who were in police custody. A Citi News source who was close to the scene, said the youth acted in that manner because the District Chief Executive of Karaga, Alhassan Yabdoo, allegedly caused the arrest of some NPP communicators.
NASA activists protest outside IEBC offices
Police shot two people during protests in Kisumu. They used live bullets, teargas and battons. Protesters erected barricades and lit fires

Police  shot two people during protests in Migori. They used live bullets, teargas and battons. Youths barricaded roads with stones, electricity polls and bonfires to prevent IEBC [Independent Boundaries and Electoral Commission] from delivering voting materials in the region.
Police shot one person during protests in Siaya. They used live bullets, teargas and battons.

assoc_actor_1: KPAWU: Kenya Plantation and Agricultural Workers Union
notes: Protesters from the KPAWU continue to push for multinational tea companies to adhere to a collective bargaining agreement (CBA). The protests lasted, at least, three days.

Controversial talkshow host Henry Costa was allegedly attacked by some CDC supporters on Mechlin Street after reportedly raining invectives at the political leader of the Coalition for Democratic Change (CDC), Senator George Weah.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: ARRESTS: The Tripoli special deterrence force Rada, headed by Abdul Raouf Kara and nominally answering the MoI of the GNA arrested at least three members of the Derna Revolutionariesâ Shoura Council (DRSC) who have been staying in Tripoli - among them a senior DRSC commander.

actor2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Islamic State elements attacked the LNA at a checkpoint, 60km south of the city of Ajdabia, killing two soldiers and wounding four.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A civilian was killed in a landmine explosion in Khasm al-Kabash, near al-Maqrun West of Benghazi. Landmines are remnants of the activities of the BRSC.

actor2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Border Guards
notes: An unknown armed group attacked Brigade 456 that is working as a peacekeeping entity in Ubari. No casualties were reported. Brigade 456 belongs to the Border Guard and was appointed to secure Ubari in February 2016.

assoc_actor_1: SYNTADE: National Union of Public Administration Workers
notes: STRIKES: SYNTADE workers went on a 72-hours strike to protest the 2014 law against illict enrichement

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Vehicle of the National Guard struck by IED on the axis Koro-Mondoro, 10km from Dioungani. 2 wounded. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 27th.

Small protests took place in Al Hoceima & Imzouren to prepare for the commemoration of the death of fisherman Mohcine Fikri one year ago. The protests were immediately dispered by police and protesters arrested.

Small protests took place in Al Hoceima & Imzouren to prepare for the commemoration of the death of fisherman Mohcine Fikri one year ago. The protests were immediately dispered by police and protesters arrested.
Members of the Islamic Movement (Shia) protest in Abuja over the detention of their leader, Sheikh Zakzaky.

Disabled persons hold protests at ExxonMobil facilities at Ibeno and Eket. The protesters blocked entrances and forcibility entered the buildings on 25/10 and 26/10. The protesters demanded social welfare from the company.
Confrontations between unidentified "farmers" and "herdsmen" (likely Fulani) in Yola South LGA causes two deaths on 25/10 and four deaths on 27/10.

Intelligence reports indicate Boko Haram has begun to move into Adamawa State in great numbers, particularly the Madagali area. The mass movement has likely been brought on by continued military offensives in Borno. Source dated 27/10.
A group of market traders protest 'marginalization' by the state government in Sapele.

The deputy governor of Bakool has allegedly told media outlets that the Somali National Army (SNA) has taken control of several areas in the Bakool region previous held by al Shabaab. The effected areas were approximately 50km south of Xudur.  The only known claimed area is Tor Tor.
A 3 Star Police officer was shot and killed in what is reported to be a targeted killing, al Shabaab have reportedly claimed responsibility for the killing.

The militia loyal to Muktar Roobow ambushed al Shabaab fighters driving a Toyota Landcruiser near Abal village (c. 22 km South East of Xudur). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire and RPGs. The vehicle overturned and four al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attack. The militia loyal to Muktar Roobow retreated from the scene.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Jubaland (JSF) on security patrol at Wirkoy area (c. 37 km East of Kismayo town). Seven JSF soldiers were killed and five others were injured in the attack. The bodies of the four JSF soldiers who were killed in the attack were taken by al Shabaab fighters to Jilib. The injured soldiers were transported to Kismayo for treatment.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An IED attack on an AMISOM convoy escalates in wider clashes between al Shabaab and AMISOM. Civilian casualties are reported, numbers not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An African Mission in Somalia (AMSIOM) convey was hit by an al Shabaab road side IED, with a reported secondary device detonating on the disembarkation of AMISOM troops. Reports claim small arms fire followed the IED strike resulting in an unknown number people killed - - locals claim 10 civilians died in the blasts and ensuing gunfire. Among the dead included a journalist. Dalsan Radio reports 20 deaths.

Supporters of Wadani and Kulmiye political parties clashed near Burao local government building during a Kulmiye rally. Police intervened to disperse the groups. There were no reports of arrests and casualties.

Hundreds of fishermen conducted a peaceful demonstration in front of Narch Fish at Bossaso Seaport. The protestors marched through the streets in protest to the five-day fishing ban due to the ongoing seaport  construction. The demonstration concluded peacefully without any incident.
Media reports have claimed that an individual aligned to al Shabaab killed himself whilst trying to wire an IED. His child and wife were also killed in the explosion.

Alleged armed clan militiamen hailing from Abgal sub clan of Hawiye killed a farmer from Jareer Weyne clan at Buurfuule settlement in Mahaday district. The killing was triggered by a dispute over farmland between the two clans living in the area.

Two armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab assailants, shot and killed a government soldier at Livestock market in Heliwa district. The soldier was  in a local restaurant when the armed men shot him. The culprits escaped. The motive behind the killing was unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two camel herders were stabbed and wounded by another camel herder hailing from Reer Samatar sub clan at Qabaal (c. 80 km East of Garowe). The motive behind the incident was unknown. Investigations were reported to be ongoing.
Unconfirmed local sources have reported a man has been shot and killed by two men in the Yaaqshid district in what is suspected to be a CQA.
25 October, Daynille. Gunmen wearing military uniform open fire against a group of civilians, killing three. It is not known if the gunmen were legitimate soldiers.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed South West State forces headed to Xudur at Hoogir village (c. 22 km South East of Xudur). The forces, with reinforcement from Xudur, returned from Korkor village where they clashed with al Shabaab fighters. There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab retreated. Three deaths reported.
Somali soldiers fought at undetermined location in Daynile. 1 killed 3 injured.
Civilian "Jeeri" assassinated by unidentified gunmen. Assailants escaped. Motives unknown.
Unidentified gunmen kill khat trader in Marka. Assailants escaped.

At the Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT), private security guards used stun grenades to disperse a group of protesting students who the university said attempted to storm the Bellville library.
On the UFS Bloemfontein campus, roughly 50 students gathered outside the Steve Biko House student centre to call for free higher education.
Seven University of the Free State (UFS) students, including two SRC members, were arrested at the QwaQwa campus and detained in a police van for four hours.
A few hundred Fees Must Fall protesters attempted to shut down the University of Cape Town (UCT).

Residents of Zandspruit in Johannesburg have vowed to reconnect electricity connections which were disconnected by the city which led to clashes between the community and police. Residents barricaded the road with rocks and burning tyres.

actor2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
notes: Around 100 angry protesters at the Juba IDP camp demonstrated carrying anti-government slogans and destroyed the offices of a humanitarian organisation (ACTED) in the camp, accusing UN officials of stopping them from meeting the US Ambassador during her visit to the camp. UN security guards fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.
A clash between herders and farmers at Azum area of Western Darfur left a number of farmers injured.

A general strike and a protest march took place in Bir ali Ben Khalifa to protest against misinformation regarding the recent death of 45 people caused by a boat crash in Kerkennah. They also demand an improvement of their socio-economic situation.

An angry mob raids the home of John Peter Ematu, the North Kyoga regional police commander, accusing him of brutalising MPs while pelting his house with stones. This event came after police used teargas as real bullets to disperse a consultative meeting on the presidential age limit organised by the Lira Woman MP.
Protesters angered at Besingye's re-arrest protest outside the police station in Rukungiri.
Police used tear gas in order to disperse the crowd. Eyewitnesses confirm that two aides of Mr. Besingye were beaten.

ARREST: Uganda's opposition leader, Kizza Besigye, was re-arrested just 5 hours after being released from spending 6 days in detention and charged with inciting violence. The motives for the new arrest are not clear. Reports mention that it might be an attempt to circumvent the long stay in detention by the Government.

assoc_actor_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: A group of Chitungwiza residents attacked a local ZANU PF leader, who had been responsible for directing the attacks on MDCT supporters in recent weeks.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: Community workers from a local NGO (Zimbabwe Peace Project), arranged a meeting with the ZANU PF councillor in Chitungwiza to discuss the high levels of violence around the voter registration process. The councillor arrived to the meeting with a group of ZANU PF youths, who beat the NGO workers.

Hundreds of employees and graduates of Al Takween Al Motawasel Universit protested, denouncing the refusal of the authorities to meet their demands, that is mainly related to the restoration of a preparatory phase, which was canceled earlier this year.
Workers in Cheraga municipality protested in front of the seat of the municipality against the decision of the authorities to dismiss them.
Social housing beneficiaries protested in front of the seat of the prefecture in Hassi Rmel to denounce the delay in the provision of housing for them.
Social housing beneficiaries from Boukhalfa and Hazoura protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Tizi Ouzou to denounce the delay in the provision of housing for them.
A 5th militant killed in Jijel this morning in operation that targeted a camp in Selma Ben Ziada, operation still ongoing.
200 workers from Macanagro gather to protest against 5 months of unpaid salaries in Luanda, paralysing activities for an indefinite period of time.
Primary school teachers went to the street to claim the payment of their primes.
4 individuals assassinated overnight in BasnÃ©rÃ© and 1 in Djibo
4 individuals assassinated overnight in BasnÃ©rÃ© and 1 in Djibo
A man in Bumba was attacked in his home by men wielding machetes.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure and police officers beat and manhandled students in Kayanza who were holding a strike to demand that the goverenment provide teachers for technical subjects.

LRA forces attacked a Peuhl camp west of Mboki, CAR. The assailants were armed with AK-47s and wore a mix of civilian and military clothing. They abducted a woman and a girl. They also looted peanuts and bushmeat

Ten people were killed in clashes at a gold mine in the Tibesti Mountains in northern Chad, pitting locals against outsiders in search of riches, a security source told AFP. The violence erupted early Tuesday when local residents told gold miners who had flocked to the central Sahara mountain region from other parts of Chad to leave, the source said on condition of anonymity. "A fight broke out and the outsiders killed three locals," he said. "The locals then ambushed the outsiders, who ended up leaving the area ... but seven gold miners were killed while the others got away."

In Buno Badale zone, a peaceful demonstration turned deadly after an unidentified group of armed men started shooting. Rioting followed, and several houses were burned. 12 fatalities were later reported as a result of the chaos and gunshot wounds. According to opposition media, the government reported the demonstration before it had happened, leading to suspicions that they had been behind the attack, however this was not confirmed.
Students and police officers clashed in the outskirts of Libreville. Students protesting the increase in university fees broke windows and fought the police.
Two days before the presidential elections, protesters demonstrate in Nairobi. Kenyan police used teargas and shot fires in the air to disperse the crowd.

The bodyguard of the Deputy Chief Justice Philomena Mwilu was shot in the shoulder while buying flowers by an armed man/group (unknown). This adds to the tension felt before the presidential election that will take place this week. Because of this, the Deputy Chief did not attend the meeting of the next day where the postponement of the presidentials elections was to take place.

A crowd of rowdy youth clashed with police forces when attempting to break into the Migori Teachers Training College to remove election material. The hundreds of rioters were repelled by police, who shot fires into the air. The rioters blocked the highway between Kenya and Tanzania using metal containers and boulders
A group called Kisii County IDPs held peaceful demonstrations in the streets of Kisii calling on residents not to participate in unlawful activities before the elections.
The government decides to deploy 130,000 police officers to the locations of Homa Bay Migori, Siaya, Kisumu and Migori to protect voters.

Police raid the house of former Kakamega Senator Boni Khalwale  in search for materials that can be used to disrupt the Thursday election. The police claims that Mr. Khalwale was storing tyres to provide to mobilised youth, which would use them to light pyres.
A group of armed men killed 2 people in the Laikumukumu area, Tigania East District, and stole over 1000 cattle.
At least three people were injured by the police in Kisumu when protesting against the electoral commission.

assoc_actor_1: KPAWU: Kenya Plantation and Agricultural Workers Union
notes: Protesters from the KPAWU continue to push for multinational tea companies to adhere to a collective bargaining agreement (CBA). The protests lasted, at least, three days.

The College of Engineering and Technology at the William V.S. Tubman University in Maryland County, southeast Liberia, risks closure for a semester to enable administration to address concerns of protesting students of the college. Protests by students have disrupted normal academic activities at the University, including ongoing midterm examinations.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A civilian was injured in a landmine explosion in as Sabri al Gharbi. Landmines are remnants of the activities of the BRSC.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Malian army post attacked around midnight in Soumpi,  two dead, one wounded and 2-3 vehicles seized/destroyed. 15 SATOM trucks burned.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: FAMa vehicle struck by IED, axis TÃ©nenkou-Dia, 2 wounded. Incident follows vast military campaign in the area, yesterday FAMa dispatched a contingent numbering +400 men and +70 vehicles to TÃ©nenkou. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 26th.

Inhabitants get together and protest at the police station to ask the office to release the people accused of spreading rumours about 'chupa-sangue' or vampires. Protesters become violent and 1 person ends up dying, while three others were injured, as a result of police action.
About 100 placard-waving community members from Kehemu and Kaisosi settlement took to the streets to demonstrate on the slow response on the land issue by the Rundu Town Council (RTC).

One person was feared dead, scores injured, and about 40 houses set ablaze during a communal clash that ensued on Tuesday in Mbayion, Gboko Local Government Area of Benue State. The clash is believed to be liked to a land tussle between the Mbayion and the Mbatiav people.

Disabled persons hold protests at ExxonMobil facilities at Ibeno and Eket. The protesters blocked entrances and forcibility entered the buildings on 25/10 and 26/10. The protesters demanded social welfare from the company.
Residents of Oka in Ondo West Local Government Area of Ondo State protested what they called "incessant activities of land grabbers in the town."

Unidentified gunmen attack Ihieorji village in Aba South. Unconfirmed reports from the area gave the death toll to ten with several persons injured. It was learnt that about four persons died on the spot, while two others died at the hospital while they were being given medical attention.
After a Fulani herdsman went missing last week an attack was launched by unknown attackers against unidentified victims in Riyom LGA leaving two dead.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Accompanied by the Civilian JTF, military forces raid Boko Haram locations at Mogole, Ngaiwa, Tongule, and Warsele villages in Ngala LGA, killing 11 insurgents. Remaining fatalities recorded in other events.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Accompanied by the "Civilian JTF", military forces raid Boko Haram locations at Mogole, Ngaiwa, Tongule, and Warsele villages in Ngala LGA, killing 11 insurgents. Remaining fatalities recorded in other events.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Accompanied by the "Civilian JTF", military forces raid Boko Haram locations at Mogole, Ngaiwa, Tongule, and Warsele villages in Ngala LGA, killing 11 insurgents. Remaining fatalities recorded in other events.

Suspected members of Boko Haram sect on Tuesday attacked Sasawa village in Damaturu Local Government Area of Yobe state. Eight soldiers reported dead. A Colonel later claimed that "there were causalities on both sides" - though this is yet unconfirmed. The Telegram Messaging Service reported on 27/10 that Islamic State claimed responsibility. The source notes, however, the attackers may have been both Boko Haram, as the group has pledged allegiance to IS.

Nigerian air forces launch a number of air strikes against Boko Haram location around Borno State. Only Arra and Boboshe are listed among the locations. Regarded as a "major success," stating, "[the strikes] destroyed the targeted structures and caused fire around the structures where they were hiding, sending a few survivors scampering for safety. [The helicopters] also strafed the area with rockets, subsequently taking out some of the fleeing Boko Haram survivors." Exact causality figures not known. Recorded as 10 at each location instance.

Nigerian air forces launch a number of air strikes against Boko Haram location around Borno State. Only Arra and Boboshe are listed among the locations. Regarded as a "major success," stating, "[the strikes] destroyed the targeted structures and caused fire around the structures where they were hiding, sending a few survivors scampering for safety. [The helicopters] also strafed the area with rockets, subsequently taking out some of the fleeing Boko Haram survivors." Exact causality figures not known. Recorded as 10 at each location instance.

Nigerian air forces launch a number of air strikes against Boko Haram location around Borno State. Only Arra and Boboshe are listed among the locations. Regarded as a "major success," stating, "[the strikes] destroyed the targeted structures and caused fire around the structures where they were hiding, sending a few survivors scampering for safety. [The helicopters] also strafed the area with rockets, subsequently taking out some of the fleeing Boko Haram survivors." Exact causality figures not known. Recorded as 10 at each location instance.
A group of 25 minor political parties protest at the electoral commission in Enugu over the exclusion of their candidates.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Accompanied by the "Civilian JTF", military forces destroy a Boko Haram logistics base and a workshop at Ngaiwa village and an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) making factory at Tongul. Various weapons were recovered in the operation. Several hostages rescued. No reported incidents of violence.

assoc_actor_1: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
notes: Accompanied by the "Civilian JTF", military forces destroy a Boko Haram logistics base and a workshop at Ngaiwa village and an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) making factory at Tongul. Various weapons were recovered in the operation. Several hostages rescued. No reported incidents of violence.

assoc_actor_1: SLUDI: Sierra Leone Union on Disabilities Issues
notes: On Monday 24 October 2017, disabled people took to the streets of Freetown in a peaceful protest over the lack of Disability Commission subvention.

Twin explosions reported in close proximity to the central police station, at present reports claim it was carried out by one suicide bomber. The explosion killed the attacker and reportedly wounded six others. Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack. A second source claims al Shabaab are responsible.

Two armed men using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a businessman at Waa Cuneyna village in Marka district. The man was a well-known businessman in the city. As result, security forces near the area responded to the incident and allegedly captured the perpetrators. The motive behind the killing was unknown.

Suspected armed al Shabaab assailants shot and killed a police man at Weydow neighbourhood, Deynile district. The officer was a municipal tax collector operating in the area before the armed attackers shot him. Police responded to the incident and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests and the perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A man hailing from Hawadle clan was shot and killed by a fellow clan member in a shootout at Qooqane village (c. 12 km North East of Beletweyne town). The perpetrator was seriously injured. The motive of the shooting was unknown but information suggested that both men had an unknown verbal dispute before the incident. The injured man was taken to Beletweyne Main Hospital for further medical treatment.

Pro-Somaliland Dhulbahante supporters and politicians gathered at Buhodle in support of the peace accord arrived at by the Presidents of Khatumo and Somaliland in Ainabo on 20 October 2017. The rally ended peacefully.

A government soldier killed a civilian man at Kaawo-Godey neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. The soldier and the man were involved in a dispute over alleged extortion of money. The perpetrator was not apprehended by the security forces. The body of the victim was brought to the Central Investigations Department for further examination.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNPF officer in Weydow, Dharkenley. Assailants escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the event.
About 150 university students marched to the National Assembly where Minister of Finance Malusi Gigaba was delivering his medium-term budget speech.

The Tanzanian High Commission in Pretoria visited by a crowd of protesters demanding the release of 13 people, including two South African human rights lawyers, who were arrested for allegedly promoting homosexuality in the capital Dar es Salaam.
Fire alarms were set off, lectures interrupted and a library evacuated, as an estimated 1 000 University of Cape Town (UCT) students marched on campus to demand free higher education.
Unknown gunmen ambushed a commercial vehicle at Apiridongo area between Duk Padiet and Duk Panyang counties, Jonglei, leaving a woman and two children killed.
Security agents reportedly kidnapped a young man at the Dream area of Yei town. Residents found his dead body a few days later.

Militants opened fire on a rickshaw at Bargo valley in Birkat Seira, Saraf Omra locality, North Darfur, leaving three members of a child immunisation team wounded. The health team was returning from the Malika area east of Birkat Seira after the completion of a vaccination campaign for nomadic children.

Militants opened fire in Fogni village north of El Malam in East Jebel Marra, leaving a number of people wounded, including three seriously. The gunmen seized money, property and livestock of the villagers. Villagers were displaced to El Malam and Dubo El Omda.
Militants attacked Fara village in Tullus locality, South Darfur, leaving three people shot dead and three others wounded.
Clashes between the Salamat and the Fallata over cattle rustling in the Dejaj area (55 km west of Graida, south Darfur) left four Fallata, including two women, and five Salamat men killed.

Agents from the Chamber of Trade and Industry organized a protest in front of the seat of the chamber in Gafsa to denounce the negligence of authorities towards the financial crisis. Two members of the National Assembly joined the protest.
Inhabitants of Hammad, Jedaida, blocked the road leading to Tebourba with tires to protest against perils on roads after a woman died in an accident.

Protesters were out in the streets to demontrate against the proposal bill for increasing the age limit of presidential candidates. When MP Joy Atim was making her speech, other MPs joined the gathering. At this point, police became violent. After the police became violent, the protesters started turning on the police and pelting stones  at them.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: ZANU PF youth league members staged a demonstration in Chipinge against the Manicaland youth league chairperson, Mubuso Chinguno, claiming that he has fraudulently distributed stands and has embezzled party money.

Medical workers from the nephrology department in a hospital in Bouira protested in the hospital compound over the scarce availability of kindeys for their patients, denouncing a bad coordination among the hospital staff.
Algerian troops killed two armed militants in the area of Selma Ben Ziada, Jijel province.
A BF army sub-officer and his younger brother were assassinated overnight in Gorom-Gorom.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure was attacked and beaten in his home in Kibago by 3 other Imbonerakure, who accused him of leaking strategic plans.

actor1: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
notes: On October 23, a Seleka faction assimilated to that of General Alkatim attacked the village of Saragba located about one kilometer from the city of Batangafo. Several houses were burned down and 16 people were killed by the ex-Seleka from Kaga Bandoro and Kabo. Antibalaka repelled the attack.
In Langandji (22 km from Mobaye, on the axis Mobaye-Kongbo), two people were killed on October 23.
STRIKES: Judges went again on a one week-strike starting from October, 23th.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The houses of Joseph Olengankoy and Alphonse Ntumba Luaba were attacked by armed men, which is expected to be a result of calls for President Kabila to step down and his crackdown on opposition.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified gunmen attacked the police office of Hoho in the night of the 22nd. The fire exchange lasted some minutes. No injuries were registered.
Several houses were burned down by Mayi Mayi Nyatura in he locality of Mirangi in Bwito, Rutshuru. The civilians fled the scene to Kanyabayonga-Lusowa.
6 fishermen were kidnapped by an unidentified armed group in Lake Edward. Mayi Mayi Charles have been reported to be involved in harassment towards fishermen in this region.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: Police officers use teargas to disperse supporters waiting for the arrival of Felix Tshisekedi at the airport of Lubumbashi. According to the police, these were protesters wanting to throw projectiles at him. Tshisekedi condemned the police action.
Egyptian security killed six militants and seized a large amount of weapons during a raid on a hideout in North Sinai.
Workers of the first LED bulbs factory in southern Sinai called on authorities to reopen it, as it was closed two months ago soon after its opening in the Sinai industrial zone near el-Tor.

Around 100 workers at the Majestic Ceramic Factory in Suez organized a protest in front of the company's headquarters to protest against the management preventing them from entering the factory and demanding them to resign.
Egyptian warplanes struck a eight vehicles entering Egypt from Libya which killed suspected militants inside the vehicles. Egyptian Air-Force did not specify the number of casualties.
Students of Adama Science and Technology University conducted an anti-government demonstration.

Thousands of BethlÃ©em schools students set up a march to prostest the lack of teaching, as schools were destroyed Thursday by a conflict between the school founder and locals. Students were armed with clubs. They interrupted teaching in several school and blocked northen axis. They were eventually dispersed by police.
Four Al-Shabaab members were killed by the KDF in Mararani after the soldiers raided the camp on Monday, forcing the other militants to abandon it.
Confrontation between police in Migori and NASA supporters started on Tuesday night and extended to the 25th, with businesses being closed and roads blocked. Scores injured.

assoc_actor_1: KPAWU: Kenya Plantation and Agricultural Workers Union
notes: Protesters from the KPAWU continue to push for multinational tea companies to adhere to a collective bargaining agreement (CBA). The protests lasted, at least, three days.

Tension has brewed at the Grand Bassa County Community College (GBCCC) where Students Monday staged a peacefulÂ protestÂ that brought activities at the institution to a standstill. TheÂ protestÂ is in response to disenchantments ranging from the lack of ID cards for three semesters, lack of PE shirts, handbooks, insurance, effective transportation service and the reconditioning of the bridge connecting Four Houses Community and the GBCCc Paynesberry Campus.
Clashes between two armed groups in Surman took place after one of the two opened fire on the criminal investigation branch Al-Gharbia.
A young man was killed in a vigilante attack ciommitted by the Fokonolona in Tsararano Anosikely in Mahajanga.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: IED attack followed by gunfire signalled in Kidal. JNIM claimed damaging a MINUSMA vehicle by IED detonation on October, 26.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: The village of Ouan (Cercle of Tominian) also under attack, telecomms cut, one gendarme killed two wounded. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 26th.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: 15 "AnsarDine" members (part of JNIM) killed and captured amidst Barkhane raid in AbeÃ¯bara area involving both airstrike and ground forces. JNIM says French raid killed 11 Malian soldiers held captive and the 3 guards. France denyed JNIM claims. JNIM's claim was confirmed by France Embassy and Barkhane on November, 1st.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: LOOTING: Gendarmerie post in Dioro Region attacked by unknown gunmen, a vehicle seized. Eventual casualty toll not available. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 26th.
In the locality of Morrua, a mob attacked the home of a community leader and tried, without success, to vandalise the police station after rumours of vampires were spreading.

Two persons were said to have been shot dead after some soldiers clashed with some riotous youths in Sopp village, in Riyom Local Government Area of Plateau State. It was gathered that the youths were protesting against alleged poisoning of a 32-year-old during an air raid by members of the military Special Task Force. It is not known if the alleged poisoning was accidental.
A Fulani herdsman went missing 'last week'. The victims remains were discovered on 24/10 in Riyom local government of Plateau State.
Al Shabaab have launched an attack against a Somali National Army (SNA) IVO Afgooye. Causalities not known. Al Shabaab briefly overtook the checkpoint.

An unidentified armed man attacked Miir Police Station by hurling a hand grenade from the backside of the station. The hand grenade exploded near the police building. There were no reports of casualties. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. Puntland police officials were reported to be investigating the incident.

Armed supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties using sticks clashed at Boqol iyo Kotonka Junction in Kodbur District. An unspecified number of supporters sustained minor injuries. There were no reports of arrests.
A local resident and a Puntland soldier exchanged gunfire due to a water dispute in Qandala. Both were wounded and rushed to Bossaso General Hospital for treatment.

Armed al Shabaab combatants allegedly attacked police forces on patrol near Buundo Yarey village in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. One soldier was killed and two others were injured.
Reported infighting between members of the Somali security forces has resulted in three killed and two injured.

A woman was killed by an anti-aircraft stray round, suspected to be fired from South Galkayo, which impacted her residence near Barwaaqo market in North Galkayo. Puntland authorities were reported to be investigating the incident. The group that fired the round is not known.

The vehicle belonging to the deputy governor of Awdal was stoned by teenagers supporting Wadani political party as he drove past a Wadani rally at Borama Liberty Garden. Police arrested two youngsters.

Al Shabaab abducted two farmers from outside of Afgoye district. Al Shabaab burnt the generator before the two men were taken to an unknown location. The motive behind the abduction remains unknown. A second source claims four abducted.

Jubland local police forces, manning the main gate of Dhobley police station, shot and killed a mentally challenged man at c. 30 meters west of the gate. The victim defied instruction of the police before the shooting.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM convoy travelling at Ceelwareegow near Marka district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

Armed men, believed to be a Pro-Puntland armed militia, attacked the residence of the President of Khatumo in Buhoodle town. The armed men clashed with the Presidential guards. There were no reports of casualties.
The police have arrested five men aged between 20 and 31 in connection with the torching of a Cape Peninsula University of Technology bus.
A man alleged to have attempted to rape a young girl has been stoned to death by angry residents from an informal settlement in Clare Estate, Durban.
In Pongola, pupils allegedly broke school windows during a school meeting in one of the high schools in protest.
UCT has confirmed a group of students attempted to disrupt classes on Upper Campus in ongoing student protests.
A handful of Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) members at Ikemeleng in Kroondal in the North West, marched to the Rustenburg municipality, demanding houses, water and electricity.

Report that SPLA soldiers have been raping and beating people in Ayachi, Imatong state, as well as looting people's food as their salaries have not been paid for a long time. The Governor of imatong state denied the claims. Date unclear - report dated 23 October.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Government forces claimed to have regained all areas occupied by opposition forces in Jonglei in clashes during the week of 23 October. Date, locations and casualties unclear.

Unidentified assaillants in military uniforms attacked a shop at a gold mine in El Liri north in Talodi locality, South Kordofan, leaving one killed, another seriously injured, and stealing large sums of money and gold.

Herders beat two farmers with sticks and an axe after driving their camels onto their farm in the Khazan Tunjur area of Tawila locality, North Darfur, causing one of the two's miscarriage. The herders also stole sorghum.
Clashes between RSF and a militia force led by Ali Rizgallah that tried to attack Kutum from Kabkabiya. RSF said it repulsed the rebels.
Inhabitants of Hammad, Jedaida, blocked the road leading to Tebourba with tires to protest against perils on roads after a woman died in an accident.
Disabled people protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Medenine to denounce insufficient ramps and access to public transport.
Voiceless people organised a protest in front of the Municipal Theatre in Tunis to pressure the government to keep its promises with regards to employment

Opposition protesters belonging to the FDS storm the police office of Nagalama to demand the release of the party's former president - Dr. Kizza Besingye - and other party leaders who have been held there for days without a trial.
Multiplex company workers are protesting over poor conditions. They are demanding higher pay and better conditions.
Vendors in Gweru barricaded the roads and pelted the police with stones to resist the police attempts to clear the vendors from the streets. A police officer was injured.

Workers of a building site in Khenchela organized a sit-in in front of the south-Corean company managing the project to denounce the non-respect of agreements that were concluded between them and the company.
The seat of the local chapter of the 'Front des Forces Socialistes' in Yakouren was ravaged by unknown individuals.
Algerian troops killed two armed militants and captured another one in a wide-scale operation in the area of Selma Ben Ziada, Jijel province.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: The National Police of Congo arrested 28 members of the UDPS who were gathered for a meeting in Lubumbashi, for allegedly insulting President Kabila (the UDPS claims the number is 48). The police surrounded the building, where the members of the UDPS were barricated, before calling the FARDC and forcing their entry into the building. The UN Special Representative to DRC called on authorities to release the people arrested. They were released 2 days later.

Masked men kidnapped leading businessman and military contractor Ayman Sahmoud from his car in front of his house in southern Arish. Sahmoud, who is from one of Arishâs biggest tribes, Al-Fawakhreya, was taken to an unknown location.
Armored vehicle of the EG army struck by IED south of Sheikh Zuweid, North Sinai. Provisional toll 3 wounded conscripts.
In East Shewa zone, Fantale woreda, Oromo Karayu (Oromo Clan) and Argoba (Ethnic group in Ethiopia, unrelated to Oromo)  reportedly clashed. No information on fatalities or further details.

In Ilu Abba Bora, Buno Badale woreda, Ethiopian federal army troopers who were reportedly wearing Oromiya forces uniforms shot at demonstrators as they were protesting in the town.  Opposition groups have accused the government of attempting to turn peaceful protests violent as an excuse to clamp down. Casualties not known.
A police operation left the son of a business owner shot dead in Nairobi. The police officers had an armoured car and the reasons for the shooting are not yet clear.

One person was on Sunday [22 October] injured during running battle between police and residents of Lucky Summer area in Nairobi. The residents were protesting the presence of suspected [proscribed] Mungiki sect members who held a meeting in the area since morning.

Police forces attacked supporters of the opposition that went to the Lucky Summer neighbourhood to check on a ritual of beheading of a sheep that was taking place (suspectedly by the Mungiki sect). The police shot at the civilians. The police confirmed that it shot a man and that the group performing the ritual had sought protection.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: 1 Libyan civilian died and 2 others were injured in landmine explosions in different locations in Souq al-Hout, Benghazi.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: 3 Egyptian workers were abducted in Tripoli by unknown militants.
Inhabitants of el-Manara neighbourhood in Sirte organized a protest to call on authorities to rebuild their houses that were destroyed during the civil war.
A man was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen and his dead body found a few days later in Ajaylat. Relatives were not able to pay a financial ransom that was demanded by the gunmen.
Unidentified gunmen hit the Town Hall of Sirte with an RPG. No injuries were reported.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: 1 Egyptian civilian died in a landmine explosion in Souq al-Hout, Benghazi.
A mob lynched three community leaders accused of witchcraft in Macanga, Chidzolomondo.

Clashes reported in the village of Columbe on 22 October. Armed men attacked a building in Mocimboa da Praia. They are suspected of being the same ones that had already attacked the locality before who are referred to as 'Al Shabaab'.

PROPERTY DESTRUCTION: Armed men, believed to be Islamic militants, attacked Ulumbi in Palma. The attack targeted a building. The incident followed another clash that had taken place in Palma and during which 11 people were captured and handed to the police. The armed men are suspected of being affiliated with the people who perpetrated the attacks in Mocimboa da Praia.

Twin explosions in Maiduguri, Borno State capital on Sunday night killed 16 people (14 in Muna Garage, 2 in Muna Dalti), including a wedding team and the suicide bombers. The explosions occurred at Muna Garage and Muna Dalti, suburbs of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected as perpetrators. Other reports indicate a third explosion occurred at an area IDP camp, injuring 10 - it is not known if the bomber was lethally injured in this instance.

Twin explosions in Maiduguri, Borno State capital on Sunday night killed 16 people (14 in Muna Garage, 2 in Muna Dalti), including a wedding team and the suicide bombers. The explosions occurred at Muna Garage and Muna Dalti, suburbs of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected as perpetrators. Other reports indicate a third explosion occurred at an area IDP camp, injuring 10 - it is not known if the bomber was lethally injured in this instance.
Ten are injured in a suspected Boko Haram suicide attack at a Maiduguri IDP camp. It is not known if the bomber was killed in the attack.
One killed and shops burnt as Muslim and Christian youth clash at Dan Anacha in Taraba following a confrontation over blasphemy.

Armed supporters of Wadani and Kulmiye political parties, using sticks, clashed at Hass fuel station near Maansoor Hotel. The police arrived at the scene and the two groups escaped from the area. There were no reports of arrests.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM and SNA forces at Mashalay settlement outside of Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew from the location. Casualties not be ascertained at the time of reporting. The exchange may have occurred on the previous day.

Armed Saâad and Omar Mohamud pastoralists clashed at Sangaduud vicinity (c. 60 km East of Galkayo). Six people were killed and 22 others were injured. It was believed that the fighting was associated with a dispute over grasslands and previous clan feuds. The situation was reported to be calm but tension was high as the situation was unpredictable.
22 October, AM, Godod, Mudug â armed clashes oppose two rival clan militias. Seven deaths reported.

22nd October, AM, Baloow, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: A minibus travelling between Afgooye and Balcad is hit by a road side IED, resulting in the death of six passengers. The highway between the two towns is controlled by al Shabaab and the IED may have been placed to target a military convoy. Shabelle Radio Network claims the attack took place at Daniga village.
22 October, 09:00EAT, Degaanley, Middle Shabelle â a civilian vehicle is hit by a roadside IED. Perpetrators not named by source.

An IED buried along the roadside between Afgoye and Balcad exploded when a civilian mini bus, headed to Afgoye district, was passing at Daniga village (c. 11 km West of Balcad district). Four female passengers, the driver and his conductor were killed. Al Shabaab believed responsible.

22 Oct: Pro-Puntland Dhulbahante supporters and politicians demonstrated at Buhodle against the peace accord arrived at by the Presidents of Khatumo and Somaliland at Ainabo on 20 October. The demonstrators marched along the streets chanting anti- Somaliland/Khatumo slangs. The rally ended peacefully.

Unknown armed assailants using pistols shot and killed an electoral delegate near Nasteho village in Wadajir district. The victim participated in the parliamentarian elections of Hirshabelle state in 2016. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
A woman was stabbed to death by another woman at Hodan-Qaylo neighbourhood in Burao. The incident was linked to a dispute over political differences. Police arrested the perpetrator.
A man has been killed in what is believed to be a clan based revenge killing in a settlement north of Elbur.
Civilian killed during clashes between rival militias manning an illegal checkpoint. Clashing actors not identified.
Two students at the QwaQwa campus of UFS were allegedly shot and injured by private security guards.
Gunfire erupted at Orlo area along the Amadi-Maridi road in Western Equatoria as SPLA soldiers bringing food from Juba were "blocked" by gunmen.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: An SPLA-IO official's statement on 23 October claimed fighting between SPLA-IO and NAS had continued for control of territory in Kajo-Keji since it erupted on 17 and 18 October. Dates unclear. SPLA-IO claimed to have killed 20 NAS soldiers in the past week (3 fatalities in past events).

A woman's body was found in the Yei river around 22 October. The woman had been raped, burnt and her throat slit. The precise date, location and circumstances around her death are unclear. The incident took place days after consultations on the national dialogue concluded in the area.
The police started firing bullets and tear-gas at protesters when the crowd did not disperse.

The protest against the constitutional ammendment for the age limit of the candidates for the presidentials was called by Mbale Municipality MP Jack Wamanga and went peacefully from the start at 3pm until 4pm. Then, the opposition leader Winfred Kiiza arrived. At the interval, police ordered protesters to stop the demonstration since meetings attended by politicians and officers from other constituencies were banned.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: ZANU PF youth attacked a group of MDCT activists who were carrying out voter registration training in Chitungwiza. Several youth from the parties were injured in the clashes.

Related inhabitants from Ghat (Libya), Djanet (Algeria) and Elyse (Algeria), organized a protest on the Tin al-Koum border crossing between Ghat and Gent to demand the opening of the border to facilitate exchange. Algerian authorities had closed the border and deployed a number of their forces as a result of instability in Libya.
A forbidden demonstration agains bad governance was dispersed by police: 4 people arrested.
Looting: A group (reportedly 10 on 5 motorbikes) ransacked & burned 5 outlets selling beverages in Tchalel-GoumdÃ©, near Inata.
Non-violent activity: Gunmen on motorbikes attempted to abduct the son of a councilman in Koutougou. He escaped.
Property destruction: The primary school in GomdÃ©-FulbÃ© was burned by unknown gunmen, teachers were stripped of their belongings and locked up.

actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
notes: The head of the SNR in Gasenyi abducted a man and took him to an unknown destination.
Police prevented demonstrators to join a pro-anglophone demonstration by occuping key points of the city. Just some people could gather in Bepanda neighborhood.
Opposition demonstration in support to anglophone regions was dispersed by police forces.
4 civilians were accused of sorcery and tortured.
A man was killed and thrown into the ditch by a member of Ethiopian national army. The location was not clear, but is said to have taken place around Haraghe.
Nairobi's Eastleigh hold protest against Mogadishu bombing.
Five people were injured when suspected al-Shabab militants sprayed their vehicle with bullets between Bodhei and Ijara, on the border of Lamu and Garissa counties.

Workers from Mellita oil & gas complex organized a protest in front of the company to denounce the company's mismanagement & corruption. They ask the management for health insurance and to quickly pay their salaries.
A number of young people from Al-Jabal Al-Akhdar demonstrated in the city of Al-Bayda to emphasize their support for  national dialogue "without foreign commandments or intervention".

Ayorou attackers reportedly subjected to heavy airstrikes by unidentified fighter jet/s (likely FR Mirage 2000). Casualties also reported without further precisions in Amalawlaw, 85km Ayorou and 15km from the Nigerian border.

Workers at the Skasawa mines, in the province of Chishawah, decided to strike and protest at the exit of Imantanut city to denounce nonpayment of salaries for two months. Police forces initially prevented workers from reaching the place but protesters used taxis to reach the scene to be able to march in Imintanoute.

An armed Islamist group that locals refer to as 'Al Shabaab' clashed with government forces in the fishing village of Maluku, some 30 km from MocÃ­mboa da Praia on 21 October. The attacks prompted the villagers to flee.
Fighting between Nigerien forces and the attackers is now reported in the area of In-AtÃ¨s, on the border with Mali.
Gendarmerie camp in Ayorou attacked: vehicles also seized as "spoils of war", 13 gendarmes killed and 5 wounded.

Authorities in Niger say at least a dozen paramilitary police have been killed in an attack. Reports said the attackers were heavily armed with guns and rocket launchers. They arrived in five vehicles to launch their ambush on a gendarmes base. The attackers left when Nigerien military reinforcements showed up. Updated toll: 13 dead, 5 wounded (Official Statement).
Military air forces targeted nine Boko Haram camps around Gudumbali on 21/10. 350 reported dead. It had been learned the sect had been gathering in the area to launch attack on the surrounding towns.

Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade into a teashop frequented by government soldiers in Berdale (c. 55 km North West of Baidoa). Three people, two soldiers and a female owner of the teashop were injured. Security forces arrived and cordoned off the area. There were no reports of arrests.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab media claims attacks on AMISOM bases in Mashaaley and Danow. Causalities not known.

Three armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab, using pistols attacked SNA soldier at Halgan area of Halwadag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne town. There was an exchange of gunfire. One of the attackers and the SNA soldier was injured in the incident. SNA forces in the area rushed to the location and took the injured soldier to AMISOM level 2 hospital for treatment. The injured soldier was headed to his house during the incident. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at a government forces position in Karan District. Two soldiers were injured. Targeted troops opened fire at the general direction of the attack but the assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Armed men hailing from Dhulbahante/Nuur-Ahmed stole a rented vehicle being used by an INGO and belonging to Dhulbahante/Ugaadhyahan clan woman near Faleryale village. The motive of the carjacking was believed to be linked to a conflict over resources. No one was harmed and local elders attempted to recover the vehicle from the armed men.
21 October, evening, Garowe, Puntland â Puntland Police Commissioner Ereg attempts to shoot Nugaal Governor Shire during a meeting following a dispute over security strategies.
21 October, afternoon â a SNPF officer shot and killed a civilian being held at a police station in Heliwa. No arrests were made. The motive behind the attack is not known.
21 October, evening â Unidentified gunmen opened fire against a group of students in Warta Nabada (Wardhigley) District. The motive of the attack is not known. No causalities reported.
Unidentified gunmen open fire against a group of students in Wardhigley. Causalities not known.
Dhulbahante/Nuur Ahmed gunmen carjack INGO vehicle rented to Dhulbahante/Ugaax Dhyahan woman. Motive is conflict over resources. Clan elders' mediation ongoing. No injuries.
Suspected al Shabaab militants assassinate SNAF soldier. Assailants escaped. SNAF soldier and one assailant injured.
Metrorail has terminated trains travelling from Cape Town to Bellville via Lavistown due to protest action.

Surrender/Defect:A group of SSDF fighters under the overall command of Lt. General Gordon Kong Chuol fighting alongside Machar's SPLA-IO defected and joined the Gabriel Changson Chang-led Federal Democratic Party, denouncing SPLA-IO's inability to consult all opposition groups and seek to address the root causes of the problems in the country. Date unclear - report dated 21 October.

assoc_actor_2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: An unidentified assaillant allegedly killed SPLM-IO spokesperson Lam Kuei Lam in Khartoum. A suspect was later arrested but the circumstances of Lam's death remain unclear.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: A clash took place in Feina, north-east of Kass in South Darfur, when SLA/AW reportedly encroached an area controlled by a splinter group. It is unclear of what group the second actor is a splinter of.

source: The Associated Press; Agence France Press
notes: ARRESTS: Security officers from Tanzania and Burundi arrested 4 top leaders of the Popular Forces of Burundi rebel group. This includes the commander in chief, Maj. Gen. JÃ©rÃ©mie Ntiranyibagira.
Protests took place in Soukra after a member of parliament inspected a school in Soukra with regards to verify recent complaints about scarce teaching personel.
Detonate/Dismantle:The National Demining Institute de-mined 400 explosive devices on Friday in the municipality of Dande.

Thousands of people took to the streets of Benin's commercial capital Cotonou on Friday to protest against President Patrice Talon's economic reforms and the high cost of living. One of the organisers said "more than 10,000" people turned out for the march to the trades union congress building. No official figure was immediately available.
DETONATION: Police forces detonated an IED found in Bamenda; no injuries reported.

A day of mourning was observed in Bangui for Pombolo's dead. Several public spaces held close during the whole day. During the night, several gunshots were heard, prompting the displacement of many inhabitants.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The FARDC got into a battle with the APCLS. The fighting lasted two days.

source: AP International, Menastream, BBC Monitoring, Oded Berkowitz Twitter, Egypt Independent
notes: At least 16 policemen and 15 militants (EG MoI figures) were killed when a military raid on a militant hideout was ambushed near Bahariya Oasis (a large area of 135kmÂ²). Other sources speak of at least 52-54 dead. A new group Jamaa Ansar al-Islam claimed the attack two weeks later.

Anti-government Oromo protests descend into violence with the Amharas group in Dega and Chora. Eight Oromos and three Amharas were reported killed, though other sources have the number as high as 20. Several houses were burnt in the fighting. Homes of Tigrayans were also targeted.

Anti-government Oromo protests descend into violence with the Amharas group in Dega and Chora. Eight Oromos and three Amharas were reported killed, though other sources have the number as high as 20. Several houses were burnt in the fighting. Homes of Tigrayans were also targeted.
Anti-government protesters overtake a coffee plantation in Jima.
Regime security forces shot and killed two anti-government protesters in Bedele. It is not known if the protesters were violent.
Regime security forces shot and killed two anti-government protesters in Gundo Maskal town of North Shewa. It is not known if the protesters were violent.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Two militants of the Shura Council of Darna Mujahideen were killed in Dhahr Al-Hamr area south of Derna.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: One killed in clashes between CMA and Platform.
Around a hundred of unemployed university graduates in Laayoune in Western Sahara have raised signs on the roofs of their houses in protest against unemployment.

A train traveling from Tangier to Casablanca caught fire between Sale and Sidi Bouknadel, leading passengers outraged with the National Railways treatment of the situation to block the train tracks by standing for about an hour.
Thousands protest in Benin City to call for economic reforms.

A police corporal shot and killed a teen-aged person in Kpansia. Demonstrators protested against police brutality following day. One of the protesters allegedly 'manhandled' a police officer on the scene.
Military forces kill three Boko Haram attackers following an ambush at Missini. The soldiers were patrolling the Dikwa - Ngala road at the time.
Military forces laid ambush to a Boko Haram location at Muzine and killed 61.
A motorist is shot and killed by police forces along the Enugu-Onitsha highway on 20/10. The action lead to a violent protest of local residents.
A motorist is shot and killed by police forces along the Enugu-Onitsha highway on 20/10. The action lead to a violent protest of local residents.

20 October, afternoon, Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle â SNAF forces capture three settlements from al Shabaab - Caanoole, Marreerey, Sabiid. This military offensive was a response to the 14 October bombing and was launched to created a security perimeter around Mogadishu. Other details limited.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 20 Oct: Al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds against a Brundian military base at Arbacow, west of Mogadishu. No injuries reported.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: Reported drone strike in Lower Shabelle. Details limited.
20 Oct: A VBIED detonates under the vehicle of an employee of the Ministry of Justice in Hodan. Two bystanders were injured.

An IED attack against a civilian is reported from Ceelasha Biyaha on 20/10. Details limited. The explosive was believed to have detonated prematurely, injuring two. Shabelle Media Network reports two dead. ERA Database reports one death.
20 October, evening, Aawdiinle, Bay â a grenade attack on a market leaves 21 people injured. Perpetrator identity not reported by source.
Al Shabaab fired five mortar shells that impacted on vacant land at Cali Onkod area near Af-Urur (c. 69 km South West of Bossaso). There were no immediate reports of casualties, damages or arrests.

An 11-year-old girl died after an explosive device, believed to be a UXO, detonated at Abaya Bilow grazing area (c. 45 km South West of Afmadow town) on the main road of Afmadow and Dhobley. The victim was herding goats with her young brother who survived the blast.

Armed men of Abgal-Mohamed Muse shot at a mini bus travelling outside of Biyo Cadde neighbourhood headed towards Mahaday district. The targets were of  Abgal/Abukar. At least two passengers were injured. The motive behind the attack was unknown.
Military forces discover an al Shabaab IED. It is not known if it was dismantled or exploded.

20 October, afternoon, Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle â SNAF forces capture three settlements from al Shabaab - Caanoole, Marreerey, Sabiid. This military offensive was a response to the 14 October bombing and was launched to created a security perimeter around Mogadishu. Other details limited.
Peace agreement: Somaliland and Khatumo State Presidents signed a Peace Accord. Future constitutional reviews for both States were also planned.
Civilians stage peaceful protest against al Shabaab following 14 OCT bombing. Religious protest, led by religious leaders after prayers.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM/SNAF base near Mashalaay. Assailants repelled. Casualty figures unknown. A second attack was reported two days later.

20 October, afternoon, Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle â SNAF forces capture three settlements from al Shabaab - Caanoole, Marreerey, Sabiid. This military offensive was a response to the 14 October bombing and was launched to created a security perimeter around Mogadishu. Other details limited.
36 students were arrested on the Bloemfontein campus late after a group of students clashed with members of the private security company and the South African Police Service (SAPS).
Three people were shot and wounded at uMlazi's notorious Glebelands hostel.

assoc_actor_1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Report that the majority of local youth were killed and women raped in Morobo and Kaya towns near the Uganda border by SPLA soldiers and SPLA-IO rebels. The claims were made by residents during a consultation with the national dialogue committee. Date of the events is unclear - report dated 20 October. Morobo area has been the scene of fighting between the two groups in recent months.
