Armed robbers forcefully broke into an NGO (International Aid Services - IAS) compound in Bor town in Jonglei, beating two aid workers and stealing property (electronic equipment, money, clothes, diesel).

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Clashes between government and SPLA-IO forces in Farasika and Bahr Olo on the Maridi-Mundri road on 16 and 20 October.

Youth in Kologi protested the health impacts of the use of cyanide in gold extraction after officials travelled to Kadugli to persuade mining companies to come and work in the area. A curfew was imposed on the town on 20 October after tensions mounted in the area. Date of the protests unclear.
A man was killed during an anti-opposition police operation in Sokode.

University professors staged a sit-in in front of the headquarters of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research. They demand academic liberty and non-intervention of the state in their affairs.
Police teargassed angryÂ youthsÂ who stormedÂ JinjaÂ East MunicipalityÂ MPÂ MrÂ NathanÂ IgemeÂ Nabeta`s homeÂ with the aim of setting it on fire on.

ProtestÂ in Mbale Town against the Constitutional Amendment that seeks among others to remove presidential age limits from the 1995 Constitution. Police fired teargas and live bullets to disperse the protestors. Secretary General for Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) was arrested.

On 20 October, angry residents of Nyabubaare Sub-county protested and closed the 15km road connecting Ishaka town through Kizinda trading center to areas of Bitereko in Mitooma District saying the road is impassable, making it hard for them to transact business and find safe way to their destinations.
Workers from 'Epic Cacva-company protested in front of the UGTA-syndicate seat in Algiers to denounce the pressuring management-board of their company.

Inhabitants from Ouled Ali, N'Memcha and Seddara, from the commune of El-Hachimia south of Bouira blocked several streets that lead to quarries in the region, showing their insatisfaction with their deteriorating living standards caused by use of explosives in the quarries.
Several associations gathered in a march celebrating the "tirailleur african" and the international peace day.
Property destruction: A group of presumed Ansaroul Islam burned the primary school in TÃ©m.

assoc_actor_2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
notes: A police officer who is a former FNL fighter went missing on 19 October from Muramvya police station.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The APCLS try to overtake the locality of Kitobo, but are repelled by the FARDC.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The FARDC got into a battle with the APCLS. The fighting lasted two days.
ISIS claimed executing an alleged "spy/informer" for the Egyptian army in Sheikh Zuweid.

Violent anti-government protests occur in several Oromia towns including Asela, Horogudru, Ambro, Wollega, Horogudru, Muketuri, and Fiche. The protested chanted anti-TPLF slogans and burned government vehicles. Students were involved at Ambro, Gebre Guracha, Horo Guduru and Asela. Other articles from the same sources state "a dozen" protesters have been killed since "last week." The dates and locations of these reported deaths are not known, and may have occurred in other towns reporting protests from other sources. Fatalities divided among town with reported violence.

Violent anti-government protests occur in several Oromia towns including Asela, Horogudru, Ambro, Wollega, Horogudru, Muketuri, and Fiche. The protested chanted anti-TPLF slogans and burned government vehicles. Students were involved at Ambro, Gebre Guracha, Horo Guduru and Asela. Other articles from the same sources state "a dozen" protesters have been killed since "last week." The dates and locations of these reported deaths are not known, and may have occurred in other towns reporting protests from other sources. Fatalities divided among town with reported violence.

In south Shewa zone, Kuyo Garba gurracha, Wucale woreda, anti-government rioters burned 10 government vehicles after a demonstration turned violent. Fatalities as a result of the violence were reported but who died is not clear.

Kenyan police fired rifles and tear gas in Nairobi's Freedom Park on 19 October to disperse demonstrators preparing toÂ protestÂ police killings of opposition supporters ahead of a fresh presidential election. Injuries reported.
Small group of ISIS fighters spotted roaming the area of Sultan, 60km east Sirte during the past two days.

The water supply in Tripoli and the surrounding area was stopped after a militia from Brak al-Shati turned off the valves of the 'Man-Made River' after its leader, Al Mabrouk Ahnish, was not released by the Rada (âDeterrenceâ) forces.
Inhabitants of Sabha protested calling for peace, stability and a cessation of war. They were carrying white flags during their protest.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a military colonel east of Sirte. The colonel was released the following day.
Heavy clashes broke out between two armed groups engaged in human smuggling at the 'Agricultural Project Brak', located 1km from Brak al-Shati, not far from Sabha.
A police officer and another man was killed just outside Farafangana by Dahalo milita.
In Blantyre a 22-year-old man, was torched and another was stoned to death following suspicion of sucking people's blood, Malawi Police confirmed.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Gendarmerie commander in GuirÃ© (Cercle of Nara) abducted and his driver found dead. JNIM claimed the ambush on October, 20th.
4 individuals arrested by the Malian army in Boulkessi last Saturday were found to have been executed & buried yesterday by herders.

A mob, believing that local officials were working for the vampires, burned down the homes of community leaders and the home of the director of the district prison.They also vandalised the police offices.

A police corporal shot and killed a teen-aged person in Kpansia. Demonstrators protested against police brutality following day. One of the protesters allegedly 'manhandled' a police officer on the scene.
Boko Haram attacks a group of soldiers in Marte LGA, killing 11.

Air forces carry out a strike on Durwawa area in Konduga LGA. Military intelligence believe the wife of Abubakar Shekau, Mallama Fitdasi, had been killed in air strikes. Other structural damage reported.
19 Oct: Al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a colonel in Warta Nabada (Wardhigley) District, Mogadishu.
AM, Ceel Waaq, Gedo â security forces intercept a truck transporting explosives. Al Shabaab responsible.
19 October, afternoon, Balidhidin, Bari â pro-Islamic State fighters kill two civilians.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fired an unspecified number of mortar shells at the AMISOM base at Arbacow settlement in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat from the area. Fatalities could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

Alleged al Shabaab fighters fired five mortar shells at the Puntland base in Balikhadar area (c. 35 km South West of Bossaso). The mortars impacted on vacant land. There were no immediate reports of casualties, damages or arrests.

A group of teachers in Cerigabo demonstrated in front of Cerigabo Ministry of Education against the Regional Education Officer accused of favouritism and corruption. The demonstrators demanded for the removal of Regional Education Officer. It was reported that the teachers were among those who failed the MoE exams and were disqualified. Police dispersed the protestors.

RECRUITMENT DRIVE: Al Shabaab fighters increased targeting youth to attend al Shabaab workshop and education centres opened at Ramacadey (c. 60 km South West of Baidoa), on the road to Diinssor and Labatan Jirow (c. 60 km West of Baidoa). The main purpose of al Shabaab was to recruit. A similar exercise was reported to be taking place in other regions in Southern Somali - location not provided. Additional information indicated that there was an increase in the number of females participating at the al Shabaab education centres.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Defusal: A Toyota vehicle, loaded with explosive devices, was intercepted by NISA troops at Ceelasha settlement in Afgoye district. The vehicle, which was left unattended in the garage, was successfully defused by the security forces. The intended target of the vehicle could not be established. There were no reports of arrests.

An Oromo man was stabbed and seriously wounded by an unknown assailant at the seaport area of Bossaso. The victim was rushed to Bossaso General Hospital for treatment. Police were reported to be investigating.

Armed supporters of Wadani political party, using clubs and machetes, assaulted a delegation of Kulmiye political party at GoâDa- Weyn village (c. 45 km North of Ood-weyne) where supporters of Kulmiye political party were opening a new office. An unspecified number of Kulmiye supporters sustained minor injuries. The police intervened and managed to control the tension between the two groups.
Al Shabaab kidnaps 200 children in various locations in Bardaale.
A civilian stabs another over political differences. Details limited. The extent of the injuries are not known.
Defusal: Puntland forces discover and safely detonate an al Shabaab IED. No casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked SNAF base in Qoryoley. AMISOM deployed QRF. Casualties unknown.
About 50 supporters of Public Transport Voice, the Treatment Action Campaign and Right2Know Campaign marched through Cape Town train station to protest the deteriorating railway system.
About 25 learners from ID Mkizhe and Fezeka high schools in Gugulethu marched from the local mall to the police station.
In Litchenburg, protesters demonstrated outside the court house during the hearing of a murder accused.
Mbizana residents and pupils yesterday marched to the local police station demanding the speedy arrest of those who killed, beheaded and dissected a schoolgirl.

Unknown gunmen killed two members of the Mahariya tribe and stole their motorcycles, five km north of Kabkabiya, North Darfur. The following day, a group of Mahariya traced the perpetrators to Umm Laota village (9km northwest of Kabkabiya towan), where two Mahariya and two Tama were killed during the ensuing clashes. RSF intervened to separate the parties.
Two armed herdsmen intercepted two boys on their way to collect firewood near Fallujah in East Jebel Marra, and kidnapped one of them as the other escaped.

Five people were shot and injured on Thursday as gangs of youths and the security forces clashed sporadically in Togo's capital Lome, ahead of a planned opposition protest that the government has ruled illegal. The streets were largely deserted ahead of the rally, which the opposition coalition has refused to cancel despite a government ban on weekday marches on security grounds. Opposition spoke about 3 dead and 44 wounded.
Arrest:ARREST: FDCâs Col. Dr Kizza Besigye was arrested on 19 October at Burambira Trading Center in Bubaare Sub County, Rubanda district by waiting police as he tried to enter Kabale.
In Kyengera town in Busiro East constituency, bullets and tear gas were reported during an age limit consultative meeting.

Police fired tear gas and live bullets to disperse protesters opposed to the amendment of the constitution to remove the age limit cap at Nateete, Rubaga South in Kampala. Stick-wielding goons were also seen working with police officers.

Social Housing Beneficiaries encircled the seat of the prefecture to denounce the latest social housing lists. Police was present but no interaction took place. Different roads in the city were also blocked with burning tires and cars.
Justice workers went on a 48-hours strike and gathered in the court building, asking for the better work conditions.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A motorcyclist was beaten by Imbonerakure in Gitega after he refused to pay a tax to them.
A man was killed in Sehe.
A vigilante died after walking on a land-mine in Amtchali. 2 wounded.

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
notes: Clashes between Kembe and Gambo in Pombolo: 26 dead and 2 peacekeepers wounded. Updated toll: 100 dead and 50 wounded.

actor2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: Armed group attacked Alindao: MINUSCA forces answered back. 2 dead, 3 wounded.
2 people on a motorbike were killed by armed men.
Armed men attacked Bamatara village: 4 dead 2 wounded and 450 deplaced people.
Clashes between different communities in Darasna provoked 11 dead, including the gendarmerie company commander of Aboudeia and the Darasna brigade commander who interposed to avoid violence.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: The convoy of the operational sector of Sokola 1, of General Marcel Mbangu, was ambushed by the ADF in the Mbau-Kamanga route. 1 soldier was killed.

A group of irate youth has attacked the regional office of Daily Guide in Kumasi, over publications carried by the newspaper about a highly respected traditional ruler.
Three police agents were wounded by protester denouncing the non-respect of government's engaments. Several demonstrators were wounded and other were arrested.
Clashes between government party supporters and the supporters of 15 dissidents MPs were reported: 4 wounded.

Protesters stormed the Huduma Centre in Kisumu city threw chairs and destroyed tents where a training camp was being set up for officials to prepare for this month's presidential election. The youths also roughed up a woman the commission had contracted to provide the tents and chairs.
Angry youths disrupted a training for electoral officials at Chango in Vihiga on 18 October.
A suspected arsonÂ attackÂ was carried out on the residence of Journalist Smith Toby on October 18, in the Tower Hill community along the Robertsfield Highway, Margibi County.
Relatives from prisoners from the Hirak Movement protested in front of the Oukacha Prison in Casablanca.
People in Zagora protested against the insufficient supply of water in the city.
At least three soldiers were killed when Boko Haram fighters ambushed a military convoy in Damboa on 18/10. The Nigerian Tribune reports seven soldiers died.
Truck drivers block roads following the killing of a colleague by revenue officials.
Reports of shots fired during a protest over the non approval of a $350 million loan requested by the state government. It is not clear if the gunfire came from the protesting group or another actor.
Revenue officials attacked and killed a tanker driver over non-payment of fees along the Lokoja-Abuja road.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Unconfirmed local sources have reported that an African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy has been hit by an IED IVO Lambar KM60 (Marka). An exchange of gunfire followed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Fatalities not known.
Local Sources have reported that al Shabaab have launched an attack on a Somali National Army position on the outskirts of Afgooye. The attack continued for 30 minutes. Causalities are not known.

A large crowd of residents in Mogadishu gathered at Stadium Koonis in Abdulaziz district for a demonstration attended by top government officials. This took place after protesters against the VBIED incident that occurred on 14 October 2017  were dispersed by police.

Hundreds of people from all parts of the community of Baidoa staged a demonstration against the VBIED attack in Mogadishu and in support of the victims of the attack. The demonstration was organized by the local authorities and South West administration. Officials from the local authorities and South West state attended the rally. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Hundreds of people in Beletweyne demonstrated against the killing of civilians during the VBIED attack that occurred in Mogadishu on 14 October 2017. Local businesses were closed and vehicle movements were restricted during the demonstration. The demonstration ended peacefully.
About 50 locals conducted a peaceful demonstration at Gaaca area of Bossaso to express grief and sorrow for the bombing incident that occurred in Mogadishu on 14 October 2017.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in various locations including Dhusamareb, Guriel, Abudwak and South Galkayo. The protesters chanted slogans against the deadly terror attacks which occurred at Mogadishu on 14 October 2017. The demonstrators urged the FGS and all nationals to conduct operations against al Shabaab fighters to eliminate the terror group in Somalia.

Residents in Garbaharrey held a peaceful demonstration against the VBIED attack that took place on 14 October 2017 in Mogadishu. Protesters showed solidarity and support to the affected families and those that were killed and injured in the explosions. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in various locations including Dhusamareb, Guriel, Abudwak and South Galkayo. The protesters chanted slogans against the deadly terror attacks which occurred at Mogadishu on 14 October 2017. The demonstrators urged the FGS and all nationals to conduct operations against al Shabaab fighters to eliminate the terror group in Somalia.

A number of demonstrations took place around the city which has led to reported gunfire in the vicinity of KM4. While details from locals remain unclear it is understood the crowd assaulted an AMISOM soldier which resulted in his death after he shot and wounded a demonstrator. The reason of the protest is not known, however, several demonstrations have been occurring following the large-scale hotel attack on 14/10.
Hundreds of locals conducted a peaceful demonstration in Qardho to condemn the VBIED incident in Mogadishu. They pledged to support the government and the Somali people in fight against al Shabaab.

Protestors, who were against the deadly VBIED incident that occurred on 14 October 2017 at Zope intersection, conducted several marches along Mogadishu districts. The demonstrators marched along Maka-almukarama road and attempted to enter the explosion site but was prevented by security forces. The protesters forced their way into the explosion site. It was reported that security forces shot at the protesters resulting in three people being injured. The demonstrators, who were chanting anti-al Shabaab slogans, threw stones at many shops and restaurants along the road. Thereafter, a large crowd of residents in Mogadishu gathered at Stadium Koonis in Abdulaziz district for a demonstration attended by top government officials.

Arrest:Somali Police Forces EOD team dismantled an IED placed inside a container which was found at the bridge on the main road that links the Beletweyne town and the airport, east of Beletweyne town. The telecommunication network was disrupted during the removal process. Two suspects, in connection to the IED incident, were arrested by security forces for further investigation.

Unknown armed assailants, suspected to be al Shabaab, using pistols shot and killed a Jubbbland state assembly member at Somali star in Calanley neighbourhood in Kismayo town. The body of the victim was taken to Kismayo General Hospital. The perpetrators managed to escape from the location of the incident before the arrival of the security forces.

A man and his mother were abducted and subsequently slaughtered by alleged pro Islamic State fighters at Canjeel village (c. 70 km West of Qandala). The perpetrators circulated threat messages to locals and government workers that they would be slaughtered if found involved in spying activities.
Civilians stage peaceful protest against al Shabaab following 14 OCT bombing.

Students and members of Equal Education (EE) picketed outside the East London offices of the Coega Development Corporation (Coega), one of the agencies responsible for building and upgrading schools in the Eastern Cape.
In Pietermaritzburg, pupils allegedly stoned teachers' cars in protest. 18 students were arrested.

Students and members of Equal Education (EE) picketed outside the Port Elizabeth offices of the Coega Development Corporation (Coega), one of the agencies responsible for building and upgrading schools in the Eastern Cape.

notes: SPLA-IO claimed Ugandan warplanes carried out airstrikes on their positions at Waat airstrip, Weideang, Boduot and Walgak in Bieh state as the rebel-appointed governor of Bieh state visited rebel troops. The reason for the clash is unclear.

Report of several consecutive days of demonstrations in Aweil by intellectuals, members of disabled union and other groups against the government's home detention of former army chief General Paul Malong Awan. The protests occurred in the context of the arrival of the national dialogue subcommittee in the town of Aweil.
On 18 October, an SPLA vehicle was attacked by armed men on the road from the town of Raga to Boro Medina in Bahr el Ghazal, resulting in eight SPLA soldiers dead and nine injured.

Unknown gunmen killed two members of the Mahariya tribe and stole their motorcycles, five km north of Kabkabiya, North Darfur. The following day, a group of Mahariya traced the perpetrators to Umm Laota village (9km northwest of Kabkabiya towan), where to Mahariya and two Tama were killed during the ensuing clashes. RSF intervened to separate the parties.

There has been another deadly crackdown on opposition demonstrations in Togo, with official sources reporting four deaths. According to the MFWA correspondent in Togo, an 11 year-old boy, Zomake Jojo, was killed by bullet fired by security forces in LomÃ© on October 18, 2017. Three more people were also killed in Sokode, some 300 km north of LomÃ©.

In accordance with a general strike, a protest march was organized in Bir el Hafey. Protesters ask for development, employment and clarification with regards to what happened with several young people from the region who died in a boat accident with National Marine.

Inhabitants from Regueb went on a general strike and protested physically to ask for compensations for the perished young guys from the region that died in a boat accident with the National Marine the week before.
Ugandan police banned what it termed illegal demonstrations over plans to remove presidential age limits, seen as paving the way for President Yoweri Museveni to serve a sixth term in office.
Two people were taken to hospital after police used teargas and live bullets to dispersed a consultative rally on age limit in Kasubi, Rubaga Division, in Kampala.

source: Associated Press International; The Daily Monitor; Chimp Reports
notes: Police shot dead between one and two people at a political rally. Police blocked hundreds of opposition supporters from entering a stadium in Rukungiri on 18 October. During the standoff, some opposition supporters pelted police with stones.
Students at Solusi University boycotted classes and gathered to protest the introduction of a $90 development levy. The riot police dispersed the protest.

Residents of Fiche violently demonstrate following the killing of two by government forces in Debre Selam. Protests continued into the following day.
Customs officer went on a 48-hours strike: those gathering at Abidjan port were dispersed by police using teargas.

A mob on 17 October disrupted planned training sessions for electoral officials in three stations in Kisumu, Migori and Homa Bay counties. In Kisumu, police intervened at the Awasi Multicultural Christian Centre. Police arrest 10 of them.

A contingent of police officers were sent to Kabunde Social Hall where training for the poll officials for Homa Bay Town Constituency was taking place.Â Police kept at bay angry youths who threatened toÂ attackÂ the officials, calling them traitors.

A mob on 17 October disrupted planned training sessions for electoral officials in Nyanza, Migori. Protesting NASA supporters stormed Simba Hotel, where IEBC officials had gathered for training. Police dispersed them.

A mob on 17 October disrupted planned training sessions for electoral officials in three stations in Kisumu, Migori and Homa Bay counties.Â In Homa Bay, security officers responded to rescue a group of IEBC officers gathered at Sikri School in Kasipul, after youth attacked them.

Hundreds of pro-ODM youth holding anti-IEBCÂ protestsÂ in Kisii County on 17 October were forced to run for safety after anti-riotÂ police lobbed tear gas canisters to disperse them. The youth were protesting the harassment of Woman Representative Janet Ong'era.
In Bondo, more than 250 people who had convened at Sironyo Academy on the outskirts of the town were roughed up by angry youth, forcing them to run for their lives. No injuries reported.
On 17 October, mobs disrupted electoral training sessions in parts of Kakamega County.

In Siaya, training was suspended in four constituencies after rowdy youth attacked the stations where the officers were undergoing their first day of coaching.Â They included Gem, Bondo, Ugunja and Rarieda.Â

Jubilee and Nasa supporters clashed in Laare, Meru County. Youths chanting Jubilee slogans lit bonfires. Their Nasa rivals attempted to push them out, leading to a rock-pelting match. Police officers used teargas to disperse the increasing number of pro-Jubilee youths.

Gunmen attacked a APC governorship aspirant in Erio-Ekiti. The attackers wore police uniforms, though it is not known if they were legitimate officers. No reported injuries.
Library workers protest to demand action to enable the completion of its head office. On the same day, the 'Charly Boy' group protest in Abuja against alleged government graft.
University of Nigeria Teaching Hospital marched round the hospital lamenting the decay in the facility.

Hundreds of Egbokodo Itsekiri indigenes in Warri South Local Government Area of Delta State took to the streets in protest of the continued closure of the United Nations Development Programme, UNDP- funded multi-million naira skills acquisition centre for over two years.

"Pandemonium" in various parts of Ondo state after a forced student immunisation rumour spread. In some instances the parents of students forcibly entered classrooms to take their children, breaking security gates surrounding the school.

Al Shabaab forces attack and overtake a police station in Buulo Folyo following an exchange of gunfire. Causalities not known. The event took place on or before 17/10.

There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated towards the western mountain. PSF continued to patrol on the tarmac road. There were no reports of casualties or arrests.

A suspected IED, planted by an unknown perpetrator, detonated and destroyed a house located at the back of Golis Telecom company in Bossaso. Investigations were reported to be ongoing.

Report of several consecutive days of demonstrations in Aweil by intellectuals, members of disabled union and other groups against the government's home detention of former army chief General Paul Malong Awan. The protests occurred in the context of the arrival of the national dialogue subcommittee in the town of Aweil.

Chaos at the Relief and Rehabilitation Commission food store at the Jondoru area of Juba on the mornings of 16 and 17 October as hundreds of people stormed the warehouse to get rice donated by the Chinese government. Many people were injured.

Subclans of the Rizeigat (Awlad Id, Awlad Zaid and Ereigat) clashed with the Zaghawa on 17 October in Hatam village (25 km south-east of Kulbus town, West Darfur), over the ownership of camels, which resulted in the death of 16 Zaghawa and 11 Rizeigat. The Sudan-Chad joint border forces were deployed to contain the violence.

A group of about 400 women tea sellers held a vigil in front of the headquarters of the Social Responsibility Forum in the Friendship Hall of Khartoum. Police dispersed the vigil by force and arrested several activists. There were no report of clash or injury. The tea sellers were protesting a ban against their work in a number of key sites in Khartoum.

Police forcibly dispersed a sit-in organised by students at the Faculty of Education of the University of Khartoum who were protesting the administrationâs dismissal of three of their colleagues who had earlier called for reform of the university environment. Police forced the students to return to their exam and injured at least four students in the process, while a number of others were arrested.

Unknown gunmen killed two members of the Mahariya tribe and stole their motorcycles, five km north of Kabkabiya. The following day, a group of Mahariya following the trail of the assaillants ended up at Um Delwa village and exchanged fire with the border guards led by Seifu, leaving six dead and three wounded. RSF intervened to separate the parties.

Human rights defenders holding a meeting were raided and detained in Dar es Salaam. They were discussing the governmental ban on drop-in centres aimed at aiding key populations at risk of HIV and the ban on water-based lubricants, an HIV prevention tool. They were accrodingly accused of promoting homosexuality.
Infrastructural workers protested in front of the municipality of the city to protest against non-kept promises from the local government with regards to their socio-economic conditions.
Several teachers who successfully passed an exam to be recruted for superior jobs protested in front of the National Assembly because the government did not recruit them as promised.

On 17 October, Ugandan police fired teargas and rubber bullets at opposition supporters in Kasubi, Rubaga Division, in Kampala protesting plans to remove presidential age limits. Two people were rushed to hospital.
Police in Kitwe arrested 15 jerabos (small scale miners) and broke up a jerabo protest at President Lungu's prayer ceremony.
Workers from 'Trans-Canal Ouest' protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Ain Temouchent.
Private workers in the transport sector protested in order to denounce the advantageous treatment of public transport companies by the government.

Seven young people with knives invaded the CEM MaÃ¢roufi Salah in Sidi El Bashir neighbourhood in Oran, threatening teachers and students. Motives are unknown. No injuries or clashes were reported. The attackers fled soon after police was informed.
Inhabitants from Skikda staged a sit-in in front of the local housing agency to shed light on their bad housing conditions.
Police station in SollÃ©, Loroum Province attacked by heavily armed gunmen.

Police broke doors with axes and metal cutters, were looking for guns, ammunition and explosives. The raid took place after police recovered rifles and bullets at a villa in Malindi he is suspected to own.

On 16 October, three people were injured in clashes between the Luo and the Kuria communities living in Karamu village in Migori County, located at the border of Suna West and Kuria West constituencies. One motorcycle was burnt by armed youths.
In Isiolo Town, Nasa supporters marched peacefully and converged outside Isiolo North Constituency IEBC offices calling for electoral reforms. TheÂ protestÂ was led by Ms Nasibo Sora Abdirahaman.

On 16 October in Migori, shops, offices and hotels were closed as Nasa demonstratorsÂ  took to the streets. Police watched them from a distance and did not  interfere with the demos.
On 16 October in Siaya, business premises were closed as hundreds of residents demonstrated in streets.Â Protesters marched to IEBC offices to present their petition.

On 16 October in Homa Bay, businesses remained closed as protesters blocked main roads in the town, paralysing, transport and other operations. Police watched from a distance as protesters took to the streets.
A two-year was shot in the neck whilst playing in Nyamasaria, Kisumu County on 16 October. It is thought the bullet came from police who were engaging protesters in Lower Manyatta.
NASA protesters engage police. Live bullets allegedly used. No reports of protester violence or injuries.
Protesters clashed with the police in Kisumu's Kondele area on 16 October. A form four student was killed by gunshot in the clashes.

On 16 October, several Nasa leaders led by Siaya Senator James Orengo and former Machakos Senator Johnstone Muthama led their supporters into the Nairobi CBD amid runningÂ battlesÂ with police officers who used teargas to disperse them.
In Mombasa, police dispersed NASA demonstrators who were assembling with an aim of storming the CBD. Police arrested a few protesters, and several others were injured in the process.
On 16 October in Vihiga [westernÂ Kenya], residents stormed streets carrying twigs and placards, demanding IEBC reforms. They called for resignation of IEBC Chief Executive Officer Ezra Chiloba.

Employees, syndicalists and other members from the 'FDT: Democratic Federation of Labour' staged a protest-rally in Rabat to denounce disadvantageous policies that were taken against them by different successive governments.

Six residents of Danare community in Boki local government area were shot by gendarmes from Bodam community during an invasion on the Nigerian territory by Cameroonians. Additionally, 1,000 farmlands were destroyed. The attack is believed to be related to an international border dispute. The victims received treatment at an area hospital.
Suspected communal militia attacks a village in Riyom LGA, and are repelled by an armed group in the village. Causality details are not known.
Pensioners block roads in Benin City over a non-payment issue with their stipends.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State on 16/10. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

An attack at Rotsu village of Irigwe Chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State, has left one person dead and about 30 houses razed. The attack is believed to be related to a series of back-and-forth attacks between Fulanis and indigenes of the area.
70 fishermen fishing in Mauritanian waters with no licence were pursued by Mauritanian Coast Guards untill in the Senegalese waters. One was shot and he's now in the hospital.
16 October â al Shabaab attack the Jubaland base located near Gaduud. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab and government forces clash in Daniga, near Balcad. The fighting started after troops commanded by [General] Abdullahi Ali Anod attacked the village, but met stiff resistance from the al-Shabab side. Causalities not known.

Armed al Shabaab attackers using pistols shot and killed a SNA soldier near Warmaxan in Wanleweyn district. The soldier was travelling on the road between Wanleweyn and Afgoye districts when the elements attacked him. The assailants stole the AK-47 belonging to the soldiers. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Nine mortar rounds were fired by al Shabaab fighters at Dervish base at Af-Urur of Galgala (c. 65 km South West of Bossaso). There were no reports of immediate casualties or arrests. Later on the same day four other rounds were fired by the perpetrators. No causalities.
16 October, afternoon, IVO Baloow, Middle Shabelle â a SNAF convoy is hit by a roadside an al Shabaab IED at Baloow (likely Balcad). Causalities not known.

Arrest:A group of armed Habar Yonis clan members shot at Habar Jeclo camel herders near Erigabo to prevent them from grazing their animals in the area. Erigabo police intervened and arrested the armed men to defuse tension between the two clans.
A government soldier shot and killed a female civilian who was searching for her loved ones in the rubble of the collapsed buildings at the explosion site in Zope junction.
Kulmiye and Wadani supporters, using clubs and sticks, clashed at Lasanod. The reason behind the clash was believed to be rivalry between the two political parties.

Armed al Shabaab elements attacked an SNA checkpoint at Buulo Foolyo area in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. Al Shabaab briefly took control of the checkpoint. There were no reports of fatalities

A large group of Somali citizens gathered at Xaawo Taako statue to protest on the deadly explosion that occurred at KM 5. The demonstrators chanted anti-al Shabaab slogans and encouraged Somali people to unite in solidarity to counter al Shabaab attacks.
Protesters in Embalenhle, Mpumalanga, looted Somalian shops and burned down municipal buildings during an ongoing service delivery protest.

Pupils from Mahlare High School in Mhlaba Cross demonstrated outside Nkowankowa Magistrate Court in support of their fellow learner who accused the doctor of raping her in his rooms last Monday afternoon.

Angry small-scale and nearshore fishers blocked the entrance to the Department of Agriculture, Forestry & Fisheries offices at the Foreshore in Woodstock in protest.

TeargasÂ bombsÂ were thrown on striking daladala operators to disperse them in Tanga City. They were protesting against traffic police fines and bullying. No one was injured.
Violence broke out also in LomÃ©, after the arrest in Sokode of an imam close to the country's main opposition. One dead.

Violence broke out in Togo's second city, Sokode, after the arrest of an imam close to the country's main opposition. Security forces and youths clashed in several parts of the city, with teargas and stone-throwing. Two policemen and a civilian died  in the clashes, 20 people were wouned.
Inhabitants from Souk Lahad protested in front of the seat of the governorate to call for the liberation of several people that have been arrested in riots with the police the week before.

Students of KigeziÂ High SchoolÂ burnt down a dormitory on 16 October. They were protesting the expulsion of two of their colleagues. Police came in and managed to disperse the students with bullets and teargas.

notes: A group of armed men in military uniforms killed 4 Hutu civilians and the 3 soldiers that were escorting them between Bambu and Kisheshe, in Bwito.

At least seven Egyptian soldiers and 24 attackers from the State of Sinai have been killed in a series of assaults on security posts in Karm al Qawadis and al-Ajra. Clashes also reported in the areas of Wifaq & Balaa and the security HQs in Al Arish. 37 soldiers were reportedly wounded.
Two rockets fired from Sinai into Israel.

At least seven Egyptian soldiers and 24 attackers from the State of Sinai have been killed in a series of assaults on security posts in Karm al Qawadis and al-Ajra. Clashes also reported in the areas of Wifaq & Balaa and the security HQs in Al Arish. 37 soldiers were reportedly wounded.

At least seven Egyptian soldiers and 24 attackers from the State of Sinai have been killed in a series of assaults on security posts in Karm al Qawadis and al-Ajra. Clashes also reported in the areas of Wifaq & Balaa and the security HQs in Al Arish. 37 soldiers were reportedly wounded.

In October, tensions escalated Adi-Halo, Debarwa area, as students protesting the lack of accommodation in the area since July began throwing stones at the military guards. The Eritrean opposition radio Medrek reports that the military responded by forcibly moving the students to Naro in the far north for military training.
The government's military operation in Boni Forest meant to flash out suspected al-Shabab militants is set to be extended for an unspecified period in Lamu, Garissa and Tana River counties.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: An IS militant is captured by the LNA in Derna some time in October. The militant was responsible for beheading an LNA volunteer in 2015.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Two brothers from the Al-Abadlah tribe were kidnapped near Tripoli on their way to the capital. Kidnapeprs demand a ransom payment.
Teachers on Tobruk stopped working and staged a protest in front of the local HQs of the education ministry in Tobruk.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Position of Fulani self-defense group attacked in Hombori by presumed GATIA, 2 wounded self-defense. Group targeted was established by former Ganda Izo commander Abderrahmane CissÃ© earlier this year.
Clashes signalled in a campment near Infoukaretane, between unknown gunmen and MSA: preliminary reports says 3 dead in MSA ranks and 2 vehicles seized.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

Six Fulanis are attacked and killed by Irigwe militia at Buji. The attack led to a retaliatory strike against an IDP camp in Nkiedonwhro village the following day. The attack is believed to be based on grazing rights.

Unidentified clan militia attacks Fulani civilians in Kajuru LGA. The date of the attack not known - likely during the month of October, though the attack could have occurred in September. Causalities likely.

Unidentified clan militia attacks Fulani civilians in Mambilla Plateau. The date of the attack not known - likely during the month of October, though the attack could have occurred in September. Causalities likely.

actor2: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
notes: Students at high schools in Brazzaville have been rioting and causing violence. The police responded strongly.

Jubbaland security forces in Dhobley conducted a security operation targeting two local police officers that defected from the police force from Dhobley at Waraq area (c. 90 km South West of Dhobely town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire between security forces and the two missing police officers. One of the targeted soldiers was injured and the other managed to escape. The injured police officer was taken to the AMISOM hospital in Dhobley for treatment. The two police officer was reported missing since 13 October 2017.

Jubbaland forces, on security patrol, clashed with al Shabaab fighters at Farwamo area (c. 04 km North of Bulogudud village). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and a Jubbaland soldier was injured in the attack. Jubbaland forces confiscated two AK47 rifles and small arms fire ammunition from the scene. The injured soldier was taken to Kismayo hospital for treatment.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 15th October, AM, Buurane Village, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: An al Shabaab IED hits a Burundian convey IVO Buurane Village. Casualties have been reported but the extent and number of injuries and fatalities are unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: A reported drone strike has been carried out on a suspected al Shabaab convey at Bariirre and Aawdiinle on 15/10. Resulting causalities not known. The following day the United States announced greater involvement against al Shabaab in Somalia.
15 October, evening â anti-al Shabaab protests are reported in Boondheere.
Anti-al Shabaab protest occurred at the site of the large hotel bombing on 14/10.

Armed men, alleged to be Pro-ISIS militia from Galgala mountain, entered Lasqorey town on foot and stayed in the city but later left. They hoisted the ISIS flag and delivered speeches to residents. They departed voluntarily without any incident. Radio Kulmiye claims al Shabaab was the actor.

Dishishe armed sub-clan militias established an illegal CP at Juurile area (c. 120 km South of Bossaso) where they shot at a vehicle transporting khat and wounded the driver. The assailants escaped and stole three bags of khat.
A man was shot and killed at Goryo village (c. 65 km South West of Hargeisa). SLP arrested the assailant and were reported to be investigating the case.
Al Shabaab killed two IJA soldiers during an attack on Buula Gaduud.
A group of people started a protest by closing down roads and stoning the main municipal building in Embalenhle

Clash between police officers and armed youth in Rumbek town left at least one police officer and one youth dead. The clash started after a police officer shot dead one of the armed youths for refusing to hand over his weapon. Soldiers came in support and chased the youth away. Other sources point to five police officers dead.
Militiamen abducted a displaced man in Tawila locality in North Darfur and took him to Damrat El Gubba.

Three armed herders opened fire on Um Tjona village in Kereinik, West Darfur, seriously wounding three women an burning four houses in the village. The herders had just brought their livestock to graze at the farms near Um Tjona chased the farmers out of the farms.
Two children were reportedly abducted by militia groups at Tagalei in Abyei. They were found unharmed two days later.

A gunman fired live bullets at security officers who came to check his identity in a park in El Fasher and engaged in running battles with the security officers as they pursued him. The gunman fired and attempted to throw a grenade at the officers but the grenade exploded in his hand. The assaillant died and several security officers were injured.
Three suspected local militiamen opened fire on a commercial vehicle in the general area of Banton, eight km south of Abyei town, leading to the death of one woman and injury to two others.
Unidentified gunmen invaded farmers in the outskirts of Kairouan. They injured some farmers with shots who had to be transported to the hospital.

assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: Police officers accused an MDC-T activist of operating a pirate taxi in Chitungwiza. They beat him with baton sticks and kicked him. They then poured boiling water over him.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: ZANU PF supporters attacked an MDC-T ward official and his wife in Chitungwiza. They beat them at the house and then abducted the official. At the councillor's house he was beaten further. The police then detained him for assaulting the councillor.

Inhabitants of Ain Djerbouaie, Baba commune, 16km South of Khenchela blocked the road to garner attention of the governor who was touring the region. Inhabitants are complaining about the lack of development, jobs and water supply.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: CNDD-FDD supporters protested in front of the Belgian embassy in Bujumbura.

notes: A man was injured when he was attacked by an evening patrol in Gatabo.

notes: Imbonerakure wielding clubs held a demonstration in Gitobe.

Soldiers from Musave arrested and beat an ex-FAB. They accused him of insulting the military.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 8 Imbonerakure accused 2 carpenters in Muzinda of causing public violence. They beat them and tried to arrest them, but passers-by intervened.

notes: An UPRONA supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure for refusing to contribute to the construction of the local CNDD-FDD headquarters.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
notes: Former Seleka armed men reportedly killed the Kagoue 2 village chief and a youngster, as reprisal for the death of Seleka leader in Houngo, on October, 13th.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: The militia Elements clashes with the FARDC in the other side of the river Luvua.
Wilayat Sinai releases pic of Humvee destroyed by IED, beside a M60 Patton MBT, a NIMR & army clothing + piece of Humvee hood put on display.
The Egyptian armed forces on Saturday prevented a terrorist attack that was targeting 101 Brig. HQ security check point East of Al-Arish, killing at least two militants.

Arrest:A large number of people were arrested in Jijiga city as they were preparing to war against Oromo residents. According to the report, they came from Shinile, Somali region armed with knives and other weapons with the intention of harming Oromos in the area.
On 14 October, six people were killed in an attack by suspected South Sudanese raiders on a boarding school in Lokichogio.
On 14 October, a student suspected of joining an armed raid that killied six at a school in Kenya was stoned to death by angry locals.
A student suspected of joining in an armed raid that killed six at a school in Kenya's far north Saturday was stoned to death by angry locals and his body burned.

A number of teachers organized a sit-in outside the headquarters of the teachers' union in Sirte to demand their "rights", as did their colleagues in other municipalities, being above all concerned with socio-economic conditions.

A number of activists and youths from Jabal al-Akhdar region organized a demonstration in the eastern city of Al-Bayda last night to emphasize "their support for dialogue, social reconciliation and the return of displaced people inside and outside the country."
In Nsanje, during a political rally, some Democratic Progressive (DPP) youth cadets assaulted Gaka Community Radio reporter.
Two individuals killed in clashes with Barkhane in the area of Tadalok, not far from AbeÃ¯bara. Both individuals killed are from the same family,

An unknown group attacked some villages in Barikin Ladi early on 14/10 and "killed a lot of people." The violence is likely linked to Fulani violence, though it is not known when group was the aggressor.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.
Six dead and five injured in an attack on Taagbe village by unidentified gunmen. The attack is likely related to a series of tit-for-tat attacks between Fulanis and Irigwes.
Military forces "recently" (source dated 14/10) killed 2 fleeing Boko Haram militants in an ambush at Futchinam village in Geidam Local Government Area of Yobe.
Military forces killed Boko Haram 3 insurgents in an ambush in Lingir village on or before 14/10 where they recovered 5 AK-47 rifles, 5 magazines and 11 rounds of 7.62mm (special) ammunition.
Al-Shabaab have taken control of Bariire town in southern Somalia following the withdrawal of Somali troops during the early morning hours.

Two car bombs exploded outside a hotel at a busy junction in Somalia's capital Mogadishu on Saturday, with officials and witnesses fearing many casualties. Initial reports stated at least 20 dead, though that figure was raised to 300+ in the following days, plus 429 wounded. Following a investigation the death toll was revised higher to 512.
An al Shabaab VBIED was stopped at a security checkpoint and the driver was arrested, it has yet to be ascertained why the VBIED detonated following the arrest. Four SNAF killed.

About an hour following the hotel attack in Hodan, a second VBIED exploded at Danwadagta neighbourhood near the Somalia airline residential building and NISA CP 4 in Wadajir district. The driver was apprehended by NISA personnel and was being taken for questioning. The VBIED detonated. There were no reports of casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Residents of Garbaharrey town held a peaceful demonstration against regional states presidents who held a meeting Kismayo during that week. The demonstration was conducted peacefully with no report of violence. The demo may have occurred the previous day.

Checkpoint established: Dishishe armed sub-clan militias established an illegal CP in Laasadaco area (c. 110 km South of Bossaso) where they shot at a vehicle transporting khat. There were no reports of casualties or arrests.

SNA soldiers sexually assaulted an 11-year-old at Bulo-Habey area of Hawtaka neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne. The victim was taken to Beletweyne main hospital for further treatment. Security forces arrested the perpetrators for further investigation.

assoc_actor_2: Reer-Hassan Sub-Clan Group (Somalia); Jejele Clan Group (Somalia)
notes: A civilian man hailing from Reer AwHassan clan was shot and killed and another hailing from Jajeele clan was injured by SNA soldiers at Hilaac area in Hawlwadag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne town. The victims were taken to a private hospital in Hawlwadag neighbourhood. The motive behind the attack was unknown. It was suggested that the soldier panicked after people gathered around him and opened fire.
Government forces withdraw from Bariire. It is believed this movement is strategic.
St George's Park in Port Elizabeth was ringed by hundreds of protesters who took part in an anti-slavery #WalkForFreedom.
Unknown assaillants fired on a policeman on his way to work in Kabkabiya locality in North Darfur, leaving him severely injured and stealing his weapon.

An RSF member killed a mini-bus driver in Nyala in unclear circumstances. Drivers of mini-buses in public transport launched a strike after the incident to protest the killing of the driver and demand the arrest of the perptrator.

Inhabitants of Ben Guardane, staged a sit-in in front of the local governmental representation to protest over the death of 4 young teenagers from the region in an accident between two boats earlier this week.
When police attempted to prevent a traditional burial practice, the mourners turned on the police officers and stoned and burned down the Mufumbwe police station.
Truck drivers blocked off the border post at Beitbridge to protest new government regulations

assoc_actor_1: FSP: Front for the Patriotic Awakening
notes: Hundreds of protesters gathered to demonstrate against President Talon's regime.
Two gunmen aboard a motorbike shot dead a man in Djibo. The individual assassinated was a local activist, in particular against terrorism and Ansaroul Islam

notes: Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Kibuye. He was accused of destroying produce

notes: A CNDD-FDD supporter beat an FNL Rwasa supporter who had blamed the CNDD-FDD for the violence in Burundi.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Protesters took to the streets in Goma, to protest against the raising of school fees, but the protest was interrupted. In breaking the protest, the police attacked protesters, severely injuring 2 of them, and hurting others. The police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: An unidentified group of armed men attacked the manager of the money transfer agency 'La Colombe' and his motocyclist. The manager, who was carrying a bag with money, died.
The Third Field Army law enforcement forces in cooperation with the Air Force managed to destroy a terrorist hotbed in Central Sinai, Military Spokesman Tamer el Refai said on Friday.

Egyptian officials say an attack on al-Gaz checkpoint south of el-Arish led to the death of six soldiers and another four people were wounded. The assailaints fled and three of them were killed in a following exchange of fire.
Anti-government protests reported in several towns in Oromia.
Anti-government protests reported in Bule Hora.
Anti-government protests reported in Gimbi.

Protests in Wollega continue for a third day. Protesters blocked the Moyale-Addis road.
Oromo young men (Qerroo) burnt down one bajaj (3 wheeled vehicle) in Jijga owned by a Somali woman because she has been sending Chat to Somali region.

On 13 October, 20 people were admitted to hospital during running battles between NASA protesters and the police in Kisumu.  Four people had gunshot wounds including one man in a critical condition who had been shot in the neck.
On 13 October, several nursery school children were hospitalised after police fired tear gas into the Mt Carmel Academy in the Nyalenda slum.
On 13 October, police shot at protesters who had coverged to march in Homa Bay.
On 13 October, NASA supporters held a peaceful demonstration in Kakamega.
On 13 October, police shot at protesters who had coverged to march in Siaya.

On 13 October, a 75 year old woman was shot on the right shoulder by the police as they dispersed a crowd of NASA supporter in Migori. The police say they opened fire after protesters destroyed their vehicle.
On 13 October, police dispersed a group of NASA supporters who had converged to protest in Mombasa. There were reports of looting and robbery during the protests.
On 13 October, police used teargas to disperse students who barricaded roads to protest the death of a student killed by a car. They demanded justice and speed bumps.
NASA rioters in Kondele throw stones at police stations resulting in injuries.

source: Agence France Presse; Daily Nation; The Standard
notes: On 13 October, three people were shot dead when people fired live shots to disperse NASA protesters. The police shot after the protesters tried to break into the police station. The Siaya Senator claimed the police shot dead the three unarmed men at close range completely without justification.
A group of some 50 or more demonstrators took to the streets of Sabratha after Friday prayers, demanding the replacement of the mayor, Hassen Dhawadi, and the entire municipal council.
A police officer was killed during clashes with Dahalo militia. 12 Dahalo were injured in the area of Betroka.

actor1: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) UIR: Rapid Intervention Unit
notes: The Rapid Intervention Unit of the Mozambican police was attacked in the night of Thursday, 12, until Friday, 13, by a group of unidentified armed men (with their heads covered, shouting intervention slogans). They kill 4 policemen in total. The attack took place in the route Mocimboa da Praia-Palma, close to the river Chiukulula. 4 policemen remain missing and it is suspected they were captured. Reports on total casualties vary between 11 and 12

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.
Residents of Abak Local Government Area of Akwa Ibom State have embarked on a peaceful demonstration, calling on the Federal Government to come to their aid in fixing an area road.

assoc_actor_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
notes: One person was reportedly shot in Ado Ekiti as commercial drivers under the platform of National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW) staged a violent protest over alleged detention of a member of the union. It took over 100 policemen to bring the situation under control. It is not clear if the deceased was a protester, police or bystander.
Residents of Oshodi-Isolo LGA protest high electricity bills.

Four Britons are kidnapped by unidentified militants at Enukoroma community. The victims were said to have been kidnapped in the community to "protest the heavy presence of soldiers drafted from 222 Battalion for the Operation Crocodile Smiles II."

Military forces rescued a 6 year-old boy from Boko Haram captivity in Bama Local Government Area of Borno on 13/10. The troops also killed three Boko Haram insurgents in gun duel at various insurgentsâ enclaves in the area.
Boko Haram raids a military location at Marte, killing one soldier and injuring nine others. The attackers carried away weapons.

actor1: NDLEA: National Drug Law Enforcement Agency
notes: Three members of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) are shot and killed by unidentified gunmen in Okene.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Al-Shabab has seized a ENDF military truck carrying supplies at Budada. No details of causalities.
Gunmen opened fire on a wedding car injuring three.

Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a government troop position at Ex-Daallo neighbourhood in Hodan district. The government forces shot at general directions of the attack. There were no reports of fatalities.

Security forces exchanged gunfire with three assailants who established an illegal CP at Laasadawaco (c. 110 km South of Bossaso). One assailant and a police officer were killed and two other assailants were wounded. The perpetrators were not identified.

New Hargeisa residents destroyed irons sheets and other building material intended to build a business centre on the grounds of RIIS Intermediate Public-School. This is the second time that residents in New Hargeisa opposed the privatisation of RIIS Intermediate public school.
13 October â  local reporting suggest the Chairman of the Puntland Parliament may have survived an assassination attempt. Perpetrators not known.

An armed youth group using clubs, believed to be supporters for Wadaani party, assaulted a Kulmiye supporter near Kenya neighbourhood in Buroa. SLP intervened and arrested the perpetrators. The victim was transferred to Burao Hospital.

Puntland forces launched an offensive against al Shabaab positions in the al Madow mountain in retaliation for the 09 October Bossaso south MECP attack. Attack targeting group of militants behind the MECP attack. Casualties unknown.
Civilians clash with al Shabaab, possibly over collection of taxes. Casualties unknown.
Al Shabaab executed Guhad Elmi (25), alleged killer of Barre Ibrahim (19).
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed and hijacked a truck transporting 11 tons of food for a UN entity. 2 passengers kidnapped. Truck headed east towards al Shabaab-controlled areas.
Arrests: Puntland forces arrest politicians and critics of Puntland's support to Saudi Arabia and the UAE.

assoc_actor_1: SADTU: South African Democratic Teachers Union
notes: Thousands of Sadtu members protested in the Durban central business district against the state of affairs in education in the province.
A supermarket was looted and a building torched in Tigane outside Klerksdorp, North West during protest action.
Gunmen opened fire on villages around Amiet common market in Abyei, leaving at least two people killed and six others injured. Local officials blamed pro-government militias for the attack.

Rioters threw stones on an ambulance in Sfax and injured a doctor and a nurse. This event follows several events in Tunisia last week, during which hospitals were vandalized and medical personel attacked.
Hoima residents have lynched a suspected robber.
Clashes between bus company's former workers (on strike) and current workers. One wounded.
Clashes are reported in Zemio between Abs and Fulani militias, supported by foreign mecenaries. Provisional casualities tolls: several dead and wounded.

A Coptic priest was killed and another wounded on Thursday. The priest was stabbed by a man in Cairoâs northeastern suburb of ElâMarg. A young unemployed man blocked the way in front of the priestâs vehicle and asked him to get out. He then hit the priestâs head with cleaver and ran away. It is believed that the perpetrator is a religious extremist. He has been arrested.
8 ISIS militants killed, 6 severely wounded & 4 pickups seized following ambush by Tarabin tribesmen near Gora Airport. Also an unknown number killed in the ranks of the Tarabin.
Anti-government protests occur in Tulu Bolo, Sululta, Gimbi, Qelem and Agarfa on 11/10 and 12/10. No reported incidents.

Protests in Wollega continue for a second day. Protesters blocked the Moyale-Addis road.

Oromo People in Borana areas blocked a road to prevent Ethiopian federal troops from delivering supplies to Somali Liyu police. Federal forces reportedly opened fire, killing five and wounding tens more. The fatality count was later updated to 6.
Protests in Shashamane continue. No incidents reported.

Ethiopian government forces killed four Oromia people and wounded 18 others in the town of Soda. The forces were transporting weapons to Liyu police and opened fire after residents demanded that they stop transporting weapons.
The teachers' union in the municipality of Sabha organized a protest in Sabha to emphasize the support and support of the General Union for Teachers.
The teachers' union in the municipality of Sabha and the municipality of Wadi al-Buanyis organized a protest to emphasize the support and support of the General Union for Teachers.
Five students were injured as students clashes at a university in Ambondrona during student protests.
Several gunshots were heard by locals close to Eastern checkpoint.
Thousands of protesters march the streets of Mocimboa da Praia to protest against the violence experienced in the previous week.
