Looting: Looting: The weekly market in Kolmane, TillabÃ©ri Region attacked and looted by a group of gunmen aboard motorbikes

Five people (plus the bomber) were killed in a suicide bomb attack when Boko Haram raided Belbelu village, near Kayamla, in the Konduga area of Borno state, at about 10:00 am (0900 GMT). The bomber was accompanied by other gunmen when fired wildly upon their attack of the village.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.
Residents of Chika, Aleyita, Pyakasa and Ketti protest a high electricity tariff on the Airport Road Abuja.

On 10 October, supporters of the opposition Sierra Leone Peopleâs Party (SLPP) attacked the headquarters of the ruling All Peopleâs Congress (APC) in Freetown. Some APC officials and supporters who were in their headquarters were trapped inside there for over an hour as SLPP supporters pelted it with stones, and bottles.

12 OCT: AM, IVO Xudur/Abal, Bakool â forces loyal to former militant leader Sheikh Mukhar Ali Robow âAbu Mansoorâ attack al Shabaab positions near Abal and south of Xudur. Three al Shabaab fighters are killed. The actors clashed at Seynilow the previous day.

Unconfirmed local reports claim al Shabaab have attacked the Somali National Army
(SNA) position at Bariire. A similar attack occurred the previous day. Causalities not known.
Somalia's defence minister and army chief have both resigned, reasons unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters executed a militiaman from Hawadle clan at Buq Aqable village (c. 90 km West of Beletweyne town) who shot and killed his fellow clanmate on 22 September 2017 at Hoolmooge village. The details of the original crime are not known - - may have been an internal or family dispute. Al Shabaab intervened and arrested the perpetrator. An al Shabaab court sentenced the perpetrator to death after both clans agreed to execute the perpetrator.

NISA and Mogadishu stabilisation mission forces clashed at Xoosh village in Dharkenley district. There was an exchange of gunfire. Mogadishu stabilisation forces were conducting a security operation in the area while NISA troops were escorting a wedding convoy which resulted in the dispute. One civilian was killed and two soldiers were wounded in the clash.
Mfuleni parents took to the streets to demand that the Western Cape Department of Education build a permanent school at Bardale Primary School in Mfuleni

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition-Deng Gai: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition (Deng Gai Faction)
notes: Arrest:FVP Deng Gai claimed some 750 rebels defected from the rebel SPLM-IO led by Machar and joined his faction in Makur, South west Gok State.

Angry residents gathered at El Jiraif neighbourhood in Khartoum as police had come demolish brick factories and forced them to withdraw. No report of clash. The residents reject the sale of the land to investors and claim ownership of the land for themselves.
A group of ten militiamen opened fire in the market in Kutum, leaving six people wounded. This followed an altercation between a merchant and one of the militiamen.
The residents of Bir Ali Ben Khalifa protested and blocked a road to protest over a ship accident earlier the week, in which relatives died.

Residents in Kebili burned tires to block crossroads in the city to protest against the death of 4 young people from the region. The young inhabitants died in an accident between two ships earlier this week.

Rioters in Souk Lahad set the seat of the local government on fire before walking to the security post and clashing there with security forces. The riots took place because death of four young people from the region, when a boat of clandestine migrants collided with a ship from the Tunisian Navy. Noone was injured.

Clashes between security officers from Uganda People's Defence Forces and police: officials from Internal Security Organisation (ISO) blocked police from arresting a former girlfriend of killed Assistant Inspector General of Police leading to the clash.
Students burned down a dormitory block in Standard College, Ntungamo.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: There were skirmishes between vendors and police officers in Harare in the latest operation to clear the city of vendors. 79 people were arrested. Many of the vendors claim to be ZANU PF supporters.
Students in Mascara staged a sit-in at the entrance of Mustapha Stambouli university to denounce insufficient pedagogical services by the university.
The retirees of "Gengaz", affiliated to the National Company for Electricity and Gas, protested in Algiers because of the delay in paying a supplementary grant, promised to retirement workers.

actor2: Military Forces of Algeria (1999-) Border Guards
notes: Over 40 Tunisian fishing boats have entered Algeria's territorial waters and carried out a "symbolic protest" over the detention of their colleague in the neighbouring country The boats, with around 120 fishermen on board, staged the protest to demand the immediate release of their colleague. The fisherman were arrested by the Algerian navy.
Inhabitants from Chetma blocked roads with stones and burning tires to protest against the decreasing supply of tap water in the city.
University teachers staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the local government in Oran to demand the swift completion of housing units that were promised to them some years ago.
Hundreds of teachers organised a sit-in to protest the delay of bonus payments.
Civil society protesters were dispersed by police: they were protesting against the release of general BassolÃ©
Clashes between armed groups: 11 dead.
Armed men attacked Pengue village (7km from Mobaye). 2 dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: The FARDC recover the city of Mukeba, in Fizi, from the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba, pushing the militiamen to the woods. One of the soldiers was captured by the militia.
5 people were killed by the Mayi Mayi militia of NDC/Renove in the village of Kabirangiriro, in the Kihondo group, in Rutshuru. The attack targetted the Mayi Mayi Nyatura and the perpetrators died.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: The FRPI clashed with MONUSCO in Tshanda, 10 km away from Geti, injuring according do one source 3 blue helmets, and according to the UN only 2. 2 civilians were also hurt during the clash, which lasted 15 hours.
AQ-linked Jamaat Jund al-Islam makes comeback by claiming ambush against an ISIS unit on October 11, killing four militants and acknowledging two dead in its own ranks.

Detonate/Dismantle:Egypt has decided to extend the nationwide state of emergency for another three months starting from Friday over security challenges, according to a presidential decree published in the official gazette on Thursday. President Sisi first imposed a three-month nationwide state of emergency in April, following a twin bombings at two churches in northern provinces of Gharbiya and Alexandria that killed at least 47 and wounded over 120.

Protests reported in Ambo after rumours spread that a mineral water factory was to move to another town. The initial protest led to a wider anti-government protest. Date unknown; reported by the source in conjunction with a series of anti-government protests which occurred on 11/10.

Three people were killed and three others injured in anti-government protests in Boke. It is not clear if the protesters engaged with a second actor. There were several anti-government protests throughout the region; more than 30 people were also confirmed to have been injured in various places, exact locations unknown.

Between five and six are dead in anti-government protests is Shashamane, Oromia. ESAT later reported 8 deaths. There were several anti-government protests throughout the region; more than 30 people were also confirmed to have been injured in various places, exact locations unknown.

Nine people were killed in clashes between the Afaris and security forces of the Tigray region in an area called Danti in Megalle district on the border between the two regions. Six people were killed and nine others wounded on the Tigray side while three were killed and three others injured on the Afari side. The fighting was sparked when an Afari father retaliated the killing of his two children by the Tigray side. The Afaris also accused that the Somali Special Police have raided a village in Aafar injuring three people and robbing livestock. Two deaths were reported in the second incident.
Anti-government protest in Wollega for the release of political prisoners.
Anti-government protests occur in Tulu Bolo, Sululta, Gimbi, Qelem and Agarfa on 11/10 and 12/10. No reported incidents.
Anti-government protests occur in Tulu Bolo, Sululta, Gimbi, Qelem and Agarfa on 11/10 and 12/10. No reported incidents.
Anti-government protests occur in Tulu Bolo, Sululta, Gimbi, Qelem and Agarfa on 11/10 and 12/10. No reported incidents.
Anti-government protests occur in Tulu Bolo, Sululta, Gimbi, Qelem and Agarfa on 11/10 and 12/10. No reported incidents.
Anti-government protests occur in Tulu Bolo, Sululta, Gimbi, Qelem and Agarfa on 11/10 and 12/10. No reported incidents.
Somali Special Police (Liyu) raided a village in Aafar injuring three people and robbing livestock. Two deaths reported.
Tigray militia attack and kill two Afari children in Danti in Megalle district. The attack led to a general clash in the area.

Demonstrations started peacefully but turned chaotic in Homa Bay town. The rioters snatched a firearm from a police officer and threw it in a shed which they set ablaze. The mobs also threw stones at Homa Bay police station.
Demonstrators clash with police in Siaya, the clash results in gunshot wounds.
On 11 October, Kisumu Governor joined NASA anti-IEBC demonstrations in Kisumu. NASA supporters engaged in running battles with police.
On 11 October, one person was injured as police fired tear gas at more than 1000 NASA supporters marching through Nairobi. Reports indicate demonstrators damaged cars.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Two high-ranking militants, Al Noufli and Ibraik al-Misriya, from the Ajdabiya Revolutionaries Shura Council have been caught by Misratan security forces after a shootout with the group at a farm in Al-Saket near Misrata in which one person was killed and several others injured on both sides. The group from Ajdabiya surrendered after a battle. Another person died some days later of his wounds.

Hundreds of protesters staged a protest rally outside the central bank of the city of Sirte to demand the renovation of the bank's building, which was badly damaged during the liberation of the city. They are furthermore demanding the transfer of the bank from its current place to the another place at the University of Sirte and denouncing irregularities in the call for bids to renovate the bank.
FAMA killed 4 militants who previously had executed an alleged informer in BoudjiguirÃ©, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region

Strike:Senator Mohammed Ould Ghada started a hunger strike in protest of his ill-treatment by authorities that forced him to attend a trial. He is being charged with corruption and destabilizing the country. Local media reported in the beginning of August this year that the authorities had prevented Ould Ghada from travelling abroad to get treatment for abdominal injuries he said he had sustained when police beat him during a protest against controversial constitutional changes. The proposed constitutional amendments were passed by 85 percent of voters in the 5 August referendum. They included abolishing the Senate and changes to the flag and national anthem.

Detonate/Dismantle:Four Boko Haram suicide bombers are dead following a failed attempt on Umarri. At least one of the bombers targeted a mosque. No other injuries were reported. The source notes the bombers were teen-aged girls.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

A member of the People's Democratic Party (PDP) from Ogwashi-Uku community, Mr. Emeka Chimokwu, who was recently kidnapped, has been found dead. The deceased's decomposing body was discovered in a thick forest at Idumuje-Uno in Aniocha North Council Area of the state. The victim was kidnapped "last week," source dated 19/10.
Detonate/Dismantle:Three Boko Haram suicide bombers die in a failed attack on Dolori Hospital. No other causalities.
A women's group protest insecurity in the area, particularly in regard to herdsman attacks.
On 11 October, SLPP supporters stabbed a journalist after forcing news reporters to leave parliament

Al Shabaab attacked a government force checkpoint at Mukayga area in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least one government soldier was killed in the attack.

Al Shabaab attacked an SNA checkpoint at Basra area under Balcad district. At least three government soldiers were killed and two others were injured. Al Shabaab claims six government soldier dead. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab stated that they took vehicles and weapons from SNA. According to a secondary source the attack may have occurred the previous day.

Al Shabaab conducted a hit and run attack against SNA troops at Bariire town in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of causalities.

Al Shabaab fighters and militias loyal to Muktar Robow engaged in a protracted armed clash at Seynilow village (c. 31 KM South of Xudur town). Three al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attack. Militias loyal to Muktar in Roobow destroyed and burnt the small al Shabaab base at Seynilow village. No casualty was reported from the other sides.

South-West State forces attacked al Shabaab fighters collecting taxation at War-Makinay village (c. 50 km West of Wajid). There was an exchange of small gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and another was injured in the attack. ISWA forces confiscated a rifle and small arms fire ammunition from the scene.

Two government soldiers exchanged gunfire for unknown reasons at Xawadley village (c. 24 KM North East of Balcad district). Stray bullets hit a civilian who sustained injuries. The victim later succumbed to her wounds on the way to hospital. The perpetrator was not apprehended by security forces

Detonate/Dismantle:11th October, AM, Dur Dur, Belet Weyne, Hiiraan: Reports claim that at least seven al Shabaab militants were killed when a VBIED prematurely detonated. The intended target of the explosive is not known.

A man hailing from Tumaalo clan was shot and killed by an armed man hailing from Saâad clan in South Galkayo. It was believed that the killing was in connection to previous clan feuds. The perpetrator was arrested by Galmudug police.

After a boy was shot and killed, community members took to the streets again to barricade Lichtenburg's main road while they waited for the mayor to address them. Burning tyres, rocks and tree branches lay on Dr Nelson Mandela-Rylaan in Lichtenburg, North West.
The Democratic Alliance held a silent protest at the AB Xuma Primary School in Orlando East.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: On 28 September, SPLA launched an offensives on SPLA-IO in Atar, Panyikang county. In retaliation, SPLA-IO reportedly shelled SPLA positions in the Pagak area on 3, 9 and 11 October.

Surrender/Defect:A force of 10,000 RSF militiamen was deployed to Kabkabiya district to enhance security and stability in the state, and to implement the second phase of the arms collection process starting this month. A week later, another 2,500 RSF forces were deployed to El Fasher to assist with arms collection and vehicle control. The deadline for the voluntary collection of weapons is 19 October; force will be used after this deadline to collect the remaining illegal arms in circulation. Several groups have rejected the process. The RAC denounced the disarmament process in Darfur as targeting Sheikh Musa Hilal and his tribe.

The parents of pupils enrolled in secondary schools in the town of AÃ¯n Drahem demonstrated against schedules that do not take into consideration the distances and commuting time and difficult weather conditions of the region.

The residents of Bir Ali Ben Khalifa blocked several roads. School classes were also suspended. They want to know what exactly happened in the collision between a boat of migrants and a Tunisian navy ship, where 4 young guys from the region died.

assoc_actor_1: UTII: Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers
notes: Taxi drivers who did not want to strike clashed with Taxi drivers from the Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers, not recognized by General Syndicate UTICA, who striked and protested in the capital Tunis. One taxi-driver tried to immolate himself but other taxi drivers stopped him. Demonstrations came after authorities failed to respond to drivers' demands including approval of the tariff increase and a review of their insurance system.

Students who passed the exam to obtain a professional master and then become professor went to the Ministry of Education and were met by Police Forces with excessive force. Several protesters were injured.

Transport workers from Draa-Ben-Khedda region blocked the central crossroads in Draa Ben Khadda with buses to demonstrate against clandestine transport workers who are not being prosecuted by authorities.
Relizane. Inhabitants of a "social housing city" protested to demand a better living environment and infrastructure.
Six beneficiaries from social housing in Sidi Ali, Mostaganem, protested on a terasse to invoke the provision of their promised housing units. They also threatened to immolate themself.

Young inhabitants of Sidi Bakhti attacked Sonelgaz-company and ransacked machinery and equipment, burned a truck and attacked the electrical transformer that supplies the town. Rioters wanted to attack workers of the company as well but were stopped by gendarmerie. Rioters were angry because a truck from the company unloaded sand in front of the village's coffeehouse.

Parents from students in Tiferdoud closed the primary school to protest against the management of the school. Students and parental representatives stayed away from school to not engage in any form of dialogue. Police Forces were present in order to guarantee that no riots take place but no interaction between protesters and police took place.
BantÃ© public agents went on strike and set up a demonstration to protest bad economic conditions and mismanagement.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a man in Kagege, who they accused of burning charcoal.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat the traders in the Ngoma market. They accused the traders of disrupting security by keeping their stalls open late.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: In Rukiga, 6 Imbonerakure tied up a woman and her 4 children and beat them for some hours because one of the children was accused of stealing bananas.

About 20 Muslims have reportedly been killed in the town of Kembe, in the southeastern Central African Republic, following an attack by a self-defence group. "The attack took place on the morning of Tuesday 10 October in this small town situated between Alindao, under the control of UPC's Ali Darass, and Bangassou, in the hands of self-defence militias since May, " the report said, adding that the "militiamen entered the town and launched an attack against Muslims who went to seek refuge in the mosque".
Clashes between armed groups were reported in Kembe. Toll unavailable.

At least 9 people were killed in the villages of Butsiri and Mirangi, in Kanyabayonga. The killings were attributed to the Mayi Mayi Mazembe. Several Hutu villagers have left the Bwito chiefdom due to the insecure climate.

A soldier was killed on Tuesday while foiling an attack on a checkpoint guarding a Cement factory in central Sinai. The force guarding the checkpoint reportedly warned the car and its driver who were suspected to belong to the militant group Sinai Province. Afterwards, the force fired at the car causing an explosion which lead to the killing of the solider and the attacker.

Police forces broke up a demonstration of postgradute students, who protested against a prime ministerial decree that concerns employment. The protest took place outside of the Cabinet headquarters on Qasr al-Aini street. Police forces broke up the protest, after which, protesters then announced a sit-in. âWe are starting a sit-in, we are here not leaving,â they chanted.
Gunmen opened fire on three policemen who responded in Masaed, W El-Arish. No casualties reported.
On 10 October, gunmen killed two female employees of a university in Ukunda, in a suspected extremist attack.
On 10 October, more than 10 police officers exchanged fire with suspected al-Shabab militants after nearly hitting an IED at Mambore-Mkokoni area .
On 10 October, hundreds of  women from various women and youth groups of Liberia took to the streets of Monrovia in protest of the rape amendment bill recently by the Senate.
On 10 October, voters bocked roads to protest their names missing on the voters roll in Bong. Police restored calm.

actor1: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
notes: The commander of a brigade from Zultan was reported killed in Al-Jmail when he and his colleagues were attacked by a local militia allegedly allied to Sabrathaâs defeated Amu Brigade. They were shot while travelling through the town. The commander died instantly; three others were wounded, one seriously, and were taken to Sabratha hospital.
Police in Limbe have arrested 21 people suspected of burning a South African pastorâs car after accusing him of being a blood sucker.
Barkhane hit Abdollahi Ag Ess's vehicle, who died, in Tifilalen.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Malian army post attacked in Labbezanga, 1 dead & 6 wounded (2 critical), 1 vehicle + arms seized.  JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.

notes: Police forces in Mozambique arrest 52 people after the attacks in the last week in Mocimboa da Praia. Authorities have dismissed links of linkage to Somalia's Al-Shabab or Nigeria's Boko Haram. Another 75 people were arrested a month later, on 1 November.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

The rioters threw stones at police. One death reported. The protest began the previous day.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at Yamteke village in Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno, kill 15. At least one soldier reported dead.
10 October, evening â grenade attack targets SNAF checkpoint, IVO ex-control Afgooye, Daynile. Three soldiers were injured in the attack. Perpetrators not named by the source.
Security forces of Jubbaland Regional State on 10/10 carried out an operation against al Shabaab near the town of Kamsuma, which lies about 90km north of Kismayo. At least three fatalities.
Early AM, IVO Lanta Buuro, Lower Shabelle â security forces kill four al Shabaab militants responsible for an earlier assassination attempt of two clan elders near Mogadishu.

AM, Bariire, Lower Shabelle â al Shabaab fire mortar rounds towards FOB Bariire as a SNAF commander visited the base. Casualties of the attack not known. A secondary source claims the attack took place on 09/11.

Over hundreds of IDPs staged a peaceful demonstration in Ainabo in protest of "unfair distribution of food aid provided by the Somaliland government and Aid organizations to IDPs" in town. The protestors accused the mayor and the other local councillors of unequally distributing the aid to the IDPs. The protestors marched through streets in Ainabo chanting against authority officials.

Two unidentified assailants attempted to assassinate an ambulance driver of Bossaso General Hospital in Raf and Raho area. The assailants were intercepted by police patrol but escaped. There were no reports of casualties.

10 Oct. 17, 01:00 EAT, Ceelasha Biyaha, Daynile â Al Shabaab gunmen stopped a vehicle transporting two clan elders (not identified) in Ceelasha Biyaha. It was believed to be an attempted carjacking. The gunmen opened fire when the vehicle failed to stop, injuring one of the passengers. The assailants escaped. Other sources report the two elders and a third person were killed in the attack. The perpetrators were later killed by security forces.
10 October, evening â al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a former Southwest Electoral Delegate, Sar Kuusta, Daynile.
10 October, 18:00EAT â unidentified gunmen assassinated a civilian, Weydow neighbourhood, Dharkenley.
Green-on-green fighting reported in Garowe. No causalities.
Al Shabaab ambushed a Jubaland convoy near Gobweyn. One IJA killed three injured.
Security measure: PSF forces launch security sweep in Majiyahan area. Four al Shabaab captured, including a high-profile leader (not named).

notes: ENDF convoy hit by roadside IED. Casualties unknown.
A group of residents from the Blydeville community in Lichtenburg torched a truck on the R503 Lichtenburg-Coligny Road.
After a group of protesters took to the streets burning tyres and torching a truck, a unknown man shot at the crowd and killed a boy.
A police officer was hospitalised and five others were injured as an angry mob attack police officers in Vanderbijlpark.

The parents of pupils enrolled in secondary schools in the town of AÃ¯n Drahem demonstrated against schedules that do not take into consideration the distances and commuting time and difficult weather conditions of the region.
Residents of Djerba organized a demonstration in front of the delegation of Homet Souk denouncing the pollution of tap water.
Relatives of the victims from a collision between a Navy-ship and a ship carrying illegal immigrants, protested today, in front of the Kerkenah maritime barracks (governorate of Sfax).
More than 400 construction workers protested today in front of the seat of the local government to demand the payment of their salaries.

On 10 Octoer, DP and NRM supporters clashed over the presidential term limit in Lwengo.
PROPERTY DESTRUCTION: Municipal authorities destroyed 700 houses in Harare South.

Rail traffic witnessed delays as train drivers entered a sudden protest denouncing the company's administration's delay in implementing its agreement with the National Federation of Railway Workers. Demands include an increase in salaries.

Workers from Trans-Canal Ouest protested in front of the seat of the local district in Chaabat el Laham. Workers are concerned with the future of the company and the board of directors and their future salaries.

Parents from students in Sadaa, Sidi Okba blocked roads between El Haouche and Sidi Okba with branches and stones to protest against insufficient public transport for their children to commute to school.

notes: The head of the SNR in Muramvya beat a man who questioned the arrest of a motorcyclist who had been accused of enlisting youth to travel to Rwanda and join a rebellion.

2 civilians killed  in Ldaoutsaf in an attack by Boko Haram

MONUSCO immediately deployed forces with attack helicopters in order to secure the area. One report mentions that 10 people were killed and that at least 22 are missing. 12 other soldiers were hurt.
Egypt's military has bulldozed at least 140 homes and more than 200 acres along the Gaza Strip border, expanding a buffer zone in an effort to cut off the flow of weapons and militants.
In West Hararge, Guraawa woreda, Dira town, People demonstrated to oppose the jailing of various Oromo political figures. Note: Girawa woreda is in East Hararge Zone.

Demonstrations for the release of political prisoners were held in Fadis, east Hararge zone. According to opposition media, a young man by the name of Jamal Kile was killed by Ethiopian military forces during the demonstration.
Youngsters took the street to protest the infrastructural shortcomings on the Kankan - Kerouane axis.
On 09 October, NASA held anti-IEBC demonstrations in Homa Bay. Businesses were shut as protesters blocked roads, lit fires and marched on the streets.
On 09 October, NASA held anti-IEBC demonstrations in Kakamega.
On 09 October, police used tear gas to disperse NASA protesters in Machakos.
On 09 October, a small group of NASA supporters protest in Mombasa.
On 09 October, three people were wounded during NASA demonstrations in Nairobi. A man in a car shot one person and injured tow other protesters before driving away.
On 09 October, police used tear gas to disperse NASA protesters in Kisumu. The police also injured journalists.
On 09 October, five militants were kiled by the Kenyan Defence Force during a raid in Boni Forest. Others escaped with injuries.
NASA protesters light fires in Makindu and are dispersed by police.
In Migori, NASA demonstrators throw stones at police.
Police disperse anti-IEBC protests in Saiya. No report of violence from demonstrators.
In Lamu, hundreds of protesters at the Milano area in Lamu town marched to the IEBC offices declaring 'Chiloba must go'
In Vihiga, MPs Alfred Agoi (Sabatia) and Ernest Kagesi (Vihiga) led protests. They asked voters not to take part in the October 26 poll if reforms demanded by Nasa are not effected
More than 200 anti-IEBC demonstrators converged at a petrol station on the turn-off to Voi town and marched peacefully to the Scripture Mission Centre
Five Kisumu journalists were harassed, beaten and injured by police while covering the anti-IEBC demos Monday.

Local municipal council and HoR employees blocked access to the parliament in Tobruk through protesting, demanding payment of delayed salaries. On another note, angry citizens threw bags of garbage and rubbish in front of the Municipal Council to protest against the non-functioning waste-system, after the closure of the garbage dump.
Militants executed an alleged informer in BoudjiguirÃ©, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region

Kaduna police officers protest non-payment of salaries.
Government officials attack and kill a civilian for refusing to pay taxes. The officials came to the victim's home and attempted to repossess the victim's belongings before the attack.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

notes: NURTW protesters engage in running battles with police over the detention of their leader. The protest carried on into the following day.
Students of Auchi Polytechnic staged a protest against the management for non-conduct of students' union election in the institution.

The Enugu State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) protested President Muhammadu Buhari's appointment of some indigenes of the state, describing it as corrupt and aimed at stifling the party.

notes: Police forces arrest a group of newspaper vendors who were using their stand to promote the Indigenous People of Biafra. Following the arrest, colleagues of the NDAN staged a protest against the intimidation. Date of both events not known - occurred on or before 09/10.

Unidentified gunmen attack Mgbuosimiri during the early morning hours of 09/10, killing ten. The attacks is believed to be related to a similar attack on the town on 05/10. The Nation reports 13 dead.

assoc_actor_1: CCES: Concerned Citizens of Edo State
notes: Indigenes of Edo State under an umbrella group called Concerned Citizens of Edo State protest at the National Assembly Complex against the Edo State Commissioner of Police, alleging 'incompetence.'
Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of Port Harcourt market traders during the early morning hours. Ten reported dead. The reason for the attack is not known. This Day reports "about 15 [dead]."

02:00EAT, Hawl Kismayo (southern Bossaso), Bari â al Shabaab ambush a Puntland quick reaction force responding to the earlier incident at Bossaso checkpoint. Two Puntland deaths reported. Al Shabaab also ambushed a group of reinforcements sent to the checkpoint later in the day. Several injured.
Al Shabaab attack a police checkpoint killing at least 7 on the outskirts of Bossaso.

Government troops attacked al Shabaab fighters at Cadow Dibile settlement outside Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire. Three al Shabaab attackers were killed and one vehicle and weapon were captured.
Saâad and Omar Mohamud clans clashed at Sabansabdho vicinity (c. 45 km East of Galkayo). A pastoralist man was shot and killed and another was injured. The incident was related to clan revenge.
Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM forces at Mashalay village outside Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: Puntland forces launched an air strike against al Shabaab hideouts in Majiyahan area (c. 25 km South West of Bossaso). Initial reports indicated that 15 al Shabaab fighters were killed and 17 others were wounded. The attack as in conjunction with a US air strike.

An explosion has been reported IVO Tarabunka junction Hodan, reports are at the moment limited with no confirmation on the type of explosion or number of casualties. The reason for the explosion is not yet known. The explosion was later determined to be an IED. Perpetrators not known.

Arrest:A suspected IED and explosives devices were discovered in the proximity of Golis Telecom company in Bossaso. Security forces subsequently removed and neutralised the IED. The device was likely planted by al Shabaab. The intended target is not known. There were no reports of casualties or arrests.
A small IED detonated near Digfer Hospital. No causalities reported.
A government official sustained minor injuries in as the result of an assassination attempt. Al Shabaab are suspected by authorities.
Wadani senior officers were beaten using sticks by Kulmiye supporters at Guleid Hotel. The victims were taken to Hargeisa Group Hospital for further treatment.

A man from Ugar Saleeban sub clan was shot and killed by an assailant from Ali Saleeban sub clan in Gaalmale area (c. 87 km South East of Qardho). The assailant escaped and police were reported to be investigating.
Al Shabaab storm SNAF checkpoint. Casualties reported, figures unknown.
Students at CPUT marched on administration building on the Bellville campus, wanting to meet CPUT executive management.

Mattresses, bookshelves and bottles were thrown out of aÂ Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT)Â residence in Cape Town during ongoing student protests. Stones rained down on the armoured car of a private security company and some of the onlookers laughed when the security guards fired a few shots from their rifles.
There were no leassons at some KwaDabeka and Clermont schools as pupils embarked on a protest demanding the arrest and suspension of a teacher they accused of murder.
THE N2 between Dutywa and Butterworth was closed due to an electricity protest. The protest was peaceful.
A small group of students protested in the rain outside a court house in Port Elizabeth.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Clashes between government and SPLA-IO forces as rebels sought to regain control of Pagak. Government claims to have inflicted "heavy losses" on the rebels, while one soldier was killed and two others wounded from their side.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Report of fresh fighting between government and SPLA-IO rebels in Waat. The rebels accused government warplanes of dropping bombs during the fighting, killing 13 civilians.
Unknown gunmen reportedly attacked a group of persons who had gone to fetch firewood outside the UN PoC site in Jebel, outside Juba. Four women went missing. Date unclear - report dated 9 October.

actor2: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Border Guards
notes: Clash between RSF and paramilitary border guards in Kasora, Niteaga locality, South Darfur left two killed. The clash came as RSF members conducted search operations in Kasora.
Gunmen ambushed and shot dead a trader driving in his vehicle at the Sarbin market in Nyala, South Darfur. Reasons unclear.

assoc_actor_1: UTII: Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers
notes: Taxi drivers from the Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers, not recognized by General Syndicate UTICA,  striked and protested in the capital Tunis. Demonstrations came after authorities failed to respond to drivers' demands including approval of the tariff increase and a review of their insurance system.
Dickson Wasswa was severely beaten by security officers who residents claim were deployed by the minister to guard his land and to evict them from "his" land.
Inhabitants from Berrahmoun in Corso staged a sit-in in front of the seat of the prefecture in Boumerdes to protest over housing problems.
Unidentified armed men wielding machetes attacked and killed a cow trader in Butaganzwa.
Unidentified armed men wielding machetes attacked and killed a woman in Nyanza, Marangara.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: The Mayi Mayi Malaika attacked the FARDC forces in Nepanepa and Matala, Shabunda. The fighting lasted until the 10th.
Wilayat Sinai released photo report showing execution of individual abducted in Rafah on October 8 accused of being EG army informer.
ISIS continues attempting to project governance in North Sinai, releases photos of hand amputation of thief if Sheikh Zuweid.
Oromo Opposition media is accusing federal soldiers of shooting and killing a high school student during a protest in west Hararge zone, Mieso woreda, in a place called Muso.
Students at Moi university in Eldoret protested after a student is raped by a security guard.
Local municipal council and HoR employees blocked access to the parliament in Tobruk through protesting, demanding payment of delayed salaries.

Owners of destroyed houses in Sirte protested in front of the destroyed Bank "Al Wahda". The protesters urged the GNA and the Municipal Council to speed up financial compensation and find alternatives to destroyed housing units.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A 20-year old man was killed and a 18-year old teenager was injured when stepping on landmines that are remnants of past BRSC-activities in Benghazi.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
actor2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: Clashes took place between the Libyan National Army and the remnants of the BRSC near the "City Hotel" in As-Sabiri Al Gharbi, Benghazi. One soldier died, according to medical sources.
One Water and Forest agent and one civilian killed in Fangasso
Youth throwing stones at Barkhane vehicles patrolling the streets of Kidal

Up to a thousand protesters came out in the streets of Casablanca to denounce the state's continued detention of rights activists who raised their voice for the marginalized Al-Rif region.During the protest on Sunday, people chanted several slogans "freedom for all detainees" and "people want to fight corruption".

Twenty-one people have been arrested after a demonstration over shortages of drinking water in a town in south-western Morocco turned violent. Dozens of residents took part in the so-called "march of thirst" on 8 October to call for a solution to the ongoing lack of drinking water in some districts of the town of Zagora. The protest was peaceful at first, but reportedly turned violent after a number of youths joined the march. Stones were then thrown at cars, shops and local authorities, rubbish bins were set on fire and roads were blocked, and at least 20 protesters were arrested. Four members of the security forces were injured during the violence.
The Mozambican police regains control of the territory after the attack in Mocimboa da Praia.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.
Students of a Polytechnic school violently protest after two students died of maleria on 06/10.
Military forces kill three members of Boko Haram at Madari, Borno State on 08/10. Premium Times claims Boko Haram were intercepted in Lingir village.
Military forces kills a Boko Haram cattle rustler at Kirbiri, Gujba LGA. Several others escaped with injuries.
Two civilians killed by gunfire over a land dispute. The identities of the perpetrators not known.
08 October, evening â al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a SNAF soldier, fled with confiscated weaponry, Heliwa.
08 October â IED targets SNAF convoy, Cabdow Dibile, Afgooye district. Al Shabaab likely responsible. Two soldiers injured.
08 October, 12:30EAT â IED targets SNAF convoy, Hawo Abdi, northern Daynile. Causalities, perpetrators not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Reports claim an AMISOM convey was hit by a road side IED at Hawo Abdi, casualties figures remain unconfirmed but one civilian was reportedly wounded. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes:
An African Union AMISOM convey was hit by road side IED. One vehicle has been damaged,
casualtyâs unknown. Perpetrators not known.
A lawmaker sustained gunshot wounds after a soldier opened fire on Members of the of Hirshabeel State Parliament. The motive of the attack is not clear.
Al Shabaab allegedly behead a man in Aleemow 20Km north of Waajid for supplying food to ENDF troops. A secondary source claims two were killed.

A civilian man hailing from Ogaden clan shot and injured another civilian man from Bartire clan at Boqolka Guri area in Farjano neighbourhood of Kismayo town over a land dispute. The perpetrator attempted to escape from the scene but JSF, on security patrol, shot at the perpetrator and managed to capture him with minor injuries. Information indicated that the incident resulted in inter-clan disputes and violence which resulted the injuries of five civilians after machetes, knives and clubs were used in the incident. The situation was reported to be calm and all the injured people were taken to Kismayo hospital for medical treatment.
Al Shabaab attacked SNAF base near Qoryoley. No casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: KDF patrol notices IED. As patrol inspects it, device detonates, killing 2 KDF and injuring two.
An RSF member reportedly harassed and tried to rape a woman in Sakali district of Nyala. As she resisted, he shot and severely wounded her.
The Sudanese president extended a unilateral cessation of hostilities in Blue Nile and South Kordofan states for three months, until 31 December 2017

Protesters in El Gammas, Constantine almost assault the local head executive during a protest over housing issues. Problems concern mainly housing because of the swift increase in the number of inhabitants. No actual violence reported.
1 killed, 3 abducted and governement vehicle seized by unknown gunmen in Tin Edja, Oudalan Province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A group of Imbonerakure accused a man coming from the Kirundo market of stealing because he was carrying beans. They tied him to a tree and beat him to death.
Detonate/Dismantle:Detonation: two hand-made bombs were thrown inside local priest's bedroom. No injuries reported.

Arrest:Arrests: between 06/10 and 08/10, hundreds of arbitrary arrests were perpetrated by police forces in Bamenda and Buea, in the aftermath of October, 1st demonstrations. 500 people were arrested and transferred to Bafoussam prison.

Arrest:Arrests: between 06/10 and 08/10, hundreds of arbitrary arrests were perpetrated by police forces in Bamenda and Buea, in the aftermath of October, 1st demonstrations. 500 people were arrested and transferred to Bafoussam prison.

Report shows that there was an attack by ADF rebels on 10 motorbike taxis in Mbau-Kamango road. Latest reports indicate around 40 dead.

notes: The militia Elements attacked the cities of Muteta and Musoma in order to fight the FARDC and to release prisoners previously held there. A total of 55 prisoners were released and around a dozen people were killed.

notes: The militia Elements attacked the cities of Muteta and Musoma in order to fight the FARDC and to release prisoners previously held there. A total of 55 prisoners were released and around a dozen people were killed.

A journalist was beaten by police while covering the eviction of the occupants of the slaughterhouse site in the Abidjan commune of Port-Bouet.
On 07 October, Kenyan conservationists participated in the Global March for elephants, rhinos and lions to raise awareness on threats facing the iconic wildlife species.

actor2: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord

Several civilians were abducted by unidentified gunmen in Sabha.

Youth from the Southern region blocked access to the Elephant oil field in the South if their demands for employment & developped are not met. The rioters threaten to stage a sit-in in the oil-fields if there demands continue to remain answered.
Jeremias Pondeca, who headed the Renamo subcomission preparing the review of the legislation, was killed by, as the report mentions, the 'death squad'.
Imams and oulemas took the streets in Kalounaye to show their support to the establishment of the Catholic University of Western Africa in Coubalan.
A Grenade attack targets a security forces checkpoint and police station injuring three, attackers escaped the scene. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A Grenade attack targets a security forces checkpoint and police station injuring three,
attackers escaped the scene. No group has yet to claim either attack.
Al Shabaab ambushes a SNAF convoy, IVO Buur Dhuxunle, Rab Dhuure district. Causalities not known.
Unidentified militias attack an al Shabaab camp in southern Xudur district, Bakool region. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: There was a reported IED strike on Ethiopian National Defence Force (ENDF) convoy at Waajid, Casualties reported. Al Shabaab responsible.
Alleged al Shabaab Militants kill 2 charcoal traders and wound a third. A secondary source claims the event occurred on 06/10.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a civilian, killed several donkeys and destroyed commercial commodities and donkey carts near Aleemow village (c. 30 km North of Wajid district). The donkey carts were used to transport commodities to Wajid district from Burdhuxunle village. Many people transporting commercial goods managed to escape. Al Shabaab fighters banned for the transportation and delivery of goods in areas under ENDF and Somali government forces in Bay and Bakool regions.

The body of a young male was discovered near Jiirada Macalin Nur in Wadajir district. Gunshot wounds were observed on the dead body. The perpetrators were unknown. The dead body was taken to CID for further investigation.
Al Shabaab operative hurled hand grenade towards Karan SNPF station. Outcome unknown.
Al Shabaab claim to have killed two Jubaland soldiers during clashes in Qam Qam (Xaar-Xaar). Incident described as response after IJA killed livestock.

Protest action by people wearing Economic Freedom Fighters T-shirts, led to the closure of Shoprite's doors at the Greenacres shopping centre in Port Elizabeth. Police then had to use stun grenades to disperse the protestors.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Rebels claimed SPLA and Ugandan gunships bombed their positions around the Waat airstrip.

notes: On 7 October, an alleged attack by the SPLA-IO on the SPLA position in Lui, Mundri East County, Western Equatoria, led to civilian displacement due to fear of further clashes.
A UXO from an abandoned RSF ammunition store in Nyala detonated as a boy played with it. The boy sustained head wounds and his fingers were amputated.
Unknown gunmen abducted a Swiss humanitarian worker from her home in downtown El-Fasher, North Darfur. She was released on 14 November.

assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)

Muslim demonstrators went to the street to show their support to Cameroonian authorities against secession.

In East Shewa , Awaday town, people took part in a demonstration denouncing the jailing of various Oromo political figures.
On 06 October, Police in Kisumu fired tear gas at crowds of opposition supporters who tried to storm the IEBC local offices ahead of a tense presidential election re-run.
On 06 October, Police in Nairobi fired tear gas at crowds of opposition supporters marching against the IEBC ahead of a tense presidential election re-run.
On 06 October, Tumaini supermarket in Kisumu was broken into and goods stolen by anti-IEBC demonstrations endorsed by NASA.
On 06 October, one person suffered gunshots wounds as police and anti-IEBC demonstrators clashed in Homa Bay town.
On 06 October, five people were arrested after a group of youths attempted to barricade a road and light bonfires during anti-IEBC protests.
In Mombasa, Nasa supporters held their anti-IEBC demos peacefully.

Around 80 demonstrators in Misrata yesterday demanded the unification of Libya armed forces, the return of the police and an end to militias such as the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council and the Benghazi Defence Brigades. Gathering in the cityâs main square they said they fully supported the Libya army and the countryâs other security forces. The protest came in the wake of Wednesdayâs deadly attack on Misrataâs court buildings by elements of the so-called Islamic State.

Drivers of private transport trucks staged a sit-in and went on strike which is seen as major cause of the fuel crisis in the area.

Some 200 supporters turned up in Gharyan yesterday to meet and show support for Baset Igtet, the businessman who is presenting himself a new leader for Libya. He was in the mountain town south of Tripoli as part of his campaign to rally support across the country for what is being called his â25 September Movementâ â the date of its inaugural rally in Tripoliâs Martyrsâ Square last month.

In Kande in Nkhata Bay District, an angry mob ransacked Senior Chief Fukamapiri's office where some items were also stolen.

NLC holds a demonstration against the 'casualization of workers.'
Islamic State claims to have killed 30 Nigerian soldiers "in the north-east" on 06/10. The military denied any such attack took place.
Military forces neutralize two members of Boko Haram at Mayanti, Bama LGA. The event occurred late in the evening hours on 06/10.

06 Oct, c. 2000 hrs: A VBIED detonated prematurely at Qolow village (c. 30 km South of Beletweyne town). Seven al Shabaab fighters were killed. The intended target of the blast is not known.

notes: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM supply convoy travelling outside of Qoryoley District exploded. One AMISOM truck was damaged. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the attack.

A pastoralist hailing from Murusade clan was shot and killed by Hawadle clan militias at Xeero area (c. 25 km North east of Mahaas). The motive of the killing was related to clan retaliation and linked to an incident that occurred at the same location on 04 October.

Murusade pastoralist killed by Hawadle militias.
After an attack in Mokgoba near Modjadjiskloof, the local community had mobilised and had gone to the attacker's house, where they proceeded to severely assault the man, who died from his injuries.
Students, led by the organisation Equal Education held a march in Pretoria.
Following a criminal incident, a local community mobilised themselves, followed a suspect criminal and assaulted him to death at his shack in the town of Tzaneen in Limpopo Province.
Armed youth shot at the paramount Chief of Panyon community in Cuei-adukan, Western Lakes State, as he was on his way with the Commissioner of Malek County to arrest one of them.
A bomb blast at Umjak village of Al-Odeiya locality, West Kordofan left a female university student dead. Circumstances unclear.

Armed herders opened fire on two farmers in Dulo, north of Fanga, eastern Jebel Marra, as they tried to keep the herders from entering cattle onto their farms. One of the farmers died on the spot, while the other one was left injured. Date unclear - report dated 6 October.
Militiamen attacked two displaced women working on their farms in Um Asal, west of Gireida, leaving them injured.

Unknown assailants attacked four villages, injured seven people and burnt one of their homes in Kalungu District on Friday morning. Assailants descended on villages of Kalungi in Lukaya Town Council, Bugiri, Kisimbanyiriri and Lusango in Bukulula Sub County.

notes: Students took to the streets to protest the killing of Mahamudo Amurane, mayor of the city who was shot in his house. Because some protesters burned tires, the police had to intervene, shooting rubber bullets to the air and using armored cars to disperse the crowd.
French forces declared that a military operation targeting the perpetrators of 04/10 attack is ongoing.
NLC airline workers protest at Lagos airport over labour concerns.

Gunmen (suspected 'cultists') have killed at least two persons and injured scores, when they invaded Mgbuoshimini Community in Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State, on the night of 05/10. It is believed the attackers targeted the town in search of rivals.
Gunmen kidnap a magistrate near Salem University on the evening of 05/10.

Al Shabaab launches a large attack on Bariirre town. The ensuing battle lasted several hours. One soldier and three al Shabaab fighters were killed and four other al Shabaab fighters were injured. A second source claimed "possibly ten killed."
05 October, evening â suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNAF soldier, Suuq Xoloha, Heliwa.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Al Shabaab media claims to have attacked Ethiopian forces in Waajid district, causing 'huge' causalities. A second report claims one ENDF dead, one wounded.
05 October, 18:45EAT â al Shabaab operative hurl a hand grenade towards security checkpoint, Mogadishu University, Wadajir. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab kidnapped five clan elders near Mahaday, Middle Shabelle region. The identity of the clan and the reason for the abduction is not known.
Clan militia established two illegal CPs at the outskirts of Bossaso on Airport road in agitation to an issue with the Bossaso port.

At the Bellville campus, students were protesting over financial exclusion and caused damage to the admin building when clashes with private security broke out. Private security at the residence used rubber bullets to disperse the crowd.
Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) students protested against financial exclusions. 200 people participated in the protests at the Cape Town campus.
Service delivery protests flared up in Cato Manor. They also broke bottles and threw them along the road. They pelted police with rocks. Police had to use rubber bullets and stun grenades.
A small group of DA supporters braved the cold and rain to march close to the Gupta familyâs Saxonwold compound in Johannesburg to protest against state capture.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition-Deng Gai: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition (Deng Gai Faction)
notes: Clash between an SPLA-IO Commander defected to the government supported by his bodyguard and civilians who attempted to defend themselves from the two gunmen who had come to loot their house at Hi Saura in Yabongo residential area at the outskirts of Yambio town. The two assalliants were shot dead.

Gunfire exchange between militiamen attempting to break into shops and guards at the Kabkabiya market in North Darfur left a militia member killed and a policeman injured in the exchange of gunfire between militiamen and guards of the market.

A group of nine militiamen abducted a merchant from the market in Kabkabiya, North Darfur. It is unclear if this incident happened before or after a clash reported on the same day at the market between police and militiamen attempting to loot a shop.
Armed men shot and killed a displaced man working on a farm east of the Fata Borno IDP camp in North Darfurâs Kutum locality. The assaillants stole his money, property and his donkey.

Clashes were reported between opposants and police during the second day of demonstrations in Togo. In Sokode, the country's second biggest city, six people were wounded as security forces tried to break up a protest.
"The police intervened by launching tear gas to free the blocked national road 1," Amnesty International's director for Togo, Aime Adi, told AFP. Five civilians were wounded in small calibre weapon fire and one soldier was seriously injured after mishandling a tear gas grenade. Several other rallies in the country's north -- a region previously seen as reliably pro-government -- also drew thousands of people in the cities of Bafilo and Dapaong, local residents told AFP.The atmosphere was more tense than during the previous day's demonstrations, which occurred without incident. 
Barricades have been erected in Lome, blocking traffic in several districts. 
"Demonstrators have used rocks to block the road from Gakpoto to St. Joseph's school, and others are preventing cars from going through," Adi said.

Rioters from the UGTT invaded the seat of the UTICA-syndicate, aggressed the guardians and organised a sit-in in the hallway. UGTT denies having perpetrated the act.

Several residents of the 'CitÃ© Evolutive, located in the main town of Ath Laaziz, 10 km north of Bouira, shut down the local governmental representation to demand the widening of the road leading from their neighborhood to another neighbourhood.
Primary school teachers went to the streets claiming their bonus.
Arrest: On the outskirts of Ouagadougou, racketeering policemen arrested by Koglweogos in Saaba

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 men travelling to Rwanda were arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure at the Kanyaru River. The Imbonerakure accused the men of joining the FNL.
A man was strangled by unidentified attackers and left in a construction site in Kigoma.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A group of civilians, including a soldier on leave, were attacked by Imbonerakure wielding machetes in Makamba. They were then arrested and accused of leading an insurrection.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Three presumed fishermen were captured after a clash between the FARDC and a coalition composed of Mayi Mayi Charles with clandestine fishermen. The clash lasted for 30 minutes.

The family of 13-year-old Sameh Youssef organized a silent stand in front of the House of Representatives to protest against the failure of police to arrest the criminals who fatally shot Youssef.  Youssef, namely known in the media as âYoussef, the martyr of Octoberâ, was shot in the head in May 2017 during a wedding ceremony in 6th of October city.

Dozens of cleaning workers went on strike in the city of Minya ALQmh in Sharkia province and gathered at their headquarters in the city center in order to protest the mayor's decision that cleaning workers be supervised.

Members of the military clash following an unarticulated dispute. One of the combatants fired on two others, killing them. The attacker then killed himself. The location of the clash within Ethiopia is not known.
Youngsters blocked the access to the Le Prince highway and burned some tires within the framework of demonstration against the government.
Opposition supporters went to the street to demonstrate against the government.
Regime opposants went to the streets.

actor2: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
notes: Clashes on the outskirts of Sabratha, with reports of airstrikes against the Dabbashi brigade, which was said to have tried to launch a counter offensive in alliance with the Mohamed Al-Kilani brigade from Zawia. It was repulsed. The clashes in Sabratha left at least 43 people dead in total.
Youth from the Southern Region took over a truck that was carrying meat to the Sharara oil field to show their dissatisfaction with fuel and gas supply, cash liquidity, employment and other issues.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Fighting erupted this evening near Gasr Ben Ghashir, next to Tripoli International Airport, between the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade and forces from Tarhouna. At least four people were killed in an Islamic State group attack & bombing at the main court building in Misrata. Thirty-nine people were wounded. An exchange of fire followed the first explosion. Of the three attackers, one blew himself up, one was killed and one arrested. 6 fatalities divided between two events.

Iboghilitane fraction chief assassinated by armed men 20 km from Anderamboukane.

Military forces kill four members of Boko Haram in Bama LGA was the sect attempted two separate attacks on an IDP camp in the area. The two attacks occurred at different times of the day.
A suspected thief is beaten to death by a vigilante mob in Amorji Nike, Abakpa in Enugu East.
Three suspected robbers were lynched by youths when they robbed the residence of one Abdulmumini Daga and three others in Daga village, Jibia Local Government Area of Katsina State.
The Congolese Government has offered an amnesty to rebel groups operating in the Pool region.

An IED targeted government soldiers in Bariirre, killing one and wounding two. Following the attack, soldiers attempted to arrest a suspect, but was shot during an attempt to flee. Al Shabaab probable suspects, as they have been operating in the area.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: A roadside IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy between Qurac Madobe and Cali Fooldheere settlements in Mahaday district, exploded. The explosion destroyed an AMISOM caspir. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

An IED targeted government soldiers in Bariirre, killing one and wounding two. Following the attack, soldiers attempted to a suspect, but was shot during an attempt to flee. Al Shabaab probable suspects, as they have been operating in the area.

At least two civilians were killed, and several others wounded in a remote-controlled landmine blast near Jowhar town. The explosion has resulted from an explosive device hidden in a water container left on the banks of a river at Munkay area. Perpetrators remain unknown.

An IED buried on the banks of the river in Maankey village (c. 10 km south of Jowhar) detonated. The residents of the village were preventing floods in the area when the explosion occurred. There were no reports of casualties. The motive behind the incident was unknown.
AMBUSH: Unspecified clan militia ambushed a Toyota Noah carrying khat on the tarmac road in Fuluja village (c. 70 km South of Bossaso). There were no reports of casualties.
A district admin official shot and killed in Wadjir. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
A tax collector is targeted and killed in Suuq Ba'ad market by armed gunmen. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. This event may have occurred the previous day.

assoc_actor_2: Hawadle Ethnic Group (Somalia); Habar Gedir Clan Group (Somalia)
notes: Jajeele clan militiamen shot and seriously injured a father and his son at Buurfiiq village (c. 10 km west of Beletweyne town). It was reported that Jajeele clan militias attempted to retaliate from Hawadle clan but shot at the two individuals who hailed from Habargidir clan. The victims were taken to a private hospital in Hawlwadaag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne for further treatment by the perpetrators.
Clan violence reported near Maxaas. Causality figures not known.
Civilians from two rival power companies clash over unfair business practices. SL Police fired upon when attempting to disperse crowds. Several injured.
Al Shabaab assassinates a police officer in Yaaqshiid.

Police used stun grenades to disperse about 150 Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) students who were marching to Parliament to hand over a memorandum to the Department of Higher Education and Training yesterday.
Traffic in Ngcobo came to a standstill and shops shut for about five hours as ratepayers and taxi operators united in a peaceful protest to demand better service delivery from municipal bosses.
Officers from the Tshwane Metro Police Department's VIP protection unit used pepper spray to force the group of about 100 student protesters.

assoc_actor_1: SPLA/M-In Opposition-Deng Gai: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition (Deng Gai Faction)

notes: SPLA-IO rebels led by Machar attacked government forces allied to SPLA-IO under FVP Deng Gai in Waat from their base in Akobo. Clashes reportedly spread over 1-4 October. Authorities rejected claims by the rebels that the town was divided between the two parties after the clashes. SPLA claimed that the rebels were supported by members of the White Army. They claimed to have killed 150 rebels and injured another 200, while four died on their side and 20 others were injured. Shelling was reportedly heard during an ICRC mission to evacuate the wounded after the fighting on 4 October.
An ERW explosion left one person killed along with his camel in Mashrou Abuzeid in eastern Jebel Marra.

NCP student supporters attacked fellow students staging a sit-in outside the Faculty of Education of the En Nahud university in West Kordofan with live bullets and metal bars, leaving 18 students injured, including one seriously. The protesters were demanding improvements to the university provision of transportation from the boarding houses to the university. Police fired teargas to disperse the groups.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on an ambulance carrying a sick person from Malha to El Fasher in Mellit locality, leaving the driver killed.
Unknown gunmen attacked and raped four girls collecting straw in Susuwa near the Rwanda IDP camp in Tawila locality.
Report of at least four militia raids on farms and roads in Gereida over 3-4 October. On 4 October, gunmen attacked three displaced women from Gereida camp, leaving them severely injured.
Opposition supporters went to the streets in Lome and in several city across the nation to ask for the return to 1992 constitution.
A student in first grade of secondary school agressed and hit school personel to show his dissatisfaction with a professor in  school. Police had to intervene to stop the rioter.
Inhabitants and youth from Jhina, Bouhajla, Kairouan decided to shut down the school and block traffic to protest against the lack of teaching personel for schools.
Medical workers on strike protested in front of the CHU Hospital in Oran to denounce an increasing number of aggressions by patients who are coming to the hospital for treatment.

Citizens of Ain Beda went on the streets to protest against police-forces, accusing them of being responsible for the death of a 19-year old citizen. When facing police, protests turned violent, with rioters attacking police and police forces using teargas and bullets against the rioters. One rioter died and several were injured.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man in Buhiga was stabbed by Imbonerakure, after he criticised them for being drunk in public.
4 men in Gihanga were beaten by police wielding guns, sticks and belts. 3 of the men were arrested and held in Gihanga prison, the 4th has been taken to an unkown location.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: The FARDC recover the territory of Kipese.

Nubians protested in front of the courthouse in Aswan against a judge's decision to extend the detention of relatives and friends who had been detained for protesting recently. Police Forces used teargas to disperse the protest and arrested seven of them.

Strike:STRIKE: Hundreds of temporary workers in Belayem oil field, began a strike on Tuesday, to protest against the nonpayment of their salaries for about a month, and abuse.The striking workers are affiliated to Gulf Proceed Catering, which is active at the Belayem oil field.
People went to the streets protesting the lack of water supply. Some youngsters burned tires and blocked the access to Fidel Castro highway. Police interveened to disperse the crowd.

Students at the University of Nairobi protest for two days after the arrest of a former student body president, now a parliamentarian for the opposition, was arrested. His detention led students to block roads at the university campuses and clash with riot police.
On 03 October, employees of the Monrovia City Corporation (MCC) protested the poor working conditions, benefits and salary increment. The employees held placards on the ground of the MCC.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: PROPERTY DESTRUCTION: The old Passports and Immigration department building in central Tripoliâs Shara Sayidi was engulfed in fire. No one was hurt. There have been unconfirmed allegations that the fire was started deliberately in order to destroy evidence of a black market trade in Libyan passports.

A number of angry citizens in the city of Tobruk, on Tuesday morning, placed large quantities of garbage bags in front of the headquarters of the municipal council, to protest against the Council's failure to address the garbage crisis after the closure of the main landfill.
There were demonstrations in Sabratha on Tueday, with people declaring their support for the Anti IS Operations room (army and police) and opposition to the Dabbashi militia.

Inhabitants from Sirte demonstrated to celebrate the expulsion of Daech from the city and demanded from the GNA to compensate them and solve the housing crises, caused through the vast destruction of infrastructure and homes in the city.

actor2: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi

No death resulted from the attack but one soldier was slightly injured.
Two people were injured as students clashed with police in ongoing protests in Toamasina. A buliding was burnt down as 9 students were arrested.

Renewed clashes between MSA fighters and unknown gunmen in the area of Takadami on the Niger border. MSA claims to have killed 15 assailants (not verified) amidst clashes in Tankademi, acknowledges 2 dead in own ranks.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: A vehicle of the gendarmerie destroyed by IED/mine explosion, 10km from Saye (KÃ©-Macina), 2 wounded.  JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.

Renamo accuses the military forces of Frelimo of killing 4 Renamo soldiers. The killing was reported by a member of Renamo in an interview shown in Macua Angola, who claims they are a provocation by Frelimo. According to the speaker, the demobilised soldiers wanted to retailiate, but under Dhlakama's orders, they were prevented from doing so, in order to protect the peace process.
Students of Moshood Abiola Polytechnic protest at the office of the rector over the state of education in Ogun.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters have attacked Southwest state forces and African Union troops at military bases at Goof Guduud. Causalities not known. The attack may have occurred the previous day.

Reports from Afgoye say that al-Shabaab fighters have attacked a security checkpoint manned by government forces. Fierce fighting, which lasted several hours, ensued between government forces at the checkpoint and al-Shabab militants who launched the attack. Area residents said that both sides suffered loss of life and injury in the fighting although the extent of loss remains unknown.
Army forces kill three al Shabaab commanders outside of Buurdhuubo.

Unknown armed assailants using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab assassins, shot and killed an SNA officer at a tea shop at Siliga neighbourhood in Wadajir district. One civilian bystander was injured during the exchange of gunfire. Security forces arrived at the scene and conducted searches but there were no reports of arrests. The attackers escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the assassination.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Al Shabaab launched mortar shells against Diinsoor airstrip. Ethiopian forces, stationed at the airfield responded in kind against the al Shabaab position. Causalities not known. A secondary source claims the attack took place on the previous day.

An IED planted alongside the road between KM 50 and Bariire settlement detonated. The blast destroyed a Toyota carib carrying SNA soldiers. At least two soldiers were killed and four others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: Possible US drone strike against al Shabaab position at Turgarey, near Mubarak. Causalities not known.

Residents of New Hargeisa conducted a violent demonstration against the Somaliland government for selling Riis Intermediate School to a businessman. The demonstrators burnt tires in front of the school and disrupted movement of vehicles in the area. SLP dispersed the demonstrators. There was no report of arrests.
Members of the Islamic State attack a coffee shop in Bossaso, killing one and inuring two, including a police officer. Islamic State later claimed responsibility.

Two people, hailing from Jidle and Hawadle clan, were killed and burnt by Makane clan militiamen at Leego (c. 8 km North of Beletweyne town). The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The security situation in the area was reported to be tense.

Unidentified armed attackers using pistols shot and killed a civilian man at Black Sea area in Hodan district for unknown reasons. Security forces conducted a search operation at the location but the assailants were not apprehended. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A man was found dead at a teashop at Dalxiska neighbourhood in Kismayo town. The body was identified as an off-duty Jubaland state house special security guard officer. JSF arrived at the scene and took the body for tests and burial.

A worker of a not-for-profit organization, hailing from Hawadle clan, was abducted by clan militias (not identified) hailing from Mohamud Gacal area (c. 37 km North of Beletweyne town) and was taken to an unknown location. The motive of the abduction was related to the dismissal on one of the militiamen hailing from Mohamud Gacal by the worker. Influential clan elders from Hawadle clan attempted to negotiate for the release of the abducted worker. The situation was reported to be tense.
No arrests have been made after several vehicles belonging to the Bapo-Ba-Mogale community in Bapong near Brits were set alight.
Hundreds of Nelson Mandela University students gathered in protest at the South Campus Kraal on following the alleged rape and robbery of two students.

A policeman fired shots as 4 people tried to seize his gun in a coordinated action. The policeman was able to ward off the assailants.
Two grenades were hurled by unknown assailants at the residences of MP Allan Ssewanyana (Makindye East) and MP Robert Kyagulanyi alias Bobi Wine (Kyadondo East) at about 1am Tuesday night.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front

A primary school in Chaib, commune of Mekla, 20 km East of Tizi Ouzou was closed by parents of the pupils to denounce the delay in the construction of a new canteen.

The transporters of the urban lines of the city of Mila and the beneficiaries of the 50 social housing units of the municipality of Derrahi Bousselah protested yesterday in front of the local prefecture.
Workers from the Agence fonciere in Mostaganem protested to demand the demission of three members of the executive board.

Police Forces arrested a 19-year old in Ain Beida and released him some hours later. The young guy declared that he suffered from torture and police brutality while being in detention. He was found dead in his bed the following day.

Double suicide bombing in Mozogo. 3 dead (2 kamikazes and 1 civilian) .
