Gendarmerie station in Baboua was attacked by armed men: they opened fire on the building before seizing a kalachnikof. The only policemen escaped by the window. The armed men kidnapped a women along the route in village Ndiba (km 17 Gallo route). She was freed at km 20.
Civilians were attacked and kidnapped (to be later imprisoned) by Thomas in order to demand ransoms.

Egyptian police forces have killed three Hasm militants in a shootout in 15 May City, a southern Cairo suburb. The gunfire exchange took place at a cemetery under construction as security forces were trying to arrest them.
Somali Liyu police shot at civilians, killing one Oromo man in Daro labu woreda.

Somali Liyu police shot at civilians, wounding one person in west Hararge, Mieso woreda. Opposition spokesmen are upset because the government had disarmed Oromos in the area, making it impossible for them to fight back.
Former rebels demonstrated in front of Man and BouakÃ© prefectures claiming a bonus of 18 millions of FCFA per head.
Former rebels demonstrated in front of Man and BouakÃ© prefectures claiming a bonus of 18 millions of FCFA per head.

Students at the University of Nairobi protest for two days after the arrest of a former student body president, now a parliamentarian for the opposition, was arrested. His detention led students to block roads at the university campuses and clash with riot police.
Peaceful protest by NASA supporters in Mombasa
On 02 October,  anti-riot police used teargas on anti-IEBC protesters  who were hurling stones at police in Nairobi and Kisumu (Kondele)
On 02 October,  anti-riot police used teargas on anti-IEBC protesters  who were hurling stones at police in Nairobi and Kisumu
On 02 October, One person died in Siaya County of Western Kenya after collapsing in a protest against the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) in the opposition stronghold.
Anti-IEBC protests in Garissa
Anti-IEBC protests in Kitui
On October 2, police reportedly used tear gas in a nursery in Nyalenda, injuring at least three children.
In Homa Bay, Nasa supporters lit bonfires as they demanded the removal of IEBC CEO Ezra Chiloba and other officials accused of bungling August 8 polls.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
actor2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: Intermittent clashes took place between the Libyan National Army and the remnants of the BRSC near the "City Hotel" in As-Sabiri Al Gharbi, Benghazi. 10 wounded and 1 killed over the five days fighting
2 people were tortured and killed as bandits attacked a shop in Ambohitsimanova,_district_of Antsirabe_II.
In Masomeloka_Mahanoro a mob attacked and killed a man in a vigilante attack.
Students in Toamasina held a protest.
Two Malawi Congress Party members were arrested after they led on marching in Nsanje singing campaign songs for the party.
Clashes reported  between elements of the MSA and a "group of bandits" in the area of Tamalate near the Niger border. No casualties and attackers repelled in Tamalate.

The police opened fire on rioters in Mandimba, killing four of them in Madimba, Niassa. The rioters set the house of the district police manager on fire, burning also his car and that of the local head of the traffic police.

No fewer than four soldiers of Operation Lafiya Dole were killed with another senior officer and a driver, escaping unhurt when some Boko Haram insurgents ambushed the operational vehicle conveying food for troops along Mafa-Sasawa Military Base in Borno State.
The group of people impacted by the regional train project went to the street to protest the low indemnisations proposed in exchange of their parcels. Policemen dispersed the crowd.
Saâad sub-clan of Habargidir and Omar Mohamud sub clan of Majeerteen clash east of Gaalkacyo on or before 02/10. Causalities not known.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Joint SNA/ENDF strike operation carried out at Baardheere, 25 al Shabaab reported killed including members of the al Shabaab leadership.
Al Shabaab fire Mortars at SNA FOB at Bariire followed by a low level attack. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a government troop position at Buulo Foolyo SNA base in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab stole a motorcycle and an unspecified amount of money from the check point. A civilian bystander was injured. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at government soldiers guarding Towfiq ward in Yaqshid district. The grenade landed on an empty place resulting in no casualties. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
A Puntland police officer shot dead on 02/10 the chief of security at an airport, reasons unknown. A secondary report from Shabelle Media Network claims that attack occurred on 03/10.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: A roadside bomb targeted an AMISOM convoy at SOS intersection in Mogadishu. No reports of casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: A powerful bomb blast struck Ugandan Amisom troops on the road connecting the town of Buulo Mareer and the village of Golweyn, Lower Shabeelle Region. The blast is said to have killed and wounded at least three soldiers. The soldiers were walking when they were struck by the blast. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
Students march for the reunification of Gaalkacyo.

SLP conducted a security operation at Sheedaha neighbourhood where they clashed with youngsters who were fighting each other. The reason for the unrest is not known. SLP fired warning shots to disperse the youngsters. Five youngsters were arrested.

Al Shabaab fighters detained two businessmen hailing from Hawadle clan at Booco Village (c. 45 km South of Beletweyne town) after al Shabaab fighters summoned businessmen to Booco village for discussions. Businessmen who honoured the call arrived at Booco village and were detained by al Shabaab fighters. The motive behind the detention was not clear.
Puntland soldier opens fire and kills head of AY Airport Security Abdisalam Sanyare "Awke" and his bodyguard. One youth bystander killed.
Attack without casualties: Suspected al Shabaab operative hurled two hand grenades against Yaaqshiid DC HQ. No casualties, assailant escaped.
Students at the Alice campus of the University of Fort Hare are protesting about fees, water outages and power cuts. The campus closed down. A student centre was set on fire
THE former branch chairman of the ANC in Nkumba in Bulwer was gunned down outside his girlfriend's home.
A mob attacked a taxi vehicle at the corner of Symphony Way and Stellenbosch Arterial Road in Cape Town.

Government forces ambushed a group of armed youth from the Kuac community, arresting five, in Apuk South County, Gogrial State. Following the incident, the gunmen that had escaped attacked civilians at a nearby village, injuring two. The gunmen returne to the village the following day, abducting two people.

assoc_actor_1: SPLA/M-In Opposition-Deng Gai: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition (Deng Gai Faction)
actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; Gurtong; Xinhua General News Service
notes: SPLA-IO rebels led by Machar attacked government forces allied to SPLA-IO under FVP Deng Gai in Waat from their base in Akobo. Clashes reportedly spread over 1-4 October. Authorities rejected claims by the rebels that the town was divided between the two parties after the clashes. SPLA claimed that the rebels were supported by members of the White Army. They claimed to have killed 150 rebels and injured another 200, while four died on their side and 20 others were injured. Shelling was reportedly heard during an ICRC mission to evacuate the wounded after the fighting on 4 October.

Government forces ambushed a group of armed youth from the Kuac community, arresting five, in Apuk South County, Gogrial State. Following the incident, the gunmen that had escaped attacked civilians at a nearby village, injuring two. The gunmen returne to the village the following day, abducting two people.

Suspected gunmen from Malou-Pec County of Gok state state killed four people and injured another three in two separated incidents on the week of 2 October in Manyang-Ngok, Tonj state. In one incident, the gunmen ambushed a prison service officer on its way to Cuei-Cok of Manyang-Ngok County to calm the situation, shooting him in both legs.

Suspected gunmen from Malou-Pec County of Gok state state killed four people and injured another three in two separated incidents on the week of 2 October in Manyang-Ngok, Tonj state. In one incident, the gunmen ambushed a prison service officer on its way to Cuei-Cok of Manyang-Ngok County to calm the situation, shooting him in both legs.
In Northern Bahr el-Ghazal, clashes between the Misseriya and the Dinka Malual along the border with Sudan on 2 October resulted in six deaths and civilian displacement.
Armed herders shot and killed a man after he refused to hand them over his cattle in Daba Naira, 15km east of Dobo El Omda.
Militiamen raided a village in Fogali area of East Jebel Marra locality in South Darfur, leaving three people killed. One person was abducted but managed to escape soon after.
A soldier was severely beaten and sustained multiple fractures after being assaulted by a trio of militants near Kairouan.

People in Tataouine and Smar rioted and blocked streets with burning tires to protest against not being recruted for companies that belong to the big oil companies in the region - which was according to them foreseen in accords between the Tunisian government and protesters in El Kamour.

People in Tataouine and Smar rioted and blocked streets with burning tires to protest against not being recruted for companies that belong to the big oil companies in the region - which was according to them foreseen in accords between the Tunisian government and protesters in El Kamour.
Soldiers beat up Chitungwiza residents to punish them for the death of a soldier.

Algerian counterterrorim troops on Sunday killed five armed militants in the locality of El Kseur, in the province of Bejaia. Army troops on Thursday had launched a wide scale dragging operation in the upper woods of El Kseur.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man was ambushed by Imbonerakure, who beat him with a broken bottle.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man accused of stealing was beaten and arrested by 2 Imbonerakure.

Arrest:ARRESTS: Police maintained a tight grip in English-speaking Cameroon on Monday a day after the anglophone minority declared symbolic independence. In Buea, police carried out overnight arrests in one of the city's districts, and left with individuals who were in handcuffs.

Catholic bishops have denounced the "barbarism" and "irresponsible use" of force against demonstrators in Cameroon's English-speaking regions last weekend. "In Bamesing, in the archdiocese of Bamenda, some young men were caught and shot on the legs," they added, adding that many people were arrested and "taken away to where we do not know."
5 prisoners were killed by police as they attempted to escape from Kumbo's prison, seizing the occasion prompted by Sunday's demonstrations. Two were wounded by bullets and are at the hospital.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: A total of 38 identified demonstrators were killed as a result of live bullets by the defence and security forces in North-West and South-West regions of Cameroon in independence protests. 4 fatalities recorded on 28 September, remaining 34 fatalities divided between events on 1 October in Mamfe, Balikumbat, Limbe, Oku, Akwaya, Ikiliwindi, Kumba, Tombel, Eyumojock, Fontem, Muyuka, Bafut, Ekona Mbenge, Ashong, Ndop, Ndu, Bamenda, Kumbo and Beau. REDHAC reported 100 fatalities.

More than 300 people went to the street protesting the lack of government engagement in the region's security.
In September/October, 4 childern were kidnapped and killed by unidentified men.

The NDC-R got into a battle with the Mayi Mayi of Mazembe, overtaking the territory on October 1st. The occupation overtook the territory which had been under the control of the Mayi Mayi over the last 10 days. The fighting led the population to flee and seek refuge in neighbouring areas.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: A military kills a young man and hurts 3 other people in Djugu after getting drunk and shooting at civilians. The casualty was an 18 year old boy.
An attack was foiled on a ring road south of Arish: soldiers fired repeatedly at a SVBIED which was driving towards the checkpoint, detonating it before it reached the soldiers on duty.

An Oromo festival on 01/10 turned into a anti government protest. Over a million people gathered at Horra Harsede, a meeting place for Irreecha celebration in the central town of Bushoftu, 50 kilometres (31 miles) south of the capital, Addis Ababa.
Inter-community clashes for the exploitation of Goin-DÃ©bÃ© forest during several weeks: 10 dead, 28 wounded, 2 rape cases and 4 campments burned.

assoc_actor_1: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Strike:STRIKE: Battalion 30, allied with the UN-backed Government of National Accord, closed the Sharara oil field to pressure the authorities with the demands for releasing detainees in Tripoli and paying delayed salaries. They also demanded developing southern cities, and providing fuel and gas supplies to them, as well as supporting health centers. The closure lasted for 3 days until an agreement was found.

A member of the Gaddafha tribe killed a fellow Gaddafa tribeman during a funeral of Warfala elders in Bani Walid. The reason for the killing was vengeance, as the victim killed the perpetrator's brother some years ago. The matter had never been settled.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Three people, including a civilian, were killed in fighting last night in Tripoliâs Gurji district, west of the city centre, between the powerful Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade of Haithem Tajouri and the Nawasi Brigade. The clashes occurred late last night after Tajouri sent in forces to Gurjiâs Massara area to clear it of a Nawasi unit. The Tajouri force is said to have succeeded.

actor2: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
notes: Fights between the Anti IS Operations Room and the Dabbasi brigade continued. The clashes in Sabratha left at least 43 people dead in total.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Armed clashes continued Sunday evening between the Nawasi and the Tripoli Revolutionaires brigade in the Zawyet Dahmani area of __Tripoli. Clashes broke out after the TRP took control of the Headquarters of the Nawasi Brigade in the area of __Qarji, on Sunday evening, prompting the latter to attempt to control the HQ of the battalion of the Revolutionaries brigade near the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Zawiyat Dahmani.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: MINUSMA vehicle reportedly struck an IED near Adar N'Tikilit, axis MÃ©naka-Ansongo. JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.

A policeman on traffic duty was assaulted in the northern city of Tetouan by an individual with a bladed weapon. The individual was, according to police, suffering from mental disorders. The suspect attacked the policeman from behind, leading the officer to use his gun. The policeman fired at the attacker, who was wounded in his shoulder but managed to escape arrest. The policeman suffered a serious injury and was transferred to a city hospital.

assoc_actor_1: BIHD: Bama Initiative for Human Development
notes: The Bama Initiative for Human Development, an NGO, on 01/10 in Maiduguri staged a peaceful demonstration demanding the return of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) to their respective communities in Bama.
Arrest:ARRESTS: Ondo State police forces arrest a member of Boko Haram known as Mohammed Basha. It is not known if the person is a notable figure within the group.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNA base at Bariire in Afgoye district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack by firing mortar shells into the base followed by an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked local armed men at Gubud-Galool village (c. 35 km North East of Xudur). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for a few minutes after which the local militias retreated from the village. Three local militias were killed and two others were injured in the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against government forces base at Teed village (c. 30 km North of Xudur town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which SNA retreated from the base. Al Shabaab took control of the base. Al Shabaab later withdrew from the  base without further clashes. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and four others were injured. SNA forces were reported to have taken control of the base without violence.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against government forces base at Teed village (c. 30 km North of Xudur town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which SNA retreated from the base. Al Shabaab took control of the base. Al Shabaab later withdrew from the  base without further clashes. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and four others were injured. SNA forces were reported to have taken control of the base without violence.

Al Shabaab fighters fired about five mortars rounds targeting Baidoa Airport from Daauudow (c. 15 km South East of Baidoa town). Confirmed reports indicated that none of the mortar rounds landed inside the airport. There were no reports of casualties or damages.

An SNA convoy travelling on the road between KM 13 â KM 15 neighbourhoods was hit by a roadside IED near Siinka Dheer area in Dharkenley district. The convoy was carrying a military commander who was travelling to Mogadishu. The commander narrowly survived the attack. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
An explosion targets government soldiers in Hodan district on 01/10. 15 reported dead or wounded, fatalities estimated at 5. Perpetrators not known.

An SNA convoy travelling at the outskirts of Wanlweyn district was hit by an RCIED. The explosion impacted a battle wagon carrying soldiers from an army base in Balidogle airstrip. Three soldiers were killed and three others were seriously injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Suspected al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade in the old livestock market. No casualties.

Unknown armed assailants using pistols shot and killed a watchman at Weydow village in Dharkenley district. The man was at the market area when the armed criminals shot him. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Somaliland army officers shot and killed a truck driver who hailed from Dhulbahante/Baharsame clansman near Gambadhe base. The motive was not clear but it was believed that the driver failed to stop at the military checkpoint. Police in Sool were reported to be investigating the matter.
Over 100 al Shabaab fighters seen crossing the Shabelle River from west to east. Motive unknown. Wider al Shabaab movements reported in the area.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated SNAF soldier.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate FGS tax collector. Assailants escaped. Victim identified as Yusuf Abdi.
A former African National Congress councillor and long-time activist in Mtubatuba near Richards Bay, north of Durban, has been gunned down.

assoc_actor_1: SPLA/M-In Opposition-Deng Gai: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition (Deng Gai Faction)
actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; Gurtong; Xinhua General News Service
notes: SPLA-IO rebels led by Machar attacked government forces allied to SPLA-IO under FVP Deng Gai in Waat from their base in Akobo. Clashes reportedly spread over 1-4 October. Authorities rejected claims by the rebels that the town was divided between the two parties after the clashes. SPLA claimed that the rebels were supported by members of the White Army. They claimed to have killed 150 rebels (including 91 on 1 October) and injured another 200, while four died on their side on 1 October and 20 others were injured. Shelling was reportedly heard during an ICRC mission to evacuate the wounded after the fighting on 4 October.

actor2: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service

IDPs at the Bentiu camp staged peaceful protests "recently" demanding more protection from the UN peacekeepers in the camp. This follows an attack on the camp by five gunmen around 25 September that left one killed. Report dated 3 October.
A major cattle-raiding incident allegedly perpetrated by armed youth in Pakur, Gany County, resulted in 28 killed and 35 injured at some point between September and mid-November.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Military Intelligence Service

Militants led by Osman Abdellatif carried out revenge campaigns against IDPs in camp Fata Borno, Kutum locality, North Darfur, after farmers refused to pay the royalties they had imposed to protect IDP farms. They looted people's goods, hampered access to Kutum and beat some IDPs between 28 September and 1 October. It is not clear when the violence precisely occurred.

Unidentified gunmen killed an RSF soldier near the Khamssa Dagayg IDP camp outside Zalingei, Central Darfur, at an unclear date. RSF attacked the camp in revenge over night and in the early hours of 1 October, killing a displaced person, injuring another nine and abducting one. Soldiers intervened to disperse the attackers.
Gunmen shot and killed a man after he refused to hand them over his cattle in Yaw, north of Tawila.
Soldier wounded in IED/mine blast at Jebel Semmama, Kasserine.
MP Bobi Wine - Robert Kyagulanyi declared that two granades hit his house on October, 1st. No injuries reported.
Soldiers beat up Chitungwiza residents to punish them for the death of a soldier.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front

Inhabitants of social housing protested to invoke access to gas supply and the electric grid for their homes.

actor1: Police Forces of Angola (1975-) Criminal Investigations Service

Hasam Movement claimed IED attack against the Myanmar Embassy in Cairo's Zamalek district, in response to the violence targeting Myanmar's Rohingya.

Intense fighting between the Ethiopian Somali police and the Oromo ethnic groups in the eastern Ethiopia has left "more than 30 people", including "more than a dozen army members", dead and several others injured in Mieso on 30/09.

The teachers of the municipalities of Al-Kubba, Al-Aqraq and Al-Maqib in the east of the country called on the parliament to enact a law guaranteeing the rights of teachers and guaranteeing them protection during the course of their work, threatened with escalating measures and stopping the study during the new year.They organized a sit-in at the Al-Ikhlas high school in Al-Qubba on Saturday to demand a salary increase and provide health insurance for them.

The Nigerian Army killed one Boko Haram member after repelling an attack by the insurgents at Bocos village in Bama Local Government Area, Borno State.

Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade against South-West State forces positioned at the animal market in Isha neighbourhood of Baidoa. The grenade landed on an empty space near the special police forces position. SWSPF opened fire after the explosion. There were no reports of casualties. Security forces arrived at the scene and arrested several people in connection to the incident.

An SNA soldier was shot and killed by another SNA soldier at Kalabeyr check point (c. 20 km North of Beletweyne town). The perpetrator attempted to escape from the scene but other SNA soldiers managed to capture and arrest him. The motive of the killing was not clear. Some reports suggested that there was a verbal argument.

Unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade at police on patrol near Karan Police Station in Karan district. At least two soldiers were wounded in the blast. The assailants escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

On the night of 30 September, several bomb attacks occurred across the capital, Mogadishu, targeting government militias based in Weydow area, Hodan district. Outcome of the Hodan blast is not known. Perpetrators not known.

A man, hailing from Warsan Geli sub clan Ugas labe, was abducted by men hailing from Isse Mohamoud Sub clan Reer Samakaab in Garowe town. The motive was believed to be clan revenge. Clan elders were reported to be in negotiations to diffuse tensions. The matter was reported to the police and investigations were reported to be ongoing.

A civilian man hailing from Dhulbahante was stabbed to death by another civilian male hailing from Ogaden clan over a land dispute at Kham Kham village (c. 18 km North East of Kismayo town). The perpetrator managed to escape from the location before the arrival of security forces.
IED detonates on MSR IVO Arabiiska. Three children WIA.
Police fired stun grenades to disperse a group of ANC members near the gates of the International Convention Centre in East London.
Residents of the Marikana informal settlement stormed the Philippi East police station demanding that police take action after 11 people were killed.
An estimated 100 residents stormed the Philippi East police station in protest demanding better policing in the area.

Over 200 people took to the streets of Soweto to celebrate the 2017 edition of Soweto Pride. Members of the gay community marched through Meadowlands and Dobsonville in Soweto protesting against hate crimes against them.
Unknown gunmen ambushed a public bus travelling from Wulu to Rumbek on 30 September, leaving at least one injured.
Police fired teargas and set fire to homes in El Salam district of Kassala to disperse demonstrators protesting against the planned destruction of their houses by the police.

Clash between the family of a displaced deceased girl and members attending her burial near the Bindisi camp in Central Darfur. The family claimed the girl had been raped before dying while doctors said she had been struck by lightning. The clash left one killed and another wounded. This is believed to have led to a retaliatory attack the following day, as tribesmen abducted seven in the camp. The gunmen allegedly set fire to houses and stole camp resident's properties. The abductees were released a few days later.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Suspected members of the security services abducted a civilian from his shop at Libya market in western Omdurman over unclear reasons.

Unidentified gunmen killed an RSF soldier near the Khamssa Dagayg IDP camp outside Zalingei, Central Darfur, at an unclear date. RSF attacked the camp in revenge over night and in the early hours of 1 October, killing a displaced person, injuring another nine and abducting one. Soldiers intervened to disperse the attackers.

Two families who had a quarrel during a wedding went to the hospital to be treated. After having to wait too long, the two families started to riot, fight against each other and ravaging the hospital. This is one of several incidents in which people started to riot in hospitals.
Soldiers beat up Chitungwiza residents to punish them for the death of a soldier.
Presumed ISIS/Katibat al-Fath militant killed & AK seized by the ANP in the area of Emir Abdelkader, Jijel Province.
3000 people went to the street to call for the liberation of ancient foreign Minister Djibril BassolÃ©, involved in the 2015 coup d'Ã©tat.

notes: Imbonerakure in Mugera accused a man of stealing and beat him, although there was no proof.

In Bale zone, Seweyna woreda, Ethiopian regime forces have been conducting house to house searches and confiscating weapons. The reason for this action is not known.
Youth erected barricades on the streets of Sangoya to protest authorities' refusal to collect trash in the city.
Police use teargas to disperse Egerton University students in Nakuru town. The students were violently protesting new examinations fees on September 29, 2017.
Protesters closed the main road connecting the town of Â«HarrabaÂ» in Mount Nafusa and the capital Tripoli, in protest at the killing of a citizen by masked bullets in front of a cafe in the town.

Unidentified gunmen assassinated four members of a reconciliation delegation from the Warfalla tribe near the town of Mezda, 140 km southeast of Tripoli. According to one report they were on their way to Sabratha to talk part in mediation attempts between the 48th battalion and the Anti-IS Operations Room. Other reports, however, say that they were to join in reconciliation talks between the Mashashia and the Qantrar tribe or Zintan.

Students protested in the city of Toamasina. Students reportedly burnt down a building.

notes: Robbery: A ICRC agent was robbed by armed men on a pick-up.
"Jidahists" said to have taken over Kanio, Kouakourou. Half population left with the army, those who stayed provided supplies and complied with their demands.

Over 500 retirees from the Delta Civil Service, organized under ACR, matched through major roads in Asaba in protest against non-payment of their pensions and gratuity by the state government for the past six years. A similar protest took place two days prior.
A police personnel and an Internally Displaced Person were killed on the evening of 29/09, in crossfire between military troops and Boko Haram in Bocobs, Bama.
Unknown gunmen attacked Gyangyang village in Jhar Chiefdom of Kanam Local Government area of Plateau state, killing the acting village head. The attack occurred during the early morning hours.

Government forces recapture Bariire following a supply of reinforcements. Military leadership claims 20 dead in the raid, including senior commanders. VOA claims 30 dead. The al Shabaab backed Somali Memo claims 95 dead.

Al Shabaab orchestrate complex attack against FOB Bariire, possibly two VBIEDs used. 17 SNAF Killed, base captured. The Somali Memo reports 23 dead. Following a supply of reinforcements, government forces recaptured the base.
Al Shabaab firing mortar rounds against base of Lanta Buuro. Causalities not known.
A military convoy is hit by an al Shabaab IED in Afgooye. Causalities not known.

Peaceful anti-government protest occur in Hodan. The reason for the protest is not known.

An IED buried along the road side, targeting an SNA reinforcement convoy en route to Bariire detonated. The explosion hit an SNA battle wagon destroying the vehicle. Nine soldiers were killed and two others were wounded.

An armed man from Dhulbahante/Hayaag clansman shot and killed a truck driver from Dhulbahante/Reer-Hagar sub clan near Cegag. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. Dhulbahante/Reer-Hagar sub clan militia were deployed to the outskirt of Ceegaag village. The area was reported to be tense.
Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against PSF base of Af Urur. Outcome and resulting casualties unknown.

notes: KDF shot a civilian driving Tabliq preachers. One civilian injured.

Members of the United Democratic Front (UDF) picketed alongside Right2Know and the newly-formed organisation #UniteBehind outside the National Prosecuting Authority's offices in Cape Town to protest state corruption.

A violent protest broke out at Makro in Woodmead. Protesters rampaged on the carpark outside Makro, throwing rocks at cars. Dozens of people were forced to stay in stores. The employees had been on strike for a week.
About 150 workers at the only Makro store in the Eastern Cape are on strike. The workers picketed at the entrance to the store at Kabega Park in Port Elizabeth.
A protest march to Remgro in Stellenbosch by Black First Land First (BLF) was a warning to billionaire businessman Johann Rupert and others.

Jubek state student union organised a peaceful march to the State Ministry of Education in Juba to protest against the lack of teaching in their schools. The teachers are said to be coming to school but unwilling to teach the students as they have not received their salaries for the past five months.

Clash between the family of a displaced deceased girl and members attending her burial near the Bindisi camp in Central Darfur. The family claimed the girl had been raped before dying while doctors said she had been struck by lightning. The clash left one killed and another wounded. This is believed to have led to a retaliatory attack the following day, as tribesmen abducted seven in the camp. The gunmen allegedly set fire to houses and stole camp resident's properties. The abductees were released a few days later.

Looting: Looting: in Mazrak Chams near Jebel Semmama, presumed Okba ibn Nafaa militants raided homes of villagers and stole supplies.
Police used teargas and rubber bullets to break up a peaceful Tajamuka protest in Harare, leaving five injured. A reporter covering the protest was also beaten.
Police used teargas and rubber bullets to break up a peaceful Tajamuka protest in Harare, leaving five injured. A reporter covering the protest was also beaten.

Several dozen families and relatives of people who tried to migrate illegally blocked Thursday afternoon the fishing port La GrenouillÃ¨re of Annaba. Many of them blocked the road to the port in order to oblige the naval forces to search their relatives, that got lost on the sea.

In East Hararghe, Golo Oda woreda, several young men were arrested and beaten for demonstrating against the violence occurring in Eastern Ethiopia. Locals surrounded the police station in opposition to the arrests. Policemen fired their weapons, accidentally hitting the city administrator. The current status of the administrator is not known.
Strike:Strikes: Opposition parties proclaimed a national "dead city" day to protest against government.

On 28 September, University of Nairobi students protested the arrest of Embakasi East MP Babu Owino. 27 students and staff at the University of Nairobi were reportedly injured when police used tear gas, beat them with wooden clubs, robbed them and threatened them with sexual violence.

Unknown gunmen killed a citizen in front of a cafe in the town of Haraba close to Jabal Nafusa.
In south Libya, clashes reported between the 116th Inf batt & the 8th near the oil warehouse of Sabha. The latter is accused of corruption.

Community members in Nsanje killed a village headman after accusing him of working with "blood suckers".
A Comanav boat was ambushed on the Niger river by unknown assailants. 5 people were wounded and rescued in Kouakourou.
A FAMa motorcycle was hit by an IED: 2 men dead.
Military forces kill two members of Boko Haram and recover weapons in Malamti, Guzamala LGA. Two of the soldiers were injured in the exchange.

Recruitment:Al Shabaab established forced recruitment drives in Bay and Bakool regions, exact locations not known. The drives caused civilians to flee these areas. The exact date of the beginnings of the recruitments are not mentioned by the source.

At least seven people were killed and several others wounded after a car bomb exploded in Xamae Weyne near the London Gate restaurant. Seven or eight dead. The car was moving at the time of explosion. It is not known if the perpetrators were in the car or if the bomb was remotely detonated. Al Shabaab suspected.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at government soldiers in a tea shop at Hamar Jadid village in Wardhigley district. The hand grenade landed on an empty place resulting in no fatalities. The assailants escaped. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.

A man has shot and killed by another man in Ceelal village. The motive of the incident was related to a revenge killing (reasons not articulated). Security forces managed to arrest the perpetrator and was reported to be under police custody in Caynabo.
A vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) detonated near Mogadishuâs Peace Gardens on 28th September. Causalities and indented target not known.
PSF launched operation against AS in El Dibir, Galgala Mountains. Outcome unknown.

A man with a mental illness was allegedly beaten to death by Red Ant Security Services in Midvaal during a service delivery protest in which protesters threw rocks at Red Army militia.
Community members marched to the municipal offices in Pietermaritzburg to demand that a politician step down, questioned whether the pistol was licensed.

Armed cattle raiders allegedly from Yirol attacked a cattle camp in Nyinmayar, Awerial North County, Eastern Lakes State, leaving seven killed and ten others injured. The attackers took 58 heads of cattle and killed 30.
On 28 September, four civilians were reportedly abducted and tukul houses were burned down in Mudubai village in Western Equatoria by armed men.
Militants severely beat and injured at least two IDPs from the Garsila IDP camp while they were tilling their farm at Yangusai, east of Garsila. The attackers tried to kidnap them, but they resisted.
Militiamen raided Tamboul village in eastern Jebel Marra, shooting dead four people, stealing about 150 livestock along with property, and setting fire to 50 houses. People fled to mountain caves.
Militiamen opened fire on a passenger lorry en route from Tawila to El Fasher, in the area of Tundabaya, and forced the passengers out of the bus, striping them of their valuables. Two were injured.

Tunisian Military forces indicated that military operations are taking place on the hills of Kasserine, seraching for armed militants.
Employees of the 'Banque Franco-Tunisienne" protested in front of the Ministry of Finance to intervene in the situation to make clear whether the bank will persist and be saved or go bankrupt.
Two explosives ripped through the house of Rubaga North MP Moses Kasibante. No casualties reported.
Protest by around 100 anti-corruption activists outside parliament. Police arrested a dozen.

Several dozen residents of the Douar El Guemardia, located in the commune of Frenda, 57 km west of Tiaret, observed a peaceful sit-in to demand from the local authorities connection to the electrical grid.

notes: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. The operations room has reportedly taken over Sabratha hospital. Another 9 reported killed between 26-30 September, bringing total to 26.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
actor2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A soldier from the Libyan National Army was wounded in clashes with the remnants of the Benghazi Shura Council of Revolutionaries that is still active in some houses near Sidi Khribish in As Sabiri al Gharbi in Benghazi.

PROPERTY DESTRUCTION: reportedly, churches are increasingly targeted by Islamist militias in the centre of Mali. Last week, Dobara's church was stripped of its furnishings that were burnt. Others churches have experienced the same accidents.
Malian army post in Imboraghane locality in Gawa area was attacked by armed men.
Mauritanian activists from the Movement for the Change of the Constitution have staged a protest against a newly announced anthem in the capital Nouakchott.

Boko Haram killed three people and set fire to 150 homes in a raid targeting rural communities in Guzamala local government area. The villages included in the attack were Goram and two neighbouring villages, Lingis and Ajidari.
ACR retirees gather in Asaba to call on the Delta State governor to pay stipends.
Private schools owners in Abakaliki, Ebonyi State protested the closure of their schools by suspected agents of the state government. The protesters numbered 60.
After a cement truck struck a group of students (accidently) killing seven, other students barricaded the Abuja-Lokoja highway in protest.
Gunmen abducted a top Zamfara State police officer and three members of his family on a remote area of Birnin-Gwari-Funtua road on  27/09. The officer was likely not on duty at the time of attack.
Two are dead after a convoy of civilian vehicles hit a pair of landmines on the Mafa to Dikwa road in Borno state, near Koibe. There were several other injuries. Perpetrators are yet unknown.
Skirmish erupted between two groups of SNAF soldiers. Casualties and motives unknown.
UPDF convoy struck by an al Shabaab IED in Marka District. Casualties unknown.
Unverified local reporting suggested 5 civilians were killed and six others injured during KDF airstrike on suspected al Shabaab positions on 27/09.
The Ethiopian government accused the Somaliland government of expelling 3,000 ethnic Oromos.  Date(s) not known.

27th September, AM, Xamar Weyne, Mogadishu: Ahmed Jamac Hirsi the son of Battulo Sheikh Ahmed, the chair of the Somali National Womenâs Organisation (SNWO) and the organisations secretary general Anab Abdullahi Hashi, have been killed in a targeted drive by shooting. Al Shabaab believed responsible.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at UAE-trained forces (it is assumed the soldier's country of origin is Somalia) at Tarabunka Junction in Hodan district. Two soldiers were wounded. The targeted troops shot towards the general direction of the attack but the assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Government forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters at Yabyab village (c. 20 km East of Xudur). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. An al Shabaab fighter was killed and two others were injured. SNA forces returned to their base in Xudur.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Howlwadaag Police Station in Howlwadag district. Police forces shot at the perpetrators but the perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of fatalities. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Somaliland police in Borama conducted a security operation where they clashed with an armed group claiming ownership of a plot of land located at Borama town centre. A police officer and two armed men were seriously injured. A violent demonstration occurred in Borama by the relatives of the armed group against police in Borama town.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An RCIED placed by the roadside and targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling at the outskirts of Bulo Marer district exploded. One soldier was injured and one Casspir was damaged. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
A protest took place in Borama on 27/09. The protest is related to a land-based clash in the area. Police reportedly made arrests in the days that followed.
A 15-year old boy was shot and killed at Hubal area located South of Bossaso. The perpetrator was arrested by police and taken to the central police station for further investigation.
Some students at the University of Fort Hare blocked the R63 at the entrance to the university. Students had thrown stones.
SASCO  Protesters held a march at the Cape Peninsula University of Technology called for classes to be restarted and private security to be removed from campus.

The historic St Mark's Church in District Six in Cape Town has been damaged after a protester threw a petrol bomb at the building amid continued unrest at the nearby Cape Peninsula University of Technology.
A group of 45 artisanal miners protested outside the Koffiefontein Magistrateâs Court after they were arrested for trespassing and malicious damage to property
Whoonga addicts and vagrants in Pietermaritzburg have been brutally beaten and chased out of part of the city centre by angry residents.
About 25 winery workers picketed outside Leeuwenkuil Family Vineyards in Stellenbosch.
A group of about 30 people pelted a block of flats with rocks in Umlazi. Gambushe was outside, watching events unfold.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a lorry transporting miners south of Tokar in the Red Sea state, leaving one killed and two injured. Reasons unclear.
Unknown gunmen abducted a pregnant woman from the Kundebe IDP camp in West Darfur. Her body was found the following day in a valley east of Ardamata. Reasons are unclear.
Militiamen raided Sousawa village, north of Tabit in Tawila locality, shooting and injuring at least two seriously, abducting a child, and stealing 84 heads of cattle.
Students at the Swaziland College of Technology (SCOT) vandalised property in protest.
Inhabitants from Homet Souk protested against the pollution and impurification of the city.
24 people were arrested in Ankole and Teso sub regions for holding unlawful assemblies to protest the anti age limit bill.
24 people were arrested in Ankole and Teso sub regions for holding unlawful assemblies to protest the anti age limit bill.
University of Makerere students protested against the anti age bill, lighting fires to block roads. At least 13 students were arrested.
Women who work in the Biskra public sector staged a sit-in at their workplace to denounce the deterioration of their working conditions.
Civil protection employees from Oran staged a sit-in to demand the resignation of the regional head of the civil protection units.
Dozens of social housing beneficiaries of Bendaoud gathered in front of the regional representation in Relizane to denounce the delay in the construction of housing units.
Strike:Strikes: Health sector workers went on a 72-hour strike to protest bad work conditions. On 30 September, another 48h strike movement was launched.

actor2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: Convoy of fuel trucks escorted by the gendarmerie subjected to IED+gunfire attack along the Tongomayel-Inata axis. 2 dead and several wounded among security forces. 2 more died at the hospital.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 5 Imbonerakure beat a man in Mwendo, who they accused of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: An environmental protection officer was beaten by CNDD-FDD officials in front of local fishermen, to punish him for confiscating fish from them.
16 armed men suspected to be LRA looted several households northeast of Ouanda Djalle, CAR. The assailants abducted 3 men as porters after looting peanuts, corn, cassava, and sugar.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 2 people were injured when a policeman threw a grenade in a market.
ISIS claimed IED detonation that struck armored vehicle between Abu Tawilah & Sheikh Zuweid, one conscript killed & another wounded.
The Islamic State executed 6 civilians accused of spying for the Egyptian government/military.
A group of people, reportedly organized by the Somali regional government, attacked and burned to death an Oromo man living in Somali regional state. The location of the attack is not known.
Looting: Looting: Armed men attacked a police post in Abobo neighbourhood and seized weapons. No gunshot was heard.
On 26 September, NASA supporters in Kisumu marched to the IEBC to demand the resignation of the Commission's top officials.
On 26 September, NASA supporters clashed with police outside the IEBC, while protesting the reshuffling of IEBC officials. Police officers used tear gas canisters to disperse them.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: One of Baset Igtet security advisers was shot outside his home in Suq al-Juma. He was part of the welcoming group for Igtet on his arrival at Mitiga airport. The family say that he was killed while he was cleaning his gun. There are other claims, however, that he was followed home and shot.

assoc_actor_1: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
notes: Ceasefire/Peacetalks:The âSecurity and Stability Operations Roomâ was set up by Abu Obeida Al-Zawi, a militant Islamist commander from Zawia. It claims to be a neutral force to ensure a cease-fire but is widely seen as reinforcements for the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi.

notes: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. Another 9 reported killed between 26-30 September, bringing total to 26.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a worker from the Ras-Lanuf oil terminal. He reportedly fought among the Petroleum Facilities Guard of Ibrahim Jadhran some months ago.
Unknown gunmen kidnapped the head of the media unit in Ajdbiya. He was released some days later.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Clashes broke out between the Libyan National Army and elements of the Shura Council fo Derna Mujahedeen. Several artillery shells were fired by both sides.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Sirte Protection Force established several security posts after receiving information about the infiltration of members of the Da'ash organization into the center and suburbs of the city. The checkpoints are spread through the entrances of the city in the areas of Dhahir, Saffran, the second residential neighborhood, the Corniche, Swawa, Abuhadi and AbuZahia and the entrance to the South Gate. The sources pointed out that the checkpoints are manned by gunmen, asking for ID cards of motorists.

source: BBC Monitoring, Sahara Media News Agency
notes: Several gold miners in Tiris Zemmour, in Mauritania's north, were injured when a military helicopter inadvertently fired at them on the morning of 26 September. The helicopter was chasing a group of smugglers who then got mixed in between the miners.
Swakopmund residents across the racial, social and economic spectrum protested over the murder of two people.

The women's wing of Isoko Development Union, IDU, protests against warring Igbide and Okpolo-Enwhe communities in Isoko South Local Government Area, Delta State, demanding an end to hostilities. The protest took place in Igbide.
A suicide bomber killed five people on 26/09 in a mosque in northeast Nigeria at Dikwa. Boko Haram are believed to be responsible.

26 Sept, c. 1130 hrs. Two groups of SNA soldiers clashed at Jowhar market in Hanti-Wadag district. The SNA soldiers disputed over the tax collection process. A civilian bystander was killed and two others were injured. Local police forces arrested the perpetrators.

Unidentified armed attackers using pistols, believed to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a police officer at Jiirada Macalin Nuur village in Dharkenley district. The body of the victim was taken to CID for examination and further investigations. The assailants managed to escape. Police forces arrived at the scene and conducted search operations. There were no reports of arrests.

26 Sept, Xerta (a religious group) and combined clan militias (not named) clashed at Balley village (c. 22 km East of Garowe town) after a land dispute. One person was killed and four others were seriously injured. Investigations were reported to be ongoing. The clash may have occurred on the 27th.
25th September, PM, Taraka, Gedo: KDF (Kenyan Defence Force) withdrawal from AMISOM position in Taraka. Al Shabaab gained control of the village the following day.

26th September, PM, Taraka, Gedo: Kenyan defence Force (KDF) airstrikes target the forward operating base at Taraka which Kenyan ground troops withdrew from on the PM of 25th September. Six civilians killed. It is believed KDF was attempting to destroy the base so it could not be utilised by al Shabaab.
26th September, AM, Johwar, Middle Shabelle: One elder killed and two others wounded by Somali National Army (SNA). The reasons for the killing are not known.
26th September, PM, IVO Luuq, Gedo: Elder, Hussein Mohamed Abdullahi "Dhofar" Beheaded by al Shabaab. The execution comes after the elder met with the Jubaland President.
Attack without casualties: Assailant hurled a hand grenade towards an unidentified target. Grenade exploded in an empty house. No casualties. Assailant escaped.
Defusal: IED discovered and safely dismantled near Beldage Hospital. No casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: AMISOM vehicle drives over a civilian car and drags it over 100m near KM4. Father and son injured. Mogadishu Mayor appealed for legal prosecution of the driver.
110 disabled students at the University of Limpopo staged a protest on campus.

Five unknown gunmen attacked a UN IDP camp in Bentiu, leaving one person killed and five others critically injured. UNMISS peacekeepers were said to have come to people's rescue too "late". The attackers had allegedly come from Kuergeng area in Ethiopia.
On 26 September, an SPLA vehicle was ambushed in Western Bahr el-Ghazal near the town of Mangayat, reportedly resulting in the death of one SPLA soldier, two missing and two civilians injured.
Parents of students shut down a primary school in Houareb, Chebika. The parents organized a protest march on the main road of the city to protest against the lack of teaching personel.
Parents of students shut down a school in Bouhajla protesting against the lack of teaching personel.
A number of security guards carried out a protest in front of the ministry of social affairs.

Security operatives forced some legislators out of the Chambers as they refused to leave the room to protest their suspension after disagreements over the debate to lift the presidential age limit of 75 years.
Anti age limi protests in Mukono. An unidentified police officer undressed the Municipal speaker as they tried to arrest her for participating in the protests.
Police dispersed a demonstration against the anti age bill in Kabale university.

Age limit protests spread to Arua, Mbarara, Masaka. Police fired bullets, teargas to disperse hundreds of youths who have taken onto the streets over the age limit. Several arrests were made. Protesters reportedly blocked streets, burned disused vehicle tyres and brandished placards with messages denouncing the move to lift the age cap.

Age limit protests spread to Arua, Mbarara, Masaka. Police fired bullets, teargas to disperse hundreds of youths who have taken onto the streets over the age limit. Several arrests were made. The police engaged the protesters in running battles on Kumi, Republic and Bishop Wasikye roads as they pelted stones at the anti-riot officers.
Police in Masaka District arrested six members of Forum for Democratic Change (FDC), who staged a march to protest the impending removal of the presidential age limit from the Constitution.

Business paralysed in Mbarara town as police battled with Forum for Democratic Change's secretary for mobilization Ingrid Turinawe and the party presidential candidate Amuriat Patrick Oboi who led a procession against lifting of the presidential age limit. After ten minutes the crowd started pelting stones at police which prompted them to fire teargas to disperse them.
People protested against the anti age bill in Mbale. Several arrested by police.

Beneficiaries of social housing (SPL) gathered in front of the General Directorate of the National Fund of Equalization of Social Works (FNPOS) to express their anger following the great delay in the provision of appartments.
Dozens of inhabitants from Grarem-Gouga gathered in front of the seat of the governorate to protest against deteriorating living standards.

Medical workers staged a sit-in in front of the EHU hospital in Oran to denounce a negative media campaign that maligns their work. On the same day, civil protection employees from Oran staged a sit-in to demand the demission of the regional head of the civil protection units.
The inhabitants of Kiziba began to beat a man who was accused of robbery. A local official intervened to save him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man who had questioned the authorities about a fine was attacked at his house by 3 Imbonerakure and 3 elected officials. They destroyed his door and then beat and arrested him.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a student from the Lycee Communal in Nyabitsinda to force her to return to school. The Imbonerakure in Nyabitsinda are attacking truant students because they believe it tarnishes the image of the ruling party.
2 people seriously wounded after BokoHaram incursion in Limani
Abs entered Zemio city and clashed with Janjaweed and Fulani controlling the city since late July. Several dead are reported.
Looting: Looting: A group of suspected LRA forces comprised of men, women, and children looted a peanut field near Sam Ouandja, CAR.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: A teenager was killed and 7 people were injured when police fired at demonstraters in Bukavu. The demonstraters then set the police station on fire.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Police broke up a sit-in outside the Minsitry of Foreign Affairs, arresting 27 Lucha activists.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Students at the UPN rioted to protest against mismanagement of the exams. They destroyed buses and private vehicles. The police intervened with teargas.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Nyatura and Hutu militia attacked FARDC forces in Rubare. No injuries have been reported.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 6 Mayi Mayi Yakutumba were killed when FARDC forces fought to regain the territory near Mboko.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 5 people were killed and a dozen injured in clashes between the police and protesters in Panzi.
Mayi Mayi militia occupied Nyakokoma town and kidnapped 16 fishermen.
The Egyptian military killed six Islamic State Militants and arrested 31 more in North Sinai.

Liyu police have attacked areas in Chinaksan woreda while in the presence of Oromia special forces. Causalities unknown. People have complained that the Oromo special forces have done nothing to protect them and that the violence continues despite their presence. It is not known if these complaints were manifest as a protest.
Jubilee supporters protest against the remarks by Embakasi East MMP Babu Owino against the president. The protesters burnt tyres in Kiambu.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Pro- and counter-demonstrators of Swiss-based Libyan businessman and former Presidential Candidate Igtet clashed on Tripolis martyrs square with fistfights. Security forces intervened and seperated them with dozens of vehicles. The pro-demonstrators initially gathered in Tripoli to show their support of Igtet who had called on people to protest.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Truckers in Abu Issa have held a protest against being forced to bribe their way through militia roadblocks or face long delays on the route from Tripoli to Tunisia. If they did not pay âfeesâ at checkpoints on the road, they were turned back or held up. This included at the border itself where the truckers claimed that unless they were prepared to pay, they were not able enter Tunisia.
Sabha inhabitants went to the streets to show their support with former Presidential Candidate Abdel Basit Igtet who had called for protests on 25 September in Tripoli.

actor1: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi

notes: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. Between 17-25 September, at least 17 people died in the clashes.
Nalut inhabitants went to the streets to show their support with former Presidential Candidate Abdel Basit Igtet who had called for protests on 25 September in Tripoli.
Az Zawiyah inhabitants went to the streets to show their support with former Presidential Candidate Abdel Basit Igtet who had called for protests on 25 September in Tripoli.
Misratah inhabitants went to the streets to show their support with former Presidential Candidate Abdel Basit Igtet who had called for protests on 25 September in Tripoli.
Head of the Radiology Department at the Sabha Medical Center, Mohammed Senoussi Hamza, was kidnapped. He was released three days after his abduction.

Residents of Bani Walid staged a protest in commemoration of the drama when armed militias stormed the town 5 years ago, following a decision by the General National Congress. The residents of Bani Walid demand that the House of Representatives investigates the decision and criminally pursues its perpetrators.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: Clashes broke out between the Libyan National Army and elements of the Shura Council of Derna Mujahedeen after the LNA was monitoring their movements on the axis al-Fatayeh-Martuba.
A gendarme police officer was killed in clashes with Dahalo militia in Tsiroanomandidy.
A MSA checkpoint was attacked by unidentified men: 2 MSA men and 5 assailants killed, several prisoners captured.
President of communal health organization abducted by presumed jihadists in Dioura

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Unknown gunmen abducted three individuals and burned down the gendarmerie post in Mourdiah, Cercle of Nara, Koulikoro Region.  JNIM claimed the attack on October, 17th.
Marabout killed and an apprentice abducted by unknown gunmen in Godoware

Protests against racketeering customs officers & gendarmes turned deadly in Koury: 1 protester shot dead & 2 severely wounded by gendarmes; customs station, gendarmerie, Water & Forest Dept. chief's house burned by the protesters.

A prisoner and an employee died in Toulal 2 prison in Meknes. The prisoner had attempted to take one of the officials of the prison as hostage. Faced with the failure of attempts to neutralize the detainee, a prison official was "forced" to fire warning shots. These shots hit the inmate in the legs and hips.The detainee then succumbed to his injuries. An official from the prison of Toulal 2 lost his life during this intervention.

Former Secretary to Oyo state government, Barrister Sharrafaden, three correspondents and others were nearly assassinated as gunmen attacked the Olubadan palace, Popoyemoja, Ibadan, shortly before the installation of some Baales. The reason for the attack is not known. Following the attack one of the suspects were nearly lynched by a vigilante group.

Former Secretary to Oyo state government, Barrister Sharrafaden, three correspondents and others were nearly assassinated as gunmen attacked the Olubadan palace, Popoyemoja, Ibadan, shortly before the installation of some Baales. The reason for the attack is not known. Following the attack one of the suspects were nearly lynched by a vigilante group.
Infighting between two SNAF units left one SNAF soldier killed and two injured.
25th September, 2000L, Wardhiigley, Mogadishu: Grenades thrown at a Security checkpoint in Wardghiigley. One NISA two civilian bystanders killed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: Detonate/Dismantle:Djiboutian EOD team successfully dismantled IED on road leading to water point. No casualties.

Al Shabaab elements hurled a hand grenade at an FGS troop position at Towfiq neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. The governmental forces responded with gunfire but the perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of fatalities.

An RCIED buried alongside the road near Cali-Kamin junction neighbourhood in Wardhigley district, targeting a mobile NISA technical, exploded. At least one soldier and two civilian bystanders were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two armed men using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and injured a civilian female at Ahmed Gurey ward in Hodan district. Bodyguards of the Presidential state minister, who were nearby the location of the incident, responded and captured the suspects. Banadir Regional Administration officials arrived at the scene of the incident and surrendered the perpetrators to the security agencies for further investigations.

An unknown man shot and injured two men at a tea-shop in Elafweyn town. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. Police were reported to be in pursuit of the perpetrator. The victims were taken to Burao Hospital for further medication.
Unidentified gunman kill two civilians at coffee shop. Assailant escaped, motives unknown.
Arrests: Galmudug troops seen moving around and establishing checkpoints around Cadaado. The forces put the Parliament Speaker house arrest.
Supporters of Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed over unknown motives. One youth killed.
MoSF cordoned-off suspected VBIED near KM4.
Residents from an informal settlement near Sir Lowry's Pass Village took their frustration to the streets causing road closures. The angry residents barricaded the road with burning tyres.

Deployment:Authorities started to deploy special task forces throughout the residential areas of Juba to control the recent rise in armed night-time robberies by members of the security forces (including members of the national security, police, SPLA and Presidential Guards).

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Clashes continued between government and SPLA-IO forces in Nhialdiu on 25 September. According to local authorities, 16 people were wounded in the initial clashes and over 10 people, including two children, were reported killed. The civilians have fled into the bushes surrounding villages of Nhaildiu. A water point was destroyed and a local NGO health facility was looted completely. Humanitarian staff of the local NGO have fled to Bentiu town and the health facility remained closed as of early October.
Teachers who recently passed an exam to teach in public institutions protested in front of regional prefectures to demand the government to employ them.
An old man stepped on a mine nearby the Doulab-Zone on Jebel Semmama. His leg had to be amputated.
Teachers and parents protested in front of the school in Korba against the high number of students. Classes therefore did not take place.
Teachers who recently passed an exam to teach in public institutions protested in front of regional prefectures to demand the government to employ them.
Teachers who recently passed an exam to teach in public institutions protested in front of regional prefectures to demand the government to employ them.

The Skhira industrial zone had been blocked due to a sit-in by workers. They blocked a road leading to a company in the zone to demand employment and development for the region before proceeding to shut down the whole industrial zone.
Hospital employees in Tataouine staged a sit-in to denounce the aggression of a nurse in the hospital.

Kamuli Municipality was on Monday rocked by gunfire for over three hours as police battled anti-age limit protesters led by opposition Democratic Party [DP] National Youth Chairman Moses Bigirwa. Police intervened to disperse anti-age limit protesters loyal to the Democratic Party (DP) in Kumuli.

Students protesting new academic rules surrounded the Vice Chancellor Prof. Celestine Obuaâs office. Some students however snuck through the neighboring regional referral hospital gates and poured onto the main road which forced police to unleash teargas.
Over 100 residents of Kahunyira Cell, Rwamucucu Sub County in Rukiga district stormed offices of the Kabale District State Attorney, protesting the release of people who had been arrested for murder.

Dozens of citizens in N'sigha commune, a few kilometers south of the town of Khenchela, expressed their dissatisfaction with the delay in allocating 215 social housing units. The demonstrators blocked the section of a road, linking Khenchela to Biskra, for almost two hours, using stones and miscellaneous objects.
Social housing beneficiaries in Ouled Djellal protested to denounce the delay in the construction of housing units, indicating that they have been waiting for more than 14 years.
Algeria's National People's Army eliminated a militant in Tagrara, Merad municipality, province of Tipaza, some 80 km west of Algiers.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat 3 men. 1 lost consciousness, so they set him alight to ensure that he died.
An LRA group attacked the community of Kpabou, CAR. They looted the community of food and non-food items and abducted 23 community members.
Students at the Higher Teachers Institute in Bukavu held a sit-in to protest professors living in a building.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Army claims to have regained control of Nundu after offensives against Mayi Mayi Yakutumba.

notes: Army claims to have regained control of the villages of Kabumbe and Munene near Mboko after offensives against Mayi Mayi Yakutumba.

notes: Army claims to have regained control of Lusambo after clashes with Mayi Mayi Yakutumba.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Army claims to have regained control of Swima after clashes with Mayi Mayi Yakutumba.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Youth patrolling in Panzi claimed to have taken away three police officers, whom they accused of being the perpetrators of burglaries listed in their environment.
In East Hararge Zone, Goro Gutu woreda, Liyu police crossed the border and killed an unknown number of people. Oromo residents responded, reportedly killing 5 Liyu policemen.
In East Hararge Zone, Goro Gutu woreda, Liyu police crossed the border and killed an unknown number of people (coded as 10). Oromo residents responded, reportedly killing 5 Liyu policemen.
People took the street and erected barricades on the main road to protest the lack of electricity.
On 24 September, eight men were found dead in Trans Mara after dispute over land between the Maasai and Kipsigis.
A woman was abducted by unkown gunmen in Al-Rahba, Benghazi. She was released several hours later.

Two leaders of a Dahalo group were killed in clashes with police in Antamponandapa,_Ankadinondry_Sakay.

notes: 3 peacekeepers killed and 5 others severely wounded in IED/mine attack on axis Ansongo-Gao.
Protests took place in the town of Imzouren. Protesters have called for better living conditions and for the release of the detainees.
Inhabitants of Zagora protested against the shortage of water supply in the city.
3 Nigerian policemen, 1 gendarme and 1 civilian killed in attack on checkpoint in Assamakka, Arlit near Algerian border.

At least 10 people were arrested after thousands of people uprooted from their homes by the Boko Haram insurgency protested in Dalori. The group was arrested after they ignored orders to disperse and return to their camps. The protesters were calling for better food, water and healthcare.

Residents of Omun-Ekiti protest after a favoured politician is suspended from the government assembly. The lawmaker was believed to have been suspended for refusing to renounce his association and loyalty to his political benefactor.
Boko Haram attacks Kurmiri village of Titiwa Ward, Magumeri LGA on the night of 24/09 killing an Imam and 20 others.
Arrest:Police forces arrest Idris Ibrahim Babawo in Ondo State, a top Boko Haram commander, who also travels under the names of "Idoko" or "Nagada."

Three policemen providing security at the Ogba Zoo were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be kidnappers. The attackers abducted the director of the park. The perpetrators took the officer's weapons and fled.

Three policemen providing security at the Ogba Zoo were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be kidnappers. The attackers abducted the director of the park. The perpetrators took the officer's weapons and fled.

24 Sept, Two groups of government soldiers clashed at SiiSii village in Yaqshid district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. At least two civilian bystanders were injured.

24th September, AM, Gaduud, Lower Jubba: Al Shabaab have reportedly attacked a base used by combined SNA (Somali National Army) and IJA (Interim Jubbaland Administration) troops. Al Shabaab also claim to have killed American personnel although this is highly likely al Shabaab propaganda. As there are no known US military units operating from this base. Other causalities not known.

24th September, PM, Galgala mountains, Bari: Reports of fighting between al Shabaab and Puntland security forces (PFJ). Al-Shabab claim they killed four soldiers including the commander of the unit it attacked. It also claims to have wounded five others when the fighting erupted in Galgala Mountains.
24th September, PM, Dharkeynley, Mogadishu: SNA General Abdullahi Mohamed Sheikh Qururuh former deputy head of logistics and his bodyguard were assassinated, al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
SNAF raided an al Shabaab camp near Qoryoley. Casualty figures unknown.

Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a moving SNA vehicle passing through Fagah junction in Yaqshid district. The grenade landed and exploded onto an empty place causing no damages or fatalities. The perpetrators escaped.

SNA forces based in Daynuunay village launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters at Lowi-Gadud village (c. 08 km North East of Daynuunay and c. 20 km East of Baidoa town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab retreated. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were injured. SNA forces departed from the location but al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA forces on the way back to their base. An SNA soldier was injured in the attack.

Somali National Army [SNA] forces in Lower Shabelle region [southern Somalia] have attacked an al-Shabab position in an area under Janale district on 24 September. The forces raided Mushaari area near Janale, then fighting ensued between them and al-Shabab fighters in the area. The al Shabaab positions were destroyed. Causalities not known.
24th September, PM, Waaberi, Mogadishu: Reports that hand grenades were thrown at Mogadishu security forces, four reported as wounded. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy en route to Yoontoy. Casualties unknown. An IED possibly initiated the ambush.
24th September, AM, Ceel Adde, Gedo: KDF airstrike carried out against al Shabaab camp allegedly used to train child soldiers. Four munitions reportedly hit the camp, casualties currently unknown.

A civilian man was shot and killed by a traffic police officer at Geed Jacayl area in Wardhigley district. The man and the police officer had a verbal altercation over tax issues before the police officer killed him. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. Residents in the area protested against the killing of the civilian man. Government security forces in the area dispersed the crowd.

Arrest:Galmudug authorities prevent all hotels from hosting anti-government meetings, while VP Mohamed Hashi is put under house arrest, reasons not known. The following day, Galmudug troops seen moving around and establishing checkpoints around Cadaado. Parliament Speaker put under house arrest.

A former senior figure called Gaddafi, who defected from al Shabaab, was targeted by al Shabaab on the tarmac road at Sugure village (c. 35 km South of Bossaso). Initial reports indicated that at least five clan militiamen were killed and three others were injured. The injured were taken to hospital for treatment.
Militiamen loyal to the Sharif Sakin regional administration killed two traditional elders belonging to the Geladle sub clan.
IED strikes SNAF convoy. One SNAF injured.
Al Shabaab attack FOB Gaduud. Casualties unknown.

They later marched to the university of Khartoum. Police dispersed the protesters with teargas and arrested dozens.
Tunisian police forces used teargas to disperse rioters that had blocked the main road in the village to demand the release of a street-vendor that recently had been arrested.
Arrest:ARRESTS: The police arrested the leader of #ThisFlag, Mawarire, for calling for protests.

The workers of the Urban and Sub-Urban Public Transportation in Ghardaia Municipality went on an open strike in front the headquarters of the Foundation, demanding the removal of the Director, due to his failure in running the company. They raised slogans demanding the end of arbitrary decisions.
Social housing beneficiaries from Ouled Djellal protested against the sudden stop in the construction of their housing units.
GFAT (CT-unit) patrol targeted by a mine/IED around 6h this morning on the axis Djibo-Mentao, 4 soldiers severely wounded following the blast.

The body of a soldier, possibly murdered by Boko Haram, was found this morning on the road Zamga-Djibril.

They were released a few hours later after an uproar (it is unknown if this was a protest) by the local community.  There were reports of beatings. Oromo youth were also arrested as they were traveling from Asabo town to Mieso to support the people who were banished from Somali region. Many also complained of "beatings."

Attack on checkpoint in Assamakka, Arlit. 4 dead in the ranks of security forces and 1 civilian.

Al Shabaab ambushed SNAF convoy patrolling outskirts of Kabtan Laas. Casualties unknown.

Al Shabaab attacked a government troop position at Caymiska neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

Armed men, believed to be part of Khatumo armed militia, attacked a hotel located in Buhodle town where the President of Khatumo was accommodated. The armed men clashed with the guards of the President of Khatumo at the hotel and stole the vehicle belonging to the President of Khatumo. It was later revealed that the armed men were disgruntled due to non-payment of salaries for the last eight months.

Pastoralists from Omar Mohamud clan, sub-clan of Majeerteen, and Saâad clan, sub-clan of Habargidir, clashed at Qod Gaashaan area (c. 50 km East of Galkayo). Three people were killed and seven others were injured. The situation was reported to be calm but unpredictable.

On 23 September 2017, a peaceful demonstration was conducted by supporters of the President of Galmudug Interim Administration (GIA) and Vice President of GIA in Cadado town. The protest may have occurred the previous day.
23rd September, PM, Faafax Dhuun, Gedo: Road side IED strikes KDF (Kenyan Defence Force) convoy. One KDF vehicle was reportedly destroyed. Causalities not known.
