A group of seven militiamen ambushed a car near Wadi Gargash, 25 km from Buram town in South Darfur, leaving a medical assistant killed and two injured. The assaillants seized the vehicle and fled.

Journalists and Civil Society Activists organized a protest in front of the security HQ of the region in Sfax to denounce the aggression of a Journalist from Diwan FM, Hamdi Soussi, earlier this week by police forces.

A hand-made bomb exploded with no casualties. Authorities link the event to the political turmoil taking place in anglophone Cameroon.

Military forces kill two members of Boko Haram near Feri-Feri and Tashan Goto axis in Bama on 22/09.

Somali government troops and al-Shabab fighters clashed near the village of el-Ade, Hiiraan region, 70km from Belet Weyne. The fighting, which el-Ade residents described to the media as "intense", resulted in fatalities and injury. At least three combatants were killed and many others were wounded on the warring sides.

Hundreds of protesters took to the streets of Galkayo to show their support for Galmudug's president Ahmed Duale Gelle (Haf) over his decision on the Gulf crisis. The protesters waved placards showing support for the Galmudug leader, and condemning the decision by his deputy and the regional parliament to oppose his stance.

A peaceful demonstration was conducted at South Galkayo supporting the President of Galmudug for his press release against FGS neutral positon in the Gulf crisis in cutting ties to Qatar. However, the Vice President and Speaker of Galmudug were against the decision of the President of Galmudug.

A Hawadle clan militiaman shot and killed a fellow clan member at Hoolmooge village (c. 18 km South of Beletweyne town). The perpetrator attempted to escape from the scene but other clan militiamen managed to capture him. After the incident, al Shabaab fighters arrived at the scene and arrested the perpetrator who was taken to Booca village (c. 25 km South of Beletweyne). The motive of the killing was not clear. It was reported that the victim verbally argued with the perpetrator during a cultural play.
Al Shabaab attacked PSF base of Af Urur. Casualties unknown. Mortars and heavy machine gun fire used.
Clan militia (not identified) intercepted and hijacked three trucks. One driver injured as he tried to escape. Incident motivated by ongoing clan clashes in the area.
Al Shabaab attacked SNAF base of Ceel Cadde. Casualties unknown.
Armed clashes erupted between al Shabaab fighters and local militiamen near Ceel Cali. Three militiamen killed.
Heavy fighting erupted between al Shabaab militants and Galmudug forces. Casualties and chain of events that led to the fighting unconfirmed.
Hawadle clansman shot and killed fellow clansman. Al Shabaab arrested perpetrator.
Hundreds of people from across the Western Cape gathered at the department of agriculture, forestry and fisheries (DAFF) in Cape Town to protest the current fishing quotas.
Two people were killed during a tense clash between illegal dwellers and red ant officials over land in Lenasia, south of Johannesburg.

Police have fired bullets and tear gas to disperse students who have gone on strike demanding the immediate release of their colleagues who are currently detained at Wandageya Police Station.

Residents of Kabonera Town on Thursday blocked Masaka -Mutukula -Bukoba highway protesting the release of suspects in a recentÂ attackÂ which left two people dead and three others injured. Workers of the municipal council suspended their work in the municipality until the availability of fuel supplies and stations and in support of youth protests that took place in the area last week.

Armed clashes broke out in the town of Umm al-Aranab (150 km) south of Sabha town between the Tabu tribe on the one hand and armed members of the the Chadian Zaghawa tribe on the other. The armed clashes continued since Wednesday, because of a recent attack by an armed group belonging to the Zaghawa on the gate of Tmassa (230 km) southeast of Sabha. The sources said that the attack on Tmassa was against the backdrop of the closure of the Libyan-Chadian border. However, the Zaghawa also reacted to a siege by Tebu militias on a Chinese company in Umm el Araneb where militants from the Zaghawa tribe are based.
6 people were killed in a Dahalo bandit attack in Antanifotsy.
FAMa vehicle struck by IED in the area of Boulkessi near the Burkina Faso border, 2 Malian soldiers wounded.
ICRC vehicle seized and staff stripped of belongings by presumed armed bandits near BorÃ©, axis Konna-Douentza.

Finally, Malian army arrived in Kanio, to conduct patrols, but the usual downside a Peul neighborhood in the village subjected to searches, with multiple families stripped of their belongings and maltreated.

The Joint Task Force, Operation DELTA SAFE (ODS) has raided a militants camp at Obiozimini, Ogba-Egbema- Ndoni Local Government Area of Rivers state and rescued six kidnapped victims including two soldiers. Some of the perpetrators were reported wounded. The victims were abducted on 18 September.

Unidentified gunmen on 21/09 invaded the Tsafe Command of the Federal Road Safety Corps, FRSC, in Zamfara, killing an official. Area security operatives mobilized following the attack, killing one of the perpetrators.

notes: 21st September, 0930L, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: Road side bomb targets BNDF convoy. Injuries reported.

21st September, AM Ceel Waaq, Gedo: KDF forces pull out Ceel Waaq one day after pulling out of Bardheere in Gedo. The move may be tactical. Conflicting report: The Somali Memo (al Shabaab media outlet) claims al Shabaab gained control of the city on 16/09.
Al Shabaab executed Zakat collector Hussein Moalim in Buula Fuulay, near Diinsoor.

21 Sept, c. 1630 hrs. JALDESO, CRIME: An armed man, believed to have defected with his government issued AK47 rifle at Buulo-guduud base on 19 September 2017, briefly exchanged small arms fire with a group of al Shabaab fighters at Jaldeso area (c. 45 km East of Dhobley town). The armed man managed to escape unharmed.

South-West Administration soldiers clashed at Diinsoor town (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. The ISWA soldiers belong to Geelid and Dabare clans who disputed over the killing of ISWA soldier from Geelidle clan by ISWA soldier from Dabare clan on 18/09. ISWA soldiers from Geelidle clan were isolated from the rest of the ISWA forces and amassed at area in the town in protest of the incident.

Al Shabaab fighters fired about seven mortar shells which impacted on vacant land in front of Puntland front line base at Afurur village of Galgala Mountain (c. 65 km South West of Bossaso). One Dervish soldier was wounded. There were no reports of immediate damages and arrests.

A young boy was shot dead by police in Dilla after two youngsters supporting Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed at Dilla town. The clash erupted after Kulmiye supporter waved a Kulmiye flag among supporters of Wadani opposition party, led by the leader of Wadani Party, that arrived the town (2nd event)

A young boy was shot dead by police in Dilla after two youngsters supporting Kulmiye and Wadani political parties clashed at Dilla town. The clash erupted after Kulmiye supporter waved a Kulmiye flag among supporters of Wadani opposition party, led by the leader of Wadani Party, that arrived the town.

South-West Administration soldiers clashed at Diinsoor town (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. The ISWA soldiers belong to Geelid and Dabare clans who disputed over the killing of ISWA soldier from Geelidle clan by ISWA soldier from Dabare clan on 18/09. ISWA soldiers from Geelidle clan were isolated from the rest of the ISWA forces and amassed at area in the town in protest of the incident.
Al Shabaab executed Zakat collector Hussein Moalim.
Detonation: IED targets SNPF convoy. Device detonates prematurely, no casualties.
Gunmen from Darod/Leykaase open fire to stop a vehicle. One death reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Detonation: IED targets AMISOM convoy. Device detonates prematurely, no casualties.
Members of the Gauteng Emergency Medical Services sang and danced as they marched through Newtown during a protest in Johannesburg.
Police and about 150 residents of Ocean View in Cape Townâs south peninsula clashed. This was the second consecutive day of protests

Unknown gunmen ambushed a commercial vehicle along the Torit-Juba road, leaving one killed and three injured. The vehicle was transporting South Sudanese refugees who were returning from the Kakuma refugee camp in Kenya.

actor1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
actor2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
notes: A force of 100 NSS officers stopped a UNMISS convoy at gunpoint and beat the unit's commander in Juba.

Although organized forces conducted patrols to reduce criminal activities in Torit town, the local population reported that SPLA soldiers on night patrol harassed and physically assaulted a civilian on 21 September.
Unknown gunmen ambushed an INGO vehicle travelling from Rumbek to Aduel on 21 September, leaving at least one injured.
IDPs at camps in Zalingei, Central Darfur, gathered in mass protest in solidarity with other IDPs in South Darfur protesting president Bashir's visit to their camp.
A group of four armed men opened fire on the home of a displaced man at the Nierteti IDP camp in Central Darfur, leaving his son killed.

actor1: Twic East Area Youth Militia (South Sudan)
notes: Suspected gunmen from Twic state shot at two MSF employees while returning to their home in Abyei, leaving one killed and the other injured. Date unclear - report dated 21 September.

source: Sudan Tribune; Human Rights Watch; ACJPS
notes: IDPs at Kalma camp outside Nyala, South Darfur, staged demonstrations and dug trenches around the camp over 19-22 September to protest a planned presidential visit at the camp. On the fourth day of the protests (corresponding to the day of the president's visit), officials accused some IDPs, including infiltrated rebel SLM-AW elements, of firing at Sudanese forces, leading to a violent response by the government forces and RSF militia that left at least five killed and 29 injured, including a government soldier.

assoc_actor_2: Kababeesh Ethnic Militia (Sudan); Zayadiya Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
notes: RSF forces clashed with members of the Musa Hilal's SARC and Zayadiya and Kababish tribesmen involved in some of the largest human trafficking operations on the Sudanese-Egyptian-Libyan border, leaving 19 killed, including 17 pro-RAC members, and six injured. RSF arrested  seven of the "gang leaders" along with 48 international illegal migrants.

Thousands of protesters inÂ TogoÂ Thursday joined demonstrations around the country for a second day against the rule of President Faure Gnassingbe, the scion of Africa's oldest political dynasty. The atmosphere was tense amid accusations of harsh repression by security forces on Wednesday, when at least 77 people were injured by rubber bullets in the far north of the country, according to the opposition.
Substitute Teachers from Ben Arous continued their protest movement to demand a regularisation of their professional situation.

Hundreds of students at the country's main Makerere University in Kampala waved branches and chanted "K'ogikwatako!" -- meaning "Don't dare touch it!" in the local Luganda language -- in reference to the constitutional clause on age limits. Armed officers -- including military police -- fired volleys of teargas forcing the students to flee to their residence halls and hostels.
In the northern town of Lira, demonstrators left a mock coffin at a central road junction with "The removal of the presidential age limit is the death of our country" painted on the side.
Police fired tear gas to disperse protestors and arrested oposition politicians who protested the age limit bill in Kampala.

Students at the National University of Science and Technology attempted to force their way into the administration block to protest mismanagement of medical aid fees. The Riot Police suppressed the demonstration.

assoc_actor_1: UGCAA: General Union of Algerian Merchants and Artisans
notes: The milk vendors of the wilaya of Guelma decided to protest against a decision by the governor (on a proposal of the Trade Department) to shut the business of several of them.

The mayor of Dechmia in Bouira-region was attacked with Molotov cocktails. The mayor was not hit by the projectiles. The national gendarmerie opened an investigation to determine the motive of this attack.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat and strangled a woman in Buhiga. She shouted for help and the neighbours intervened.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure in Kigina attacked a student, beat him, broke his phone, and threw him in a lavatory. He was accused of having FNL Rwasa songs on his laptop.
2 wounded in Sagme attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 2 people were killed in a Mayi Mayi Malaika clash with FARDC forces in Kaselebela, in Kabambare.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Police arrested 30 protesters demonstrating outside the Ministry of Foreign Affairs against the invalidation of semi-biometric passports.
A subway sit-in took place to demand allowances for working on Saturdays, like other companies, as metro-workers work full-time on Saturdays and official state holidays.
ISIS claims to have damaged an armored vehicle of the EG army by IED detonation west of El-Arish, North Sinai .
ISIS claims to have executed 4 alleged "informers" of the Egyptian army in the area of Qabr Umair, Rafah.

assoc_actor_1: UFDG: Union of Democratic Forces of Guinea
notes: Tens of thousands of people demonstrated in Conakry, on the appeal of the opposition, to demand the organization of local elections which have not held place for 12 years. Two people were wounded by bullets and a young protester was shot dead by police on his way back home after a UFDG demonstration.

Supporters of the Liberty Party (LP) and the Coalition for Democratic Change (CDC) violently clashed on Wednesday, 20 September, leaving at least two persons reportedly wounded, in t campaign violence ahead of the October 10th Presidential and Representatives Elections.
One of the members of a mediation delegation that entered Sabratha and succeeded in negotiating a ceasefire, was shot and injured in the abdomen and was transferred for treatment in Tunisia.
Several people were kidnapped in the last few days in Obari. The most well known victim is the head of the regional offices of the Commercial Bank.

actor1: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Despite a ceasefire, clashes took place in Sabratha for the fourth consecutive day, between the Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, and a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord.

Armed clashes broke out in the town of Umm al-Aranab (150 km) south of Sabha town between the Tabu tribe on the one hand and armed members of the the Chadian Zaghawa tribe on the other. The armed clashes continued since Wednesday, because of a recent attack by an armed group belonging to the Zaghawa on the gate of Tmassa (230 km) southeast of Sabha. The sources said that the attack on Tmassa was against the backdrop of the closure of the Libyan-Chadian border. However, the Zaghawa also reacted to a siege by Tebu militias on a Chinese company in Umm el Araneb where militants from the Zaghawa tribe are based.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Complex attack: seemingly armed assault on MINUSMA positions and and rocket/mortar shooting to camp "Kandi" in Kidal this morning. 1 peacekeeper lightly wounded and material damages. Civilian house also damaged/destroyed by mortar/rocket fire. Attack claimed by JNIM on 24/09.

Malian army convoy ambushed along the axis MÃ©naka-Ansongo,  15km from In-Delimane. Provisional toll: 4 Malian soldiers killed & 3 wounded, 2 FAMa vehicles destroyed; 3 vehicles managed to return to MÃ©naka.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes:
Complex attack: seemingly armed assault on MINUSMA positions and and rocket/mortar shooting to camp "Kandi" in Kidal this morning. 1 peacekeeper lightly wounded and material damages. 
Civilian house also damaged/destroyed by mortar/rocket fire. Attack claimed by JNIM on 24/09.
Boko Haram kills nine at an IDP camp in Rann on 20/09.
Soldiers kill a farmer for riding a motorcycle after an area ban on the vehicle had been put in place.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Pro-al Shabaab media reports the group attacked a ENDF and Somali forces position in Waajid on the evening of 20/09. "Deaths and injuries" reported - numbers not known.

20th September, AM, Shibis District, Mogadishu: NISA officer Omar Abu Shiine is killed after an IED, planted on his car, exploded while he was reportedly on route to work at the Aden Adde international airport. Al Shabaab have claimed responsibility for the attack.
20th September, AM, Bardheere, Gedo: KDF troops pull out of Bardheere and moved back to the town of Belet Xaawo on the Kenyan Somali border. At present, no clear reason has been given for the move.
Al Shabaab assassinated cleric Sheikh Abdiweli Afyare in Gaalkacyo. Execution announced on al Andalus.

20th September, PM, Galkacyo, Mudug: A number of unverified reports have claimed gunmen open fire on a civilian bus killing 3, at present no one has taken responsibility for the shooting. The attack occurred outside Gaalkacyo.
Four members of the same family (Darod) assassinated by unidentified gunmen from Sacad/Habargidir who opened fire on minibus.

A magnetic IED attached under a small luxury vehicles exploded at Mana-bolyo junction road in Bondheere district. The driver was killed in the explosion while the owner of the vehicle sustained injuries. The injured was taken to a nearby hospital for treatment. Perpetrators not known.

A civilian businessman hailing from Majeerteen clan was abducted by Derasame militiamen of Gaaljecel clan at Nur Xawaad area in Xawa Taako neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The militiamen took the man to an unknown location. Reports indicated that the abduction was related to the arrest of a civilian man from Beletweyne who was detained in Garowe by the administration of Puntland state eight months ago.
Al Shabaab attacked a Southwest Special Police camp. No casualties, assailants repelled.
A lecture theatre at the Cape Town campus of the Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) was set alight in ongoing student protests.
Protest turned violent in Humansdorp as protesters were were singing and dancing peacefully when teargas and rubber bullets were unleashed on them.
Leaders from five OR Tambo ANC branches protested outside the party's Nelson Mandela Drive offices (Mthatha) accusing the regional leaders of sidelining them
Hundreds of angry locals took to the streets and blockaded with burning treest on the N2 in Murchison (Port Shepstone) , on the KwaZulu-Natal South Coast, to protest poor service delivery.
Surrender/Defect:Unverified claims that 450 members of the Agwelek forces defected to the government in Fashoda state. Date unclear - report dated 20 September.
A girl and a teenager were sexually assaulted by unknown assaillants in Yei River County during the week of 18 September.

source: Sudan Tribune; Human Rights Watch; ACJPS
notes: IDPs at Kalma camp outside Nyala, South Darfur, staged demonstrations and dug trenches around the camp over 19-22 September to protest a planned presidential visit at the camp. On the fourth day of the protests (corresponding to the day of the president's visit), officials accused some IDPs, including infiltrated rebel SLM-AW elements, of firing at Sudanese forces, leading to a violent response by the government forces and RSF militia that left at least five killed and 29 injured, including a government soldier.

Police have arrested 36 demonstrators for causing unrest in the Jangwani area of Dar es Salaam. Members of the public stoned officers of the Ilala Municipality who were supervising demolitions in the area. The Ilala police commander, Salum Hamduni said the demolition exercise went ahead after security in the area was boosted.

Opposition parties in Togo kept on demonstrating over the rule of President Faure Gnassingbe, the scion of Africa's oldest political dynasty, amid accusations of harsh repression by the security forces. At least 77 people were injured in the town of Bafilo when security forces fired rubber bullets at the crowd on Wednesday, according to the opposition. Four people who were critically wounded were sent for treatment in Sokode, the country's second biggest city, about 50 kilometres (31 miles) to the south, it said. In statement, the opposition added that soldiers and militiamen in civilian dress "infiltrated demonstrations" in the northern cities of Bafilo, Kara, Mango, Sokode and Dapaong."In Dapaong, soldiers staged punitive operations all night," the coalition said. In Mango, the source said, a nine-year-old child was killed and 25 people were injured, including 10 by gunshot. The injuries were caused by hunting rifles and other guns -- types of weapons that the security forces did not use, the source said.

Police made use of teargas to disperse a sit-in in front of the SIAP-factory near Gabes.

Parents of students from primary school in Gataya, Kebili, installed tents inside the compound to allowed their children to go to school and to protest against lacking infrastructure at the school, e.g. the lack of walls against non-domesticated dogs et al.

assoc_actor_1: ISIE: Independent High Authority for Elections
notes: The 'Independent High Authority for Elections' (ISIE) went on a general strike in all of Tunisia on September 20 to demand a regularisation of their professional situation. Video shows employees chanting.
On Wednesday, police issued an order banning protests in Uganda. Ugandan police also raided the offices of a charity and a think tank which have publicly opposed the constitutional change
People attempting to register to vote became restless with the delays, so the Riot Police were called to suppress the protests.
A group of land-owners in Marondera barricaded their plot and threw stones at the Messenger of Court who had come to evict them. They then beat him.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO rebels ambushed a convoy on its way from Waat to Akobo in Jonglei capturing 14 civilian peace delegates, including the Jokyier County commissioner. The rebels later vowed to treat them as prisoners of war. The 14 officials claimed to have escaped from SPLA-IO detention on 21 December.

About forty young people, mainly from BenboulaÃ¯d city, at the entrance to the city of Arzew, blocked the railway line between Arzew and Oran in order to ask authorities to recruit them for the SociÃ©tÃ© nationale du transport ferroviaire (SNTF).
Pharmaceutical workers staged a sit-in in front of their working place to denounce the sacking of the director.

Dozens of residents of El Matmar, a locality just a few kilometers to the west of Relizane, protested in the city center to denounce the delayed initiation of criminal proceedings by police. It took the intervention of the local authorities to persuade the angry inhabitants to free the traffic that was interrupted for hours.

Social housing beneficiaries from El Mohgoun (Arzew) protested in front of the seat of the 'Caisse Nationale Du Logement' (CNL) in Gambetta to ask for a provision of housing units, complaining about waiting for more than 6 years already.

The residents of HaÃ¯ Meddah, a village in the commune of Sidi Chahmi, held a protest rally at the planned hospital's roundabout to denounce the delay in launching the land regularization plan for this site as promised by the former governor in December 2016.
Inhabitants from 3 neighbourhoods in Skikda protested to shed light on their bad housing conditions.

In Mwakiro unidentified attackers killed a man and his wife, and injured their daughter. The family had been accused of practising witchcraft.

Following yesterday events, Anti-Balakas blocked a city neighbourhood.

Protesters held a sit-in at the administrative building in Moanda to demand unpaid wages.
A subway sit-in took place to demand allowances for working on Saturdays, like other companies, as metro-workers work full-time on Saturdays and official state holidays.

On Monday, members of the Freedom and Justice,  demonstrated to register their displeasure with the human rights abuses of Muslim Minority in Myanmar.
During the protest, the group presented a petition to the Israeli Embassy in Ghana, with a demand for immediate cessation of the sale of offensive weapons, training of military and other security forces of Myanmar, specifically in the Rakhine State.
Protesters outside the Supreme Court waved placards against Chief Justice David Maraga whom they accuse of slowing the country's development after nullification of President Uhuru Kenyatta's victory

Supporters of President Kenyatta protest against the Supreme Court's decision to annul the elections in the strongholds of Nakuru, Kikuyu, Nyeri and Eldoret towns. In Nakuru, protestors barricaded the Nakuru-Nairobi highway, paralysing transport.

Jubilee supporters in Nyeri town demanded the Supreme Court to order recount of votes of the presidential elections. The demo was held as Kenyans await the full judgment of the court.

Pro-Jubilee protesters blocked the road to the Kerugoya Law Courts and burned an effigy of Narc-Kenya leader Martha Karua for the hearing of her petition against the election of Kirinyaga governor Anne Waiguru of the Jubilee coalition. Anti-riot police were called in to disperse the rowdy protesters.

The employees of the Labor Bureau in Sabha announced the suspension of their work, as of Tuesday, in protest against acts of theft and vandalism that targeted the office several times.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: Three civilians were killed Tuesday in a landmine explosion in the Sabri area of __Benghazi as they entered their houses. The mines are remnants of militants that were occupying the area some weeks ago.

The Zaghawa Tribe attacked the Tmassa gate 400km North of the border, supervised by Tebu groups, due to the recent closure of the border. 5 people from the Tebu tribe died. The Zaghawa also reacted to a siege by Tebu militias on a Chinese company in Umm el Araneb where militants from the Zaghawa tribe are based.

At least one person died.
5 people were killed in fighting between Dahalo militia and military forces in Bekapaika_TsaratanÃ na.
Members of the taxi industry in Antananarivo held a demonstration.
CSREF accountant was attacked by armed men and stripped of money, telephone and pc.
Scores of stakeholders of Oando Plc from across South Western States protested in Ibadan protesting alleged N263billion liability of the company.

assoc_actor_1: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
notes: NUEE employees protest in front of the Alausa office over labour issues.

notes: Workers of the Federal Airports Authority of Nigeria (FAAN) under the aegis of the Air Transport Service Senior Staff Association (ATSSSAN) and the National Union of Air Transport Employees (NUATE) staged a protest to express their disapproval of plans by the federal government to concession the Lagos and Abuja Airports.
At the Ilorin International Airport ATSSAN and NUATE members protested the concession of some airports by the federal government. The airport workers blocked roads.
Military forces repel Boko Haram attacks at Beta and Pulka; 2 in Beta, 16 in Pulka.
Military forces repel Boko Haram attacks at Beta and Pulka; 2 in Beta, 16 in Pulka.
Youngesters from Gouye-Gall neighbourhood blocked the RN2 protesting the modification of the route Gueoul-Saradawo.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen attempted to assassinate a Southwest Police officer. Exchange of gunfire ensued. Target survived the attempt, but was injured.
Armed clashes reported between Jubaland forces and al Shabaab militants in Maracade, near Belet Xaawo. At least five al Shabaab killed, one al Shabaab vehicle destroyed.
19th September, PM, Belet Xaawo, Gedo: Unconfirmed reports of fighting near the town of Belet Xaawo between SNA and al Shabaab, 8 al Shabaab members reportedly killed.
Unpaid Galmudug soldiers blockaded roads around Galmudug Administration HQ. Events remained peaceful.
Unverified local media reports suggested KDF troops set on fire Hormud HQ in Belet Xaawo. Motives unknown.
Detonate/Dismantle:Mogadishu security forces cordon-off suspected VBIED in Waaberi. Driver taken in custody for further interrogation. No confirmation over yet over presence of explosives.
Two nomad girls are raped in the area of Gaalkacyo. The attack is believed to be related to clan-based fighting.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated local section district chief in Hodan. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a standoff attack against Biimaal clan militia based at KM 50 vicinity (c. 20 km South West of Afgoye). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Two militants from both groups were injured.

Residents in Faluja neighbourhood peacefully demonstrated against Somaliland Army whom they accused of grabbing land adjacent to SLA headquarters that was given to residents by the local government. Somaliland police dispersed the demonstrators. There were no reports of arrests.
At the Bellville campus of CPUT, a petrol bomb caused significant damage to a financial aid office.

assoc_actor_2: AMCU: Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union
notes: A member of the Association of Mineworkers and Construction Unions (Amcu) was shot dead at Impala and another wounded at Lonmin in Marikana near Rustenburg.
A staffroom was also torched in Mowbray campus of CPUT in ongoing protests.
Members of Right2Know (R2K) and the Diepkloof Voices of Poor Concerned Residents picketed outside the head offices of several cellphone companies in Gauteng to demand cheaper airtime and data.
A group of #FeesMustFall students has stormed into the University of Cape Town library and disrupted classes and study sessions.

A night-time amed robbery by suspected members of the military in Juba's Gudele residential area left at least two killed and another injured. The assaillants made away with various valuables. Police later arrested seven suspected members of the organised forces.
On 19 September, armed men reportedly from Panyijar County attacked a vehicle travelling from Shambe to the town of Yirol, killing one police officer.

Unknown gunmen ambushed a convoy of at least 10 vehicles on the road between Guldo and Golo in Central Darfur, hijacking four of the vehicles along with 47 of their occupants. One passenger managed to escape and sound the alarm. A week later, a relative said they were held in the area of Tringa but that the assaillants had not yet made demands and authorities not yet intervened.

Unidentified rioters vandalised a primary school in Bizerte and stole equipment from inside.

A gang of armed miners attacked a group of policemen in Esigodini. The policemen fled.

To denounce the delay of public authorities in responding to their demands, the communal guards staged sit-in in front of the headquarters of the wilaya of Bejaia. They demand an improvement in their socio-economic- and working conditions.
Teachers from a school in Ksar Chellal went on strike/protest against the nomination and missconduct of the new director of their school.
People protested in front of the seat of the National Algerian Water Company in Souk Ahras to denounce bad water supply in the city.

notes: Imbonerakure raped a young girl in Kivoga.

actor1: Military Forces of Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: Following the attempt to arrest Anti-Balaka General NdalÃ©, militias opened fire all over the city. One dead.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 2 people were killed in fighting between ADF and FARDC forces near Beni. 1 ADF rebel was captured by FARDC.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Government forces attacked ADF forces in the forest near Mbau in retaliation for an attack the previous day.
Cairo criminal court on Monday sentencend 43 defendants to life in prison. The defendants include several high-profile Muslim Brotherhood youth cadres and preachers known to have supported the group.
Arrest:48 Oromo students in Jigjiga University were arrested, reasons not known. Five  cannot be located.
Students at the Omar Bongo University are preventing other students from enrolling, in order to protest the increase in enrollment fees.

assoc_actor_1: FESCI: Student Federation of Ivory Coast
notes: Students protesting high registration fees and police forces clashed: students blocking the streets and throwing stones were dispersed by teargas by police forces.
Unidentified gunmen shut down a fuel pipeline in the western Libyan city of Zawiya that feeds the capital Tripoli.

A small group of demonstrators gathered in the centre of Misrata last night in support of Baset Igtet, ahead of his proposed rally in Tripoliâs Martyrsâ Square on 25 September. Numbering less than 50 and said to be mainly refugees from Benghazi, they expressed support for him, condemning Haithem Tajouriâs opposition to the rally.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: LNA forces established a security basis/checkpoint 150km south of Tobruk on the road to Jaghbub to extend control over southern areas and control smuggling and illegal migration.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
actor2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: Clashes reportedly took place between LNA forces and the remains of the BRSC nearby the City Hotel in Benghazi. At least 1 soldier died.

actor1: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: For the second consecutive day, the Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, who controls almost half of Sabratha, clashed with a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord. A security officer was killed several others were injured
Students of the College of Education, Ikere Ekiti, on Monday went on a "rampage" following alleged rape of a female student by a commercial driver.

Unidentified assailants kidnap two soldiers and four civilians in Rivers State on 18/09.  It is not clear if the rescued military personnel were kidnapped for ransom or negotiating leverage for the perpetrators. The group was rescued on 21/09.

Arrest:Security forces announced they had arrested 59 members of IPOB in Abia State on 18/09. The date(s) of operation not known. Per a recent government declaration the arrested will be tried for terrorism.
Boko Haram suicide bombers have reportedly killed at least 15, others injured. It was gathered that the attack occurred at Mashimari, Konduga, outside Maiduguri. This Day reports the deaths of 12.
A military convoy is targeted by a roadside IED near Bar Ismail CP, south of Afgooye. Device detonated prematurely. Two civilians killed.
18th PM, Bari, Puntland, Bosasso: Puntland security forces discover an IED planted on a busy junction, the area was cleared before detonation. No casualties reported.
A Puntland police officer shoots a civilian after a unknown dispute.

source: Local Source Project; Shabelle Media Network
notes: 18th AM, Mogadishu, Xamar Jabjab: Foos Mohamed Hussein, Xamar-Jajab District Official shot dead in an assassination. A four-year-old girl was also killed. Assailants escaped the scene. Perpetrators not known. Shabelle Media Network reports the attack occurred on 16/09.

South-West Administration soldiers clashed at Diinsoor town (c. 90 km South West of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. The ISWA soldiers belong to Geelid and Dabare clans who disputed over the killing of ISWA soldier from Geelidle clan by ISWA soldier from Dabare clan on 18/09. ISWA soldiers from Geelidle clan were isolated from the rest of the ISWA forces and amassed at area in the town in protest of the incident.

A few school teachers in Cerigabo demonstrated in front of the Office of the Ministry of Education in Cerigabo in protest over the teacherâs examination results. This came after the Ministry of Education demoted several tutors after failing to achieve the pass scores for the examination. The demonstration ended peacefully.

A youth group burnt shanty houses belonging to the Oromo community at Xamarta and Togdheer school neighbourhoods in Burco town. The motive of the attack was linked to the recent killing of the Somaliland khat dealers in Oromiya region. SLP arrived at the scene and dispersed the youths.

Residents in Ainabo staged a peaceful demonstration against the local administration whom they accused of diverting humanitarian assistance received from humanitarian agencies and the Government of Somaliland. Residents, mainly those who became IDPs during the recent droughts, walked through the main roads of Ainabo and disrupted traffic movements. There were two main temporary IDPs camps in Ainabo which host about 2000 people that depend on humanitarian assistance from agencies. There were no reports of casualties.
MoSF cordoned-off suspected VBIED parked near Wabeeri Police station. No explosives found upon inspection by EOD team.
Learners from a school in Bloekombos have been protesting against the school's policy on hair and clothing.
A MyCiTi bus was torched on the N2 near Delft, about 29km east of the Cape Town CBD during a taxi strike.
Rubber bullets were fired into a group of people throwing stones at buses and police in Du Noon, north of Cape Town as a taxi driver strike took hold.
On Potsdam and Wellington roads in Fisantekraal, a group of people threw stones at police and traffic officials
On the N1 at Joostenbergvlakte, a burning barricade blocked the road during the taxi strike.
Buses were also stoned at Site C in Khayelitsha and a Dairy Bell truck was torched on Govan Mbeki Road near the electrical depot.
Examinations were cancelled for students at Klipspruit West Secondary High School in Soweto as a small group of parents protested outside the main gates.
At least 13 people were arrested, shops were closed and commuters were left stranded as protesters blocked roads with burning tyres in Matatiele. Police had used rubber bullets to disperse the crowd.
Buses were stoned at Borcherds Quarry near the Cape Town International Airport during the taxi strike.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; Xinhua General News Service; UNSC
notes: SPLA-IO reportedly temporarily captured Nhiladiu town in Unity after clashes with the SPLA. SPLA-IO claimed to have killed 19 soldiers including their area Commander, while one died and four were injured on their side. The government forces claimed to have repulsed the rebels after they burnt down some houses at the outskirts of the town. A later toll given by the area's information minister put the number of fatalities at 25, including six policemen and four civilians killed in the crossfire.

Suspected armed youth from the Kuacdit clan killed the Executive Chief of Eastern Lakes State from the rival Kuacthi clan, while he was attending a marriage ceremony in Pagarau in Eastern Lakes State. Kuacdit people fled Nyang town as a result of the tensions that ensued between the two groups.
Unknown gunmen shot dead a couple in their home at Hai Kosti in Wau town. Circumstances are unclear.
Parents of pupils in Ain Jenan, Foussana, closed the gates of the school as a sign of protest over the lack of teachers in the school.

actor1: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
notes: The National Guard reportedly shot dead a suspect, Nouicer Jedidi, on his way home from a nightly party in Ain Seidene, Jendouba.

A journalist from Diwan FM who covered a sit-in in Sfax in support of a teacher that was accused of blasphemy earlier was aggressed and injured by police forces. Another journalist who then came to the police station to support his colleague was similarly aggressed by police forces.

A journalist from Diwan FM who covered a sit-in in Sfax in support of a teacher that was accused of blasphemy was aggressed and injured by police forces. Another journalist who then came to the police station to support his colleague was similarly aggressed by police forces.

Candidates who passed the exam to be recruited as bus drivers at the Transport Company 'Sahel' protested today in front of the Ministry of Transport because of irregularities in the aftermath of the exam. Moreover, the union of official and agents of judicial services belonging to the 'CGTT: Tunisian General Labour Confederation' entered into a 3-day strike to protest against non-fullfilment of demands made by the sector.
Ugandan police have detained a lawmaker and 10 others who were arrested while protesting against a plan that they charge would enable the country's long-term president to rule for life.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: An MDC-T activist in Madzivadzivo, Gokwe, was attacked by ZANU PF youths. They stoned him and threatened him with a knife.
Women from Sidi Abdellah in Mahelma commune protested in front of the primary school to protest against poor public transport.

assoc_actor_2: UNITA: National Union for the Total Independence of Angola
notes: The son of a UNITA official was shot by police officers in Luanda.
Village chief of TÃ©m near Nassoumbou abducted and executed by presumed Ansaroul Islam members.
An unidentified armed group attacked civilians with machetes in Kanyosha, leaving 2 people injured.
5 dead in a twin suicide attack this morning in Kossa (two fatalities included for bombers).

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
notes: Abs and UPC elements clashes following the assassination of a man and the fire of the Apostolic church. Provisional toll unavailable.
11 LRA forces looted a field near Ngouyo, CAR, and abducted 6 men to porter the looted goods. They later killed 3 of the abductees after they tried to steal the LRA group's weapons and escape.

actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: A MONUSCO soldier was killed and another wounded in an attack by ADF forces on the Mbau-Kamango road.
Cluster bombs and bomblets dropped by Egyptian Air Forces aircraft, said to have been dropped today, were found near al-Barth.
Clashes broke out between Liyu police and armed Oromos in Borana, Moyale town.  Two Liyu policemen were killed, while 2 Oromos were wounded.
In Awaday, a young man was arrested and beaten by policemen. Further details unclear.
At least 28 houses have been burnt down in Kaloleni Estate, Kisumu County, by a group of suspected boda boda operators in search of motorcycle thieves.

actor1: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: Libyan authorities have sealed the border crossing of Ras Gadir with Tunisia amid intense clashes in the nearby city of Sabratha.

actor1: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
notes: The Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, who controls almost half of Sabratha, clashed with a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord. Five people were killed and eight others injured. The former trafficking militia who reportededly switched side to cooperate with international migration authorities, earlier that day intercepted nine boats carrying undocuments migrants from another Sabrathan militia. This seems to be the reason for the clashes.
The civil registrars office in Sabha was stormed by unidentified gunmen who attacked the supervisor. Due to the event and ongoing verbal attacks the office decided to close its gates.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
notes: A LNA-soldier from the special forces shot and injured a policeman in Masakin in Benghazi.

actor2: Military Forces of Mali (2013-) Operational Coordination Mechanism
notes: A MOC element was shot down by armed men, possibly as reprisal of Gawa events of 14/09/2017.

Hundreds of cars and several other valuables were destroyed at Rumuekini Community, Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State, following the discovery of the remains of one Mr. Heaven Ihuigwe, Chairman of People Democratic Party, PDP, in Ogbogoro Ward 15. The information surrounding the death of the Ward Chair is not known.
Suspected members of Boko Haram invaded Kurmiri village of Titiwa Ward in which the attackers killed the Chief Imam of the village alongside four other persons.

Hundreds of cars and several other valuables were destroyed at Rumuekini Community, Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State, following the discovery of the remains of the Chairman of People Democratic Party, PDP, in Ogbogoro Ward 15. The information surrounding the death of the Ward Chair (date and perpetrators) are not known.
Agricultural producers went to the street to protest bas working conditions and the inhability of the newly-appointed PRODAC coordinator.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked BNDF base near Burane. Casualties unknown.
Unverified local source reporting suggested al Shabaab gunmen assassinated two SNAF soldiers patrolling in Dharkenley. Assailants reportedly escaped.
Troops loyal to Sheikh Mukhtar Robow ambushed al Shabaab fighters at IVO Korkor/El Big. Four al Shabaab killed and three injured. One al Shabaab vehicle destroyed.
Al Shabaab threw a hand grenade at government forces in Wardhigley District. The latest reports say that there are several casualties and destruction of property, numbers of causalities not known.
Al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a police officer in Yaaqshiid. Assailants fled with confiscated weaponry.
17th September, AM, Hiiran, Beledweyne: Al Shabaab attacked and seized an SNAF checkpoint at Kalabeyr near Jawill village. Five SNAF killed.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: UPDF convoy returning from Buulo Mareer struck by IED at Golweyn. One Caspir damaged & immobilised, 5 UPDF injured. Al Shabaab believed to be responsible.
Protests erupted at the entrance of Mogadishu seaport. SNPF blockaded the road for one hour. Protests were against bad working conditions at Seaport.
17th September, 1305, Mogadishu, Dharkenley: Kaxda district intelligence Chief identified as Mohammed Qooley killed in a drive by shooting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
Unknown gunmen have shot and killed a youth activist in Galkayo on 17/09. A second article from the same source claims the victim was Former Ministry of Finances official Liiban Hassan Abdulle.

Ahmed Kheyr (Aulihan) clan militia clashed with police forces over a disputed piece of land behind a UN compound. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. The clan militia spent the night guarding the land after government soldiers left the area. The militia were reported to be on standby and alert. It was reported that the previous land owners were engaging in a construction at the disputed land.

Khat dealers in Lascanod protested as a result of a decision made by the government to increase the tax on khat coming from Kenya to Lascanod. SLP in Lacanod denied for the entry of khat into the town. Community elders at Lacanod intervened and managed the situation. Transportation of khat proceeded to the town.
ANC leaders fromtwo factions within the party fought in the Ladysmith town hall at a meeting of the Ukhahlamba regional general council. Five people were injured.

Over 500 people from Parkwood Estate participated in a peace walk against gangsterism, crime and other social ills, which have in recent times claimed a number of lives, including those of children, and terrorised the community.

actor2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Two leading members of the Alternative Port Workers Union staged a protest against the visit of representatives of the Dubai Ports Company to the Southern Container Port in Port Sudan. NISS briefly arrested the two protesters.

A group of gunmen riding on camels and horses stormed the Tur Eastern IDP Camp in Central Darfur, firing shots in the air, and beating and stabbing camp residents. 13 displaced people were injured, while eight homes were looted.

Another police officer has died after being stabbed and his gun taken by suspected thugs in Busia District. Constable Daniel Mayende was attacked on Sunday night at Kayembe Check Point in Sofia village in Busia Town located Uganda -Kenya border while on night duty.
Inhabitants from Ain El Beida staged a sit-in front of a newly built school that did not yet open its gates. The inhabitants demand authorities to open the school as soon as possible.
Dozens of subscribers to social housing programs in Ali Mendjeli protested yesterday in front of the office of the governor to denounce the delay in the completion of the housing units.
Hundreds of persons took the street to protest against the FCFA in Cotonou, Dakar and Bamako.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The CNDD-FDD staged a demonstration in Bujumbura to protest the UN report on Burundi human rights abuses.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a man in Butihinda for refusing to join the CNDD-FDD.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The CNDD-FDD staged a demonstration in Gihanga to protest the UN report on Burundi human rights abuses.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: The CNDD-FDD staged a demonstration in Matana to protest the UN report on Burundi human rights abuses.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: An FNL Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure, who accused himm of listening to radio broadcasts from Rwanda.
Police beat a man in Rutegama for failing to pay a bribe.
In the night of 16th to 17th sept, Boko Haram members attacked Hidoua and Bavaloga villages, burning 109 houses.
Reports of violence along the Oromo border with Burji and Amaro tribes in what is believed to be Guji Zone. Casualties not known.
In West Hararge , Gumbi Bordede, 3 Oromo residents were killed in clashes with Somali region Liyu police that lasted for 4 hours.

In what is believed to be Guji Zone, Oromo people submitted complaints that they had been shot at by the Southern regional special forces. The date(s) of the violence is not known. Source reported on 16/09. Causalities not known.
Some illegal vendors torched Mzuzu City Council (MCC) Planning Offices at Mzuzu Stadium.
Hundreds of persons took the street to protest against the FCFA in Cotonou, Dakar and Bamako. The demonstration was dispersed by police.
Unidentified militants seized 178 cows, and destroyed several fields and water pumps.
2 armed man killed an off duty policeman in the mosquee for the morning prayer.
The siege on Kanio, is still in place: an elderly MalinkÃ© was shot dead on his property by Islamist miltiants.

A group of âOzone Environment and Services" workers in Guelmim held a protest in solidarity with one of their colleagues who underwent disadvantegeous treatment by the company after publishing a post on "Facebook" critisizing the company.
Unidentified gunmen have shot dead a police inspector, commander of Kaduna state vigilante group and abducted two young girls at Unguwar Katsinawa, Shika, Giwa local government area of Kaduna state.

Three persons, including a Police officer and an expatriate, have been killed in Kogi State along the Ajaokuta-Lokoja Highway by suspected kidnappers. Gathered that the expat, who was travelling with one of his staff, ran into the gunmen that had laid an ambush to kidnap him, but were resisted by the Police escorts.
Youths, wearing Igbo attire protest for ethnic peace in Nigeria. The protest took place at an unknown location in Kano State.
Hundreds of persons took the street to protest against the FCFA in Cotonou, Dakar and Bamako.

source: Local Source Project; Voice of America (Washington, DC)
notes: Fighting after Mogadishu stabilisation force tried to disarm some members of the military who were in Digfer Hospital area. Six reported combatant deaths. Three civilians were reported dead from stray gunfire.

Al Shabaab forces overtake Bula Hache (near Ceel Waaq) following a fight lasting between the evening of 15/09 - the morning of 16/09. Causality numbers not yet confirmed. Following the government defeat at Bula Hache, Kenyan forces at Ceel Waaq fled their positions.

Al Shabaab gains control of Ceel Waaq after the Kenyan forces who were guarding the town fled. The retreat comes after al Shabaab and government forces clashed in nearby Bula Hache through the overnight hours.
16 September, PM, Bari, Bosasso: Police Commissioner Mohamed Ali shot and injured by suspected al Shabaab gunmen. Assailants escaped.
Al Shabaab fighter hurled a hand grenade towards a passing Mogadishu Stabilisation Force military patrol. No casualties, assailant escaped.
16 September, PM, Mogadishu, Wadajir: A senior SNAF officer and his bodyguard are assassinated. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
Civilians spontaneously organised protests against the green-on-green skirmish that opposed Mogadishu Stabilization Force to Army in Hodan. Protests remained peaceful.

Mogadishu Stabilization forces attacked SNA soldiers, who were organized in clan militias, based at Haanta Dheer and 77 Military camp on Industrial road in Dayniile district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about three hours. Five civilians were killed while 11 others were injured and taken to hospital. It was further reported that residents started to vacate their home to seek safer shelter.

Two people, including a senior municipal police officer and civilian businessman, were shot and killed near Kawo-Godey market vicinity by two armed men using pistols. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the assassination.

An unspecified number of people demonstrated on the streets of Erigabo in protest of the quality of services provided by the electricity company and the cost of electricity. Demonstrators blocked traffic on the main road and burnt tires. The demonstrators later dispersed after police were deployed in the area.

source: Local Source Project; Voice of America (Washington, DC)
notes: Students damaged the Ministry of Education building and public transport in the vicinity of the area after the Ministry of Education announced that more than 3,517 students failed the 2016-2017 examination in Somaliland. The results were published by the Somaliland national examination board.

About 600 people protested outside the Philippi East Police Station in Lower Crossroads. When angry protesters began to burn tyres outside the police station, the police dispersed the crowd with rubber bullets and teargas
Local youth from the Ayual and Awulian communities clashed during a wrestling match in Twic county, Jonglei, leaving one killed and three injured. Circumstances are unclear.
An NGO national staff member went missing and was later found dead in Lui, Western Equatoria. As a result, staff members from the affected organization relocated from the area due to safety concerns.
SPLM-N faction led by Malik Agar claimed that government forces attacked their positions at Taga in the Ingessana Hills, Blue Nile state.

Unknown gunmen attempting to loot cattle in Jaber area of Kutum, North Darfur, fired at the herders who were trying to resist them, leaving one killed and four injured. The assaillants looted 110 heads of cattle and fled towards Fata Borno.

Demonstrators from the Manich Msemah movement have gathered in Tunis to protest a controversial law passed by parliament, which grants amnesty to Ben Ali-era officials convicted of corruption offences if they agree to return any funds they acquired illegally.
A guard shot a reveler dead at Kiira Bar in Kamapala.
Thugs raided Mponye police post in Kabalagala Division and hacked a police officer who was on duty and stole his gun.
On Saturday, two Special Police Constables (SPC) attached to Mutundwe police station were killed by thugs moving on motorcycles at Denovo Bread Company in Kalerwe, Kawempe Division in Kampala.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: One person has been confirmed dead after an armed group attacked Ugandan fishermen on Lake Albert in western Uganda. According to witnesses, the group invaded the fishermen on Nsonga Landing Site, in Kyangwali sub-county. They allegedly stole mobile phones, boat engines and fish valued at millions of shillings. The attackers were dressed in military uniforms similar to those of Democratic Republic of Congo soldiers.
A militia from a mine opened fire on security guards at a rival mine in Odzi. 3 people were shot and injured.

actor1: UNITA: National Union for the Total Independence of Angola
actor2: MPLA: Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola
notes: There were clashes between UNITA and MPLA militants in Bocoio. Residents fled into the woods to escape the violence.

assoc_actor_2: UNITA: National Union for the Total Independence of Angola
notes: The police broke up a Lunda Sul UNITA meeting by assaulting officials and firing teargass at them.
Three individuals incl. Wendpoli village chief assassinated overnight in the Soum, near Mali border.
A man was stoned to death by his neighbours because he won a land dispute in the court.
A MNJTF military personnel and 2 vigilantes of Bonderi were killed between Ardori  and Woulba, after IED explosion.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Burundian asylum seekers rioted in Kamanyola and were suppressed by FARDC forces, who opened fire into the crowd. 37 Burundians and 1 soldier were killed.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Residents and miners in Kasulo, in Kolwezi, barricaded the main road. The police intervened and fired teargas. The rioters ransacked 2 police stations and burned police vehicles.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified militia ambushed civilians in Bushendo. 1 person was killed, 7 people were injured and 3 people were abducted.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified militia abducted a priest from Ntamugenga.

The locality of Lowa, in Tshopo, has been since September under the control of the Mayi Mayi Thomas Mesandu. The militia has reportedly extended its control to other areas since September (Babengongo, Basikake, Banakile, Banakwenge and Bindi) and was accused by residents of setting up illegal road blocks and looting the population. No report of clashes with security forces - an FARDC commander declined responsibility in this area.

The militia has reportedly extended its control to other areas since September (Babengongo, Basikake, Banakile, Banakwenge and Bindi) and was accused by residents of setting up illegal road blocks and looting the population. No report of clashes with security forces - an FARDC commander declined responsibility in this area.
