The militia has reportedly extended its control to other areas since September (Babengongo, Basikake, Banakile, Banakwenge and Bindi) and was accused by residents of setting up illegal road blocks and looting the population. No report of clashes with security forces - an FARDC commander declined responsibility in this area.

The locality of Lowa, in Tshopo, has been since September under the control of the Mayi Mayi Thomas Mesandu. The militia has reportedly extended its control to other areas since September (Babengongo, Basikake, Banakile, Banakwenge and Bindi) and was accused by residents of setting up illegal road blocks and looting the population. No report of clashes with security forces - an FARDC commander declined responsibility in this area.

Four people have been killed and seven others wounded in heavy fighting that took place in Bule Hora, near Hagere Maryam between the area farmers and Ethiopian Somali special forces. The clashes began on 14/09 and continued into the morning of 15/09.
Unidentified militia shelled Shinfa town in Quara District. Casualties not known. Following the attacks, the Ethiopian government has "closed all mobile phone networks in the area".

Armed youths in Guinea destroyed the offices of the ruling party and occupied parts of the restive mining town of Boke on Friday, witnesses told AFP, following the deaths of two protesters this week. The youths controlled entire sections of the northeastern city by early evening after erecting barricades, with local officials and soldiers alike sheltering in military barracks, the witnesses and a local official said.
A car explosion near the passport office in Budzira, Benghazi left 5 security guards injured. No one has claimed responsibility for the explosion.

Youth and elders protested outside the interim governments offices near Beida against the decision to suspend the mayor of Shahat Obeidallah and threatened strife. Military governor Nadouri then reversed the decision and put the mayor back in place.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A mine explosion Sabri area in central Benghazi resulted in the death of one man. The mines are said to have been put into place by the Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaires, who are still remaining in a small area of Benghazi.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Family members of Ibrahim Jadhran were released after having been kidnapped by the Special Deterrent Forces that belong to the Ministry of Interior of the Government of National Accord.

Unidentified persons, suspected to be IPOB (Igbo) attacked a Hausa settlement in Asaba, killing four. The attack began with a failed bomb attack on a mosque. In a separate attack elsewhere in the city IBOB killed two in a market.

Al Shabaab forces overtake Bula Hache (near Ceel Waaq) following a fight lasting between the evening of 15/09 - the morning of 16/09. Causality numbers not yet confirmed. Following the government defeat at Bula Hache, Kenyan forces at Ceel Waaq fled their positions.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Al Shabaab launched an attack on Garbahaarey on the evening of 15/09. The attack started with a [suicide] car bomb hitting the main entrance of a Somali army base in south Garbahaarrey. Al-Shabab fighters, who had been waiting outside, then launched a large-scale attack on the base. A fierce fighting is currently underway at the base, with the two sides battling each other with heavy weapons. Ethiopian forces, aiding the government launched mortar fire on al Shabaab positions outside the city. Causality figures not known at this time.

15 September, AM, Mogadishu: a SNA convoy was reportedly hit by an IED between Ex-control Afgooye checkpoint & Siinka-Dheer junctions in Daynile District. No Casualties reported. Perpetrators al Shabaab.
15th September, PM, Mogadishu: Unidentified gunmen in the Hodan district shot and killed a prominent elder identified as Sharif Aden. So far no one has been apprehended for the killing.
Al Shabaab fighters opened fire against group of soldiers. Two soldiers killed. Assailants escaped.
Al Shabaab raid several houses in Muuri. Four civilians subsequently executed.
An RCIED targeting an SNA convoy at Elasha neighbourhood exploded. An SNA truck was damaged. At least two civilian bystanders were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a well-known Government staff member who worked with the Ministry of Labour and public work at Zone K village in Hodan district. The victim was exiting the Mosque after prayers when he was attacked. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing.

Several hundred people gathered outside the South Gauteng High Court in support of a R60-billion Constitutional Court class action bid to change legislation to prevent the sale of re-possessed houses at very low prices

Chaos erupted at the Burmese Embassy in Pretoria after a crowd of protesters affiliated to the #SA4Rohingya campaign gathered to picket against the plight of Rohingya refugees who have fled Myanmar. Some people within the protesters started shaking the perimeter fence and throwing stones and garbage into the diplomatic mission's premises. Police fired stun grenades to quell the protesters.
In September, a group of youth caused a commotion at a Mvolo distribution centre and looted water, sanitation, hygiene and household supplies.
A truck transporting nutrition supplies was looted and staff members were assaulted by an armed actor in Mvolo County in September.
A male NGO staff member was killed during the looting of an agency-supported health centre in Unity in September.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Clashes between government and SPLA-IO forces in mid-September led to civilian casualties in the Mugwo and Morobo areas of Central Equatoria.
In September, a civilian vehicle travelling from Wulu County to the town of Rumbek in Lakes state was fired upon, injuring four passengers.

Three children have died after aÂ bombÂ exploded on them on Friday. According to Loksale village chairman Julius Mhale the children were grazing cattle in the field used byÂ TanzaniaÂ Peoples Defense Force (TPDF) for training.

Activists from civil society protested on the art-square in the center of Kairouan to protest against the recently passed administrative amnesty bill that will pardon thousands of bureaucrats who are accussed of corruption under Ben-Ali rule.
Individuals who had been prevented from fishing on the coasts of the Kerkennah Islands by the Maritime Guard blocked the main port of the island, paralyzing ferry traffic.
A teacher in a school in Sousse was aggressed physically by parents of pupils of the school. They accuse her of being a non-believer and having a bad influence on the children.
Five panga-wielding men attacked the police post with the view of stealing weapons and injured a constable who was on guard inside the post.
Inhabitants from Tasga Melloul prevented employees from the National Water Company in Ain el Hammam to enter the premises. They protest against not having access to water for more than 20 days.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: 5 members of FNL Rwasa were beaten and arrested by Imbonerakure in Mayange for meeting at a bar.
Abs blocked the Bouar-Niem Yelewa axis claiming the Bangladeshi Blue Hemlets to be the cause of the region insecurity.
Abs took as hostage the NGO Cordaid basis in Bocaranga, asking for a ransom. After a pacific negotiation, the Abs left the city.
The Egyptian military killed 3 militants of the Islamic State in North Sinai.

In East Hararge, Goro gutu woreda, Karra Mille, a demonstration was held against continued incursions by the Liyu police. It is not clear if the protesters were violent. Federal troops intervened; one man was killed and 6 others injured.

Four people have been killed and seven others wounded in heavy fighting that took place in Bule Hora, near Hagere Maryam between the area farmers and Ethiopian Somali special forces. The clashes began on 14/09 and continued into the morning of 15/09.
Police arrested demonstrators in Keroka town in Nyamira County. The demonstrators were protesting against President Kenyatta's verbal attacks against the judiciary.
Police in Lilongwe arrested a woman who was a part of the protests against gender based violence.
A National Guard pick-up was seized after an exchange of fire: 3 guards dead and several civilians wounded. Malian army in pursuit till 5 km from the city.
2 Platform pick-ups were attacked: 2 dead and 4 men kidnapped on the Platform side.
The siege on Kanio conintues: two civilians  killed during the week.

Following rumours that soldiers had killed a number of residents of Umuode and burnt their homes, unidentified youths attacked a Aba police station and set it alight. Police used tear gas against the rioters. Soldiers attacking residents may have been related to tensions related to Biafran secessionists in the area. There were unsubstantiated reports of killings and shootings in different parts of the city; causality numbers not known.

Following rumours that soldiers had killed "a number" of residents of Umuode and burnt their homes, unidentified youths attacked a Aba police station and set it alight. Police used tear gas against the rioters. Soldiers attacking residents may have been related to tensions related to Biafran secessionists in the area. There were unsubstantiated reports of killings and shootings in different parts of the city; causality numbers not known.
A University of Jos student, mistaken for Igbo, is attacked and killed by a group of anti-IPOB protesters.

Surrender/Defect:The Borno State police command has said that over 13 members of Boko Haram including a top Commander of the sect, named Ibrahim Dala ( alias Abu Ali) , formerly of Kawar Mela ward, of Maiduguri and an Amir of the Mamman Nur faction of the Boko Haram surrendered to the intelligence arm of its police anti-robbery squad following a peaceful negotiation.

assoc_actor_1: EYCDA: Elete Youth Community Development Association
notes: A youth coalition (EYCDA) within Elete Kingdom has protests against the alleged imposition of a ruler against their wishes.

Soldiers raid the family home of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) leader, Mazi Nnamdi Kanu, in Afaraukwu, Abia State, around 5.00 p.m. on 14/09. The soldiers on arrival shot sporadically for about 40 minutes that the invasion lasted. It is not known if the owners of the home defended themselves. The house was reported destroyed. Causalities not known. The operation led to further unrest in the area.

Two persons said to be members of IPOB, were reportedly shot dead by military forces along Bank Road in Umuahia, while another person sustained bullet injuries while coming out from the nearby branch of Zenith Bank. At the time of the attack the members of IPOB were participating in a protest against the military. No report of protester violence.

The traditional ruler of Obollo autonomous community in Isiala Mbano Local Government Area of Imo State is attacked and nearly lynched after a unfavourable political appointment was made on the ruler's behalf.

Unsubstantiated reports of "shootings and killings" throughout the city of Aba following an attack by rioters on a police station. Injuries, fatalities not numbers by source. The perpetrators may be Biafran secessionists.

Opposition MPs protested against the detention of Dakar Mayor Khalifa Sall, who was not allowed to participate to the first session of the newly-elected National Assembly despite his parlamentary immunity.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al-Shabab has launched attacks on a base belonging to government forces and AMISOM troops in the locality of Jalalaqsi in Hiiraan Region [central Somalia]. Reports indicate that the sound of both heavy and light firearms being exchanged by the warring sides could be heard in the area. Reports indicate there were causalities on the al Shabaab side, numbers not known (divided among the two days). The attack began late on 13/09 and ended the following morning.
14th September, PM Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: SNA soldiers injured after Al Shabaab launch an attack in the Mahaday District.
14th September, PM, Dharkenly, Mogadishu: Suspected Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a SNA soldier in Dharkenley.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 14th September, PM, IVO Al Shabaab Claims IED attack on AMISOM convoy. Causality figures not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 14th September, AM, IVO, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: Reports that AMISOM have carried out a mortar offensive against Al Shabaab in areas around Mahaday District. Causalities not known. Al Shabaab launched an attack against government forces after the incident.
Civilians protest at Ethiopian consulate following killing of Somali nationals in the Ethiopian Oromo region.
Two Ethiopian nationals are killed by Somaliland police after the officers had family members killed during Oromo/Liyu clashes in the  Ogaden region.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated businessman in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped.
Convoy transporting Balcad district commissioner ambushed. Action initiated by IED + 30min gunfight. No casualties.
Defection: Al Shabaab Somali Memo claimed SNAF Ceel Buur Commander Mahmud Ali defected to the group.
Two al Shabaab assassins kill a defector. Assailants escaped.

CPUT classrooms and equipment were damaged during ongoing protests protests. Violence entered the fourth day after private security guards disrupted a student gathering near the Sadenburg residence at the Cape Peninsula
The Golden Highway in Lenasia South, Johannesburg has been blocked off by burning tyres and rocks due to a protest that flared up in Ennerdale, Johannesburg.
The Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) marched to the Gupta-owned Shiva Uranium Mine in Hartbeesfontein near Klerksdorp on demanding the dismissal of the mine's human resource manager.
The KwaDukuza community turned up in their numbers outside the KwaDukuza Magistrateâs court for the appearance of two murder suspects.
A truck and a bus were torched in violent a protest in Marapong outside Lephalale, Limpopo
A man was dragged from his shack, beaten in the street and killed by vigilantes in Phillipi. His shack was set alight, 50m from where he was killed.

NUM embarked on protests at the Exxaro mine on  (Thohoyonda) after the union failed to reach a wage increase agreement with the employer through the Commission for Conciliation, Mediation and Arbitration

source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Dabanga; Xinhua General News Service
notes: SPLM-N faction led by Malik Agar claimed to have repulsed a government attack on its positions at Taga area in the Ingessana Hills, Blue Nile state, inflicting human as well as material damage. Agar had accused government troops of breaching the cessation of hostilities a day earlier by advancing towards their positions. The Sudanese army denied the clashes.

Activists from the Popular Front marched on the streets of Gafsa to protest against the recently passed administrative amnesty bill that will pardon thousands of bureaucrats who are accussed of corruption under Ben-Ali rule.

Activists from civil society protested on Chelli-square in Sousse to protest against the recently passed administrative amnesty bill that will pardon thousands of bureaucrats who are accussed of corruption under Ben-Ali rule.
Unemployed graduates protested in Tozeur to demand development and jobs in the region.

Arrests: Police and the UPDF in Mbarara on Thursday arrested the regionâs Democratic Party Vice President Imam Makumbi, while he prepared to launch a procession in protest of Tuesdayâs adaptation of the age limit removal bill by NRM MPs.
Inhabitants in Blida region blocked a road with tree branches to protest against the delay in opening a school.
Beneficiaries from a social housing program staged a sit-in in front of the 'National Company for Real Estate Promotion' in Oran. They protested against elevated housing costs.
Several unidentified gunmen forced their way into the UN offices in Bujumbura. No one was harmed.
A man was decapitated and his body was dumped in Cishwa.

assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
notes: A man who had supported FNL Rwasa and protested against Nkurunziza's third term was killed and dumped in Gitega.
A man was killed by unidentified attackers. His body was dumped in a septic tank in Ntahangwa.
The spouse of Meinta, farmer in Bia village, has been kidnapped last night by Boko Haram armed elements
5 dead in suicide attack by Boko Haram in Sanda-Wadjiri.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Military forces clashed with a militia in Kyavinyonge, causing the population to flee.

actor1: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Hunde Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A Hunde and Nande coalition militia attacked members of the Hutu community with machetes to protest the killing of 2 youths. Soldiers fired into the air to disperse the crowd.

Two soldiers and six militants from the Islamic State were killed in a foiled suicide bombing near Rafah on Wednesday. The bomber had taken advantage of a fog to creep up on an army "installation" when troops spotted and killed him. The military said five other "jihadists" were killed in ensuing clashes. ISIS also claims killing a soldier in Rafah by sniper on the same day
The prime suspect in the Badrashin attack (July 14) was shot dead by security forces in Al Bitash, Alexandria governorate. The Hasam movement had claimed repsonsibility for the attack in July.
ISIS claims destroying an armored vehicle/MRAP of the EG army by IED detonation on the road between Hasna & Nakhel, Central Sinai.
On 13/09 protests were held in Boreda and Karamille towns of Western Haraghe zone. One person was killed by security officers, reasons not known.

On Tuesday and Wednesday, people went to the street to protest the lack of water and electricity. The clashes between rioters and police forces resulted in several material damages to property, a police station plundered, ammunitions and weapons seized. 2 civilians and one soldier dead and 41 wounded.
A situation between two youngsters triggered some clashes between autochthonous and non-native communities. People of both parts were wounded, and some houses were burnt down.

assoc_actor_1: FESCI: Student Federation of Ivory Coast
notes: Students protesting high registration fees and police forces clashed. 3 students were wounded.
Police officers used tear gas to disperse a youth group who blocked roads and hurled stones at the police. The youth group accused a group of women of buying voter IDs.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: The security guard of the General Authority for Culture reportdely kidnapped the Administrative and Financial Affairs Officer of the General authority for Culture of the Government of National Accord, Kassem Badi, on Wednesday morning, in the capital Tripoli. He was later released, being in good health.
A number of young people and residents from Bint Baya organized a protest against the deteriorating living conditions, and demanded the provision of basic commodities.
A number of young people and residents from Obari organized a protest against the deteriorating living conditions, and demanded the provision of basic commodities.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
actor2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: Two militants from the BRSC were killed as forces of the Libyan National Army advanced towards one of their last positions near the City Hotel in Benghazi. One officer and two soldiers were injured. One soldier later died from his wounds.
An explosion followed by an exchange of fire was reported by Kidal inhabitants.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Clashes between JNIM's Katiba Macina and a National Guard patrol was signalled this evening in Kouakourou, Mopti Region. The patrol was ambushed in a forest 5km from Kouakourou without suffering any casualties.

An army colonel was attacked by individuals with covered faces and armed with knives, who then stole an army pick-up truck. It is not determined whether the act had a criminal or political background. Early investigations led by a police unit suggested that the attackers likely belonged to drug- and cigarette-smuggling gangs but it can not be exluded that the Polisario is connected to the attack.

Strike:Strike: More than 30 out of 216 detained activists from the Hirak movement went on a hunger strike in different prisons of Morocco. After two weeks of strike detainees who were moved to Casablanca, Fez, Taza and Taourit were particularly affected.
Hundreds of disgruntled vendors demonstrated peacefully at the Helao Nafidi town at Oshikango in the Ohangwena region.
Former airline workers protest unpaid severance package at Lagos Airport. The protested blocked a road nearby.
Members of IPOB attacked and killed a police officer and injured two others in Oyigbo LGA. The attack was related to a clash in the area the previous day.
Residents block the entrance of the Maritime Academy of Nigeria, Oron in protest of a leadership appointment.

Retired military officers on the platform of the Coalition of Concerned Veterans (CCV) protested at the Federal Ministry of Finance to demand end to illegal deduction from their pensions. The ex-military officers barricaded the main entrance of the ministry.
Security forces "foil" an attempt by suspected Biafran secessionists to burn a market and police station. Extent of damage not known. The perpetrators continued violence the following day.

Four persons, including a retired Major and  a former PDP state chairmen were reportedly killed in a conflict between supporters of All Progressives Congress, APC, and PDP, at Ondo community, in Ogobia, Ugboju District of Otukpo Local Government Area of Benue state. The melee stemmed from a rivalry of the Otukpo council chairman position.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al-Shabab has launched attacks on a base belonging to government forces and AMISOM troops in the locality of Jalalaqsi in Hiiraan Region [central Somalia]. Reports indicate that the sound of both heavy and light firearms being exchanged by the warring sides could be heard in the area. Reports indicate there were causalities on the al Shabaab side, numbers not known (divided among the two days). The attack began late on 13/09 and ended the following morning.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: Early AM, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle region: al Shabaab attacked a Burundian National Defence Force (BNDF) military base. Several soldiers were reported injured.
Al Shabaab attacked military base. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: Kunya-Barow, Baraawe Lower Shabelle region: US forces launched three drone strikes against al Shabaab camps. Six deaths reported.
Afternoon, Makka al Mukarama road, Mogadishu: peaceful pro-government protests were witnessed. The nature of the protest is not known.
There was a pro-government demonstration between KM1-KM3 is Mogadishu. Disruption was minimal.
Civilians burnt several houses belonging to Ethiopian nationals from Oromo ethnicity following the killing of several Somali nationals by Ethiopian forces in Oromo region.
Arrest:Unverified local source reporting suggested Iterim South West (government) forces may have arrested dissidents and MPs planning a motion of non-confidence against President Sharif Hassan.
Early AM, Belet Xawo, Gedo region: al Shabaab assassins killed a civilian suspected of spying for the Somali government.
Two Jubaland soldiers escaping from Belet Xaawo complex attack attempted to stop a NGO-rented vehicle 18km from Luuq. The soldiers opened fire. Two occupants injured.
Hamar Weyne, Mogadishu: a civilian driver was killed by a Somali soldier at a security checkpoint. The reason for the shooting is not known.
Unidentified gunmen with pistols assassinated a civilian near Hormud building in Bakaara Market. Assailants escaped.
A man was stabbed and wounded by an unidentified assailant in the proximity of Lanta Hawada in Bossaso.
Small surveillance drone crashed near former Coca Cola factory. Origin yet unconfirmed.
Over a thousand people marched to Parliament to protest against the killings of Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar. The march was led by the Muslim Judicial Council.

A Limpopo township (GaKgapane) was completely shut down amid violent service delivery protests in the area. Police had to remove some of the burning tyres and large rocks used to blockade the entry road into the area from the R81.

A senior Netwerk24 photographer was assaulted and robbed of all his belongings by protesters in Mooi Uitsig, Kleinmond. Violent protests have occurred as informal settlement residents express displeasure that a local resident had not been awarded a tender to clean up the town's streets.
Merebank residents and South Durban Environmental Alliance activists took to the streets to protest against a logistics park development at the former Clairwood Racecourse.
Members of the National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa (Numsa) have downed tools and protested at Mpact Plastics in Pinetown in Durban in protest against unequal wages and employee benefits.
Some university students abandoned their studies and flocked to the Randburg Magistrates' Court to show their support for Mduduzi Manana who faces assault charges.
Two Taxify vehicles were set alight in Sunnyside, Pretoria during ongoing taxi violence in the province.
Two more women were arrested as disgruntled Thembalethu residents blocked streets for a second day. 300 people blocked the main entrance to the Thembalethu and the N2 with burning tyres.

Suspected gunmen from Kuac and Wau areas clashed with government forces in the Manyang area of Apuk south, Gogrial state, leaving two killed and one wounded. Local officials claimed the gunmen burned down several houses before being repulsed by the state forces.

Traders in Bor closed their shops to protest a disagreement with the government over a new business profit tax. The traders re-opened their shops a few days later after discussions with the authorities. Start date of the protest unclear - report dated 14 September.
Report of rising harassment and robberies by SPLA soldiers around Raja town. Data is unclear - report dated 13 September.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Between 9 and 13 September, SPLA and SPLA-IO forces clashed in Bieh, Koch County, Unity. The offensive was launched in Bieh in retaliation for the previous clashes in Pakur and Koch. Local people, including aid workers, fled into the bushes. An NGO health and nutrition facility in the area was vandalised and looted of supplies during the fighting.

Pro-United People's Front (UPF) students demonstrated at the Bahri and El Sug El Arabi markets in Khartoum against NISS' detention of their fellow students a few days earlier at markets in Omdurman after debates organised by the group. Police arrested nine students involved in the demonstration.

RSF militiamen attacked Tambasi village, Al-Salam locality in South Darfur, killing two residents and injuring several others before fleeing. As a group of residents formed to pursue them, the assaillants ambushed the villagers again, killing another eight and injuring another seven. The attack came against the backdrop of a marriage refusal.
Inhabitants from Kef and al-Galaa paralyzed train-traffic between near Dahmani and Seres, in order to protest against the cancellation of the 4AM-train from Dahmani to Tunis.

Several people rallied outside the parliament on Wednesday at the call of the "Manish Msameh" (I will not Forgive) group to demand the immediate withdrawal of the administrative amnesty bill. The peaceful protest turned violent when people started to throw rocks on the police after they were prevented to enter the parliament. The bill will pardon many administrative employees under the Ben-Ali era.
Dozens of beneficiaries of social housing besiged the local representation of the government in Ain Temouchent, protesting against social housing lists on which they could not find their names.

Social housing beneficiaries forcefully entered the local seat of the administrative region and then protested against social housing lists that were published the day before. Police in place could not prevent them from entering.
Doctors from the Infectious Diseases Department in the CHU hospital in Constantine held a protest throughout yesterday morning to denounce the deplorable conditions they have been in for months.

The evacuation of some families that were living in improvised homes near a gas pipeline in Barais led to altercations between the inhabitants and national gendarmerie. According to inhabitants, one girl died due to teargas used by the gendarmerie. Several injuries were reported as well. Officials deny the death of the girl.

Social housing (LSL) recipients of pre-assignment certificates, observed a sit-in in front of the offices in Souk Ahras to invoke the assignment of their allocations, that have been delayed for several months.

assoc_actor_2: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
notes: The treasurer of UPD-Z was abducted by police officers as he walked down the street in Mutanga.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man from Rutegama was beaten by Imbonerakure for criticising the youth league.

assoc_actor_2: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
notes: A UPD Zigamibanga official was abducted by men in police uniforms driving a car with tinted windows. Neither his family nor the UPD has any information about his whereabouts.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Military forces broke up a barricade that the residents of Buganga had set up, following a clash with the military the previous day.
Strike:Civil society organised a strike in Butembo to call for the resignation of the administration.

Oromo militias attack and kill 32 ethnic Somalis in Aweday. More than 50 dead were later reported by both Oromo and Somali officials. Government forces were sent to restore order. An estimated 55,000 - 70,000  were displaced by recent fighting in the region. "Hundreds" were later arrested. The government sent military forces to the region in response.

Protests against the TPLF take place in several Oromia Region towns (not named). Protesters are demonstrating against the killing of Oromo persons by Somali region militia members, politicians and activists believe the Somali region militias are backed by the ruling party in Ethiopia which is Tigrayan Peopleâs Liberation Front (TPLF).

Residents of eastern Hararghe towns staged protest demonstrations against Liyu violence in Dedere, Qobo, Awoday and Chelenko on 12/09. Two protesters were injured by police in Dedere. Possibly related to the protest, a mob attacked a group of ethnic Somali traders in Aweday, killing more than 30.

Residents of eastern Hararghe towns staged protest demonstrations against Liyu violence in Dedere, Qobo, Awoday and Chelenko on 12/09. Two protesters were injured by police in Dedere. Possibly related to the protest, a mob attacked a group of ethnic Somali traders in Aweday, killing more than 30.

Residents of eastern Hararghe towns staged protest demonstrations against Liyu violence in Dedere, Qobo, Awoday and Chelenko on 12/09. Two protesters were injured by police in Dedere. Possibly related to the protest, a mob attacked a group of ethnic Somali traders in Aweday, killing more than 30.

Residents of eastern Hararghe towns staged protest demonstrations against Liyu violence in Dedere, Qobo, Awoday and Chelenko on 12/09. Two protesters were injured by police in Dedere. Possibly related to the protest, a mob attacked a group of ethnic Somali traders in Aweday, killing more than 30.

People in Chinaksan village demonstrated against continued violence perpetrated by the Liyu police. They also complained that the government was disarming locals but not doing anything to stop the Liyu police. Similar protests took place in Dedere, Qobo, Awoday and Chelenko.

On Tuesday and Wednesday, people went to the street to protest the lack of water and electricity. The clashes between rioters and police forces resulted in several material damages to property, a police station plundered, ammunitions and weapons seized. 2 civilians and one soldier dead and 41 wounded.
Youngsters attacked the Foumbadou police station: local inspector was heavily wounded, and several motorcycles were seized.

A group of businessmen have called upon the police to investigate,and  arrest youths who stoned their vehicles on Tuesday evening as they were coming from Mwingi at the end of a tour of Kiambu, Machakos and Kitui counties.
Officers conducting the ongoing multi-agency security Operation in Lamu have discovered and destroyed three key Al-Shabaab hideouts at Lango la Simba in Witu Division of Lamu West.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A man and his 10-year-old son were wounded on Tuesday by a landmine in Sabri area in central Benghazi. LNA-forces are controlling most of Benghazi. However, the remaining militants, who depend heavily on landmines, are still stationed in a small area in central Benghazi. The mines are said to have been put into place by them.

Forces from Nalut kidnapped 15 Tunisians as a bargaining chip to demand the release of one Libyan citizen who was arrested by Tunisian security forces some weeks ago in the border near Dhehiba. 12 of the 15 Tunisians were released, though 3 Tunisians and the Libyan citizen remain in detention.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: An ophthalmologist was kidnapped in Tripoli. The victim was seized in front of his house by unidentified gunmen, bundled into a vehicle and driven away.
Food producers protesters took to the streets in Morondava. Police fired tear gas at the protesters after they blocked a road.
A National Guard vehicle was seized after an exchange of fire. One civilian wounded.

Former senators tried to hold an improvised session in the former senate but were prevented and chased away by police forces. Reminder that the senate has been abolished by popular referendum around one month ago.

Dozens of construction workers protested at the company responsible for completing the health center project for not paying their wages. According to local sources, the Royal Gendarmerie prevented workers from completing their march towards the center of Tangier city.
Around a dozen of persons staged a sit-in in front of the Court of Appeal in Casablanca to show their support with detainees from the Hirak movement.
Midwives protest in Asokoro, Abuja over non-payment of allowances.

Some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) on 12/09 clashed with the Hausa community in Oyibo Local Government Area of Rivers State. Several injuries reported, buildings destroyed. IPOB instigated the attack by entering a Hausa area, threatening to burn down a mosque.

Thousands of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) being accommodated at the International Market Camp, Makurdi on 12/09 protested alleged diversion of relief materials by camp officials. The protesters overpowered security guards at the camp, and blocked the camp entrance to prevent the vehicles from moving out with the materials.

Soldiers invaded the Secretariat of the Abia State Council of Nigerian Union of Journalists at No. 1 Aba Road Umuahia and assaulted some journalists over articles written critical of the military. The soldiers held the journalists hostage for 10 minutes.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade against an AMISOM patrol. A civilian bystander killed and two injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: AM, Dhobley, Lower Jubba region: a Kenyan military convoy was hit by an improvised explosive device (IED). No causalities. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an IED attack against AMISOM KDF supply convoy from Tabta at Jaldesa area (c. 42 km East of Dhobley). There were no reports of casualties or damages.
Belet Xawo, Gedo region: Kenyan aircraft carried out two airstrikes against al Shabaab at Buursagar and Habar near Belet Xawo. 16 al Shabaab killed and 10 injured.
A mob opens fire on convoy transporting Khat in El Dahir neighbourhood. One Puntland soldier escorting the convoy killed. It is not clear if the perpetrators were rioters or organized.
Two al Shabaab gunmen armed with pistols assassinated suspected defector outside of Marka. Assailants escaped.
Two unidentified gunmen armed with pistols assassinated business woman Duniyo Hussein. Assailants escaped. The motive for the attack is not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: A hand grenade was hurled at AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol at the Livestock Market vicinity in Heliwa district. The soldiers reacted with gunfire. One bystander was killed while three others, including one child, were injured. The perpetrator managed to escape unidentified. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM soldiers on security patrol at Libaanta channel near the main bridge in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the attackers were repelled. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

An SNA soldier shot and killed another government soldier employed by NISA at Albarako junction road neighbourhood in Hodan district. The incident generated an argument between the two parties for unknown reasons. The perpetrator attempted to escape but was eventually apprehended by other SNA soldiers.

A truck owned by Osman Mohamud sub-clan militiaman was hijacked by armed Warsangeli sub-clan militiamen in Sheerbi area (c. 40 km North West of Qardho) and was taken to Dhahar village of Sanaag. Following the incident, Paramilitary police and the armed perpetrators clashed at Dhahar. There was an exchange of gunfire. One police officer and a militiaman were injured. Police recovered the truck and captured one militiaman who was injured. The other militiamen managed to escape.

An IED, planted near the Somali immigration office at the border of Belethawa town and the Kenyan border, exploded. There were no reports of casualties. There were no reports of arrests. Perpetrators not identified.

A civilian truck driver hailing from Majeerten clan was abducted by Farah Cagaweyne militiamen of Hawadle clan in Kooshin neighbourhood, East of Beletweyne town. The militiamen took the man to an unknown location.
A man from Isse Mohamud sub-clan was shot and wounded by an armed perpetrator from Osman Mohamud sub-clan due to a dispute over khat. Police were reported to be investigating.

Alleged armed Warsaageli sub-clan militia established an illegal CP at Ceeldahir area (c. 90 km South of Bossaso). The militia shot and killed a khat dealer and stole the khat. Police arrested the perpetrators.

A truck owned by Osman Mohamud sub-clan militiaman was hijacked by armed Warsangeli sub-clan militiamen in Sheerbi area (c. 40 km North West of Qardho) and was taken to Dhahar village of Sanaag. Following the incident, Paramilitary police and the armed perpetrators clashed at Dhahar. There was an exchange of gunfire. One police officer and a militiaman were injured. Police recovered the truck and captured one militiaman who was injured. The other militiamen managed to escape.
More than 200 demonstrators gathered in the parking area outside the Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) Cape Town campus.
Police used stun grenades to disperse a group of protesting nursing students who were approaching the East London campus.
Furniture was dragged from a restaurantin Hout Bay and set alight to form a burning barricade during a fishing quota protest.
Residents of Marikana informal settlement in Philippi necklaced three suspected robbers to bring the governmentâs attention to the spike in crime in their area.

assoc_actor_2: AMCU: Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union
notes: An Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union (Amcu) official was gunned down at the Impala mine in Rustenburg.

Two men were killed when a service delivery protest turned violent at the Marry Me informal settlement near Soshanguve in Tshwane. Protesters shut down roads with rocks and burning tyres. The tewo deceased are believed to have been killed by protesters.
Three women and a man were arrested for public violence after illegal structures were demolished in Thembalethu, George. Police officers had to use stun grenades to disperse them.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Between 9 and 13 September, SPLA and SPLA-IO forces clashed in Bieh, Koch County, Unity. The offensive was launched in Bieh in retaliation for the previous clashes in Pakur and Koch. Local people, including aid workers, fled into the bushes. An NGO health and nutrition facility in the area was vandalised and looted of supplies during the fighting.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Fighting between government and SPLA-IO/Agwelek forces in Adodo near Aburoc, Upper Nile, forced 30 humanitarian workers and local populations to flee. Government forces captured the area. Rebels claimed 10 civilians killed and shops looted in government attacks on their positions around Aburoc around this time. OCHA claims three civilians killed in the fighting on 11 September. One humanitarian compound was looted and one school was occupied by military forces. An undetermined number of people fled to the bush, and cases of sexual and gender-based violence were reported. The fighting reached Aburoc the following day and SPLA took control of the IDPs camp.

RSF militiamen opened fire and killed a member of the Sudanese army who refused to let them enter Murnei in West Darfur with their motorcycles. The soldiers retaliated, injuring one and capturing another RSF militant.

Demonstrations broke out in El Jareif West, Khartoum, after a death sentence was issued against four people accused of killing the former director of the Sudan Cotton Company three years ago. Police slapped and violently arrested a journalist covering the protest. She was later beaten and verbally abused in detention by NISS officers.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Demonstrations broke out in El Jareif West, Khartoum, after a death sentence was issued against four people accused of killing the former director of the Sudan Cotton Company three years ago. Police slapped and violently arrested a journalist covering the protest. She was later beaten and verbally abused in detention by NISS officers.

SLM-MM claimed to have repulsed an attack by RSF and PDF forces in Diffra area of south western Kordofan state, inflicting "heavy losses of life and equipment". The group also admitted to casualties on its side.
Opposition went to the street to protest against the government refusal to include into the parliamentary debate the consitutional reform.

actor2: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
notes: Units of the National Guard at the Kef dispersed a sit-in staged by students of the Higher Institute of Sports and Physical Education (ISSEP) wishing to enroll in master. According to the Institute's management, the protesters blocked the entrance of the establishment and interrupted the normal course of activity.

According to statements by recently arrested militants clashes between Ajnad al-Khilefa and the Okba Ibn Nafaa brigade took place on Mont Salloum. The statements indicate that this was caused by difficult living conditions in the mountains and ongoing Tunisian security operations.

Several protesters rallied outside the Municipial theatre in Tunis on Tuesday at the call of the "Manish Msameh" (I will not Forgive) group to protest against the foreseen adoption of the administrative amnesty bill in the national assembly. The bill will pardon many administrative employees under the Ben-Ali era.
Conductors subscribing to the Kampala Operational Taxi Stages Association (KOTSA)  matched on the streets of Kampala supporting the move to uplift the age limit.

assoc_actor_1: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: MDC-T senators protested Grace Mugabe at the opening of parliament, singing and holding placards.
The Riot Police used teargas to disperse a crowd of 500 people who had gathered to witness the coronation of the Ndebele king.

Strike: The National Coordinating Committee for Professional Integration Workers and the Social Network decided to organize a national strike in all directorates, expressing their indignation at policies of indifference and marginalization that authorities pursue regarding the problem of difficult working conditions.
Dozens of beneficiaries of social housing besiged the local representation of the government in Ain Temouchent, protesting against social housing lists on which they could not find their names.
Dozens of parents from school children protested in front of the regional seat of the region in Bouira against the authorities disregard of their demands to improve conditions for their children.

assoc_actor_1: CNAPESTE: Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers
notes: The 'Autonomist National Council of High School and Technical School Teachers' organized a sit-in in front of the local seat of the education directorate in Relizane. They protested, amongst others, against the their sidelining in meetings to solve professional and socio-economic problems of employees.

assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
notes: A Frodebu official who owns a bar in Kirambi was beaten by police for refusing to serve them free drinks.
A man from Nyabitsinda was beaten by undentiifed attackers.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Government forces regained control of Kilembwe, which had been taken by Mayi Mayi Yakutumba. 6 people were killed, several people were injured, and 3 soldiers were taken prisoner.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Government forces clashed with Mayi Mayi Yakutumba in Penemende, Makola, Mapanda, and Kiungwe.

notes: Government forces clashed with Mayi Mayi Yakutumba in Lubango

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Government forces clashed with Mayi Mayi Yakutumba in Lwiko

notes: Students in Butembo held a protest. The police broke up the protesters by firing live bullets. Several people were injured.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: A crowd in Nyandura rioted and stoned a soldier to death when he accidentally shot a child in a tree.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: An angry group of people attacked a group of soldiers in Buganga, Kalehe. The rioters disarmed the soldiers and killed one of the soldiers.

State of Sinai attacked a police convoy with an SVBIED before ambushing the convoy in person and killing the rest of the police forces in a shootout. 18 policemen (plus the driver) were killed in the attack in Bir el-Abed.
ISIS claims to have repelled an army campaign in the Rafah area, engaging in combat & forcing army to withdraw. ISIS burned a bulldozer & destroyed another bulldozer by IED amidst army withdrawal
ISIS claims to have repelled an army campaign in the Rafah area, engaging in combat & forcing army to withdraw. ISIS burned a bulldozer & destroyed another bulldozer by IED amidst army withdrawal
A Oromo civilian is killed in Gursum. Local authorities blame Liyu militias.

A gun battle was reported between police and Al Shabaab militants in Mandera Town Monday morning. Mandera County Commissioner Fredrick Shisia said more security personnel had been deployed to secure the area but could not confirm if there were casualties so far.

Striking nurses protest outside Afya House in Nairobi on September 11, 2017. On the same day, taxi drivers working for Uber, Little, Taxify and Mondo began an indefinite strike in protest of the rates at which they are currently being paid. Tens of drivers gathered outside City Hall in Nairobi, hooting and making their plight known to passers-by.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Arrest:Imam Abdul Razzaq Musheireb from the Bin Nabi Mosque in al-Sareem street has been arrested by authorities. He is accused of sending youth to tension hotspots and said to be close to Tripoli Mufti Gharyani.

Eyewitnesses said that one person was killed yesterday by unknown gunmen, near the post of El Salamani junction in the city of Benghazi. It is not clear whether the act has a political or criminal background.
Inhabitants of Benghazi protested to demand the dismissal of the mayor, making him responsible for the accumulation of garbage in the city.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
notes: Special forces of the LNA arrived in Bin Jawad and Ras Lanuf to be prepared against Islamic State elements near the city. The LNA also moved in the direction of Harawa and Wadi al-Ahmar due to recent reports of Islamic State activity there.
9 villagers were killed in an attack by Dahalo militia in Ihosy.
Gao's 8th district, airport and the FAMa camp subjected to mortar fire this morning, 2 Malian soldiers lightly wounded

Journalists staged a sit-in in front of the National Directory of Security in Nouakchott. They protest against the confiscation of passports from some colleagues and tracking of their professional activities.

Former senators tried to hold an improvised session in the former senate but were prevented and chased away by police forces. Reminder that the senate has been abolished by popular referendum around one month ago.

Aggrieved shareholders protested  the Annual General Meeting of Oando Plc at Ibom Hall in Uyo, Akwa Ibom State with placards demanding the resignation of the company's Group Chief Executive Officer over mismanagement.
Military forces kill five suspects involved in the attack on Ancha on 07/09.
Youths barricade the office of an oil company. The group was protesting the company's refusal to relocate its head office from Lagos to Akwa Ibom State.
Strike:NLC Zamfara government workers begin a labour strike over non-payment of salaries.

Early AM, Belet Xawo, Gedo region: al Shabaab temporarily captured the border town of Belet Xaawo after launching a large-scale complex attack. The attack began with an IED detonated at a police station. The source suggests 30 Somali soldiers may have been killed. Xinhua reported 26 government soldier dead. Police and military forces re-gained control of the town in the evening hours, causalities not known. Al Shabaab destroyed much of the town upon their exit. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Jajeele clan militias in Maroodile (c. 20 km West of Beletweyne town). There was an exchange of small arms fire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Two al Shabaab fighters and a militiaman were killed while three clan militias were injured. The injured were taken to hospital at Hawlwadag neighbourhood, West of Beletweyne for further treatment. Contradicting this report, a second source reports Ethiopian Liyu Police were involved.
Al Shabaab attacked military checkpoint at Arabiiska near Afgooye. Two al Shabaab killed.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a military technical vehicle carrying nine SNA soldiers at Haansheekh neighbourhood (c. 09 km East of Balcad district). At least five soldiers were killed and the SNA technical vehicle was burnt.

Early AM, Belet Xawo, Gedo region: al Shabaab temporarily captured the border town of Belet Xaawo after launching a large-scale complex attack. The attack began with an IED detonated at a police station. The source suggests 30 Somali soldiers may have been killed. Xinhua reported 26 government soldiers dead. Police and military forces re-gained control of the town in the evening hours. Al Shabaab destroyed much of the town upon their exit. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

Wehliye Hotel, Mogadishu: a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) parked along Makka al Mukarama road detonated, killing one and injuring six others. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility, stating the intended target was government officials.
Suspected al Shabaab militants kidnapped several local NGO employees west of Baidoa near Aawdiinle.

Unidentified men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, hurled a hand grenade at the residence of the Police Commissioner of Baidoa in Hawlwadag neighbourhood. The grenade landed on the street near the house. A female bystander was slightly injured. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. There were no reports of arrests.

SNA soldiers, in an escort vehicle, shot at a crowd of civilians at Lamiyaraha Zobe in Wadajir District to clear road traffic. At least three civilians were injured and rushed to Madina Hospital for treatment. The SNA vehicle did not stop after the incident.

A civilian man hailing from Leelkase sub-clan of Daarood was shot and killed by unknown armed men near Kulmiye Hotel at Garsoor village in North Galkayo. Puntland police arrived at the scene of the incident. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive of the killing was unknown.
11 September, PM, Daarsoor, Galkacyo, Mudug region: unidentified gunmen assassinated a youth activist.

Abgaal clan militias attacked Biyomal sub-clan militias based at Muri village (c. 18 km West of Afgoye district). At least two militias from Biyomal sub-clan were killed while two others were injured. The motive of the attack was related to clan retaliation.

Hundreds of protesters demonstrated on the streets of Cel-Buh village (c. 111 km South East of Cerigabo) in protest against the denial of the Somali shillings by local traders. The demonstration ended peacefully.
A group of about 60 fishermen marched on the office of the Department of Agriculture Forestry and Fisheries (DAFF) in Cape Town.
CPUT's Cape Town campus was petrol bombed on September 11, and stun grenades were fired by police during protests at the institution.
Protesting pupils set eSokheni Secondary School, in Greytown, near Pietermaritzburg, ablaze during unrest.

About 100 BLF members gathered at Gandhi Square in the Johannesburg CBD under the watchful eye of police to march to FNB Bank City following a failed meeting with FNB chief executive, Jacques Celliers.
Angry community took to the streets and blocked the road in Mmakau in support of the Mmakau kraal, endorsing its legitimacy to royal status.

Unknown militants ambushed and raped two girls on their way back from collecting hay near Jumeizaya in Tawila locality, North Darfur.
Unknown militants shot and killed a displaced farmer when he was tilling his farm in Kullu, near Tawila, in North Darfur.
Interim teachers form Kairouan staged a sit-in in front of the National Assembly to demand regulating their professional situation.

To denounce the delay of public authorities in responding to their demands, the communal guards staged sit-in in front of the headquarters of the wilaya of Bejaia. They demand an improvement in their socio-economic- and working conditions.

The residents of HaÃ¯ Meddah, a village in the commune of Sidi Chahmi, held a protest rally at the planned hospital's roundabout to denounce the delay in launching the land regularization plan for this site as promised by the former governor in December 2016.
Detainees of Kibago prison were tied up and beaten by the police chief.

Ten militants from Egypt's Islamic State group affiliate were killed on Sunday in a police raid and a near three-hour shootout in Ard al-Lewa neighbourhhood. Five policemen were wounded in the clashes at two apartments.
Arrest:A human rights lawyer, was arrested at Cairo International Airport as he was travelling to a UN conference on enforced disappearances. He was held incommunicado for 3 days.
ISIS claims two previous IED attacks on Armed Personl Carriers in Al Arish.

East Hararge, Chinaksan woreda 10 houses were burned down by from a heavy gunfire, presumably from Liyu forces. Following the attack locals in the area clashed with the Liyu police, reportedly driving them from the area. Causalities not known.
In Borana zone, Wachile woreda, in a place called "Laga Siminto" Liyu Police attacked civilians. Heavy weapons were reportedly used. Causalities not known.

In East Shewam Walanchite city a Oromo man is killed and his brother wounded. The event occurred on or before 10/09. Perpetrators not known. Local residents believe the perpetrator to be a Tigray man.

In East Shewam Walanchite city, a Tigray man was accused by a crowd of "spying" on people in the area. He was also accused of killing an Oromo man by the name of Bakala Babsa, and wounding his brother. The crowd lynched the man, burning his body in the main street.

At least one police officer was killed and two others injured when the vehicle in which they were travelling ran over an improvised explosive device (IED) in the coastal Lamu County on Sunday evening.
Three people have been killed and eight others seriously injured in a banditry attack in Baragoi town, Samburu County

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Employees of the General Authority for Culture of the Government of National Reconciliation protested at the headquarters of the Commission in Tripoli, to demand the demission of the Chairman of the Steering Committee of the Authority, to protest the closure of the Dar Al-Fagih Hassan centre and other assaults on cultural institutions. The protestors Tripoliâs Rada (âDeterrenceâ) force for forcibly closing the centre and ejecting staff.
A number of young people and residents of Al Ghuraifa municipality in Wadi Al-Ajal organized a protest against the deteriorating living conditions, and demanded the provision of basic commodities.
2 men shot to death a person in Kidal city centre.
The village of Kanio was besieged by "jihadists" for days following recent clashes with villagers, supplies scarce.
Militias from Ugbo and Ugbonla clash in Ugbonla clash for a second day. Injuries reported.

Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures "destroyed."
After a restaurant patron dies of food poisoning a "mob" gathers outside the establishment before they were dispersed by police.
Military forces ambush a Boko Haram contingent along Ngurosoye-Bama road, neutralizing a "large number" and recovering equipment. Several soldiers were reported wounded.

Soldiers, police and members of IPOB clash in Umuahia after soldiers attacked the home of an IPOB leader in the city, killing five. The military denied this report, stating that IPOB members blocked a road and threw objects at police.  IPOB, however, claimed the attack on the leader's home was an unprovoked attack. A late report by the Guardian claims 15 were killed in a battle between the two sides at the home of the leader.
Activists burn a coffin in Lagos to express dissatisfaction with the call for Nigeriaâs separation and restructuring. Date not known, source dated 10/09.

Soldiers on security patrol shot and killed a suspected al Shabaab militant armed with hand grenade and pistol at Ali Boolay village neighbourhood. NISA conducted security search operation in the area and arrested number of suspects.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Mogadishu Stadium: al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against the African Union base in Mogadishu Stadium, Wardhigley district. Several rounds landed within the base. No causalities reported.

Al Shabaab fighters detained a local business woman in Hagar town (c. 160 km North West of Kismayo) and was taken to unknown destination. The woman was a resident of Dhobley and was alleged to have connections with Jubbland forces.

Beledweyne, Hiiraan region: a suicide bomber detonated near the Beledweyne Administration Headquarters Building. Six deaths reported, four injuries. The fatality counted was raised to 7 in the following days, per Shabelle Radio Network.
Bakaara Market: unknown gunmen assassinated a businesswoman in Bakaara Market.
Dharkenley district: a Member of Parliament (MP) survived an assassination attempt. Another traveller in the vehicle was killed and a second injured. Perpetrators not known.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills a government soldier.
MoSF units cordon-off suspected VBIED parked near the Parliament Building.
About 50 residents of Kensington in the Cape Town northern suburbs picketed along Voortrekker Road demanding more police to combat gangsterism in the community.
Two roads leading to Kleinmond were closed as 300 people burnt tyres in protest action.

Supporters from football club "Club Africain" staged a sit-in in front of the training stadium of the Club to denounce the mismanagement of the club by the executive committee.

Violence erupted n Busei, Iganga District when supporters of a Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) candidate were attacked by thugs affilaited with NRM who were armed with pangas and sticks, leaving them with several wounds.

ADF attacked the Besongabang army camp, 3 dead and one wounded seriously.

3R men attacked the Vacap village (30km from Bouar): houses were burnt down. 3 civilians dead and several wounded.

An official of  Somali Region, Hudet woreda, Liben zone, was killed along with some militia men (numbers not known) on 09/09.  The man was a head of Water and Rural Infrastructure of the woreda. The perpetrators are unknown.

In East Hararge zone, Midaga lola woreda, Somali Liyu police reportedly attacked an area, killing 4 people and wounding 2 others. It is not clear if the targets were civilian or military. Armed Oromos retaliated, killing 7 Liyu policemen and wounding 3 others including a commander.

Clashes continued in Rayitu Woreda of Bale zone. According to Pro-Oromo sources, more than 25 Liyu police have been killed so far during clashes in the woreda. This number has not yet been confirmed. Several Oromos were also killed and wounded.
