9th September, 11:00LT, Mogadishu: the Dharkenley District Commissioner survived an assassination attempt by al Shabaab in Wadijir District.

9th September, Mogadishu: a local government official and a Somali soldier were assassinated by al Shabaab in Hodan and Boondheere districts respectively. The military claims the soldier survived, however al Shabaab claims the target died in the attack.

Employees of Berbera port boycotted from work in protest of the new safety measures imposed by a commercial company on all staff, contractors and agents when accessing the port. The safety measures included possession of a metal helmet, a safety vest and safety shoes.

9th September, Mogadishu: a local government official and a Somali soldier were assassinated by al Shabaab in Hodan and Boondheere districts respectively. The military claims the soldier survived, however al Shabaab claims the target died in the attack.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a civilian man at Cagadhiig vicinity in Wardhigley district. The victim was in his barber shop when he was attacked. The motive of the killing was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A civilian man hailing from Abgaal clan was shot and killed by Hawadle clan militias at the border between Maxaas and Ceel bur (c. 100 km North East of Beletweyne). The motive of the killing was revenge of the man who hailed from Hawadle who was killed by Murusade clan militias on the previous day. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. The situation was reported to be tense between the clans. Clan militias were reported to be mobilizing for possible attacks.
Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a local businessman at Siigale neighbourhood in Hodan district for unknown reasons. The perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: Al Shabaab ambush UPDF convoy, no casualties.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Ceasefire/Peacetalks:The Commissioner of Nyal county in Southern Liech state defected to the rebel SPLA-IO led by Machar, denouncing the government's failure to restore peace after the 2015 peace agreement.

actor1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)Â Presidential Security Unit
notes: Two presidential guards reportedly attempted to attack a former South Sudanese newspaper editor at his house in Thongpiny area of Juba. They left as neighbours intervened.

Unknown gunmen ambushed a World Vision vehicle on its way to a workshop at Lunyaker hospital in Apuk South county, Gogrial state, leaving one injured and stealing $70,000 belonging to the organization at gunpoint.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Between 9 and 13 September, SPLA and SPLA-IO forces clashed in Bieh, Koch County, Unity. The offensive was launched in Bieh in retaliation for the previous clashes in Pakur and Koch. Local people, including aid workers, fled into the bushes. An NGO health and nutrition facility in the area was vandalised and looted of supplies during the fighting.

actor1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
notes: A number of rebel groups have accused UNAMID of handing over two of its former bases in Maleet and Malha areas of North Darfur to the RSF, breaching the Status of Forces Agreement (SOFA) signed between the Government of Sudan (GoS) and the UN mission. The UNSC has recently agreed to scale down UNAMID's operations in Sudan.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: 2 MDC-T ward officials were attacked by ZANU-PF youths in Chitungwiza for campaigning.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: ZANU PF youths beat an MDC-T activist in Whitecliffe, when they saw him dropped off in an MDC-T vehicle.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: An Imbonerakure was held and tortured by a military commander until he urinated blood. He was accused of stealing from a field, however it is believed that he was targeted to set an example that the CNDD-FDD is improving its image.
5 hostages kidnapped on 17 August by Boko Haram were freed.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa (Amidou Faction)
actor2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa (Ousta Faction)
notes: Clashes between FPRC faction. No casualty toll available.

actor1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
actor2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa (Ousta Faction)
assoc_actor_2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa (Amidou Faction)
notes: MINUSCA forces intervened to divide the two factions: 10 dead and several wounded.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 9 people were killed in a land dispute between Kalumbi village and Ngelwe village. The militia used machetes and shotguns to fight each other.

In Moyale, Borana zone, Chamluk town 12 people were killed and 9 wounded during clashes between Liyu police and Oromo people. Liyu police were supported by Ethiopian military army. People in the area have been evacuating in fear of continued clashes. Later in the day  Liyu militias attacked from a state of retreat from the previous day. Liyu police later returned to the area, sparking clashes that reportedly killed up to 80 people - 60 Liyu police and 20 Oromos. (These numbers may be unreliable - a conservative estimate was made at 50, making the total for the day 62.)

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: Family members of Ibrahim Jadhran were kidnapped from their residence in Tripoli by the "Special Deterrent Forces" belong to the Ministry of Interior. Former militia-leader Jadhran said that his family members had been subjected to "intimidation and espionage, forcibly taking them to an unknown place and hiding them there.
Daesh elements and movement were repoted in Harawa.
The explosion of a vehicle on a IED in the Etambar valley was reported by Kidal inhabitants.

2 "jihadists" killed by Barkhane (Tigre helos & mountain commandos/paratroopers) on Sept 8, in N'daki near the BurkinaFaso border. 2 pick-ups, 3 motorbikes, 3 AK-47s, ammunition, IED-manufacturing materiel seized.
Two suicide bombers attack Muna Garage area. The bombers were reported dead, five other injuries.
At least seven people were killed when Boko Haram attacked an IDP camp in Ngala. The attack began with RPG fire followed by sustained gunfire.

A group of "local hunters and vigilantes" battle Boko Haram in Buni Tadi area. Two Boko Haram deaths reported, six injuries, weapons recovered and 13 hostages released. Six of the hostages were believed to be children who were abducted in Biu LGA on 19/08.
8th September, evening, Mogadishu: a Somali National Police Force (SNPF) officer was assassinated by al Shabaab gunmen. The district within the city is not known.
8th September, 18:00LT, Baidoa, Bay region: a suicide bomber detonated his vest inside a popular restaurant. At least six dead and others injured.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: A roadside bomb struck an armoured vehicle outside the town of Mahaday, Middle Shabeelle Region. The vehicle was part of a convoy travelling from the town. The blast killed at least 11 Burundian soldiers and destroyed the vehicle. Burundian military commanders have yet to speak on the attack.

Two armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, using pistols shot and killed a military officer at Tabeelaha Weydow neighbourhood in Dayniile district. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the assassination

Approximately 100 locals conducted a peaceful demonstration on the road linking the Airport and Botan in protest to the inflated exchange rate of Somali Shilling to the US dollar. The demonstration ended peacefully without any incident.

A local business man hailing from Hawadle clan was shot and killed by an armed militiaman from Jajeele clan at Hawlwadag neighbourhood of Beletweyne town. The motive behind the shooting was related to clan retaliation. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene. Security forces were deployed to the scene where they conducted search operation but there were no reports of arrests.

A civilian man hailing from Hawadle clan was shot and killed by militiamen from Murusade clan at the border between Maxaas and Ceelbur (c. 100 km North East of Beletweyne town). The motive of the killing was related to disputes over grazing land. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Tension between the two clans was high as clan militias were reported to be mobilizing at their respective settlements.
Protests in Ceelasha Biyaha and Afgooye after AMISOM forces shot and killed a farmer.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: AMISOM soldiers shot dead farmer after he threw stones at a patrol. AMISOM dogs had eaten the farmer's chickens.
Protests in Ceelasha Biyaha and Afgooye after AMISOM forces shot and killed a farmer.
JSF soldiers killed a young civilian after he failed to stop when ordered.

Fighting between rival clans left at least two people killed and three injured. Their identities of the clans are not known.  Ahmed Abdi Yusuf, FGS representative in Gadoon, announced tensions remain high despite clan elder mediation.
Duduble gunmen assassinated two Habargidir/Ceyr. Linked to previous clan fighting.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: Al Shabaab claimed its fighters attacked a Djiboutian base near Buulo Burto. Causalities not known.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: Unidentified gunmen ambushed an ICRC convoy of nine trucks and shot at a four-wheel-drive vehicle, leaving the driver killed. The convoy was returning from a humanitarian mission in Western Equatoria and was attacked in Kotobe, Amadi area.

Thousands of people marched through the streets of Mbabane on 8 September 2017 to deliver a petition which calls for democracy and socioeconomic justice to the country's Cabinet. The Swaziland United Democratic Front organised the march.

Citizens of Bouarada protested, thereby blocking the railway line at the local station, preventing the passage of trains in both directions. The protesters wanted to draw the attention of railway officials to the problems caused by the change in the timetable of certain trains, as well as the cancellation of certain shuttles.

Inhabitants from Giyada in Nefza staged a sit-in in front of the seat of seat of the prefecture in Nefza. They demand proper water supply and the set-up of infrastructure to better connect their villages.

A municipal police officer was assaulted with a knife this Friday in Tunis at the time he was performing his job. The police officer had seized in accordance with the decree of the governor of Tunis, the merchandise of a street vendor who had improvisationally set up his shop on the stret.
The mayor's office in Diguel, Soum attacked by presumed Ansaroul Islam members, material damages & the accountant abducted.

A family in Muyange was ambushed and attacked by an unidentified group wielding machetes. 2 people were killed and another was wounded. It is believed that they were attacked because of a land dispute.
A cameraman for the Radio Television Nationale de Burundi was beaten by police officers.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure attacked and beat 2 young men, who they accused of failing to report a dead goat.

A couple and their father were ambushed by an unidentified group and hacked by machetes as they returned home in Muyange. The couple died and the father was badly injured. Their neighbours believe that they were targeted because they had been part of a protest against a high court decision over a land case.
Following some illegal exactions on Njindoun farmers, people's protestations resulted into the death of a young man.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa (Amidou Faction)
actor2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa (Ousta Faction)
notes: Two factions of FPRC clashed in Bria: 10 dead and 50 wounded.
5 civilians died in violent clashes after an aid worker was killed.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Nyatura militia attacked Mutanda village. 3 villagers were wounded.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Nyatura militia attacked a military base in Bwalanda. 3 militia were killed.

actor2: FLEC-FAC: Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda-Armed Forces of Cabinda
notes: Angolan forces surrounded the village of Kakongo, in Lukula, because they believed that the villagers have been harbouring FLEC-FAC militants.
2 police officers were wounded after being subjected to heavy gunfire.
ISIS claims killing 2 EG soldiers by sniping at CP in El Arish. On the same day, ISIS claimed damaging two armoured vehicles at Kilo 17 near al-Arish with a heavy sniper.
Suspected Liyu militia attack Moyale, leading to a clash from defending residents. Fatalities are believed to be about 30.
On Sept. 7, at least four people were killed near Moyale when Oromo militia armed with machetes attacked patients in a hospital. The motive of the attack is believed to be revenge.
Oromo militias push Liyu militia out of Chamuk. Several fatalities reported, though no numbers were provided.

In Baale Zone, Rayitu woreda, Somale Liyu police reportedly attacked villagers in the area. Locals (Oromos) fought back, killing 8 of the Liyu police. 3 Oromos were killed and an additional 5 were wounded. The armed Oromos reportedly took control of a kabele that had been given by the government to Somali region, controlling it for a bit of time until federal troops intervened and took it back, causalities not known.
People blocked the Northern route linking Ivory Coast to Burkina Faso and Mali to protest against bad route conditions and general insecurity.
People went to the street to protest against bad route conditions and general insecurity.
Unknown people have torched the offices of Homa Bay Governor on Thursday night. Police arrested one person following the incident

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
notes: Five individuals have been assassinated/executed in Ajdabiya after Saiqa-commander Warfalli arrived in the city. He is said to be involved in the executions.

Military battalions belonging to the command of the Tobruk military area found at dawn Friday the bodies of 13 Egyptian migrants near the al-Jaghbub oasis, south of Tobruk. It is not clear who is responsible for the death of the 13 Egyptians.

An independent force from Qatrun consisting of army soldiers, revolutionaries & volunteers, and led by a veteran Tebu militia leader, claim to have closed the Southern border. A source claimed that the Tebu-commander was hoping to be paid by the Europeans for his actions.

The Tanarut Libyan Creativity Society announced its suspension of activities in order to preserve the safety of its members due to the repeated attacks on the headquarters and its members in the city of Benghazi.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A Chadian national was killed by a landmine explosion in the Sabri area of __the eastern city of Benghazi. Landmines are mostly remains of the BRSC after having been defeated.
A bandit was killed in a clashes with military forces in Lambomay, Ankerana,_Ambohimahasoa.

Workers of Balearia Company for Maritime Transport organized a protest with The Moroccan Workers' Union against the dismissal of workers by the Ministry of equipment, transport, logistics and water, after it was expected to renew the company's utilisation of the line between Nador and Ameria.

17 Boko Haram fighters stormed Mallan village (near Maiduguri) at about 8:00 am (0700 GMT) on Thursday (07/09), killing two farmers. The group attack the village the previous evening as well. The attacks were an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia.

Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures "destroyed."
Nineteen are dead following a Fulani attack on Ancha, a village in Maingo, Bassa Local Government Area. The attack came during the evening hours.
Air forces bomb Boko Haram areas in Zanari, which borders Lake Chad. An "unknown number" were believed to have been killed.
Unidentified gunmen abducted 20 bus travellers in Isiokpo.
Socialist Women association demonstrated in front of the Rebeuss prison asking for the liberation of Dakar Mayor, Khalifa Sall.
A police officer is killed by unidentified gunmen. Assailants escaped. Motives understood to be related to land-grabbing/clan tensions in Dharkenley.
7th September, AM, Bakool: Somali soldiers killed an al Shabaab sympathizer in Mora Gabey. The District Commissioner criticised the move, describing the action as an 'assassination.'

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab claimed to have killed two AMISOM soldiers during an ambush near Ceel Waregow. No independent verification. Calamada reports the attack occurred on 06/09.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: IED detonates as BNDF foot patrol in Burane. No casualties. Perpetrators al Shabaab.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: US AFRICOM announces airstrike in support of Somali forces near Baraawe. At least one death. Intended target unknown.

Defection: Bishar Adan, a reportedly high-ranking al Shabaab leader in Gedo, defected this morning (07/09) to the Federal Government of Somalia in Baardheere. Secondary sources claim the event took place on the previous day.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Defusal: ENDF EOD team notices IED. Devices safely destroyed, no casualties. Perpetrators al Shabaab.
Gunmen attack house near Korontada Junction. One woman killed, one injured. Gunmen later arrested by security forces. Incident related to clan/family tensions/land grabbing.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy at Buurane village neighbourhood exploded (c. 03 km West of Mahaday district). Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Hundreds of protesters conducted a violent demonstration in Qardho in protest to the inflated exchange rate of Somali Shilling to the US dollar. All markets were closed. There were no immediate reports of casualties or arrests.

Armed men stole 50 camels from a prominent Habar-Jeclo elder near Damala Xagare village (c. 99 km South East of Erigavo). The raiders were believed to be from Darod (Warsangeli and Dulbahante clans). The incident was as a result of previous cases of raiding between the clans (darod-Isaq).

Two armed men using pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed a civilian man near Dabakayo Madow vicinity in Dharkenley district. The victim was attacked shortly after exiting his shop. The perpetrators escaped. The District Police arrived at the scene but there were no reports of arrests. The motive of the killing remains unknown.

Al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a well-known traditional elder at Zone K village in Hodan district. The victim was exiting a mosque after-evening prayers when he was attacked. The victim was an electoral member of Galmudug state elections in 2016. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: IED targets AMISOM convoy. No casualties reported.
Three cars were torched in a Johannesburg business district on Thursday in the latest clash between drivers with ride-hailing service Uber and traditional cabbies.
Angry residents in Sheffield Road, Philippi, barricaded a street, which they claimed is a street of death after a woman was knocked over and killed on the road.
Armed youth clashed with police forces in Rumbek after raiding cows in the town, leaving at least seven killed and eight injured. The assaillants briefly overran the police station.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Clashes between SPLA-IO and government forces in Gany payam, Koch county and Pakur in Unity. A Northern Liech security official said the clashes left 28 killed and 33 wounded on their side, while 100 rebels were also killed. He also accused the rebels of burning down houses and raiding cattle. The attacks have reportedly left Pakur completely burned down, including offices of humanitarian agencies and a health centre, and have led to retaliatory attacks in Bieh.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: Clashes between SPLA-IO and government forces in Gany payam, Koch county and Pakur in Unity. A Northern Liech security official said the clashes left 28 killed and 33 wounded on their side, while 100 rebels were also killed. He also accused the rebels of burning down houses and raiding cattle. The attacks have reportedly left Pakur completely burned down, including offices of humanitarian agencies and a health centre, and have led to retaliatory attacks in Bieh.

assoc_actor_2: CHADEMA: Party for Democracy and Progress
notes: Gunmen shot and wounded prominent Tanzanian opposition politician Tundu Lissu, an outspoken government critic, outside his home in the capital Dodoma.

Riot police fired tear gas at massive crowds gathered in Togo's capital late Thursday, breaking up the huge opposition protests against President Faure Gnassingbe's regime. In the Be area, where there were clashes with police throughout the night, barricades of rocks and burning tyres were visible. Demonstrators, blowing whistles and waving Togo's green, yellow and red flag, had said they were determined to stay in the streets "all night" but were finally made to disperse by security forces.

Tunisian  farmers gathered on Thursday, September 07, 2017 at Kasbah Square to protest against the deterioration of their living conditions and to challenge the authorities on the problems the sector is facing.
A customs official that was recently transferred to Tabarka was found hanged in his house. It is unclear what the motives behind the killing were.

In Medrissa, teachers observed a sit-in of two hours in protest against the absence of a director in this establishment who experienced organizational disturbances that they impute in part to the former director transferred elsewhere.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat a man in Buhiga, who they accused of scratching their car. They yelled that diry Tutsis must not drive in their parking lot.
Police officers beat a young domestic worker.
A man in Kabizi was killed and thrown into the Nyakabanda river.
A man in Kivuruga was killed and his body dumped in a field.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 2 Imbonerakure, led by a tax collector, beat a man in Nyamitwenzi until he lost consciousness.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure beat 2 policemen in Shanga when the policemen intervened to try to protect a civilian.

notes: An ex-FAB officer was abducted by SNR officials.
5 people abducted in Dzaba on the night of 05 September returned to their village.
200 people participated in a demonstration to protest against overcrowding in the Dungu prison.

Strike: Civil society held a strike to protest the lack of protection of civilians in Butembo. A week later, on 12 September, civil society also organised a strike in Butembo to call for the resignation of the administration.
Two gunmen were killed in clashes while attemping to attack a checkpoint in al Arish.

In East Hararge Zone, Mieso district, Somali special police (liyu) reportedly threw a grenade that landed near students who were registering for school. 4 children were seriously hurt. The school name was Buno primary school. Event not confirmed.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in Hindi village in Lamu county. Police have lauched an investigation.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in Lamu county. Police have lauched an investigation.

Deployment:The Southern African Development Community (SADC) has deployed a standby force from South Africa, Angola and Mozambique into Lesotho, as the regional bloc moves to avert another bout of instability prompted by this week's assassination of Lesotho Defence Force (LDF) commander, Lieutenant-General Khoantle MotÅ¡omotÅ¡o.
The imam of a mosque in al-Bayda was reportedley killed by the Shura Council of Darna Mujahedeen as he returned to his family home in Darna for Eid el-Adha.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: A neurologist was stabbed by a soldier from the LNA on Wednesday. The neurologist was heavily injured. The director of the hospital called on the LNA to arrest their fellow soldier.

admin1: Tajura wa an Nawahi al Arba
notes: On Wednesday, employees of the Central Bank of Libya organized a protest in front of the bank's headquarters in Tripoli, denouncing the kidnapping of the director of the information technology department at the bank by unknown persons. It was later revealed that the director was arrested by a militia on criminal charges, in accordance with the law.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: A teenager was injured by an IED in Benghazi. The Libyan National Army warned residents from reentering their homes without attention as many landmines were put in place by the now defeated BRSC.

Sporadic armed clashes broke out between youths of the Qadhafi tribe and gunmen from Misrata in Sirte last night, injuring an elderly woman inside her home in the popular neighborhood. Earlier, gunmen belonging to one of the military battalions in Misrata raided the house of a member of the tribe of Qadhafi in the district to arrest him.
Angry villagers killed a suspected pyromance in Sakoamadinika.
Attempt to seize a FAMa supply vehicle "foiled" at MÃ©naka market, one soldier killed one wounded.
Sub-saharan Migrants were fighting with residents of Tangiers Masnana neighbourhood. Security forces intervened after they were informed about the clashes. The migrants were later deported.
Bandits plundered refugees' shops in Tabaraybaray, 6 km from Ayorou. One refugee wounded.
Boko Haram attacked Kesa Kura village near Maiduguri on the evening of 06/09, killing three. The attack was an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia.

Boko Haram attacked Mallan village near Maiduguri on the evening of 06/09. Three reported dead. The attack was an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia. Boko Haram also attacked Kesa Kura in coordination with this strike.

Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures "destroyed."

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Local Security forces and ENDF attacked an al Shabaab position in a village (not named) outside Buurhakaba town (c. 60 km South East of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabab managed to escape. After a short stay at the location, the security forces returned to their base in Buurhakaba town. There were no reports of casualties. The government is said to be in control of the town.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked an military position at Imbareeso village (c. 05 km North of Barawe district). AS was forced to retreat. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

Kismayo: an explosion was reported in a restaurant owned by a Jubaland Member of Parliament. The target is believed to have been Jubaland soldiers. At least one injury reported. Other causality figures are not known.

An RCIED targeting an SNA convoy in Elasha neighbourhood at Hawo-taako/Afgooye village near Orphanage camp (Xero Agoon) exploded. The explosion damaged an military Toyota 4WD vehicle. At least two SNA soldiers were killed while three others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

All markets in Qardho were closed in protest to the increasing rate of Somali Shilling to the US dollar. Police conducted security operations where they detained 10 forex dealers. The forex dealers were taken to Qardho Police Station.
Arrest:Hargeysa, Wooqoyi Galbeed region, Somaliland: security forces arrested a high-profile cleric who had recently criticised the arrest of suspected insurgents.
Suspected Habargidir gunmen open fire against Biyomaal household, killing one. Assailants escaped.
IED targets SNAF convoy at entrance of SNAF base. 2 SNAF killed.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: IED targets AMISOM convoy. No casualties.
Several people were arrested after a violent service delivery protest which saw them blocking the R67 about 28km from Fort Beaufort towards Komani. Protesters attacked a Parmalat truck.
Debris was set alight on Austerville Drive in Wentworth as parents protested over the selection of the Principal of a school.
A handful of residents gathered outside the Wynberg magistrates court in protest as five people appeared in connection with the murder of a child.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: On 6 September, SPLA-IO reported clashes in Patit and Lingpuot, Unity. Rumours of such attacks resulted in at least 500 persons seeking shelter at the UNMISS Temporary Protection Area in Leer.

Clashes between the Kassab IDP camp gate guards and militants between Kassab and Kutum, North Darfur, lasted from 3-6 September. On the fourth day of clashes, a child was severely injured in the crossfire.
A Sudanese soldier stabbed a civilian at El Salam distric of Gireida, South Darfur as he refused to hand over his possessions. The victim later died of his injuries.
Camel herders attacked farmers at Krukuli village in Kass, South Darfur, leaving five injured. The farmers refused to let the herders' cattle graze on their lands.

Protesters took to the streets in huge numbers on Wednesday and Thursday calling for political reform, in the biggest protest against President Faure Gnassingbe in years. The opposition wants to limit a president to a maximum of two, five-year terms and the introduction of two-round voting.
Taxi drivers initiated a protest rally in support of their colleague who was assaulted by police officers in front of Bazma Civil Prison, Kebili.
Al Alaa residents have closed all public facilities today and blocked the road linking Al Alaa to Hezoua as a protest against water supply cuts.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: ZANU PF youths were bussed into Chitungwiza to violently protest against the town clerk, who is in a different ZANU faction.
A woman was arrested and tortured because she was accused of lying.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure attacked a man in Murwi with clubs and machetes. This man was accused of failing to pay his debts to the Imbonerakure.
Local media report that a second person was killed early Tuesday as violence continued.
3 dead, 8 people kidnapped, 46 houses burned in Dzaba.

The creation of a new armed group was announced last week: Rally of the Republicans (RDR) founded by GaÃ©tan BoadÃ© with Junior KÃ©nguÃ©mba as spokesperson. BoadÃ© was a leader of Anti-Balakas, though allied with FPRC in Bambari and Bria. actor2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Surrender/Defect:A Kamwina Nsapu leader and 8 militia members surrendered to the Demba administration.
At least 15 fishermen were kidnapped on Lake Edward by Mayi Mayi Kakule
The Lesotho Defence Force (LDF) commander was shot dead during a gun battle with other members of the Lesotho Defense Force at Ratjomose barracks (Outside Maseru). In total, three people were killed.

A group of youth stormed the court compound on Tuesday morning with placards and preventd vehicles from entering the court yard. The group was in protest of the court's decision to drop criminal charges against former mayor of Monrovia. Seven protesters were arrested, and released on September 7th.

actor1: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
actor2: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
notes: While trying to flee from Saiqa-forces, a militant from the BRSC stepped on a landmine that other militants from the same group had put in place recently, and died.
In a mob attack,  in Nsanje the local community has killed a suspected criminal by beating and burning him.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: MINUSMA vehicle struck by IED 15km from Aguelhok this afternoon, 2 peacekeepers dead and 2 severely wounded reported.
A vigilante mob beats a 70-year-old to death for alleged witchcraft on 05/09.

Somaliland Police clashed with seven Al Shabaab suspects in an attempt to arrest a prominent pro-al Shabaab Sheikh. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for 30 minutes. The pro-al Shabaab Sheikh (Adan Nunne) was arrested along with the armed members protecting him. The Sheikh was arrested for inciting youth to fight against the government after admitting that 13 al Shabaab suspects who were arrested in the previous week were his students.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Early AM, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan region: al Shabaab attacked a Somali National Armed Forces (SNAF) military base. Government forces, along with AMISOM, repelled the attack, incurring "losses and injuries" to al Shabaab. Government/AMISOM causality figures not known.

Al Shabaab fighters fired three mortar rounds against Jubbaland force base at Abdi-birole village (c. 45 km West of Kismayo town). The mortar shells landed near the base and injured a Jubbaland soldier.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 5th September, 09:00LT, Tor Toorow, Lower Shabelle region: a United States drone strike targeted a convoy of al Shabaab. Three deaths reported, identities not known. Conflicting reports claim the strike occurred in Bay Region.

Armed men driving a Toyota Salon vehicle attacked an Upper House senator in his private car at Tarabuunka neighbourhood in Hodan district. The senator survived the assassination attempt but his daughter and driver were injured. The assailants escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Al Shabaab kills three Kenyan construction engineers in Dhobley on the evening of 05/09. Security forces conducted a security sweep soon after.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated Digil/Garre civilian. Assailants escaped.
Group of SNAF soldiers gang-raped civilian, and arrested her son. Son taken to AMISOM base, under alleged links to al Shabaab.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for an alleged IED attack against a KDF convoy. Al Shabaab claimed one vehicle destroyed and "several" casualties.
Members of the Social Justice Coalition protest outside the Western Cape High Court during sentencing proceedings against a man accused of rape in Cape Town.
Three buses were set alight and roads blocked in Ikageng near Rustenburg
A violent mob has beaten, stabbed and stoned to death two men they believed had kidnapped a child in Pinetown.
Angry supporters, who blamed local municipal and ANC leaders for the murder of a politician protested in Umzimkulu.
Two vehicles were pelted with stones during protestsin Vuwani.

source: Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio; Gurtong; UNSC
notes: Fighting erupted after suspected youth from Kuac South county and from Marial Bai attacked Matiel village of Apuk South county, Gogrial (Warrap). Fighting resumed the following morning. At least 21 casualties. The assaillants were said to have burnt down at least 30 houses.

actor1: Rup Clan Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
notes: Suspected armed youth from the Rup community clashed with police forces at a parade in Cuei Adukan, leaving at least six killed, including three police officers.

Political leaders from Maban County recently withdrew all their members from the government of Northern Upper Nile State in Renk to protest the recent fatal border dispute between Maban and Melut. Report dated 5 September.
A group of 10 soldiers allegedly raped four women in Jonglei on 5 September. Other cases of rape reported in SPLA-controlled areas in the region.

Clashes between the Kassab IDP camp gate guards and militants between Kassab and Kutum, North Darfur, lasted from 3-6 September. On the fourth day of clashes, a child was severely injured in the crossfire.

Gunmen shot dead a civilian at Mat Keru village west of Kabkabiya in North Darfur who came to rescue his neighbour, whom the gunmen were attempting to abduct. Bystanders arrested one of the alleged perpetrators while the other two escaped.

Four gunmen riding camels opened fire on a farmer and his son working in a farm in the Dolo area in Eastern Jebel Marra. The father died instantly while the son was seriously wounded. The assaillants stole their cattle.

Unemployed people from the municipality of Regueb in the governorate of Sidi Bouzid protested today, thereby shutting down the local headquarters of Finance Ministry after they shut down the seat of the municipality yesterday. Protesters are calling for development and employment as well as jobs in the public institutions that will soon be set up in the region.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
assoc_actor_2: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
notes: An MDC-T activist in Epworth was attacked by ZANU-PF supporters. They dragged him to a ZANU-PF house, where they beat him. They then organised for the police to arrest him for breaking a door at the house where he was beaten.

Algerian authorities have sent additional reinforcements of up to 3,000 troops to the border areas near Libya, following a new security plan to prevent the possibility of infiltration by "extremists".
Beneficiaries from social housing protested to demand the continuation of constructing proper housing.
Inhabitants of Issers marched in their village to protest against the increasing lawlessness and insecurity affecting their village.

Inhabitants from Nesmen shut down the local representation in Taghzout, in the Bouira province, to invoke the equal sharing of water resources. The inhabitants were facing a dire situation, not having access to tap water for more than 3 months.
Police officers shot dead a motorcyclist who resisted an attempt to confiscate the motorcycle, sparking a riot from other motorcyclists, who threw stones.
Strike: Political activists being held on charges of terrorism began a hunger strike to protest their excessive pre-trial detention.
2 individuals abducted by unknown gunmen this morning in Kourfadji (Nassoumbou).

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: Imbonerakure assaulted a civilian in Kiyange. When a police officer tried to intervene they assaulted him as well.

Violent unrestÂ broke out in northwesternÂ CameroonÂ after gendarmes shot dead a teenage boy on Monday. TheÂ unrestÂ points to the continued tensions in the country s two English-speaking region. Hundreds of people shouted and ran to seek refuge Monday evening at the cathedral inÂ CameroonÂ s northwestern town of Kumbo amid theÂ unrest. A school and government buildings were burned in protest.

In an official statement, Cameroon's defense minister, Joseph Beti Assomo, said that a boy was shot accidentally after villagers attacked gendarmes with locally made guns, wounding one of the gendarmes. The defense minister said the gendarmes were in Kifem on an anti-drug operation and that they opened fired in self-defense. Residents say the gendarmes seized the teenager s corpse and paraded it through the streets.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Mayi Mayi Yakutumba clashed with FARDC forces at the Congolese naval base in Baraka.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Patrolling police officers apprehended an armed group in Kananga, shots were exchanged for several minutes.

Police officer shot dead by unknown gunmen while travelling aboard motorcycle in Beni Suef.
In East Hararge zone, Dadar woreda, Qerro(Oromo young men) killed a man who had been reporting Oromo young men to Federal police. The attackers cut his arms off. The event was not confirmed.
Residents of Bonyamatutu village in Nyamira County, the home of Chief Justice Maraga, protest against Kenyatta's verbal attacks on the judiciary.
Second day of peaceful protests in NASA's stronghold Kisii over President Uhuru Kenyatta's remarks on Justice David Maraga
People from Kufra protested in front of the health center to denounce the deteroriating health conditions in the city.
The Zawiyas Martyrs brigade conducted a combing operation in Wadi al-Ahmar after Daesh elements were seen in the area.
Militants from Misrata set up a checkpoint 20km East of Sirte, after reports of ISIS activity in the area.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Presumed Islamists kidnapped 30 people in Mamba as revenge for the beat up of two Islamists after a quarrel about veil wearing.
NGO ambulance was attacked at 25 km S of Afoud on the Tassiga axis. One wounded.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Tense situation these past days in the Macina: clashes between "jihadists" & locals in Kouakourou.
A physical altercation broke out between a group of sub-Saharan migrants and members a Moroccan family in the Masnana neighbourhood in Tangier.
Loggers in Manica protested the Manica Forest Industry company.
A child was kidnapped by Boko Haram men.
Boko Haram ambush and kill four farmers in Bulamari, outside of Maiduguri.
Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram in Banki, killing "a large number." Several others were wounded.
"Delta Militants" attack a police checkpoint and a nearby station and steal weapons. A sergeant was killed and two civilians, attempting to aid the police officer, were injured.
Tricycle (Keke) operators clash with military forces in Umuahia for unknown reason. Several of the Keke operators were later arrested and charged with riotous assembly.

assoc_actor_1: NARD: National Association of Resident Doctors
notes: Strike:Members of NARD begin a nationwide strike after the government failed to reach their demands.

Biyamaal clan militia attacked Habargidir militia at Bullo - Jaan village in Merka district. There was an exchange of gunfire. At least two armed men were killed while three others were injured. Tension was reported to be high.
Ceelasha Biyaha, Daynile district: a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) missed a Somali military convoy and struck a civilian vehicle. Two civilians were killed in the blast.
Al Shabaab claim IED attack on KDF vehicle near Baardheere, al Shabaab claimed 4 injured and "several" killed. Exact numbers not known.

Men in military uniform raped a mother and her three daughters at Farxano village (c. 05 km South West of Qoryoley). The armed men, who arrived at the home of the victims while conducting security operations, abducted the son accusing him of being a member of al Shabaab. The criminals looted money from the home of the victims. The perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab "Somalimemo" website claimed responsibility for an alleged IED attack against a KDF convoy  at Hosingow. Al Shabaab claimed one vehicle destroyed and "several" casualties.

Arrest:NISA received information of an IED placed in a house located in Guufaale section of Xaaho Taako neighbourhood, East of Beletweyne. NISA cordoned off the area and informed an EOD team who safely removed and destroyed the IED. It is believed that al Shabaab fighters targeted to move the IED to another location. There were no reports of casualties or damages. Security forces arrested three civilian males in connection of the incident.
Civilians stage protest against extradition of Qalbi Dagax. Protests remained peaceful.
JSF convoy travelling to Yoontoy hit by two IEDs. 3 JSF injured.

assoc_actor_1: AMCU: Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union
notes: AMCU members have disrupted a memorial in protest near Carletonville for the five Harmony Gold miners who died last week.
Students continued protest action, which entered its third week, by padlocking the main gate to the FET college Msunduzi.
Police dispersed crowds which gathered to demand the implementation of resolutions announced by President Jacob Zuma in July, after months of protest over a demarcation dispute.

Residents from the Westville area in Kwadwesi blockaded the roads leading to and from Uitenhage on the R75. Tyres were burnt on the roads and residents were stoning vehicles as well. A truck was also set alight in the Westville area

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO rebels reportedly attacked government bases in Ombasi, southeast of Yei County. SPLA said they repulsed the rebels, while SPLA-IO claimed to have captured the area. No mentioned fatality.

Suspected youth from Apuk South attacked Alek village and surroundings in Kuac South county, Gogrial (Warrap), leaving five people killed.

Clashes between the Kassab IDP camp gate guards and militants between Kassab and Kutum, North Darfur, lasted from 3-6 September. On the fourth day of clashes, a child was severely injured in the crossfire.

Armed pastoralists reportedly killed a farmer and looted his food in Bau locality in Blue Nile during the week of 4 September. Residents have complained of continuous attacks by pastoralists grazing livestock on their farms in the area.

Unemployed people from the municipality of Regueb in the governorate of Sidi Bouzid protested today, thereby shutting down the local headquarters of Finance Ministry after they shut down the seat of the municipality yesterday. Protesters are calling for development and employment as well as jobs in the public institutions that will soon be set up in the region.

A number of teachers and substitute teachers organized a demonstration in front of the headquarters of the regional education delegation in Sfax and prevented the employees of this delegation from joining their offices.
Police in Budaka District on Monday arrested three Members of Parliament who reportedly staged a demonstration over the sorry state of Mbale-Tirinyi-Nakalama road.

assoc_actor_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: ZANU PF youths stormed the Chitungwiza council offices to demand the resignation of the town clerk
A bar owner in Butaganzwa was assassinated by unidentified attackers wielding machetes. As nothing was stolen, it is believed that the murder was political.
A man slained yesterday night in Doulou, near Mora by BokoHaram militants

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Mayi Mayi militia attacked the headquarters of a police mobile group in Kabindula. They fought police and military and then looted the armoury.
The prisoners in Kabinda Prison attacked the guards, then 119 escaped.
Dozens of Nubian activists were arrested Sunday in Aswan after rallying to demand their right to return to their lands.
Strike: Oromo political prisoners begin a short hunger strike to remember those who died in a prison fire last year. The duration of the protest is not known.
A man who was part of the Oromo forces fighting against the Somali special police was killed in Eastern Hararge, Babile woreda.
36 Jean Ping supporters were arrested at a demonstration in Libreville.

"Ninety-eight inmates" escaped at dawn Sunday from the prison about 45 kilometres (30 miles) north of Bouake, said the director of the penitentiary administration, Joachim Kongoue Koffi, in a statement.  The inmates who escaped were followers of the late leader of a prison mutiny last year, Coulibaly Yacouba, sources told AFP Sunday.
Two Police Officers were killed and their rifles were stolen by unknown gunmen. The two officers were manning the church compound when they were killed.
Peaceful protests in NASA's stronghold Kisii over President Uhuru Kenyatta's remarks on Justice David Maraga

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: ISIS reportedly abducted three civilian Salafists, described as Madkhalis, which are normally known to be allied with Haftar forces.
ISIS took control of Wadi al-Ahmar, east of Sirte

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: LNA announced that direct and price strikes were launched against ISIS targets near the Ain Taqaraqat area, in central Libya. No number of fatalities was given.
A young man was killed in a mob justice attack by Fokonolona members in Antsampanimahazo, in the rural commune of Antsoantany in the district of Antsirabe II.
After a police officer extrajudicially shot and killed an Emir, locals violently protest the act, fighting the police.
After a police officer extrajudicially shot and killed an Emir, locals violently protest the act, fighting the police.

Early AM, Gaduud, Lower Jubba: al Shabaab fighters conducted a complex attack against the Jubaland Security Force (JSF) base located near Gaduud, 30km north of Kismayo. The attack began with a large explosion, which was followed by a small arms attack. Al Shabaab claims 26 Jubaland force dead. Some numbers have varied from other sources. The attackers were eventually repulsed.
Arrest:Somaliland forces dismantle a "terror cell." Details limited. Three arrests believed to be made.

Kaxda, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: a suspected al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade towards a group of civilians near a Mosque. Injuries reported. The perpetrator escaped the scene. The attack may have occurred on the previous day.

Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at military forces manning a checkpoint at Hawa-Taako neighbourhood in Beletweyne town. There were no reports of injuries. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

Unknown attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, hurled a hand grenade at an military checkpoint near Nacnac Factory in Heliwa district. The grenade landed on an empty place close to the checkpoint. SNA shot at the general direction of the attack. There were no reports of casualties. The assailants escaped.
Somali military forces shot and killed a woman at Moorgabey village (c. 30 km West of Xudur). The woman was affiliated to al Shabaab but the circumstances surrounding the incident were unknown.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and severely injured a civilian man at Daryeel IDP camp in Kahda district. The victim was attacked on his way home after he came out from the IDP camp. The motive was not clear. The attackers managed to escape.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped boy from Biyomaal. Victim later assassinated.

After a car knocked down and killed a pensioner, Philippi residents have closed a road in protest, forcing motorists to use alternative routes. Residents burnt tyres, and dug trenches on the 400m stretch of road, and set alight at least one car.

Clashes between security forces and suspected robbers in military uniforms who had started to loot properties in Juba's Hai Cassava area. One of the robbers was killed and another injured. The incident came amid reports of rising armed robberies by security officers in the capital, blamed on delayed salaries.
Local youth in Pakur, Northern Liech State (Unity) clashed with suspected cattle raiders from Tonj state, leaving one killed and another injured.
A World Vision employee disappeared in Yambio town on 3 September. His body was found four days later in Uze, at the outskirts of Yambio town.
Unknown gunmen ambushed civilians traveling on a motorcycle from Agok (Warrap) to western Bol County (Unity), leaving two killed and another injured.

Report of several civilians killed in the context of revenge killings between conflicting ethnic groups and night robberies in Western Bahr Naam county and Nyat-tiak-angui IDP residential area of Rumbek, Lakes state. The attacks occurred around 3 September.

In Ajugo, Warrap, on 3 September, SPLA soldiers reportedly killed two armed youth who refused to surrender their weapons. The disarmament exercise was being carried out as part of the state of emergency declared by president Kiir on 17 July.

Clashes between the Kassab IDP camp gate guards and militants between Kassab and Kutum, North Darfur, lasted from 3-6 September. On the fourth day of clashes, a child was severely injured in the crossfire.
Former Darfur rebel commander Abbas Ahmed Aseel (aka Jebel Moon) joined SLM-MM, which the group underlined as an important step towards a unified fight against the regime.

Egyptian soldiers reportedly opened fire on and abducted 41 Sudanese gold prospectors in the Wadi Al-Alaki area of Red Sea state. A week later, Egyptian soldiers arrested another 16 Sudanese gold prospectors from the area.
Residents of the Ain Karma region of the Sakiet Sidi Youssef delegation in Kef carried out a demonstration on the national road n5 to protest against water cuts.

The medical staff of the regional hospital of Jbeniana was assaulted following the death of two young people,that died in a road accident. The families of the victims also broke the hospital equipment.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
notes: A member of National Guard CT-unit found stabbed to death this morning in Sousse. Three arrested incl. 2 men and a woman for the killing. The defendants claim they stabbed the agent because he attempted to force their female friend into his car. A political motive can not be excluded.

notes: Members of the CNDD-FDD held a march in Gahombo to protest the UN human rights report.

RRR left the city.
LRA soldiers attacked a construction site. Several civilians dead.

ISIS activities increasingly overt & daring, accumulating reports of movements east of Sirte & possible Command post near "Om el-Gendell", North from An-Nawfaliyah.

The Misratan militia continued to hold the men on suspicion that they were ISIS members.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: IS had withdrawn from areas it had entered to the east of the group's former stronghold of Sirte following LNA-air strikes the previous night.

IS had withdrawn to the southwest from areas it had entered to the east of the group's former stronghold of Sirte following LNA-air strikes the previous night. The area that IS had entered had not been under LNA control, but was instead held by forces from the al-Bunyan al-Marsous-forces, which had been tasked by the UN-backed Tripoli-based Government of National Accord (GNA) to fight IS in Sirte in 2016.

notes: 2 vehicles part of MINUSMA logistics convoy struck by dual-IED, 5km north of Tabankort
Boko Haram men attempted to kidnap 4 people from Koutou village: three managed to escape, one died.
Boko Haram attacks and kills 21 farmers in the Damboa region over two non-consecutive days; 17 at Bula Buba and Tawarmada villages on 31/08 and four at Mirimari village on 02/09.
Two police officers are nearly lynched "at the weekend" by a vigilante group accusing them of theft.
A farmer was "at the weekend" attacked and killed by Fulani herdsmen.
Gunmen attack Amatu community "at the weekend" shooting sporadically and abduction one civilian.

02nd September, evening, Boondheere, Mogadishu: al Shabaab claimed one of the groupâs fighters hurled several hand grenades against the Somali National Police Force (SNPF) station of Boondheere. Resulting causalities not known.
02nd September, evening, Bossaso, Bari: a suspected al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade at a Puntland Police patrol. No causalities.
Al Shabaab militants fired a mortar round towards an unidentified target in Bossaso. A round landed near a petrol station. No casualties reported.
A prominent clan elder is assassinated in Kismayo. Perpetrators not known.

2nd September, evening, Cagaare, Sool: suspected clan militiamen killed four civilians in Cagaare, near Lascanood in Sool region. The attack is likely related to clan revenge. The identities of the clans involved are not known. This evenT may have happened on 01/09.

Dulbahante and Majeerteen herders clashed at Gumbur Cagaare pasturelands. Three fatalities and an unspecified number of casualties were reported. Tension was reported to be high around the area as the respective clans mobilized militiamen from their respective clans.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked an military base at Main bridge vicinity of Qoryoley district. SNA forces responded and forced al Shabaab militants to withdraw. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab fighters stormed into the homes of two prominent elders from Gare sub-clan and killed them in Ceel Waaq district. Al Shabaab displayed the body of the two prominent elders at Cel Waaq town. The two elders were allegedly affiliated with the government.
Two auto-rickshaw drivers from Isse Mohamud clash for an undetermined reason. One death reported.

notes: SPLA and DRC soldiers exchanged fire at the border market town of Nabiapai after a disagreement over the arrest of a suspected robber by the Congolese forces. Calm was restored when the two armies' commanders intervened.

notes: Surrender/Defect:A ruling party member of parliament and a military officer from Kapotea state defected to Machar's SPLA-IO along with 1000 soldiers following political disputes with the government.
Unknown gunmen raped a young woman near the Aribo valley as she made her way from camp Hamidiya to Zalingei, Central Darfur.

Inhabitants from Kef blocked National Road 5 in order to protest against water cuts that are affecting the city.

Farmers from Gamaa and Dra-Rmel, in the commune of Doucen blocked the road that connects Doucen with Lioua with huge stones and palm branches. They are demanding a secure electricity supply to their region as current irregularities in provision lead to constant difficulties in tilling the fields.
API Police officers beat a youth in Buhiga who did not stop for passing authorities.

notes: Imbonerakure armed with clubs and knives beat the manager of a bar to force him to close it 'for security reasons'.
Civil Society organisations held a demonstration in Bujumbura to protest the conclusions of the UN Human Rights report.
Boko Haram asking ransom & foodstuffs to villagers in exchange for woman abducted in Igawa.
Sudanese mercenaries plundered the Catholic church in Zemio. Several dead reported.
A clash between Oromo people and Liyu police on 01/09 in Mieso claims 30 lives.

actor2: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
notes: ISIS reported that their fighters "took control of El Tesseyn" (halfway Harawa-Nofaliya) and held an Eid prayer in its mosque.
A police truck was attacked by Dahalo militia. One police officer was killed in the attack which occurred in the area of Betroka.
Angry residents at Area 49 in Lilongwe fatally assaulted a suspected robber.
Boko Haram attack an IDP camp in Banki, killing 11.
Following a road accident which killed three commercial motorcyclists, the victim's colleagues protest the incident.
Three Boko Haram commanders and deputies to Abubakar Shekau (Afdu Kawuri and Abubakar Banishek and Modu Bako) were killed in a military operations at Alafa in Borno on Sallah day.

Air forces destroy Boko Haram camps in Garin Maloma area in Sambisa Forest, neutralizing "hundreds." It is believed Boko Haram in the targeted location were planning to disrupt Eid-el Kabir celebrations in the area.

Following the attack on a group of soldiers outside Letugbene, military squads retaliate against Letugbene and Bilbri towns, destroying homes and forcing residents to flee. The date(s) of these operations are not entirely known - source dated 01/09.

Following the attack on a group of soldiers outside Letugbene, military squads retaliate against Letugbene and Bilbri towns, destroying homes and forcing residents to flee. The date(s) of these operations are not entirely known - source dated 01/09.

1st September,  Af Urur, Puntland: a coordinated improvised explosive device (IED) and mortar attack targeted a group of Puntland Security Forces (PSF) soldiers. Al Shaaab suspected as perpetrators. Several mortars were fired by al Shabaab fighters in the area after the VBIED attack. Four Dervish soldiers and three civilians were killed and 33 other soldiers and civilians were wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 01st September, early AM, Jilib, Middle Jubba: a suspected United States (US) airstrike killed an al Shabaab leader. The target, Abdirrahman Jarat, was killed. Further damages not reported by source.
01st September, evening, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: unidentified gunmen assassinated a clan elder.
01st September, evening, Ceel Waaq, Gedo: suspected al Shabaab militants kidnapped two clan elders. The victimsâ bodies were discovered during the early hours of 02nd September.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: An airstrike was conducted by suspected American drones at Kunya-Barow village (c. 75 Km West of Barawe district). Purportedly, at least three missiles were fired against an al Shabaab convoy transporting at least two senior al Shabaab officers. Five al Shabaab fighters, including a top official and ex-AS Governor of Jubba regions, were killed and three others injured.
A remote controlled IED targeting soldiers kills two civilians on 01/09.

An RCIED targeting military vehicles detonated near the khat market neighbourhood in Qoryoley district. The device missed its target. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not known. The perpetrators escaped.

Four nomads who belonged to Omar Mohamud sub clan of Majeerteen were killed by armed militia men hailing from Bahararsame sub clan of Dhulbahante clan at Gumburka Cagarweyne (c. 60 km North of Burtinle town) located at the border between Sool and Nugal regions and close to the Ethiopian border. The incident was attributed to previous clan feuds. A peace deal was agreed between the two clans and the situation returned to normal.

Unidentified armed attackers using pistols shot and killed a civilian clan elder at Dhagaxtuur neighbourhood in Afgoye district. The motive behind the attack was unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Protests erupted after Eid al Adha prayers against the extradition of ONLF official Qalbi Dagax. Five female organisers arrested by JSF Police. No reported violence from the protesters.

assoc_actor_1: EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command
notes: University of the Witwatersrand EFF Student Command (EFFSC) members took their fight for affordable student accommodation to the Gauteng Human Settlements department's offices in Johannesburg and held a protest march.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO rebels claimed to have captured Guit town, Unity state, as well as other areas in the county following clashes with government forces, which left 20 SPLA soldiers and three rebels killed, while five government soldiers were captured. They warned civilians to evacuate oil-fields in the region. Local authorities denied the clashes.

Residents living in UN PoC sites in Juba held a peaceful demonstration to show their support to the recently appointed Regional Protection Force, amid tensions between UNMISS and the government over their deployment.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO accused NAS forces of killing at least three SPLA-IO soldiers hailing from Eastern Equatoria whom they had earlier arrested but escaped. The clash occurred around Kit in Central Equatoria. At least nine SPLA-IO soldiers were also arrested by NAS forces at an unclear date and remained unaccounted for as of 9 September.
A group of six unknown gunmen attacked a displaced couple at their house in Kabkabiya, beating them with sticks and hitting them with knives, which left them severely injured.
Unknown rioters threw molotov cocktails on a Russian tourist bus that was on its way from Douz to Tozeur. Noone was injured.

A young man entered the Laala Police Station in Kairouan Governorate. The individual assaulted a police officer in charge of the reception with a wooden stick. A security patrol visited the scene and the perpetrator was arrested. The investigation is ongoing and the reasons for this intrusion remain unknown.
